name: Rival Troops
description:
In Rival Troops, players explore a campground, adding new sites to the expanding area. Players will move their troops around the board, trying to position themselves in the best sites to set up camp. At the end of the game, players will score points for the sites that they've claimed, as long as they have the majority of troops on a site.

—description from the designer

name: Farmen: Kampen for tilværelsen
description:
This game is heavily based on the successful show Farmen at TV2's TV-channel.

You play the game by rolling a dice, collecting milkbuckets on your road. After collecting enough milkbuckets you could either spend it on money (buying resources), or buying knifes (counting as points when scoring to win).
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: The Dark Quarter: The Yesterday Demon & Other Stories
description: The Yesterday Demon & Other Stories takes place before the events depicted in The Dark Quarter and features four all-new standalone scenarios, each highlighting a single Beaumont Agent and their (inevitably) tragic pasts.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Mature / Adult, Murder/Mystery
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Map Addition, Role Playing, Solo / Solitaire Game, Storytelling
publishers: Grimspire, Lucky Duck Games, Van Ryder Games

name: Chocoloco
description:
Chocoloco is a casual card game of chocolate swapping and order filling for 2-4 players. Each player manages their hand, which can have chocolate and action cards. Players may play any or all of their cards on their turn before drawing back up. Players arrange chocolates on the table to try and fill orders to score points.

The catch? You have to work to build your own order combos while blocking your opponents. Oh, and there's a limited set of orders. The easy ones go fast, so plan ahead! It's kind of like a certain candy-swapping puzzle game but made with cards where players can mess with the board of chocolates — and each other!

All players share the cards on the table and may use any of them to complete and score orders. Get 15 points to win a round (or 10 points to have faster rounds). Once you win a round, you gain a Round Winner card. Win 2 rounds and win the game.

Reimplements Crazy Cake Bakery.
mechanics: Hand Management, Real-Time, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Vigilante: Story Mode
description:
In Story Mode, you and your friends each lead a team of heroes in an ever-changing campaign to rid the city of crime.

You will start off as agents working together in this 10-chapter campaign. Each chapter brings fun new twists, as you recruit new heroes and find useful equipment to bring from chapter to chapter.

In Chapter 1, The Agency is putting you to the test. Choose your weapon and work with your fellow agents as you combat mechanical foes.

In Chapter 2, take to the streets to take down Dino Gambino and his criminal empire. Meet new heroes, find useful gadgets, and save those in need - how you win is just as important as winning!

Vigilante: Story Mode is a standalone cooperative campaign that is compatible with Vigilante, featuring hundreds of new cards and other content to enhance your game.

-description from designer
categories: Adventure, Comic Book / Strip, Fantasy, Mafia
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Legacy Game, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Combat of the 30: Chivalric Combat in 14th Century Brittany
description:
Combat of the 30 pitches 2 players together in a small battlefield. Each player controls 30 knights, who have sworn to defeat the other side in order to win the bloody War of Breton Succession.

Each side is divided into 3 wings, which are activated and controlled in an innovative way in order to have as little downtime between turns.

Combat of the 30 melds historical wargaming with accessibility, and teaches players about this formative event in the history of European Chivalry.

—description from the publisher

name: Nay-Jay!: Expansion Pack!
description:
Expansion for Nay-Jay! Extends the original game from four decks to six thereby allowing for six players. Aim is to get rid of all your cards by simultaneously placing cards on a number pile in numerical and colour order.

"Forget taking turns and playing it coll. This game is HOT HOT HOT! Flip your deck and flip your lid. Your friends and family will go wild! Nay-Jay is a rip-roarin' hootin' and hollerin' good time!

Each player races to play their own cards, building up and down on the shared number piles. Flipping cards, slapping cards and sometimes throwing cards, everyone competes to get their cards played first!

If you count to ten and back while doing the Hokey-Pokey, you can play Nay-Jay! If you can do all that while running from a ferocious tiger, you might win.
Get ready to play the fastest card game you'll ever lay your hands on. Nay-Jay is about to blow you away! - Designer blurb"
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Children's Game, Expansion for Base-game, Real-time

name: Arch-hunt
description:
Architecture is around us us, from our house to the museum we visited on our last trip. It is our daily environment.

It is not necessary to know architecture to consider certain buildings iconic: they are the ones that give identity to our cities. The aim of this game is to to get the best collection of this architectural icons... avoiding the obstacles put by the rest of the players!

Arch-hunt is an English contraction of "architecture-hunter". It is a game that aims to promote architecture by giving visibility to some of the most emblematic buildings of the 20th and 21st centuries. But its main purpose is to entertain during games in which resource management and strategy will be essential to win.

Each player represents an era through a famous architect. The goal of each player is to get as many points as possible by building the best collection of iconic buildings. To do this, each player must build 8 buildings using coins and cards from their hand. It is, therefore, a management and strategy game in which luck plays an important role. The game ends when a player manages to complete his collection, but this does not mean that he wins the game: the value of the buildings and the possible bonuses at the end of the game can make the difference.

—description from the publisher

name: Toumaï
description:
In a race to the star, three magicians release their five birds towards the heart of the closest star to bring them back three magic wands that will turn the sky in their favorite color. The third wand will be the right one.

The first player to get 3 magic wands wins the game.

MOVES
Each player in turn (clockwise) plays one of their top-line pawns (the closest to the center of the star) ; the pieces make circular movements, clockwise or counterclockwise, to land on the top square of the line they just joined.

A bird of strength 1 must join the nearest line, either to its right or left.
A bird of strength 2 will join a line two tracks further to its right or left.
A bird of strength 3, will join a line three tracks further, to its right or left.
A magician has the choice between these 3 routes.


Empty tracks are not counted in the pawn’s moves. More the game evolve, more the empty spaces between the tracks are big.
A pawn can move alone, or take with it all or part of the pawns in its line, even if they are neutral or of the opponent's color ; the pawns taken along join the same line as their top pawn, behind it and in the same order.
The pawns of the "neutral color" can only move with the top pawns of the playing colors.

—description from the publisher

name: Teufelsbrücke
description:
A bridge is built by 13 small open boxes distinguished by 4 colors. Dice rolls decide in which box and how many jungle animals you have to add to or to take from one box of the bridge. Play clockwise until the bridge collapses.

—user summary

Hilfe! Die Brücke schwankt - Wer bleibt cool und hat die ruhigste Hand?
Unten am Fluß lauern schon die Krokodile. Stürzt die Teufelsbrücke mit den Urwaldtieren ein, oder gibt's noch eine Rettung?
Reihum setzt ihr Urwaldtiere in die einzelnen Brückenteile. Dies geht so lange gut, bis die Brücke einstürzt. Wer es so geschickt anstellt, dass die Brücke erst beim nächsten Spieler einstürzt, gewinnt das Spiel.

—description from the back of the box

name: Kriegs-Spiel, zur angenehmen Unterhaltung für Offiziere und gebildete Stände
description:
Wargame played on a 75x99 cm game board with a square grid, each grid representing 200x200 paces of terrain of a hypothetical battlefield with generic blue and red armies. Played with approximately 75 cardboard square pieces representing 10 different types of military units and hundreds of smaller cardboard markers used for things like terrain that is demolished or on fire.

It was meant to be easier to learn and play in a shorter time than contemporary wargames, according to the rulebook.

Unlike most boardgames from this era this game was sold in a cardboard box with all components included. Game board was unmounted with instructions to glue it to thicker paper or cardboard. All game components were unpainted with included instructions what colors to paint board and pieces in.

name: Digital Transformation Card Game
description:
The aim of the Digital Transformation Card Game is to offer an entertaining and easily accessible way to learn about the many aspects of digital transformation, its underlying drivers of change, methods and technologies connected with that change and particularly the many ways to combine any of these into a winning strategy.

Feel free to use the cards in any way you desire:
For example try to play your favorite card game with the digital transformation set of cards, e.g. Poker, or develop new rules to create your very own game. At the back of the pack you will find rule-sets for Digital Power Black Jack, Go Fish Digital Powers!, Digital Memory, Digital Moving Puzzle and a suggestion how to use it in a consultancy setting.

—description from the designer

name: Color Strike
description:
You steal good Cards, give away bad cards like lightning and you never confess color.

Build a secret straigth of 6 cards in the right color order by thinking tactically and quickly.
With the highest score in your street, you are the king or queen of Color Strike!

Gameplay:
6 Cards are placed in a circle on the table, 1 of each color.
1 card is placed in the middle of the circle, the color of that card shows what cards you are allowed to play (the card colors next to the same colour card in the circle)

Depending on the type of card you play, it can have some effects:
- Number cards: Nothing happens
- # cards: steel a card from another player en give him one card you don't want.
- Strike Cards: You MAY Place a card on the table to build your straigth, if you place a card, all other players MUST place a card on the table. If you don't, nobody does.

Thez cards should be in the same (color) order as the cards in the circle.

The game ends when each player has 6 cards on the table, you receive points for the longest straigth and #cards.

name: Beau Séjour
description:
After the discovery of a murder, it's up to a restless ghost and a few brave seers to unravel the mystery. But that could get tricky...

One of you is responsible for this heinous crime and will do everything in his power to go free.

As a seer or ghost, can you find answers to all the dark questions surrounding this murder? Or will you, as a killer confuse the group so they will never find out the horrifying truth?

name: Dino Draw 'n Dodge
description:
The meteors are showering down! as a velociraptor or Raptorex, you are in charge of rescuing the dinosaur population from extinction by collecting as many eggs as you can... but there are other dinosaurs out there trying to steal and eat eggs, and some nasty Apex predators out to get you too! Do you have what it takes to collect the most eggs and fend off the competition?

Avoid meteors, defeat dinosaurs, and collect eggs in an always changing map system where the routes and challenges are never the same!

The person with the highest score at the end of the game is the winner!

Playing solo? try and beat your own personal best!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Resource to Move, Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Set-up

name: 跳舞戰爭 (Dancing Battle)
description:
We love to play board games and have opened a board game store, but we found that there is no board game in Taiwan or even in the world where you can dance to music and have fun! That's why Dancing Battle, the world's most entertaining dancing board game, was born.

Table game features

The dancers flip over the dancing cards and follow the movements on the cards to dance to the music.
There are various built-in games, such as judging players according to the accuracy of the movements to give points, such as guessing players to answer what card the dancer is dancing, such as dancing mimic solitaire.
The first danceable party game type table game in Taiwan, which is very rare in the world.
Created by Taiwan's elite team of research and development.
People who do not know how to dance can easily play, you can set the level of difficulty, children and the elderly and foreigners can play, the rules are simple five minutes to know.
The original dance rhythm music.


—description from the publisher (translated)

name: 戰古人 (Call of Ancient Fighters)
description:
This is a board game based on the idea of "don't open the textbook at dusk", four modern college students (rich kid, school sister, cat girl, silent boy) vs. five ancient people (Mulan, Qin Shi Huang, Mencius, Pu Song Ling, Zhuang Zi), using the Chinese and Western humanities classics to battle.

The game includes map exploration + card battles + camp rivalry, helping each other or framing each other, it's just a matter of thought.

There are 36 debate cards (a collection of 36 different classical ideas from the East and West!), 5 types of 30 disobedience cards, 9 types of 18 contingency cards, 5 Demon King cards, 4 player character cards, 4 summon cards, 15 Demon King partner cards, and a unique triangle map card designed to match the map for exploration.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Game Worldview

Four college students accidentally open the "old Chinese textbook" and fall into a mysterious space.
They are confronted with the obsession kingdom created by five Chinese ancients!
Repeatedly think and reason with the ancient people who are trapped in their obsessions, so that the discourse has power and the words become weapons!

【Game Features
Map Exploration + Card Battles

At the beginning of the game, players will first decide their roles, and then explore the map to collect card resources. While deciding on a character, a "summon card" will also be drawn. The player who draws a summon card becomes a demon king summoned by the Ancients and fights against other players secretly.

When a player reaches the end of the map, the map exploration phase will end and the identity of the Demon King will be revealed.
The next step is to enter a one-on-many card battle, where other players have to join forces to defeat the player who has become the Demon King.
Will the player who becomes the Demon King be inspired by the values of the ancients and win?
Or will the player with modern thinking and debating ability be able to overrule the ancients?

Here comes the battle of ancient and modern arguments!
Debate Card: The wisdom of Eastern and Western classical thought will become the basis of your debate.
The "no contest" card: the slippery slope, the face ......, the modern way of "discussing" things, will become your best trick.
The unexpected event card: in the process of exploring the map, the effect card will be randomly drawn, and you have to sense the direction of the wind in case of emergency!

Five Demons, Five Levels
The five demon lords and five levels are drawn by 葉長青, the artist who won the 2021 Japan International Manga Award, and have both ancient and modern aesthetics.

Mulan
In this game, you designate the size and wind direction of your own card.
Defiant card: 5 effects and one more "symbolic struggle".
Debate card: 3 cards exclusive to Mulan + 4 cards drawn blindly from the debate card pile

Emperor Qin Shi Huang
Invalidate the opponent's disobedience card once.
Disobedience card: 5 effects and 1 more "facepalm" card
Debate cards: 3 cards exclusive to Qin Shi Huang + 4 cards drawn blindly from the debate card pile

Mencius｜I am doing this for you
Replace a card played by your opponent with a blank card.
Defiant card: 5 effects and 1 additional "Karma Blast".
Debate cards: 3 exclusive cards of Mengmu + 4 cards drawn blindly from the debate card pile

Pu Songling
You may replace a card from your hand once after you open a duel.
Defiant card: 5 effects and 1 more "Slip" card
Debate card: 3 cards exclusive to Pu Songling + 4 cards drawn blindly from the debate card pile

Zhuangzi｜Northern Meditation with Fish
1. 1 point of blood is returned at the end of each match
2. not take any damage once
Defiant card: 5 effects and 1 additional "Sleep" card
Debate cards: 3 copies of "Zhuangzi" + 4 blind draws from the debate card pile

Explore the map with the topic!
The map of "Call of Ancient Fighters" combines five issues: gender roles, authority, parenting styles, media literacy, and philosophy of life.

In order to create a richer "educational and fun" experience, both the map design and the play style are intended to combine both the issues and the player's own reading experience.

For example, in the "Mulan" map, we designed three special exploration points: jeans, car keys, and pens. Players need to explore these points and open the map card before they can successfully summon Mulan to appear.

These three exploration points correspond to the "gender roles" we want to convey in this map.
Jeans symbolize the imagination of women who no longer have to conform to a specific feminine temperament.
The fountain pen represents the power of women to speak, to argue, to write, and to enter the public sphere.
The car key is a means of transportation, signifying the independence and mobility of women.

While novels and comics focus more on the plot, the board game is based on the concept of classic humanistic sentences, focusing on the four protagonists, who enter the realm of the Ancients' obsessions and need to defeat them to regain their freedom. The tabletop game is a combination of two modes: map exploration and card battles, plus role-playing and camp battles.

The five ancients (five maps) represent the following issues: Mulan (gender roles), Qin Shi Huang (authority), Mencius (parenting style), Pu Song Ling (media literacy), and Zhuang Zi (philosophy of life).

The cards are divided into two types, one is the "debate cards" which are based on sentences from Chinese humanities classics and Western contemporary thought classics, divided into three main parts: rational, emotional and value, on the one hand, and on the other hand, the cards are played in the way of point size comparison. The second is the "disobedience to battle cards" that use concepts commonly found in modern slang to trigger events or effects, such as: karma detonation, facepalm, slippery slope, etc.

—another description from the publisher (translated)

name: The Good Old Hockey Game
description:
The Good Ol’ Hockey Game lasts 3 periods. During the game you will try to score more goals than your opponent. You have to shoot to score! But, you can only shoot if you have possession of the puck in your Offensive Zone.

Each period you will play your Player Cards trying to get closer to your opponents goal, in a series of puck battles. During a puck battle, you play cards facedown, hoping to have the highest total. The highest total wins the puck battle and moves one step towards the goal.

Use your 18 cards wisely as you balance going for the go ahead goal and saving your cards for later in the period. Perform a Line Change to save your cards.

If you run out of cards first your opponents will score as many goals as they can with their remaining cards!

-description from designer
mechanics: Area Movement, Hand Management, Score-and-Reset Game

name: Defence Net: An invader-busting roll & write game
description:
Your mission should you choose to accept it:

Defend Earth by setting up strategic defences and unleash massive damage on the invading fleet. Can you complete the mission in 20 turns?


Mission Overview
Player only have 20 turns to avoid space mines and destroy the Invaders fleet. You can perform only one of the following in a single turn:

a) Upgrade your defence
b) Attack the Invaders

Player attack the invaders by upgrading defence points and connecting 2 upgraded defence points with a straight line. Any Invaders within the “box” that the line crosses will take a hit. Default (not upgraded) defence points cannot be used.

A defence point is upgraded by circling it. Function of the defence point increases with the level of upgrade.

Level 1 (represented by 1 circle) - allow player to connect to another defence point
Level 2 (represented by 2 circles) - allow player to deflect an incoming connecting line to one other defence point
Level 3 (represented by 3 circles) - allow player to deflect an incoming connecting line to two other defence point

Combos Madness
3 types of defence point upgrade, 4 different types of Invader with different level of life-meter (some are tougher to destroy than other) and space mines which explode every time you crosses them. Players must plot their attack wisely to max out their mission score, those who destroy all the Invader Ships before the end of 20 turns get extra bonus points!

Print and play: One PDF, thousands of mission
The game come in a single PDF (black and white print cost friendly) which automatically generate random missions each time the file is refreshed on the Internet browser or reopened in a PDF viewer.

Each mission comes with an unique mission code. You can reprint the old mission challenge by typing the old mission code over the newly generated one.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Dice, Print & Play, Puzzle
mechanics: Connections, End Game Bonuses, Paper-and-Pencil, Re-rolling and Locking, Turn Order: Progressive

name: Hajiku Nemoly
description:
Hajiku Nemoly is a roll-and-write crossword game inspired by classic Nordic-style fill-in puzzles.

Game lasts 10-12 rounds and each round has three phases: roll, write, and score.

Players collect random word units, use them to build complete words on their crossword grids (simultaneously and secretly), and then score the completed words in multiple categories. Words that are related to adjacent icons give bonus points, but repeating identical words induces a penalty. Special rewards are given for filling rows and columns. The player with most victory points wins.

Game booklet includes 12 thematic scenario grids, each with their own special rules.

All scenarios are naturally suited for solo play with minimal rules differences. Additionally, all word grids may be solved like traditional fill-in puzzles with some new twists.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Compile
description:
Compile is a mathematical trick-taking card game for two players, based on Cassino. The deck includes cards numbered 1-15 in 4 suits, or 60 cards in total.

In setup, 4 cards are dealt to each player and 4 face up to the centre. Players take turns putting down one card from their hand and are trying to take as many other cards from the centre as they can. Aces are worth one point each, and two lucky cards are worth three points if captured - 3 of triangles, and 10 of lozenges. Build (compile) piles of cards up over the round, but beware - the other player may be able to capture your pile!

—description from the designer

name: TAG: The Card Game
description:
Get points, draw strategically, and freeze the competition; all while avoiding the dreaded IT card!

Players will play and discard cards to rapidly match T, A, and G cards to make sets. The deck is the main source of cards, but if you're lucky, someone may discard a card that you could use!

Sometimes, you'll draw a Special Card instead of a letter card. Depending on which one you get, they can be great for attacking the competition or defending yourself!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Hot Potato, Set Collection, Take That

name: Bordélocratie
description:
Bordélocratie is a game that puts players at the heart of the French political "bordel" (or shambles). Find yourself at the head of a political party that will leave its mark on the Fifth Republic (or maybe just a dent).

But to reach the supreme position of President and get to move into the Elysée palace, you must first increase your popularity, get more votes in the Assemblée et vote laws for the good of your part... country !

Designed as a party game that can also be played in a more political version (longer, more intense and with more knives stuck in your back by the end), a game lasts around 1 hour and brings to the table 4 to 6 fans of the best televised political debate of the Fifth Republic, or 4 to 6 players who want to feel powerful while disdaining your nobody opponents (until they become somebody).

HOW TO PLAY

Every turn, players draw 2 Action cards then can only play one.
Then the First Player draws three Bills, submits one to the Assemblée and draws a second random one.
Players vote on the Bills submitted (each one giving victory points to player based on specific conditions).
Then the turn end and we start again.

THE ACTION CARDS

The Action cards you get to use have different abilities. Events change the course of the game, Campaign increases your popularity and backers bring you more weight at the Assemblée. You can also play fraud cards to turn the tide in your favor, or rip the tide away from another player.

ELECTIONS

Mimicking the Constitution of the French Fifth Republic (with a few liberties of course) every 5 turns, a President will be elected in a two round system. In the first round only the two players with the most popularity get to the second round. Then for the second round, every other players has to endorse one of the two finalists and lend them their own popularity.

WINNING

At the end of turn 12, it's time to see who collected the most victory points through being elected or Bills that gave your points based on the backers you have accumulated.

Of course there is much more to discover in the cards and positions within the government, but that's for you to discover in the game !

—description from the designer (English)

Bordélocratie est un jeu qui vous plongera dans le bordel politique de la Ve République. Vous aurez l'occasion d'incarner de grands partis qui marqueront l'histoire du pays et qui vous propulserons au sommet : à l'Élysée !

Mais pour ça, il vous faudra réunir des soutiens de tout bord, avoir plus de voix à l'Assemblée, voter des lois et faire campagne.

Créé comme un party game qui peut être joué en version politicarde (plus longue, plus intense, avec plus de couteaux dans le dos), une partie dure environ 1h et réuni autour d'une même table entre 4 et 6 personnes, passionnées des grands débats télévisés de la Ve République ou simplement qui veulent à leur tour se sentir puissant·e·s tout en méprisant leurs adversaires politiques qui ne sont rien (jusqu'à-ce qu'ils ou elles le deviennent).

COMMENT JOUER

Chaque tour, tout le monde pioche 2 cartes Action puis en joue une seule.
Ensuite, le ou la Premier·e joueur·euse pioche 3 cartes Loi et en propose une à l’Assemblée avant d’en tirer une 2e qui est soumise aussi à l’Assemblée.
Tout le monde vote sur les propositions de Loi (chacune donne des points de victoire selon des conditions spécifiques).
Puis le tour se termine et on passe au suivant.

LES CARTES ACTION

Les cartes Action que vous pouvez utiliser ont plusieurs rôles. Les Événements changent le cours du jeu, les Campagne vous permettent d’augmenter votre popularité et les Soutiens vous apportent plus de Voix à l’Assemblée. Vous pouvez aussi jouer des cartes Fraude pour tirer la couverture à vous, ou la retirer d’une autre personne qui la veut pour elle ou lui.

ÉLECTIONS

En imitant la Constitution de la Ve République (avec quelques libertés bien sûr) tous les 5 tours un·e Président·e est élu·e dans un système à deux tours. Au premier, seules les deux personnes avec le plus de Popularité passent au second. Puis, pour le second tour, tout le monde qui n’a pas passé le premier doit soutenir un·e des deux finalistes en leur prêtant sa popularité.

GAGNER

À la fin du 12e tour, c’est l’heure de trouver un·e vainqueur. La personne avec le plus de points de victoire (obtenus par des élections ou des Lois) gagne le jeu, la politique et toute la République.

Il y a bien sûr encore plus à découvrir dans ce jeu, à travers les cartes, les rôles au sein du gouvernement etc, mais ça c’est à vous de le découvrir !

—description from the designer (French)
mechanics: Alliances, Role Playing, Set Collection, Voting

name: Sydney (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
description:
A fan expansion for Ticket to Ride based on the train and bus networks in the city of Sydney, Australia.

Map background created by Stamen Design and used under CC BY 3.0

name: The Unknown Soldiers
description:
The Unknown Soldiers is a solitaire game of squad-level combat during World War 2 by designer Gottardo Zancani. The Unknown Soldiers is designed and played in the style as the award-winning Space Infantry series. Players will conduct several Missions as either the United States or German forces. Players can play either a single mission or as part of a full campaign.

—description from the publisher

name: Unseen Domains
description:
In a world plunged into chaos by the Witchplauge, humanity grapples to survive. But with struggle, comes the endeavor for revival. The Unseen Domains are treacherous, but might lay the foundations of a new future if it is not destroyed by greed first.

In Unseen Domains the players compete for victory points over three rounds using their unique decks. In the end, the player who has the most victory points wins. During the rounds, each player can perform actions by playing their cards. Actions are used to recruit new units and move them, activate area abilities, and perform various maneuvers for a positional advantage.

Victory points are scored for controlling the domains at the end of each round. They also let the players use the given area's abilities. In the Wilderness, various quests can be completed for powerful Bloodshards.

Each player can perform actions in their turn, but only one of each action type. With certain abilities, and the precious Bloodshards, this limitation can be exceeded, so the pace of the game can be manipulated.

Once the first player has run out of cards, the round ends. Everyone else has one more turn to play, and the player who ended the round gets a free bonus action. With this bonus action in mind, it might be worth it to play your hand as early as possible. But some players who read the game well can make an even better deal by leaving the bonus to the others.

The key is to carefully assess your options, use the abilities to your advantage and time your actions right. Those who can do this can dominate the Unseen Domains.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Deck Construction, Hand Management

name: Good & Bad Deeds
description:
This is Print&Play game with dice management on good and bad deeds background. In this game is very big pressure for dice results manipulations.
There is a theme here of managing the reputation track and balancing between good and bad deeds.
Each round you roll one die for choose environtment (outside or inside) for available deeds. Then you roll three dice and use them for one of different actions. Finally you aim to achieve both end goals at the end of the game - one from Reputation Type and one from Reputation Amount. It you achieve both end goals you won.

name: Dibu Dilo
description:
Up to 4 teams of 2 or more members are formed. Each team chooses a starting artist, but everyone must draw at some point, as it rotates each turn.

On each turn, a team spins the wheel, it will indicate a color. Advance to the next square of that color. The player who draws on that turn, removes a card from the deck of words, and must try to represent by drawing the word to guess (according to the selected color). After making the drawing, his partner will try to guess the word in an agreed time.

The draftsman cannot add details to the drawing or speak while his partner tries to get it right, he can only guide him by indicating one of the orientation symbols on the board: Almost, On the track, Wrong idea, Combine, Sounds similar, First-second (for words compound). If you guess the word, you get 1 point.

There is also the possibility of all teams playing in one turn, or challenging another team to guess the word.

The team that gets 10 points first wins.

name: Hexslingers
description:
Hexslingers is a "build and break" weird west card game for two to four players.

In this alternate universe where witchcraft and the old west collide, you start by using spells to build locations in the town of Superstition on your block - from filthy outhouses to fancy hotels.

As the town grows, all manner of weird and wild folk and critters are attracted to your town. Strategically place them to gain bonuses and grow your hex power. However, as the town of Superstition grows, so does its tension level.

When the tension finally "breaks", a hex-slinging gun fight erupts! "Sling" your hex cards to defeat your opponent's folk and shatter their buildings and their protective spells.

The surviving player with the most points (calculated using a variety of methods from set collection to building strength) is the winner!

—description from the designer
categories: American West, Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Chaining, Deck Construction, Finale Ending, Set Collection, Take That

name: Estate Sale
description:
Overview

You and your family are quietly walking around your neighborhood. Suddenly you hear a commotion around the corner. It seems that EVEYRONE is pouring into a house! One of your neighbors has suddenly left and they are having an ESTATE SALE! You and your family jump on the opportunity to pick up some art; books; furniture; silverware; and clothes from the home. Over the course of the day you all explore the house in an attempt to find long lost treasurers and some hidden gems. You also stop to participate in some instant auctions against the other families in the home. Of course, one person’s trash is another person’s treasure as you learn to dumpster dive for some discarded items. No matter what, you always have to remember to move and buy wisely! At the end of the day the family that scores the most points wins the game!

Summary

Estate Sale is a 1-6 player table top game involving buying; auctioning; and acquiring different items from an estate sale. Players represent families competing against one another to score the most victory points and win the game.

What is an Estate Sale?

An estate sale is a method of selling ALL (or most) of the contents of a home. Estate sales usually happen after the death of an occupant or other event that causes the inhabitants to quickly move away from the home. Estate sales usually take place over several days and are generally open to the public. An estate sale is like a garage sale or a tag sale. The main difference is that an estate sale is meant to dispose of all of a home’s possessions in an orderly manner. Estate sales are much more than a yard sale as EVERYTHING has a price tag. Everything is up for sale.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Constrained Bidding, Hidden Victory Points, Highest-Lowest Scoring, Point to Point Movement

name: Reise durch das Märchenland
description: The players take turns to roll and move. They start at space 1 and have to reach space 66 to win the game. On some spaces events from fairy tales hinder or benefit the players.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: きりきりケーキ (Cut Cut Cake)
description:
A genius patissier who works at a popular cake shop is great at baking cakes, but not so good at cutting.
So you have been hired at the cake shop to cut the cakes.
Using a pen, draw lines to cut the cakes into many pieces with ordered toppings within the time limit!
Don't worry about their non-uniform size and shapes. It's OK as long as the toppings match! Be the best cutter of all!

ある大人気ケーキ屋さんで働く天才パティシエはケーキ作りは一流だけど、カットは苦手。
君はそんなケーキ屋さんに雇われたカット係。
制限時間内にペンで線を引いてケーキを区切り、注文通りのトッピングのケーキをたくさんカットしよう！
大きさや形がバラバラ?トッピングさえ合っていればOKさ！誰よりも優秀なカット係を目指そう！

—description from the designer

name: Better Letters
description:
Come up with words that meet the criteria set forth by the board. Score points for difficulty and type, and meeting personal and public objectives.

Better Letters is played on a 5 x 5 grid of cards. Set up the game by shuffling the entire deck and dealing out nine cards into a 3 x 3 grid into the middle of the play area. Cards may be placed in any location as long as there are no more than one of each type (color/shape) in a column or row (Sudoku-style). If you are unable to place all nine, discard the duplicates and redraw/refill until the 3x3 grid is complete. Shuffle the personal objective cards and deal out three to each player. Each player will select two to keep and discard the other. These are kept secret from other players. Shuffle the public objective cards and deal out three face-up next to the playing area. Place the three timer cards in order from 1-3 above the public objectives and set the 30-second timer next to them.

Better Letters is played in rounds with all players acting at the same time. Turn over the 2-minute timer to begin the round. Each player’s goal is to form a word(s) by following the restrictions listed on one or multiple cards. You may work from the top, bottom, left or right, in a straight line without skipping any cards and beginning with a card on the edge. Write down your word(s) on your score sheet in the corresponding round box. All players must finish discovering their words before the timer runs out. When the timer expires, everyone makes sure they have one word circled from their list and will be the word they submit for the round.

Custom scoring commences and the game is played over 10 rounds.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Party Game, Real-time, Word Game
mechanics: Action Timer, Paper-and-Pencil, Real-Time, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Pacific Crucible Naval Battles of the Pacific
description:
Pacific Crucible picks up where Jay Boyer Carrier Battles and Iron Samurai left off. Pacific Crucible includes the Basic, Advanced, and Optional rules for Carrier Battles, and Basic Game Rules for The Iron Samurai for Naval Battles.

Pacific Crucible is a historical simulation of Navy warfare fought between, the Air, Naval, and Land forces of the Imperial Japanese Empire and the Allied forces during World War II. Pacific Crucible covers the aircraft carrier operations in detail, along with the surface actions. We have a large allotment of scenarios both historical and hypothetical with an extended campaign system.

—description from the publisher

name: Bunter Abend
description:
This is a compendium of small games and quizzes for the family to emulate a tv-show. After each game points are awarded and counted by moving meeples on a counting sheet showing spaces 1 - 90.

There are quizz questions for the themes "Fairy tales and legends", "Sports and games", "Various", "Music" and "History". Additionaly there are geographical questions in the categories Europe, Asia, Africa, America and Australia.

There are games with dice, a spinner, a rod and line, a catapult for flying hats and so on.

If a player reaches certain spaces on the counting sheet he has to solve a task to get extra points. The first player to reach 90 points wins the game.

The game was published in the 1960s.

—user summary
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Puzzle, Trivia

name: Town & Gear
description:
Before embarking on your thru-hike, pack your bag with essential gear to help you handle the most extreme weather, maximize your energy, and your enjoyment points! Don’t forget to stop off and tour the towns, repack your bag, and much more!

There are 16 different polyomino-shaped gear, each with a unique shape, size, and ability! With a bagful of goodies, you'll be able to mitigate dice rolls, avoid negative effects of weather, and break some rules entirely!

Towns along the trail offer new and powerful actions that you can use! You can Tour the Town, send a postcard to a friend, and rest and recover like never before! You can also repack your bag with your favorite gear and take advantage of new and interesting scoring opportunities!

—description from the designer

name: In Mahan's Wake
description:
In Mahan's Wake is ATG’s third supplement for Dawn of the Battleship. It has thirty-one scenarios, a mix of historical battles, like the Sino-Japanese War, near-historical (“almost happened”), and fictional scenarios.

The latter include a series of scenarios called the Great Maritime War of 1899, by William Le Queux, one of the many “war scare” books of that period (the techno-thrillers of that age). The story line was converted into playable scenarios by the knowledgeable Bob Eldridge, who unfortunately passed away in 2017. Mike Harris, his co-author, has finished the work.

In addition to the scenarios, the book includes annexes covering all the ships and weapons required to play them.

name: Read My List!
description:
Read My List is a category-association game in which players draw cards and provide three more examples of things that would fit a given list of words, name the category of a list of words, or take turns naming a word from a category until no one can come up with anymore.

In each round, the reading player draws a card from the box. The card will be one of three types of cards: List, Category or Lightning Round. Every card also has a Beginner side (blue) and an advanced side (red). The reader gets to decided which difficulty they want the players to play that round.

List cards offer a list of a number of items (e.g., the "Cheeses" list card lists Brie, Jack, Colby, goat, etc.). To score points the other players must provide three more items that fit the list's category, but are NOT on the card.

For Category cards, the reader slowly reads each item in the list as the other players shout out guesses as to what the category is—for instance the reader could be reading "lookout", "thief", "map", "parrot", and so on, and if a player correctly guessed "pirates", they would earn points.

The Lightning Round cards simply provide a subject (e.g., "Celebrities") after which players take turns quickly providing a thing that matches the subject. If a player can't come up with something quickly enough they are out. The last player to provide a timely answer gets the points.

The object of the game is to be the first player to score 5 points.
mechanics: Connections, Hot Potato, Memory, Move Through Deck, Speed Matching, Targeted Clues

name: Observatory
description:
The night sky is divided into 88 Constellations. From those 88 Constellations, Asterisms are created as additional patterns. You and your fellow astral cartographers will map the night sky in this roll and write family friendly game. Each Constellation and Asterism card contains details about the pattern, providing for an educational experience as well.

On each player's turn, they will roll all of the dice. The active player is the only one to use the larger dice to plot a star. All of the other players, including the active player, will choose from the three smaller dice by picking two numbers for their chart coordinates and one for its research value.

The Constellation and Asterism cards have their own mapping patterns you must draw in your grid. As you complete cards, you earn victory points and other bonus actions.

Your research area is where you will use one die per turn to advance your equipment and funding resources.

Rounds are based on the number of players and final scoring is tallied from your completed constellations and asterisms, as well as any funding you have unlocked in your research hub.

—description from the designer

name: Alice's Race in Wonderland
description:
This is a children's race game that casts players in the roles of characters from Lewis Carroll's popular novel "Alice's Adventures in Wonderland." Alice, the White Rabbit, the Mad Hatter, and/or the Queen of Hearts each follow their own single-color 80-space path to the finish, similar in nature to "Peter Rabbit's Race Game" (1917).

Although the game is built for 2 to 4 players, some editions accommodate up to 8 in teams of two (with two of each character's playing token provided). Alternatively, it is suggested that single players may use both identical tokens, always taking care to move the rear-most of the two.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Hotline Dice Game
description: 1 to 6 players take on the roll of Hotline operators. Every round more calls come in so everyone has to roll the dice to try and complete the hotline calls before they get built up and to try and get the right response to right calls.

name: Space Pirates
description:
"Infinite space awaits you! Unknown planets are calling to you with treasures and adventures. Now you can find out what the life of a real space pirate is like, searching for hidden treasures and even fighting battles to get more loot. It's worth taking the risk for the fantastic treasures, because their magic power can come in handy on your journey. But watch out, use them wisely!"

—description from the publisher

In Space Pirates the players are pirating astronauts who each turn roll a special die to determine their next destination. Reaching a yet unexplored planet is rewarded by a special treasure.
Each treasure may have a hidden special bonus action, which help the players navigate to harder-to-reach planets, evade asteroid fields, or even give an advantage in case of a fight when a meeting another pirate.
The game ends when all treasures are found, the player with the most treasure being the winner.

name: Star Wars: Rebels vs. Galactic Empire
description:
"Choose your side of the Force and join the fight! Become the young Rebel Ezra, or the ruthless hand of the empire - The Inquisitor. Make use of your allies, defend or conquer. In this strategic card game it is you who will decide the fate of the galaxy. May the Force be with you!"

Star Wars: Rebels vs. Galactic Empire is a fast-paced card game for two players. The Rebel team must persevere against imperial superiority, while the goal of the Empire is to rush down and destroy the Rebels as soon as possible.

On one side of this galactic battleground are the Spectres, the heroes from the Star Wars Rebels television series. Opposing the heroic endeavors of the Ghost Crew is the massive power of the Empire, led by the Grand Inquisitor.

The empire wins if they successfully break into the Rebel base, while the Rebels win if they can keep the base and the imperial player run out of cards.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Moving Multiple Units, Point to Point Movement

name: Gridiron All-Stars
description:
Gridiron All-Stars is a hard-hitting game of American Football set in a post-apocalyptic America. Gridiron All-Stars does away with the complexities and randomness that have become a staple of sports games; instead relying upon abstracted movements and euro-mechanics to deliver an authentic and quick-playing sports experience that takes mere minutes to learn yet many games to master.

Gridiron All-Stars relies upon action programming and resource management to create a deep tactical experience that captures the feel of the sport without getting bogged down in its nuance. Before each drive, choose a Play to determine what Actions your team will take on that Drive (action programming). Once the ball is snapped, you can use a limited pool of Action Cards to supplement or upgrade those actions to try to score a touchdown or tackle the opposing team’s ballcarrier.

Start playing the Base Game in 10 minutes. Captain a seven player Gridiron team in the local leagues to develop your favorite Plays, learn to manage player positioning, and how to maximize the impact of your Action Cards. When you’re ready for the primetime, unlock the asymmetric aspects of the game by taking control of one of one of the pre-made teams or create one of your own. Add Star Players and specialized Team Cards to unlock new levels of strategic and tactical depth.

Most importantly, Gridiron All-Stars plays fast. There are no dice. There are no charts. There is no waiting for your opponent to decide whether to block your action. Play moves quickly back-and-forth emulating as much as possible the speed with which the actual sport is played. Play as fast as you want – think speed chess – with a full game playable in 30-45 minutes.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Queue, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Score-and-Reset Game, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection, Square Grid, Variable Player Powers

name: Shadow and Steel
description:
The Shadow and Steel Expansion adds 12 agents and 4 tyrants to the base game.
The agents have two categories: Shardhunter and Schemer. Each player controls one of each type during the game, selected at the draft. Every agent has a unique active and passive ability, for a wider range of possibilities.
Shardhunters move across the wilderness, gaining extra abilities based on the quests they complete.
Schemers help the player to dominate the Havens, they also have extra abilities.

Tyrants add unique opponents to solo play. Each has 3 levels to fine-tune the difficulty. By including them and the agents you can play through a gradually more challenging solo campaign of 12 missions. This campaign is further supported by event cards, which can even be used in multiplayer, breaking the basic rules, creating interesting situations, and increasing replayability.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Deck Construction, Hand Management

name: Anawak Starter Set
description:
Ce- Anahuac “The Known World” in Nahuatl.

Anawak is a Mesoamerican miniature skirmish tactical game where up to four players must foster the greatest army of the continent immersing into a highly mythical Mesoamerican world, The players will search and persuade warriors to join their cause, gather and shape obsidian for arrows and macuahuitls (swords), prove their shamans in battle so they can understand the cosmos, siege Cities, protect temples, Invoke creatures of old: Battle by battle the warriors will become jaguar or eagle warriors, and if they are lucky to survive they will become leaders. Owl-Man (Shamans) will become Astronomers and Invocators, and in the end, only the player that invokes The great spirit of Quetzalcoatl will win the Tournament….

Or bring total destruction to all, of course.

Anawak Starter Set has 3 “Tutorial” Tournaments of 5 battles each. The tournaments were meticulously designed to let you start playing without learning all the rules, you will learn as you play. As you advance, the battles grow in size and epicness! Every battle let the players experience different tactics and scenarios: Siege, area control, extermination, summon gods, exploding volcanoes, run-for-your-life-from-flooding-cities scenarios, and more.

And when you end the 15 battles you can start all over again, mix and match battles to create your own tournaments, or with the help of the “New scenario sheets” and the 80+ different tiles of the board you can create infinite battle scenarios.

Anawak Starter Set comes with 24 different miniatures and a total of 65.

—description from the designer

name: Hackagon
description:
Hackagon is a cyber security game that can be played with 2-4 players. The game is about the challenge between the Blue Team and the Red Team.

The purpose of the game is to develop the best strategy to strengthen the security of the system or to deepen security gaps to create vulnerability in the system.

The factors for determining the winner of the game are created by individual or collective choices during the play and the right use of in-game elements.

The purpose of the Blue Team is to provide security of the current system. The Red Team aims at spreading in all cells of the system by doing the greatest harm to the system. The basic motivation of each team is the achievement of required basic information and their usage towards developing an effective strategy in accordance with the aim.

Besides, team members can behave as Purple Team during the play. Players who come to the relevant phase do interactive studies with each other to share data about cyber security vulnerabilities. The achievements in this part directly contribute to teams and players.

All players in the game can earn extra income by actively taking place at cryptocurrency market. Players who experience market’s volatility based on the analysis and news on the relevant cards try to predict the investment tools to advantage them.
mechanics: Communication Limits, Dice Rolling, Investment, Map Reduction, Simulation, Stat Check Resolution, Take That, Team-Based Game, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks

name: BattleTech: Shrapnel Magazine – Issue 9
description: More Shrapnel, featuring fiction from both new and established BattleTech authors, and new game material.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: Hot Stove 1: The Mother of Battle
description: This is ATS ALL NEW HOT STOVE 1, a set of 6 scenarios + AFV Cards set on a 24" × 52" map that begins a series of large, large hex actions. This is NOT the old Hot Stove 1. Ownership of standard German, Russian, American and British Personnel and AFVs, plus the ATS Rulebook 2014 and standard system small and large markers - is required to play.

name: The Trash Pack: Dash for Trash
description: Race your Trashie around Trash Town visiting the Recycle Ranch, Grot Lot and Compost Island. Collect a Trashie token at each of these locations before making a dash to the Junk Food Restaurant for one more Trashie token. Be the first player to collect one of each kind of Trash and to reach the Finish space to claim victory.

name: Dumpster Fire Party!
description:
Dumpster Fire Party! is a storytelling game in which you and your friends share the absurd, embarrassing, and hilarious stories that make us want to chuck our whole life in the dumpster and set it ablaze.

Grab your friends, pick a theme, then kick back and listen to everybody describe one personal nightmare after another. The person with the best (or worst) stories wins!

You'll be surprised at how terrible your lives really are!

—description from the publisher

name: Flying Colors: Beat to Quarters, Vol III
description:
Beat to Quarters, Vol III (Blue Cross, White Ensign) is an official expansion to Blue Cross, White Ensign by GMT Games, LLC and requires a copy of that game to play.

One of the most common criticisms of the Flying Colors system is the clutter of status markers on the map and that they may detract from game play. This concern can be minimized somewhat by using status sheets and a handy pencil to keep track of things on paper. This, however, adds a separate record-keeping aspect that the design of the game goes out of its way to avoid.

Beat to Quarters provides the ultimate way by which to keep track of the status of individual ships through the use of individual tracking cards that are kept conveniently near the map and that are laid out to conveniently hold a variety of status markers such as Broadsides Fired, Sail State, Rigging Damage, and Hull Damage. The cards are designed to be printed at a standard 3.5 by 2.5 inch size so that they can be slipped into card protectors for extended usage.

Individual tracking cards are included for all 231 individually named ships included with Blue Cross, White Ensign. But that’s not all!

As a bonus, Beat to Quarters also includes the print-and-play components for an entirely new way to play Blue Cross, White Ensign. Drawing from games such as Naval War, Modern Naval Battles, and (in particular) Enemy in Sight, Beat to Quarters can be played with just the ship tracking cards, a special set of markers and 8.5 x 11 inch tracking board, and the status markers from Blue Cross, White Ensign. The ship cards are organized into squadrons that maneuver and fire against the opposing fleet within a relatively small playing area. With Beat to Quarters, you can play the huge battles without the space requirements for several game maps.

NOTE: This volume of Beat to Quarters only includes marker sheets for the British, French, and American fleets. There are insufficient Spanish, Venetian, and East India Company ships to form a fleet, but these ships can be included in the fleets of the other nationalities as desired or added to the cards from the first volume of Beat to Quarters.

With Beat to Quarters, you can either enhance or completely change your enjoyment of Blue Cross, White Ensign!

—description from the publisher
categories: Age of Reason, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Napoleonic, Print & Play, Wargame

name: Zoomalia
description:
The Zoomalia is a game to play with friends and the whole family.
​
Players will participate in two distinct phases to accumulate the most points. In the first phase, which consists of an Animal Auction, players will purchase animal cards that will be used in the next phase. In the second phase, players must collect the best combination of foods through the Food Market using the cards acquired in the first phase.

The player with the highest score will be the winner.

—description from the designer
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Party Game
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Hand Management, Order Counters, Selection Order Bid, Set Collection

name: Vem får sista ordet?
description:
Vem får sista ordet? is a word game. Each round there will be two cards drawn, one with a letter and one with an category (eg. dishes). After that a timer is started, and all player in clockwise order gonna start say a word that fits the category and also that starts on the given letter. The player that has said the last word when the timers rings move that players pawn one step on the board. The first player that reach goal (takes 13 steps) is the winner.

—user summary

name: Rex
description:
This is a track game, copyright 1888, with "safety tracks" (turnouts) on each side. In fact, it almost exactly resembles the board layout of Parker Brothers' later games Pollyanna and The Popular Game of Broadway. The only real difference is that there are no "home" paths branching off of the main track. Instead, players start pieces off on their "entrance" space (the board corner in front of them) and make a single loop of the board, returning pieces to the entrance space and then moving them to the center of the board, called the "court."

THe game is first seen in the Parker Games catalog for 1889, on page 5. The ads do not indicate how the game is played, only that it includes "turned maple pieces" and a spinner. Identical listings are found in the 1890 and 1891 catalogs.

By 1892, Rex is being packaged with The Amusing Game of Kilkenny Cats as two sides of a "combination" board game. It is available in this form until 1895.

name: Chilli or Chunder: Chilli Eating Contest Game
description:
As chilli eating contestants there are two things you focus on: Eating more chillies than the other contestants. The other... Not chundering!

Over five rounds of ever increasing hotness, you will eat your way through each chilli, bite by bite. You will need to keep down the bites and once the whole chilli is gone, you show your empty mouth before progressing to the next round. Or fall victim to the chilli, either by failing to take the next bite or chundering it back up.

Outlast your fellow contestants to take the crowning glory and become the Chilli or Chunder Champion!

Included is the 5th and 6th contestant expansion "Chilli or Chunder: Hot Stuff", with two new ways to play:

- First Timer (more challenging)
Having never eaten hot stuff chillies before but decided to give the contest a go none the less, this contestant shows determination of steel, but without the matching stomach.

- Professional (less challenging)
A hot stuff chilli eating machine, this contestant should eat up this contest.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck, Variable Player Powers

name: ESHIP: Navigating Uncertainty
description:
The Game
Players test their team-based decision-making abilities within the safe environment of a game. They role-play, discuss, narrate, and make strategic decisions under uncertain conditions simulated by characters, traits, unforeseen events, team-communication, and time pressure.

Who can play?
Basically anyone with reading and comprehension skills can play. Although created for students of Entrepreneurship, it can be played by novices, experts, educators, entrepreneurs, or anyone who wants to kickstart their own project – for-profit, non-profit, or social.

Who can play?
Basically anyone with reading and comprehension skills can play. Although created for students of Entrepreneurship, it can be played by novices, experts, educators, entrepreneurs, or anyone who wants to kickstart their own project – for-profit, non-profit, or social.

Winning condition
In contrast to many other games, a lower score leads you to success. In a multi-team setting, the team with the lowest uncertainty score wins.

name: Sunset
description: In Sunset, players take turns to shape the sunset. Each turn, a player may choose to expand the sky by placing a colored card in a grid. Or, they can place a cloud on a sky card. They may also move the sun token (sideways or down). When the top row is completed, each player chooses a scoring card from their hand. On these cards are descriptions such as “grey clouds in the top row”, “pink cards in the sky” or “clouds on the top row”. The player with the highest scoring card places it in front of them. The top row is removed and the game continues until one player has collected three scoring cards.
mechanics: Events, Pattern Building, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Square Grid, Tile Placement

name: Strike HQ
description:
Strike HQ is a two-player, head-to-head, expandable battle card game that brings the classic thrill of real-time strategy (RTS) video games to the tabletop.


Starting with only a Headquarters and a handful of units, you play commanders of opposing factions and will use an innovative blend of simultaneous action programming and hidden information mechanics to construct your bases, deploy more units, and launch a strike against the enemy HQ.

The game takes 2 minutes to set up, plays in around one hour, and you win by either destroying your opponent’s HQ through an overwhelming offensive or by sitting back and storing up enough resources to launch a game-ending Atomic Strike!

Gameplay is inspired by classic PC RTS video games of the 1990s like Command & Conquer: Red Alert, and more recently Company of Heroes.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Movement, Deck Construction, Programmed Movement, Secret Unit Deployment, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: BattleTech: Technical Readout – 3085 Supplemental
description: Technical Readout – 3085 Supplemental provides details and gameplay statistics for additional infantry, battle armor, vehicles, 'Mechs, and aerospace units that debuted during the Jihad and its immediate aftermath.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: Boxcar Battle
description: Build the highest scoring trains while preventing your opponents from doing the same. Players are dealt cards with train cars depicted on them including engines, boxcars, tankers, flat cars, and cabooses. Different cars have various abilities that raise or lower the point total of the train onto which it is played. On their turn the player plays one card on any of their trains or an opponents train them chooses another card from the deck. Play continues until all three track cards are discovered from the deck at which time points are totaled.

name: Snitches Get Stitches: the card game
description:
Snitches Get Stitches: the card game, is a game of "Riotous Prison Fun" for 3-6 players ages 13 and up. Players will recruit "gang members" and collect "contraband" in order to reduce their prison sentence and get out of prison first. Shanking other players, stealing their contraband, or encouraging their gang members to defect are all useful strategies to win. This turn-based card game gives players the opportunity to collect sets of contraband, trade with other players, and cheat, steal or lie their way to the finish.

Just remember, "he who shanks last, shanks best!"

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Bribery, Hand Management, Race, Take That, Trading

name: Machi Koro: Millionaire's Row Event Construction Kit
description:
街コロシャープ (which translates as "Machi Koro Sharp") expands the Machi Koro base game with thirteen new establishment cards, including a winery, a moving company and a general store. The designer notes that the new cards somewhat increase the difficulty of the rules, and this expansion can be combined with Machi Koro: Harbor Expansion.

街コロシャープ contains 72 cards: six copies each of the ten red, blue, and green establishments and four copies each of the three purple major establishments.
categories: Card Game, City Building, Dice, Expansion for Base-game

name: Stomp The Monster
description:
See who's the best at monster spotting in this snap card game Stomp the Monster from Ridley's Games!

You and your friends are out searching for the elusive Stomp, the Monster. But on your trek, you've lost your batteries and only have one working camera between you all!

The aim of the game is to be the first player to find two batteries and have the camera in front of you to snap a picture of Stomp to win!

As you play, you'll want to try to collect batteries by either getting a double battery card or winning a snap on a numbered card that features batteries on it, as when you do you get to keep that battery card. And each time there is a snap, the camera card moves to the next player. So you'll want to have collected two batteries and have the camera card in front of you when the Stomp card comes up, for if you do, you've won!

Packaged in a sasquatch style container, this game is perfect for families and groups of friends, for Halloween or year-round monster fun!

—description from the publisher

name: Adulting
description:
Get ready for a hilarious night in for fully groan-up adults with Adulting from Ridley's Games!

Finally, a game where you're rewarded for when you do the dishes straight away and show up to work on time!

First, pick a badge randomly and read it to yourself without showing the other players. Then, it's time to put those hustling skills you earned working three jobs to cover off rent and your cat's deluxe silk bed and organic food subscription to use!

Do ANYTHING you can think of to EARN that badge while other players try to guess what achievement your badge is for. This isn't charades though -- you can speak, make noise and use nearby stuff like furniture, props, and even people!

The player who has earned the most badges and pins by the end of the game is the ultimate adult!

Perfect for millennials and any other adults who still don't know how to throw a proper dinner party, it's suitable for 3-5 players and has an average 20 minute gameplay. Can be played with roommates in your shared apartment, at the dinner table in your parent's house, or at your married friend's three-bedroom bungalow.

-description from publisher

name: Grab A Slice
description:
Get a pizza' the action with Grab A Slice from Ridley's Games!

In this supreme pizza game with all the tasty toppings, try to win points by rolling the dice to match the good type of toppings on a pizza card.

Start by grabbing a slice card that could come in handy later! Then, roll as many times as you like to try to win a pizza card, hopefully rolling enough of the good ingredients pictured in order to win it! But other players may challenge you for that pizza card! And if you roll too many of the bad ingredients listed, you'll go bust for that turn!

But beware, at the end of the game, the leading player rolls a die one final time to select a topping -- the player who grabbed the slice with that topping at the start of the game gets bonus points, and could potentially come out in the lead!

The player with the most points wins the game as the ultimate pizza aficiona-dough!

Freshly delivered in a pizza style box, it's perfect for pizza lovers or anyone who loves a cheesy party game. With gameplay for both small and large groups, it's suitable for ages 8+, 2-6 players and has an average 30 minute gameplay. Printed on FSC paper using vegetable inks.

-description from publisher

name: Riot Police Commander: Assault! Asama Mountain Lodge
description:
Riot Police Commander: Assault! Asama Mountain Lodge is a one-person exercise kit that deals with the final phase of the Asama Mountain Lodge incident, the hostage rescue operation on February 28, 1972.
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Asama-Sansō_incident

As the on-site commander, the player aims to completely control Asama Mountain Lodge. The exercise system refers to Avalon Hill's Squad Leader, especially for "units", "command ability" and "morale" in order to recreate the commander's influence, which was particularly noticeable in actual rescue operations.

In addition, the "Storm over System" (Area Impulse) was incorporated in the reproduction of the important aspect of "riot police battle", which is "eliminating barricades while suppressing extremists with water cannons and gas cylinders".

And besides, since the event cards reflect the "sudden incident" that occurred in the Asama Mountain Lodge incident, its impact can also be verified.
mechanics: Area Movement, Events, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Vilniaus pramonės istorijos
description:
Develop industry in XIX-XX c. Vilnius through different eras: rivers, rail and modern.
Each turn player will draw limited resources from the bag, and use them to build factories. Besides victory points factories allow to get production needed for other factories, to fulfill orders and long term projects. You can use factories of your opponents to help fulfil your orders faster, but you will give them extra resources.
Best industry developer wins!

—description from the designer

name: Etna: Fires of Sicily
description:
Trapped under Mt. Etna & chased by an ancient Sicilian philosopher, Players must use their unique abilities, manipulate the tomb and find artifacts to escape before the entire tomb collapses with them inside!

Players take turns moving their explorers through the maze to find the four needed keys to escape the labyrinth. They must bring them to the other side of the labyrinth to unlock the exit and run back to the exit before the volcano drops down on them!

Each room has a different ability or instant action the players can use; both can be good or bad, and they won't know until they enter!

Players have multiple routes to move through and can use several abilities; the ability of the room they occupy, their unique ability, or they can search for artifacts that give them a one-time use ability. Or they can rotate a room to block the philosopher's way.

At the end of each player's turn, the Philosopher moves closer to the explorers. If he ever catches up with a player, a curse tracker moves toward a round tracker, giving him more movement each round; the trackers ever meet its game over!

At the end of a full round of players, the round tracker moves toward the curse tracker on the numbered board. If they ever touch, it's game over!

Once the exit is opened, the rooms fall apart behind them, flipping them over to the destroyed side. They all must rush back to the exit before they are trapped forever!
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Line of Sight, Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Vexagon
description:
In this move-and-capture game, simple rules lead to complex play. Up to six players race to get their pieces across a hexagonal field of play. The direction and distance of each move is set by the throw of two dice. You can obstruct your opponents by jumping over their pieces and sending them back to the start, but the evil twist is that you can choose to move another player's piece rather than your own. So for example player A might move player B's piece backwards, capturing one of player C's pieces in the process.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Dragons with Rocket Launchers
description:
It's a peaceful summer's day on Dragon Island... or is it? A case of rocket launchers just washed onto shore!

Dragons with Rocket Launchers is a card game of frantically shooting rockets while fending off rockets coming in the player's direction. Each turn, a card is played affecting the state of the battlefield. When a Rocket Time card is played, all the rockets in play will move around the table and potentially eradicate some players.

Be the last dragon standing to win Dragons with Rocket Launchers!

—description from the designer

name: Simple Space Ship System
description:
A miniatures focused wargame with simple rules for space opera style armada versus armada combat, for any number of players. The game emphasizes and promotes players to make their own miniatures to represent their armadas, using any material they have available at any skill level.

Players start the game by allocating a number of unit points to create an armada compliment to battle with. Each player has the same unit value. Players take turns making actions with up to 5 ships of their ship, and an additional 2 with a special rule. They roll multiple six-sided dice to determine if ships become damaged. Once a ship takes 4 damage tokens it is destroyed. The game is played until one person surrenders or all of their units are destroyed.

The game is distributed as a book with no components, and players are encouraged to source pieces from gaming shops. Simple Space Ship is played on a field of any size, any foregoes all movement measurement mechanics. Players are free to move their units to any position they choose, simulating very fast moving spacecraft.

The book contains the rules of play, as well as a chart which tracks play over multiple gameplay sessions through it's legacy mechanic.

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, Game System, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Legacy Game, Line of Sight, Moving Multiple Units, Player Elimination

name: Potion Making
description:
You inherit the old potion shop from your ancestors. now, it is a great timing of potion making!!

Potion Making …plays like a roll-and-write dice game, but without dice. It is a Flip-and-write game.

Representative reveal a material card from the top of the deck. These materials are appeared as primary number. You refer that number and take an action to your own sheet.
You may try to make a BINGO line, or use that number to upgrade Magical Pots.　You can also “compound” new numbers.

Because of the communal actions, game play is simultaneous. It means that, Potion Making is playable for large groups of players.
mechanics: Bingo, Chaining, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Danger Bingo
description:
Imagine the classic format – a room full of fun-loving people, each with their own bingo card, a lively caller wielding a rotating bingo ball machine. Now this is where it gets interesting. The timeless bingo calls have all been updated *gasp* with a series of outlandish forfeits!

The bingo game where the more you win, the more you lose
Classic bingo calls have been turned into hilarious forfeits.
Just make sure you don't get BINGO!
Includes bingo ball machine, check board, cards and tokens

The one, who don't get bingo or the last player wins the game!

name: Roscoe Turner Air Race Game
description:
Simple "Roll and Move" dice game simulating airplane races of the 1920-40s. Game consists of 6 airplane miniatures and a board representing the race course. In turn/position order players move their planes forward "dice roll" number of spaces avoiding other players and occasionally encountering beneficial or detrimental spaces on the race course. First plane crossing the finish line (after a predetermined number of laps) wins.

—user summary
mechanics: Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: The Last Veggie
description:
Winter is coming, so best start stockpiling your food! Whether it be through diligent collecting, immoral stealing, or charismatic trading, there’s no right or wrong way! Just survive!

The Last Veggie is a card game won by being the last remaining player with cards. As to how you obtain cards, that is up to the player. The game allows for passive players to simply draw and collect cards, aggressive players to readily steal cards, and strategic players to trade with others. Games go by quickly, so the winner is usually determined by whoever reaches a set number of games won (recommended 3 games). Build allies, play alone, be petty, do whatever you like. Just make sure that you are the last one standing at the end of the game!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Bribery, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Voting

name: Immer vorwärts
description:
Each player gets 6 or 12 meeples (soldiers). The two neighboring player colors are allied. Movement is determined by the actual starting space of the soldier to be moved. The arrow shows the direction of movement and the numeral the number od spaces to move. The direction of movement may be changed after the first space.

A soldier may shoot an enemy soldier if he get on a space exactly matching the shooters range, which is also determined by the arrow and mumeral on the space the shooter is standing on. The players may not look at the numerals of the spaces occupied by enemy soldiers. The shooter moves to the space of the shot soldier, which is removed from play. If the enemy soldier stands on a space inside the shooters shooting range, the shooter moves to the space matching his shooting range, whereas the shot soldier stays on his space und gets a ring around his neck to indicate that he is wounded. If a wounded soldier get a second wound, he dies and is removed from the game.

Wounded soldiers have to move back to their starting spaces to recover from their wound. On their way back they ignore the arrows and may not shoot at enemy soldiers.
