The party or player to get the most soldiers to their opponents starting spaces wins the game.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Static Capture

name: Det nappar med Mamma Mu och Kråkan
description:
Mamma Mu and Kråkan have lost their adventure puzzles in the lake. Now all the pieces are lying and bouncing around in a mess. You have already received the first piece. But you need five more pieces from the same puzzle to win the game. Now it's time to fish right puzzle pieces from the lake. Each puzzle has 6 pieces.

The players in turn fish up a piece of the puzzle and place it in front of them. If it´s not fit the player's own puzzle, the player can still save the piece.

The winner is the player who has first placed the whole of his puzzle.

name: Le Labyrinthe du Minotaure
description: Be the first to get out of the labyrinth imagined by Daedalus while avoiding the Minotaur. This is a tile-laying strategy game. Roll the die then place your tiles, move or block your opponents. Be careful, if you meet the Minotaur in his lair, you will have to face him in a duel!
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Tile Placement

name: Passport To Culture: Travel Edition
description:
In Passport to Culture players travel around the world map depicted on the game board, with the goal of filling their passport with stamps. Along the way players must attempt to answer questions pertaining to the diverse peoples and countries of the world.

The Travel Edition includes more than 1,000 new and unique questions, as well as a Cultural Intelligence (CQ) scoring key score pad and a reduction in player count.

Contents: Game comes with 203 country/ continent cards (with over 1,000 questions), 5 Passports, 50 magnetic passport stamps, custom Passport To Culture die, 15 answer cards, a score pad and instructions.

name: Sheep 7
description:
In Sheep 7, players take on the role of shepherds trying to round up their flocks of sheep as quickly as possible.
Your flock of sheep has scattered into small groups! As a good shepherd, you must regroup them! If you want to win, be the first to gather your flock!
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Number

name: 黒猫ポーカー (Black Cat Poker)
description: This game is cooperative poker. Everyone puts out one card at a time, and everyone makes one role. We will discuss it well and aim to make a better role. However, please note that there are obstacles there. [Purpose of the white cat] Earn the specified points or find the black cat in the specified number of games. [Purpose of the black cat] Do not meet the specified points. However, be careful not to notice the white cat.

name: 9ポーカー (9 poker)
description:
Explore poker with a simple "Hunt Strength" number from 1 to 9, in this one handed poker game for two. The information disclosure dice determine the number of face-down cards that can be turned over. Use the disclosure dice to predict your opponent's hand and consider whether or not to chip it.

Use "critical cards" with various effects to advance your battle to your advantage.

name: Gear Wars
description:
-===**** COMING SOON ****===-

STORY
~~~~~
Set in a distant future. Humans must live and survive by playing in an annual game by racing or battling with cars.

OBJECTIVE
~~~~~~~~~
Plays as 1 of 6 unique character roles and 1 of 6 unique vehicles to win based on the type of game modes selected.

GAMEPLAY
~~~~~~~~
There are 3 Phases in the game:
1) Planning Phase: Players will use this time plan for the other 2 Phases (Movement and Attack) Players will play a Gear Card face-down to plan for the Movement Phase. They may also play a Power-up face-down to add to the Movement Phase. Next, Players will play a Weapon Card face-down to plan for the Attack Phase. They may also play a Power-up face-down to add to the Attack Phase.

2) Movement Phase: Players will take turn resolving their movements based on the Gear Cards they have selected in the Planning Phase and play any additional Power-ups added.

3) Attack Phase: Players will take turn resolving their attacks based on the Weapon Cards they have selected in the Planning Phase and play any additional Power-ups added.

After completing all 3 Phases, this is considered a round. The phases are then repeated until a winner is determined.

WINNING THE GAME
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Winning the game is based on the game mode players have selected. For example, If it's a Race Mode, they have to be the first to the Finish Line. If it's a Deathmatch Mode, they have to reach a certain amount of points to win.

GAME MODES
~~~~~~~~~~
1) Competitive Race Mode
2) Classic Race Mode
3) Team Race Mode
4) Capture the Flag Mode
5) Deathmatch Mode
6) Team Deathmatch Mode
7) Elimination Mode
8) Assault Mode

GAME STATS:
~~~~~~~~~~~
Ages 8+
30-45 Minutes
2-6 Players

GAME TYPE:
~~~~~~~~~~
Asymmetrical
Competitive
Cooperative
Family
Party
Sci-Fi

MECHANISMS
~~~~~~~~~~
Action Queue
Bluffing
Deception
Deduction
Grid Movement
Hand Management
Memory
Modular Board
Player Elimination (mode specific)
Programmed Movement
Racing (mode specific)
Simultaneous Action Selection
Take That
Team-Based (mode specific)

-description from publisher
categories: Bluffing, Party Game, Racing, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Queue, Cooperative Game, Deduction, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Memory, Modular Board, Player Elimination, Programmed Movement, Race, Simultaneous Action Selection, Team-Based Game

name: Simpatico!
description:
Simpatico! is a social word game in which players try to intuit how their friends transformed one word into another… and another… and another. Each round, the Associator starts with a prompt word and uses instructions on Association Cards to transform it three times. The rest of the players try to guess the two hidden steps between the prompt word and the result. The player who is most Simpatico will come out on top. WILL IT BE YOU?!?!

—description from the publisher

name: Half-Pint Heroes: Bottoms Up! – Promo Cards
description:
The set contains 5 cards of value 0 which can simply added to the game. The cards added the following rule to the game: whenever a player wins a trick which contains a card with value 0, the whole trick is worth 0 points.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Das Paket enthält 5 Nullerkarten, die ihr einfach ins Spiel einmischen könnt. Die Karten ergänzen dann die Regeln, um eine Sonderregel: Bekommt ein Spieler einen Stich, der eine Nullerkarte enthält, so bringt ihm dieser Stich keine Punkte.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor
mechanics: Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection, Trick-taking

name: Quest for Home: 30,000 BC
description:
Quest for Home: 30,000 BC is a single-player, narrative card game about a clan of Neanderthals searching for a new cave to live in. Your eight-person clan will trek through hazardous terrain, encountering events along the way, while foraging for food, crafting, and entertaining each other to keep spirits up. No two journeys are ever the same.

You begin the journey with a clan of eight people - a mix of adults, youth, elders and toddlers who each contribute dice to the clan's dice pool. Each turn, you decide how far to journey. You can camp in place to rest and remove weariness, or move more quickly through a landscape of forest, meadows, rivers and other types of terrain. Be careful of moving too quickly, however, or members of your clan will become weary.

Each time you draw a Terrain card, you also draw an Event card. Depending on the cards, your clan might have to deal with anything from a sudden blizzard to an encounter with stragglers from another clan.,On each day of your journey, you choose whether to craft clothing and shelter to keep out the cold, to entertain the clan to keep morale up, or to forage for food and medicinal plants. You can only perform two of these activities, so choose wisely - whichever activity you don't choose will cause members of your clan to become hungry, sad or cold. At the end of the day, you check to see if any of your clan become sick - or if they die from illness.

When your clan finally reaches the cave, the game is scored based on how many of your clan survived, and whether they are sick, injured, or suffering from a condition.

-description from publisher

name: Monslaught in Halloween
description:
This game is the new deck building game. The player can select and take the new cards in the hand from the discarded pile at the end of the turn. No random.

The players collects the monsters from the field.
Their monsters are added to the deck.
The Boss round is happened every three rounds.

Each cards has the points. After 12th round, the winner is the player with the most points.

name: Építs velem, Boribon!
description:
Boribon would like to create a nice house, a car and maybe a boat for his blue toy bear from the colorful building blocks. Help him: roll the dice, carefully place them on top of each other, collect building blocks as a reward. The player who first collects seven building blocs wins.

Based on the Boribon book series by Veronika Marék.

name: Co-opoly: a "conversion kit" for Monopoly
description:
A conversion kit that turns the classic game of Monopoly into a co-operative game of tearing down luxury condos and building tiny homes for the people. Co-opoly was nominated for an award for "Best Adaptation" by Indiecade 2019.

—description from the designer
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Political, Print & Play

name: Dino Fite
description:
A 2-4 player card game where deception is your best friend.

Players take turn choosing one face up or face down Dino on their side of the field to attack a face up or face down Dino on their opponent's side of the field. If either player's Dino is face down, they may bluff the power of their Dino. However, this is a gamble.

If your opponent calls your bluff correctly, your Dino is revealed and destroyed and they are able to Bonk one of your Dinos. Bonking flips face up a face down Dino or destroys a face up Dino.

Once one player is no longer able to refill their field with a Dino, players reveal all surviving Dinos on the field, in their hand, and in their deck. Players sum the total of all their surviving Dinos and compare. The player with the higher total power has driven their opponent to extinction and has won!

name: Attack & Defend
description:
LUCK & SKILL: The perfect combination of both War and Uno card games. It is easy enough for kids to win, yet strategic enough for adults to stay entertained endlessly!

FAST & FUN: Play in 10 minutes. Players will try to build their deck as they take turns attacking others and defending themselves. Once the draw deck runs out, it becomes a race to be the first out of cards.

EASY TO LEARN: Beginners can learn by playing, reading the quick gameplay guides/directions, or watching a short Youtube instructional video with the creators as your guides.

TRAVEL-FRIENDLY: This small and study box can go anywhere! Take it on trips to the beach, camping, the office and anywhere else!

MAKES A GREAT GIFT: great for birthdays, holidays, events, and even party favors.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Medieval, Party Game
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Lose a Turn, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Take That

name: Bad Landlord
description:
Bad Landlord is a card game that combines wild landlording stories with dysfunctional responses.

Jillian in apartment 7 had her mail stolen, including a $100 gift card from Amazon. Turns out it was used by Stillman from across the hall. Do you suggest that they resolve it on a trashy courtroom reality show? Invite them to a group therapy session with the other tenants in the building? Or maybe just set them up on a blind date together? You’re the landlord, and the decision is yours!

Bad Landlord is a player judge game for 3-8 players. Each round a judge chooses the best response played to a given landlording situation. The first player to win 6 rounds wins the game.

Don’t we all wish we could be a bad landlord once in a while?

—description from the designer

name: Like Cats and Dogs
description:
In Like Cats & Dogs, each player runs their own pet shelter. The objective of the game is to get all the pets in your shelter ready to be adopted and paired with the perfect family. First player to empty their shelter wins!

Each Pet card has a list of Needs that you need to meet before they can be adopted. Meet these needs by traveling around the game board and collecting the corresponding cards. Once a Pet’s Needs have been met, search for their perfect Fur-ever Home at Adoption Events by comparing potential families to the Pets’ Home Requirements listed on the Pet card.

—description from the publisher

name: The Game of Telegraph Messenger Boy
description:
The card game adaptation of the 1886 McLoughlin Brothers board game District Messenger Boy.

Each player is dealt cards forming a face down pile. In turn order, players turn over the top card of the pile. The initial objective is to obtain employment as the Messenger Boy. Over the course of the game players try to advance to more senior positions in the Company, until one player becomes its President.

From the McLoughlin Brothers 1914 Catalogue - “The Messenger Boy game has been a favorite for a generation, and there is no evident reason why a card game on the same lines should not be equally popular.”
mechanics: Events, Ladder Climbing, Move Through Deck, Race

name: Castle Made of Sand (砂上のROW閣)
description:
Pharaoh is in trouble... His beautiful kingdom was attacked by a massive flood! The city that had thrived for hundreds of years was washed away except for the Great Pyramid, the symbol of his kingdom...

Pharaoh shouted to his people from the top of the Great Pyramid, "Now, we shall split the Great Pyramid to rebuild the city!"

Castle made of Sand is a first board game with using real sand.

First, players create a big pyramid with dedicated mold and sand. On the way you create pyramid, you can fill in gem token(*) to the pyramid.
(*The token will be your point when game finish.) After create pyramid, you remove the pyramid from the mold. Then, you attach construction pick the pyramid's middle of the slope, and pharaoh meeple on the top.

Each player split sand from the pyramid with dedicated spatula(**) in order. So you can create 4 type of construction with dedicated mold, and you put on your board the construction. (**If you get gem token in the sand, the token will be your point. And if you fell down construction pick from pyramid, previous turn player get the pick.)

If you can create the construction with perfectly, so you get 1 point(***). But you can't create with not perfectly (not enough sand compared to the mold), you lose 1 point. (*** you have construction pick the same shape with the sand construction, you can attach the pick on the sand.
So you get more 2 point.)

In the following situations, game will finish.
- any player who knocks down down pharaoh meeple on the pyramid's top, the player's point will change "0".
- any player reaches the needed number of victory points.
(2 players : 30 point, 3 players : 25 point, 4 players : 20 point)

Then, the player who has the most points, is the winner.


『砂上のROW閣』は本物の砂をリソースに使用した屋内で棒倒しをする日本初のボードゲームです！！始めに、全ての砂で獲得すると得点となる宝石トークンを埋めた大ピラミッドを作り、建物ピックを刺し頂上にファラオミープルを置いて準備完了！
各プレイヤーは順番に大ピラミッドから砂を切り出して、個人ボードに4種類の建物を建てていきます。
途中で建物ピックを倒してしまうと、前の手番のプレイヤーが獲得！対応した建物に刺す事で得点アップ！！
頂上のファラオミープルを落とさないように、多くの建物を建てて勝利を目指しましょう！！

切り出した砂を、可能な限り使い切りながらコントロールしつつ建物を建てていく感覚は他のボードゲームでは味わえない新体験！
砂のマネージマントが鍵となるゲームです！

name: Let's Make A Deal
description: Pressman's home edition of the 2009-current CBS version of the TV game show, hosted by Wayne Brady. Gameplay is similar to the Let's Make A Deal from Ideal, but with updated prizes & Zonks plus it now has separate plastic door & box stands rather than a "full stage" setup.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Betting and Bluffing, Modular Board, Simulation

name: Commandeer
description: A strategic, flicking game where you combo into the other players ships to commandeer them as your own. To win you must kill all of your oppononent's ships or kill his king. Just be sure not to commit treason or you lose the game!

name: Necromunda: Underhive – Cawdor Gang Tactic Cards
description:
This box contains 26 100mm x 75mm cards for use in games of Necromunda:

18x Cawdor gang-specific Tactics cards
8x Blank Fighter cards

You will need a copy of the Necromunda: Rulebook and Necromunda: House of Faith to use the contents of this set.

name: ジャントリック (Juntrick)
description:
Juntrick is a trick taking game using the theme of rock, paper, scissors. Players have to follow suit in playing a card. If all cards are of the same suit, the largest card win. If there is two suits, using rock, paper, scissors to determine the winning suit and the largest card wins. If all 3 suits are in the trick, the first-played smallest card wins.

It has a deck of 36 cards in suits from 1 to 12. Card 3, 6, and 9 has a bomb. Whoever collects a bomb will score -4 points at the end of a hand; otherwise, each card collected worths 1 point.
publishers: メリーアンドリューワークス(merry-andrew-works)

name: Carrera de Palabras
description:
CARRERA DE PALABRAS ES UN JUEGO PARA 2 a 4 JUGADORES DONDE SE VA A PONER A PRUEBA TU VELOCIDAD Y VOCABULARIO.

¡SÉ EL MÁS RÁPIDO!
Descarta primero tus pilones de sílabas, formando palabras con las sílabas del centro. En este juego los jugadores deben intentar ser los primeros en descartar todas sus tarjetas de sílabas. ¿La regla? Armar palabras con otras sílabas disponibles. Un juego para pensadores dinámicos.
Partidas rápidas para entrenar nuestro diccionario interno y nuestra agilidad mental.

PENSAMIENTO DIVERSO
Incluye cartas de imágenes que te obligan a pensar de otra manera; combinando diferentes destrezas mentales y formas de pensamiento.

---

WORD RACE IS A GAME FOR 2 TO 4 PLAYERS WHERE YOUR SPEED AND VOCABULARY WILL BE TESTED.

BE THE FASTEST!
Discard your piles of syllables first, making words with the syllables in the center. In this game, players must try to be the first to discard all of their syllable cards. Rule? Make words with other available syllables. A game for dynamic thinkers.
Quick games to train our internal dictionary and our mental agility.

DIVERSE THINKING
Includes picture cards that force you to think differently; combining different mental skills and ways of thinking.

name: Jalopy Derby
description:
Players bid, simultaneously, to race their Jalopies around the Checkpoint and back but beware: duplicated bids mean those jalopies take must take damage - and the more damage a jalopy takes, the slower it can move! However, guiding those jalopies are a variety of drivers each with their own special ability: let the fast-paced shenanigans commence!

—description from the designer

name: The Frog Princess
description:
Players are Princesses who have been turned into frogs and must catch the juiciest flies and kiss the Prince to remove their curse.

Each round, the cloud of flies is positioned away from the lily pad - where the frogs have gathered - and the players must quickly guess how far away (in matchstick lengths) the flies are away: the player(s) who guess closest to the correct distance extend their reach toward the Prince - the first player to reach the Prince by accurate distance guessing is the winner.

This game is an homage to the fabulous Froschkonig by Zoch.

—description from the designer

name: Fou Fou Fou!: Je reviendrai
description: A new card for Fou Fou Fou!. At the end of his turn the player must shout "I Will Be Back".

name: Fou Fou Fou! PnP
description: 28 new cards for print and add to the base game.

name: Project: BIOME
description:
You will manage your own ecosystem in limited resource condition to beat the others. Beside that you will get to know our nature life such as animals, plant, and microbes better and see how beauty of them.

You will receive a card that represent the nature lives. Use them wisely to survive the last one and get your victory of Project: BIOME.

—description from the designer
categories: Abstract Strategy, Animals, Card Game, Educational, Environmental
mechanics: Action/Event, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Push Your Luck

name: Ever Aegis
description:
Ever Aegis is a fantasy themed social deduction game, as well as a tactical card game. Choose 1 character among 30 characters, each with different abilities and play styles. You will be playing against your friends to be the sole winner.

Win in 1 of 3 ways:

Have possession of 5 face-down cards.
Eliminate all other players. To eliminate a player, flip 4 or more of their cards into face-up position.
Some characters have a 3rd alternate win condition.


Each turn you will:

Draw a face-down card each turn
Use 1 of your 8 actions.


The 8 actions are as follows:

Recruit: Gain 2 Soldiers. (No cards are needed)
War: Go to war with 1 other player. (No cards are needed)
Temple: Give a player a revealed card. The action corresponding to that card is Sanctioned. (Sanctioned actions are counterproductive actions.)
Mason: Discard 2 items in play or gain the Wall item (The wall protects only you from some actions).
Barracks: Have all players discard a face-down card.
Treasury: Gain 5 soldiers
Laboratory: This action is unique to each character.
Library: This action is unique to each character.


Bluffing & Cards:
Cards are "needed" to use actions. You may use any of your actions, even if you do not have the correct cards, because you may lie about having them. As cards are revealed, it becomes more apparent who is lying.

War & Soldiers:
Players will have soldier tokens. When 2 players go to war, the player with the least soldiers, reveals 2 cards. Both players lose half their soldiers.

Items:
Players gain item chits that act as passive or active effects in the background.

—description from the designer
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Fantasy, Medieval, Negotiation, Renaissance
mechanics: Action Retrieval, Alliances, Betting and Bluffing, Command Cards, Deduction, Hand Management, Hidden Roles, Interrupts, Lose a Turn, Memory, Ownership, Player Elimination, Prisoner's Dilemma, Turn Order: Progressive, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Kashi
description:
In Kashi, each player uses members of various ganas to build temples to lure lord Shiva back to the city.

The game plays out on a small game board representing the map of city Kashi and its temples. On their turn, a player may discard a virtue card to move to the corresponding zone, place a card on the region they are currently located, build a temple by having the favour of the ganas. Together they work to get Lord Shiva back to Kashi.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Alliances, Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Złap mnie! Gra przygodowa
description:
Tom has been trying to catch Jerry all day, will he finally succeed? …
Try and check, how easy is it to catch this smart and fast mouse!
Tom and Jerry. Catch me ! This is a simple game for the little ones, the children have to match the tokens with the right colors, to catch the mouse and win the game.
Playing in a friendly way teaches cheerful competition and develops logical thinking and insight.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Monster Zone
description:
Monster Zone is a card game that’s based off of luck, strategy and skill. Each player will have a deck of monsters, spells and traps and both will battle until all life points are depleted are depleted which is a lot harder then you think.

The core of this game are the dice and defense points. The defense points protect the player from taking full damage from defense monsters, keeping the player in the game longer. While the dice are used to use the effects of most of the cards In the game.

It’s a fun strategy card game that can be hours of fun and entertainment!
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, Lose a Turn, Push Your Luck, Single Loser Game

name: Hockey Score
description:
A card-based game wherein two teams (2 or 4 players) play cards out of their hand trying to clear the board and score goals across three periods. The scorepad allows best-of-seven series of games.

—user summary

name: Dual Dragon (fan expansion for Carcassonne)
description: A new White Dragon is scaring Carcassonne. Play with 2 Dragons (a Red and a White one) that can both move and eat meeples during their path. The player who places the Dragon Tile decided which Dragon will move.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Medieval

name: ポロンちゃんのマジカルレッスン (Poron's Magical Lesson)
description:
ポロンちゃんのマジカルレッスン (Poronchan No Magical Lesson) is a memory game from Japan.

Poron is teaching you magic. You learn various magical spells, Fire, Stone, Wind, during Poron's Magical lesson. Each spell that Poron demonstrates on the cards has a colour combination, yellow, red green and so on.

Players are shown a number of cards face up, and given time to memorise them. Then the cards are turned face-down, but the order is not changed. A new Poron card is dealt up, and the players must identify which hidden cards have which colours.

If a player can correctly recall the hidden spell, and determine if it matches the new spell at all, they gain points. But if they make mistakes, they lose points.

The player at the end with the most points is the best student and wins the game.
user summary

name: Sucesos Argentinos: Hundimiento del ARA General Belgrano promo card
description:
A promo card for Sucesos Argentinos about the sinking of the ARA General Belgrano in the Malvinas War, adding one more event for your timeline.


Hundimiento del ARA General Belgrano
categories: Card Game, Educational, Expansion for Base-game

name: Drill Bit Dwarfs
description:
The competition in the Lorendon mining racket is fierce and only the strong have survived; the Drill Bit Dwarfs.
Now the battle for Honor between them has pushed the competition to the limit. Become a legendary drill bit Dwarf and take on your former brethren for the crown of the Driller King.

Drill Barter Conquer!
DBD is an action packed card-driven competition featuring drilling, bartering, deck building and sabotage of course!

Protect your mine!
Cut barter deals with factions to defend your mine and repair it.

Fill Faction Orders
Factions Orders can reward both faction favors and honor.

Buy Enchanted Drill Bits
To build your deck, drill for gold and buy enchanted drill bits from the vendor.

Barter With Factions for Offense Strikes
Lorendon is home to powerful factions with a wide variety of offensive capabilities.
How To Take The Crown
Win by getting to 50 Honor first with your Mine still standing or when only one Mine remains, the Dwarf with the highest Honor wins.

- Solo VS AI
- Multiplayer 2-8 Players (Coop or Competitive)

—description from the designer

name: WORD TO WHO
description:
Overview:
WORD TO WHO is a guessing game that consists of the most popular and widely used slang words and phrases from the Baby Boomer, Gen X, Millennial and Gen Z generations. Players compete against each other to see who can guess the most slang words and phrases. The player or team to guess the most right wins!

Game Play:
Players break up into teams and teams take turns, alternating players each round, with one player attempting to prompt his or her teammates to guess the slang word or phrase on the card. When your teammates guess the word or phrase you move on to the next card. The opposing team keeps a timer with each round lasting 1 minute. Each card is worth 1 point and the first team to 30 points wins.

Cards are color coordinated by level of difficulty, green cards are easy, blue cards are moderate and red cards are hard. Each card comes with a definition that players can use but players can come up with other hints, clues and definitions to help prompt their teammates to guess the word or phrase on the card.

Purpose:
My ambition for WORD TO WHO IS to to promote social connectivity and build a sense of community across generations, cultures, communities, and cities. English is a language that is spoken all over the world and slang is a result of every place putting their own spin on it. My vision is to use slang as a way to forge ties of understanding, acceptance, and unity between people of different backgrounds.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Induction, Team-Based Game, Turn Order: Random

name: The Constable (fan expansion for Carcassonne)
description:
The constable is not a follower, but a special unit.

Each player adds a single Constable meeple to their stock at the beginning of the game.

The constable can only be placed on a road that already has a robber (whether a standard follower or the wagon). That meeple is removed from the road and returned to the owner. No points are scored by that player for that road. Should a road with a constable connect with another length of road which has a robber, that follower is also removed, with no points being scored. This same is true for any builder on the road. Should two road sections with constables be joined, nothing happens. At the end of the game, both players receive the full points.

The constable remains on the road until the end of the game.

The constable is not affected by the tower (being a royal servant itself).

The constable can be eaten by the dragon. If the dragon consumes the constable, return the dragon to a volcanoe and end the current movement phase for the dragon (it has retired to its lair to licks its wounds). The constable is returned to the players stock and made be played again.

A player cannot place the faerie in a tile containing her/his constable.

As the constable is not a follower, you cannot place your builder on a road with your constable.

Roads completed with a constable on them are not considered when determining the 'longest road'.

At the end of the game the constable scores VPs equal to the normal value of the road. If the road connects to one or more cities (complete or not) then the player scores one point for each tile that makes up that/those city(ies). If the road connects to a cloister, it scores an additional 5 points. (The tile with the well now becomes very valuable for the Constable, as it creates three endings and potentially more points).

Roads with a constable on them do not count for a point toward the value of the Robber Captain.
categories: City Building, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Medieval

name: Héroi'cartes: A la Poursuite de Barbe Crasse
description:
Draw your cards and live your adventure!

You are part of the Detecteam, a team dedicated to protecting the world from super villains. In this new adventure, a bottle thrown into the sea will take you back to the time of... pirates! The terrible Dirtbeard has stolen the treasure from the Crabuga Islands, and only you can get it back! Let's go, boy!

To win the game, draw and discover your cards as you go along to advance your adventure. Choose your actions for a 100% fun single-player game!
mechanics: Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Syzygies
description:
You have an starting word.

And you have to write words that shares 3 consecutive letters with the previous one

And, also, you have a goal word.

Start the timer and get to the last one in less words than your opponents.

After each round if no one got to the goal, there is no scoring, but:

The player who got to the goal word in less words, doesnt score. In case of a tie, the player with less letters wins

The other players score 1 point for each word used

The game finishes when someone gets to 10 points, and then, the player with least points, wins

name: Word Duels
description:
Pick an 8 letter word. This will be your life. Your opponent will do the same

Now, alternating turns, will choose a word to attack the rival one. This one can only have up to many consonants and up to many vowels as the attacked word.

Defend your word. Same rule than for attacking.

Hey, dont repeat words, it is forbidden

name: MORFINS
description:
MORFINS is a set-collection game for exactly 4 players.

The players each start with 4 cards in hand; on their turn, a player can initiate a round of passing, swap cards with the center, or exit the round.

Once a player has exited the round, the other players have up to 2 additional turns, and then the players score their hands. The player with the largest set (for instance, 4 of a kind) receives 2 chips from the player with the lowest set.

The player with the most points after 4 rounds wins.

name: Try!Angler
description:
In Try!Angler, the players, as fishermen, fight against government restrictions to catch their dinner.

On a player's turn, they draw a line across four boards which make up an image of the ocean. If the line completes a triangle, the player writes their initials in the triangle, marking their ownership.

Some of the contents of a triangle will grant a player positive points and some negative.

Once no additional lines can be drawn, the player with the most points wins.

name: Prison (fan expansion for Carcassonne)
description: The Sheriff meeple will capture one opposing thief on the road and will send them to the Prison for 6 turns. All the other thieves on the road will run away, back to players' supplies.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Medieval

name: Flick Forts
description:
In Flick Forts, players take charge of an endearing team of well-intentioned but poorly trained fantasy characters, each vying for battlefield control.

Characters are represented by poker chips that form a player's starting fort. Each turn, players take a character from their fort and use the chip to attack the opponent, Crokinole-style, or to build a defence.

Akin to curling, attacking characters will score points for ending the game in their opponent's endzone. Knocking chips from the enemy fort will reduce an opponent's character pool, and defences left standing at the end of the game will earn bonus points.

Flick Forts can be converted from basic to advanced mode (featuring asymmetric character abilities focusing on different dexterity playstyles) in under 5 seconds, and features language-independent gameplay components.

The chip-flicking, tower-toppling excitement of Flick Forts is perfect for friendly, head-to-head battles or grudgematch-style tournament play.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Flicking, King of the Hill, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Physical Removal, Score-and-Reset Game, Turn Order: Progressive
publishers: Paper Fort Games, Stone Sword Games

name: BN1: A Board Game All About Brighton (10th Anniversary Edition)
description:
You and up to three friends must travel the length and breadth of the city, looking for interesting things to do and see. And adventure can be found in the most unlikely places.

Will you hike out to the Chattri, lounge in the Pavilion Gardens or see a film at the Duke of York’s? Take part in Paddle Round The Pier or watch the Pride procession? Learn about Martha Gunn or Disco Pete? Or will you go busking, picnicking, shopping and exploring until it’s time to go home?

For 2-4 players, take turns moving around the labyrinthine streets of the city, having encounters, buying useful equipment and exploring destinations. Visit city events and local sites of interest on the way, scoring extra points in the process. The first player to score 50 points and get themselves back to Brighton station wins the game.

You can play the game as a roll-and-move, or with sets of action cards that are unique to each player.

—description from designer
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Exploration, Maze
mechanics: Action/Event, Command Cards, Push Your Luck, Roll / Spin and Move, Take That

name: Cyber Crime Files: Das Geheimnis der Hackerin
description: Take on the role of a cybercrime specialist and follow a hacker's clues to a major scandal. Analyze newspaper reports, decipher hidden notes and follow the hacker's instructions to discover more evidence. There is no time limit - everything depends on the skill of 1 to 4 investigators.

name: Cosmic Battle Training CBT Card Game
description:
Cosmic Battle Training CBT Card Game is a battle simulation card game in which you plot offensive and defensive moves during the strategy phase of each round, then carry out those plans in the action phase. Players start with 3,000 personal defense points, and you win by either building up 3,000 active defense points or eliminating the opponent's personal defense points.

Cosmic Battle Training CBT Card Game was created as a therapy support tool, and at the bottom of each card is a therapeutic principle from cognitive-behavioral therapy (CBT) that the card represents.

name: Box Against Bangtan
description:
A BTS themed card game played in the same manner as Cards Against Humanity.

The cards are all about Your favorite boys Jin, Suga, J-Hope, RM, Jimin, V, and Jungkook.

Cards are divided into two groups, the Red (or Black depending on which version you have)cards consist of fill in the blanks or question cards. The white cards are possible answers to the red cards.

Each player holds 7 white cards. One person (the Card Czar) selects a fill in the blanks or question card from the appropriate pile. The remainder of the players choose one of their 7 cards in hand which they feel best matches the reader's card. The Card Czar reads all the answers and selects their favorite. The person whose card was chosen gains the point. Play proceeds around the table until everyone has a chance to be the reader. The amount of points required to win can be a predetermined number.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Judge, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Horizon First Contact
description:
Horizon First Contact is a cooperative survival board game set in a dark sci-fi setting.

Each player chooses a unique faction and will have to fight against the odds and the incoming threat in order to survive.

Collaborate with your teammates and experience the increasing difficulty and unique mechanics of Horizon First Contact.
mechanics: Action/Event, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Different Dice Movement, Events, Market, Moving Multiple Units, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: Treasure Hunt (fan expansion for Carcassonne)
description:
Many years ago, because robbery was becoming an increasing problem, some peasants, and even royalty, took to hiding their most precious possessions from the thieves and vagabonds of the
province. The whereabouts of such items have gone, along with their owners, to the grave. In fact, the region is flooded with unclaimed wealth – or spoils, as some peasants prefer to call it. Those lucky enough to discover where this treasure is hid are often rewarded with untold riches, but
others are not so lucky…

Treasure Chest and Key tokens are collected when completing a Road, Field, City or Cloister with those icons. They have 3 colors (Red, Green, Blue). When you collect both the Key and the Treasure Chest of the same color, you can get a Treasure Tile than can give you some benefit, some special Royal tiles to play or some disadvantages like killing your meeples.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Medieval

name: Colonial Wargame Rules
description:
These rules are designed to allow players to role-play officers and leaders in small skirmishes during the colonial wars in the 17th and 20th centuries.

—description from the rulebook

Game can be played solitaire or cooperatively. It's essentially a colonial skirmish game with rules covering 19th century colonial infantry, cavalry, native forces and African animals.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Necromunda: Ash Waste Nomads Gang Tactics Cards
description:
This set contains 26 cards for use in Necromunda games.

Inside you will find:

18 Ash Wast Nomads Gang Tactics cards and 8 blank Fighter cards, each bearing the mark of the great Ash Waste trives - ideal for marking out Champions and Leaders in your gang deck!

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction

name: Necromunda: Orlock Vehicle Gang Tactics Cards
description:
This set contains 26 cards for use in Necromunda games. Inside you will find:

18 House Orlock Vehicle Gang Tactics cards (which can be used by House Orlock gangs and 8 blank Vehicle cards each proudly stamped with the log of House Orlock - the House of Iron. Ideal for marking out vehicles in your gang deck!

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Science Fiction

name: Dan Dare Space Shooting Game
description:
Dan Dare Space Shooting game by Glevum has a target board featuring 3 enemy spaceships. The gun, as is often the case in British games, is a curious metal device, that fires the shot using a spring mechanism. After a pre-set number of turns, the winner is the one with the most successful hits.

During the early 1950's the Comic Hero Dan Dare spurred several similar target games that can easily be confused. Featured on this link is Glevum's version titled "Dan Dare Space Shooting" game.

Listed elsewhere on BGG is two from Chad Valley; that being simply "Dan Dare Shooting" game and the other called "Dan Dare Big Game Hunt on Venus".

—user summary
categories: Children's Game, Science Fiction, Space Exploration

name: Drawing Without Dignity: Expansion Pack 1
description:
The first expansion to the hit party drawing game, Drawing Without Dignity. Even more fun things to draw with your friends, and introduces a WILD new game mechanic!

—description from the publisher

name: inTENse
description:
inTENse is a light and fun roll and write game for infinite players.
Your objective is to fill in the grid with dice rolls to create sums of 10, as well earn bonus points which are added to your score at the end of the game.
The player with the highest score after 10 rounds, wins!

Play alone, or with an infinite # of friends.
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Educational, Math, Number, Print & Play
mechanics: Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Set-up

name: Besieged: Build Your Castle!
description:
Gather Resources. Develop Technology. Build your Castle. Assemble your Army. BESIEGE THE ENEMY!

Play out highly competitive epic siege battles to become the new king! Includes brand new game mechanic - Castle Building!

Draft cards to build a deck, develop technology and strategically build your castle with walls, towers, traps and moats before you besiege each other's castles to kill the King!

Every game is unique, every castle designed becomes the game board. Play is simultaneous for everyone! No taking turns! No boring waits!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks

name: Hätten Sie's gewußt?
description:
Any number of people can participate in the game.

Pink Cards: Can be played as a question and answer.
However, since it contains a play on words (root play!), only the first word can be said to a player. This now has to form the other words from the existing stem of the word. Whoever brings together the correct words and has the most cards is the winner.

Green cards : The game is played as a question and answer. One player receives all the cards and takes turns asking the other players the questions printed on the cards. Whoever can answer the respective question receives the card. The answer is printed on the back. Whoever has the most green cards at the end is the winner.

As a question and answer game, you can also ask the answer on the back as a question to a fellow player and expand the game according to the rules as above.

Both games are also suitable as quartet games for children. 4 cards with 4 identical characters, which are attached to the top left of the card, belong together and form a quartet. Whoever can lay down the most quartets wins.

—user summary

name: Bretagne TT Version (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
description:
It’s 2120 and some Breton islands are now accessible by train thanks to floating bridges equipped with the latest technology. What will be the best strategy to connect the iconic places of Bretagne? Discover the surprises that some cities have in store for you, as well as new rules for the most adventurous players…

This game follows the same rules as the basic Ticket to Ride Europe game.
This extension offers the possibility to play with 5 additional rules, including Bonus cities, Special actions and Game variants. These additional rules were introduced to speed up the game and reduce the risk of "being blocked".

Great horizons and public objectives are among the new variants introduced.

Published by permission for non-commercial use. All rights to the Ticket to Ride™ name, gameplay, mechanics, and imagery are reserved by Days of Wonder, Inc., who have not endorsed or playtested this expansion.

---

Nous sommes en 2120 et certaines îles bretonnes sont désormais accessibles par train grâce à des ponts flottants dotés de la dernière technologie. Quelle sera la meilleure stratégie pour relier les lieux mythique dont regorge la Bretagne? Venez découvrir les surprises que vous réservent certaines villes, ainsi que de nouvelles règles pour les plus aventureux…

Ce jeu suit les mêmes règles que le jeu de base des Ticket to Ride Europe.
Cette extension offre la possibilité de jouer avec 5 règles supplémentaires, notamment les villes bonus, les actions spéciales et les variantes du jeu. Ces règles supplémentaires ont été introduites pour accélérer le jeu et réduire le risque de "blocage".

Grands horizons et objectifs publics font partie des nouvelles variantes introduites.

Publié pour une utilisation personnelle à des fins non commerciales. Tous les droits sur le nom, les mécanismes de jeu et l'imagerie des Aventuriers du Rail™ sont réservés à Days of Wonder, Inc, qui n'a pas approuvé ni testé cette extension.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play, Trains, Travel
mechanics: Hand Management, Network and Route Building, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Barbarossa: Kickstarter Promos
description:
Part of these were also stretch goals in the Kickstarter campaign.

The set contains the following cards:

P02 - Fraulein Kleist
P03 - Li'l Rundstedt
P04 - Li'l Fuhrer
P06 - Further Reinforcements x2
P07 - Li'l Hoth
P11 - Grenadier Regiment (Cosplay Alternate Art)
P12 - Panzer Grenadier Regiment (Cosplay Alternate Art)

name: Vedelsz vagy Mersz?
description:
Do you drink or dare you? Drinking card game.

"Are you brave?" your new favorite drinking game! This game brings strangers closer together, can break friendships that have lasted for years, and has even helped some people get pregnant. If you’re looking for a game that makes you laugh so much that your tears flow out and you want to get to know the side of others you didn’t know about yet, look no further. The best part is that you probably won’t remember what happened the next day.

How to play:

Shuffle the cards and place them in the middle of the table. The youngest player starts and then moves clockwise. The first player draws the top card and then completes the task on it. If you do not want to, you must drink the amount indicated on the card. Then the next player draws and so on.

Whoever completes the most challenges by the end of the night will be the winner of the game.

Only +18 and up!
categories: Card Game, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Battle of Money Exchange: You can well understand system of foreign exchange!?
description:
For currency exchange, whether it goes up or down, there are good and bad sides to it.
First, there is a gap between rich and poor countries, and everyone wants to import from the wealthy countries.
Therefore, people all over the world buy the currency of the wealthy country.
As a result, the price of the currency rises.
As the price rises, it becomes harder and harder to buy.
In such a situation, if there is another country that can produce the product at a lower price, everyone will buy it there, and the products of the country that used to sell well will no longer sell well.
I made a game out of such a mechanism.

—description from the designer
categories: Abstract Strategy, Economic, Farming, Industry / Manufacturing, Party Game

name: Draft Scout
description:
4 years later, The-Magical-Star once every 10,000 years arrives in Japan.
As the approaching, the people have magical power, they have be able to use black magic.
So, it was decided to hold the "National High School Black Magic Golem Championship".
You have been appointed by the principal as a team manager.
Train your students, scout great students and win the Championship 4 years from now!

—description from the designer

name: The Black Tail's Panda Slayer
description:
This is the country of panda plush toys.
In recent years, King Panda, who has been hurt his heart by the pandas with the wrong tail color, has finally enforced the "Black-Tail-Slaying-Law".
This made it legal to tear off the black tail.

However, the black tail force is deep-rooted, and even in the black tail slayers unit formed by volunteers, the black tail is secretly mixed.
Hide and cheat on your own black tail, blame the other black tail severely, and with the cooperation of bears and red pandas, let's regain the appearance of giant pandas as it should be!

—description from the designer
categories: Animals, Bluffing, Card Game, Party Game

name: Código Secreto: Expansão promocional Brasil
description: This promo pack is produced by Devir and has 10 cards with 20 new words from Brazilian Portuguese.
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Spies/Secret Agents, Word Game
mechanics: Communication Limits, Cooperative Game, Memory, Push Your Luck, Team-Based Game

name: Goons: The Reinforcement Pack
description: Twelve new exciting Schemes to add to the game! A new Scheme for every Villain ever released!
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Betting and Bluffing, Variable Player Powers

name: Goons: Les Promo Card
description: A promo Goon Card from the original Kickstarter campaign. He has a unique ability of moving cubes around making it easier to take the action you want.

name: Sugar Heist: Crib of Thieves
description:
Sugar Heist: Crib of Thieves, a stand-alone and combinable expansion of Sugar Heist, is an action-packed heist game where players collect, trade, and steal candy cards. Quick-to-learn and strategic, Sugar Heist: Crib of Thieves can be played on its own or mixed in with Sugar Heist to create even more great gameplay opportunities!

On your turn, lay down matching sets of candies from your hand and try to draw, steal, and barter for more! The more candy you collect, the closer you are to locking it safely into your Vault. Sometimes though, other players may not want to give you their confectionary treasures and you might have to play a Battle Card. The all new Accessory Cards and Vault scoring add even more variable powers to your game. Execute your strategies and plan your next move to score the most points and win the game! Beg, barter, steal, and battle your way to supremacy in this wacky set collecting game.

-description from publisher
mechanics: Action/Event, Events, Hand Management, Matching, Set Collection, Trading

name: Ancient Souls: Fenrir
description:
The Aesir sleeps peacefully, knowing that Fenrir is bound until Ragnarök. But is he? You play as the spirit of Fenrir, reborn as a pup. Travel the realms by hunting, scouting and exploring different sites. Your actions will influence how you get stronger. By enlisting the help of Gods and creatures alike, your goal is to free yourself from the torturing reigns of Gleipnir.

In this "choose your own adventure"-campaign, the choices you make will impact what happens next. Will you be able to free yourself? Will the Aesir discover that your spirit has broken free and hunt you down? Will you discover and aid the Vanir's plot against the Aesir? You decide! With the use of modular hexagonal tiles, action-based strength increases and multiple story arcs, each playthrough will feel unique.

A true solo board game, where you play as a wolf. "Choose your own"-adventure campaigns set in Norse mythology. Focused on narrative, exploration, battle, and character building.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Animals, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Mythology, Travel
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Map Addition, Minimap Resolution, Modular Board, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Push Your Luck, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Stat Check Resolution, Storytelling, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: MEGA Mini Space Cowboys
description:
Across the Great Void, mankind has colonized planets like islands dotting a vast jet-black ocean. Vital to the Solarline Syndicate are the spacefaring ships that transport passengers, cargo and cattle. But as everyone knows - any ship is only as good as it's crew!

In Mega Mini Space Cowboys, players assemble a motley crew of misfits that find a new family in each other. Shipmates come in all shapes and sizes. Some are skilled pilots, while others specialize in hand-to-hand combat or ship repair. Some are even bounty hunters. But life is not always so black and white. Sometimes under the right circumstances, the criminal can join the crew, bringing their own set of unique skills to a peculiar, yet accepting, new family.

Mega Mini Space Cowboys is a fast-playing 1-4 player strategy game of set collection with exclusive dice and modular mapping. Each turn, roll six dice, each engraved with six symbols: Move, Nano Med Kit, Bounty, Passenger, Crates, or Cattle. Over three consecutive throws, choose what to keep or discard. You can also recruit crewmates from the passengers you meet, or occasionally even the criminals that you track for bounties.

Hey spacer - do you have the moxie to make big Moolings? (in-game money) Can your family of misfits survive distant planet-hopping and navigating the Void? Stay tuned for the next game session of Mega Mini Space Cowboys to find out!

Later, Space Cowboy…

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Dice, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Bribery, Contracts, Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Re-rolling and Locking, Solo / Solitaire Game, Track Movement

name: Merchant Navy at War (fan expansion for Naval War)
description:
MERCHANT NAVY at WAR
- FAN EXPANSION (PnP)
The NAVAL WAR card game (Avalon Hill, Battleline by S. Craig Taylor, Neil Zimmerer) and the “CARDS AT SEA” expansion covered all the AXIS & Allies Warships from WW II and also a few Land-Based Air units. However, this left the majority of heroic seamen unrepresented which are those of the Merchant Navy. This fan expansion endeavours to rectify that omission.

Over 100 new Merchant Navy ship cards and 18 additional play deck cards with complete rules for the new cards and how they integrate into the existing Naval War game play.

This Print-n-Play fan expansion allows you to sink even more ships, ones that normally can’t fight back. You will also sink several Merchant ships at a time.

The Print-n-Play will be in the Files section and any Feedback will be appreciated
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Nautical, Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Hand Management, Take That

name: Cheese & Crackers
description:
The Queen is planning to host a fancy afternoon tea...and only the freshest cheese and crackers will do. Perfect! You think, cheese and crackers are your specialty! Unfortunately you're not the only one...

Outmanoeuvre the competition in this delightful 18-card worker placement game, to prepare your ingredients and finish making your cheese and crackers before the competition does. Lovely!

The game is played in a series of rounds, each consisting of three phases. Players place workers (phase one), take a total of two actions each (phase two), then workers return to players and action cards are reshuffled and laid out to start a new round (phase three).

Players are racing to be the first to complete making both cheese and crackers, by rotating and flipping their cheese and crackers cards until their cheese card has "8. Cheese!" at the top and their crackers card has "8. Crackers!" at the top, at which point the player yells "Lovely!" to win the game.

-description from designer

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry – Lumineth Realm-Lords
description:
The Lumineth Realm-lords seek to purify the Mortal Realms, scouring the taint of Chaos wherever it’s found. Some brave warbands take the battle to the enemy, striking deep into the Eightpoints itself to hunt the vile servants of the Dark Gods at their source.

With elements of three kits to choose from, this box allows you to tailor your warband to be highly aggressive, defensive, or a balance of the two. They fight like nothing else in the game with ranged weapons, plus heavy armour and loads of unique abilities. Beyond the Vanari Auralan Sentinels, Vanari Auralan Wardens, and the Alarith Stoneguard, you’ll also find fighter cards for a variety of other models from the Lumineth Realm-lords range. Add some cavalry, superbly skilled warriors, and wielders of elemental magic to your warband, and there's nothing that you can't take on.

Contents:
15 Miniatures
‣ 5 Alarith Stoneguard
‣ 5 Vanari Auralan Wardens
‣ 5 Vanari Auralan Sentinels
15 Round Bases (32mm)
Lumineth Realm-lords Wound Divider & Abilities Cards
19 Fighter Cards
84 Tokens

-description from publisher's website

name: Love Battleship
description:
Love Battleship is a sex board game for couples. It builds anticipation with every sinking ship as the losing player performs steamy foreplay activities.
The winner is whoever sinks all of their opponent’s ships first. Love Battleship includes game grids for each player. On one grid, each player draws their ships, while on the other you each mark your guesses for where your opponent’s ships are placed. When you successfully sink your partner’s ship, you pick a foreplay or activity card to perform.
Nevertheless, this game is designed for both players to enjoy it whether they win or lose. Love Battleship game is meant to keep the passion alive while having a hot and steamy night in a fun and playful way.
There are 25 intimate activities and 25 foreplay activities included, so you can play this game several times, and each time will be just as exciting as the first. Love Battleship comes with enough game grids to play eight times, but if you wish to play more, you can download or draw additional grids as well.

—description from the designer

name: Clash of Galliformes: Untamed Pheasants
description:
This expansion allows you to play solo in Clash of Galliformes. Expand and explore to be able to fight back The Untamed Pheasants.

—description from the designer
categories: Animals, Exploration, Fantasy, Territory Building, Wargame
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Programmed Movement, Set Collection

name: Disputed Land: War in Azerbaijan – 2020
description:
Disputed Land covers the flashpoint war between Armenia and Azerbaijan over the Armenian controlled territory of Nagorno-Karabakh, which was won in 1994.

This territory was Azerbaijan's prior to 1994. The loss was never agreed to and remained a bone of contention between the two countries. As time went on, Azerbaijan became sovereign country and quickly built up its former Soviet army. Russia remains allied to both countries now but has a defense pact with Armenia. It also sells both countries its military weapons.

While Azerbaijan built up its military forces that are superior to Arme-nia, Armenia did could not match them due to the fact Azerbaijan used revenue from oil. By 2020, it was time for Azerbaijan to reclaim the disputed loss area.

In late September of 2020, Azer forces made a surprise attack across the Nagorno front positions and slowly made in roads. The opposing forces were fewer but it was the terrain that would determine success. But the war did bring into view future warfare using deadly armed drones that Azer forces bought from Turkey and Israel. Unable to shoot them down, Armenian tanks and radar were decimated within a week losing 173 T-72 tanks, 257 APC, 67 rocket launched artillery, 23 SAM, and 14 radar. It was a staggering blow and great military feat of future warfare tactics.

Eventually, Armenia agreed to a ceasefire in mid-October. Azer forces took the time to redirect their offensive and unleash its 1st Corps along the Iranian border on the 18th. This was a brilliant move catching the Armenian forces off guard in the Fuzuli\Fizuli area. the Azer armor and mechanized formations raced deep into Nagorno territory coming with-in 20 km of the key town of Lachin in the mountains. If taken, Azer would cutoff the only supply road into Nagorno. As Azer forces cau-tiously approached, Armenian military units in Goris began to counter-attack halting further advance. Being that the two lane road was sur-rounded my 4000 ft. mountains, Azer forces pulled back on Oct. 24.

Now, Azer forces switched to another attack from Fizuli towards Shusha and the Nagorno capital. This main attack was a slugfest due to the mountainous terrain. Armenian troops fought tooth and nail but by Nov.4, Azer forces were within 10 km of Stepanakert and nearly sur-rounded Shusha. If either fell, again, the main supply road would be cut. Bitter fighting and artillery fire continued until Nov. 9, when Shusha fell to Azer.

It was now Armenia agreed to Russia's peace plan. Estimated losses were up to 8000 men, well over 300 tanks lost total and hundreds of artillery guns or rocket launchers.
LESS

name: Detox
description:
DETOX a drinking card game.

The essence of the game: Each card has a task to complete. If you don't comply, you must drink. There are many, many exciting tasks ahead of you. You might even grow a mustache during the game, or you might lose a cold shower, but you might even finally be able to lick your elbows. Get ready because this game will be an experience of a lifetime. The more tasks you do, you get more chance to winning the game, and not hanging drunk.

Why choose the DETOX drinking game:

It is provided with a drip-resistant foil so it does not get soaked.

It is 2x the size of a French card, so you will see it perfectly even when drunk.

Made of the highest quality material.
categories: Card Game, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Complete Murder Mystery Night
description:
A perfect way to entertain your friends and family, now you can host your very own Murder Mystery Night. The Complete Murder Mystery Night game is presented in a whiskey gift box, elegantly finished with matt black wrapping and gold foil. Containing everything you need for 10 different fun and entertaining Murder Mystery Nights. With different games included, you can host on 10 different occasions. From invitations to a newspaper that lays out the plots of ten gruesome murders, all the players need to do is work out whodunnit! The stylized newspaper containing plots and recipes for your perfect night in. Instructions, character booklets, instructions, name stickers and the murder cards are also included in this wonderfully designed whiskey tube-style packaging. Presented in an elegant whiskey-style gift tube, this murder mystery game makes a perfect dinner party gift. This game is suitable for ages 14 + years.

Contents
Newspaper containing plots and recipes
10 x character booklets
10 x murder cards
2 x sheets of name stickers

name: Monopoly: Édition Côte d'Azur
description:
Monopoly at the French Côte d'Azur - edited for the International Game Festival in Cannes 2000.

Limitied edition with number on the board
- wooden houses und hotels
- playing pieces in gold-colored metal.

Tirage original édité à l'occasion du Festival International des Jeux de Cannes. Édition numerotée à tirage limité.
Maisons et hôtels en bois. Pions de jeu en métal doré.

name: Scoop
description:
Scoop is a series of fast-paced word games where players compete to make three-letter words.

The game has 35 target cards, 2.25" x 2.25", with single letters, and 150 cards, 1.15" x 1.15", with bigrams (two letters); all cards have point values. There are rules for 4 different games. In all but one of them the bigrams are all face up on the table for all to scoop from.

1. Be Quick: Reveal a target card, and everyone has 15 seconds to gather as many bigrams as they can that make a word with that card.

2. Elimination: Reveal a target card, and each player chooses one of their 10 bigrams to make a word with it. The one with the highest-scoring word gets the points of all the cards revealed.

3. Winner Takes All: Each player chooses one of their 3 letter cards and takes a bigram to go with it. The one with the highest-scoring word gets the points of all revealed cards.

4. Scoop Five: Each player takes five bigrams, one for each of their five letter cards. Each player scores the points for each of their words made.

name: LockDown
description:
LockDown is a word game where players collect letters to build successively longer words as listed in their secret, anagrammatic manifests. Players may alter others' words, and lock down their own words to prevent alteration. [adapted from the rule book.]

LockDown has 106 letter cards, 6 bonus indicators, and 20 manifest cards, each of which has four lists of four successively longer anagrams, e.g. SEA, EAST, DATES, TASTED, or RUT, ROUT, TROUT, TRYOUT. Each player is dealt 7 letter cards, one manifest, and one bonus indicator.

In a turn a player may do one of these:
- Draw 2 cards.
- Trade a card from the hand with another player.
- Play one or more cards to make words on the table.
- Add a card to another player's word to make a different word.
- Take a card from another player's word.
- Lock one of your words by flipping its letters face down.
- Gather one or more letters from your words, making any words you wish, and placing unused cards back in your hand.
Then they draw or discard so their hand has 7 cards.

The round ends when someone plays an End of Round card, or plays their whole hand out and declares the round over. Then players score positive points for their words that are listed on their manifest, and negative points for their words that are not on their manifest.
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: Option
description:
This is an elaboration of the idea behind the traditional word game Ghost.

The deck has 61 letter cards: one is dealt to the table as the key letter, and the rest evenly divided among the 2-6 players.

On their turn, a player plays a card so that it adds to either a row or column of letters that include the key letter. The row or column played to must spell part of a valid word, whether read forwards or backwards, without actually finishing a complete word.

A player who finishes a word, or makes an invalid set of letters, or cannot make a valid play, or loses a challenge to a play, gains a point. The round ends and the deck is shuffled for another round. When a player reaches a certain number of points they are out; the last player left wins.

—user summary

name: War of Words
description:
This game consists of the formation and capture by reformation of words made from letters of different value, the object of the game being to use as many letters of value as possible in such formation and capture. [From the rules sheet.]

There are at least 129 letter cards, which are more like cardboard tiles, 1" x 1". At the start, 12 are dealt to each player, and the rest are face down in the table center. In their turn, each player:
- Draws a letter.
- Either:
--- plays a word from the hand
--- attacks and captures another player's word by adding one or more letters to it from their hand, making a new word which has a different root meaning
--- passes
They draw 2 letters after forming or capturing a word.

The game ends when all the letters are drawn and everyone passes. Points are scored for each letter in all the words a player owns, according to the letters' ranks. Most cards are Privates, worth 2 points, but each vowel has two cards which are officers, worth more:
A - General (20 points)
E - Major (15 points)
I - Captain (10 points)
O - Lieutenant (5 points)
U - Sergeant (3 points)

The player with the highest score wins.

name: Name The Thing: Retail Hell
description:
Welcome to Retail Hell! This expansion to Name The Thing introduces new 99 new cards with all new prompt and word cards from the crazy shopping frenzy that is Retail! Add these cards to your Name The Thing collection and do your best to name even more things!

-description from publisher

name: Name The Thing: Sports Ball
description:
BATTER UP! Step up to the plate with Sports Ball, the expansion to Name The Thing that introduces all sorts of Sports based words and things to name. Can you name all the things in time for the buzzer!?

-description from publisher

name: Game of Astronomy
description:
This contains thirty-eight card, each bearing the chart of a constellation and a point value from 5 to 25, and the rule book which contains a brief story “Legends of the Zodiac”, and a set of sentences, one for each constellation card. [Adapted from the rule book.]

The cards are dealt equally to all players, except the leader who will read “Legends of the Zodiac” as rapidly as possible. When they read the name of a constellation they count to 5 rapidly. If the player holding that card calls out its name before 5 they keep it in their holdings on the table; if not, they place it in front of the player to their left. After the end of the story, players add up the points of the cards they won, and the player with the most gets a 25 point bonus. Reshuffle the deck and repeat this, rotating the leader, until someone reaches 300 points and wins, or after an agreed-on number of rounds is played, the highest score winning.

An alternate mode has the leader reading from the individual sentences of the constellations, in a randomly chosen order so players won’t know which constellation comes next.

—user summary
publishers: Cincinnati Game Co., Merrimack Publishing Corp.

name: The Melox Football Game
description:
This is a promotional game by W.G. Clarke for their Melox Dog Foods in the 1930's. Unusually packaged in a (then) brown grocery bag.

The first player to throw a six kicks off. He then throws again and moves the counter in the direction of his opponents goal, as indicated by the dice. Should the counter fall on a line bearing one of his own players, he continues to throw except where otherwise marked, namely, if the ball lands on a line marked “Foul,” which is a blue player, the Red gets the next throw. If the ball lands on a player marked “ Hands,” then the Blue gets the next throw, and if the ball lands on either player marked “ Free Kick ” then the same side gets a further throw. If the counter finishes on a line bearing an opponent, the throw passes to the other player.

The method of scoring goals is for the counter to fall exactly on Line 12, but if it should fall on or go past Line 13, a goal kick is awarded, the counter being placed on Line 11, on the spots indicated. The centre line is a neutral line, and if the counter falls upon this line, the player continues to throw. The player whose team scores the most goals in 30 minutes (or in the period of time arranged) is the winner.

name: Making Words Snap
description:
Here is a fab learning device ideal for young minds to learn words and understand phonics. This unique deck of cards lets you play two family favourites, Snap and Pairs, using language concepts. For example, when playing Snap with this fantastic deck of cards, you would be trying to snap cards that create words such as 'br' and 'ain'.

To play Pairs, simply turn all the cards upside down and turn two over to see if they make a word. If they do, then the cards are kept; if not, they are turned back face down.

The aim is to collect all the cards. Two fun games in one that help children learn important language concepts.

Helping children gain a head start at school in an essential skill, Making Words Snap is the smarter way to play Snap and Pairs!

Contents: 52 playing cards [26 word beginnings of 2 letters and 26 ends of 3 letters], 3 rules cards

[The above adapted from the website, archived Sep 2015.]
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Word Game

name: My First Making Words Snap
description:
Master early years language concepts, whilst having lots of fun with this deck, through either Snap or Pairs. For example, playing Snap with this fantastic deck of cards, you are trying to snap sections of words together, such as 'c' and 'at' to form 'cat'.

To play Pairs, simply turn all the cards upside down and turn two over to see if they make a word. If they do, then you keep them; if not, you turn them back face down.

The aim is to collect all the cards. Two fun games in one that help children learn fundamental language concepts.

Helping children gain a head start at school in an essential skill, My First Making Words Snap is the smarter way to play Snap and Pairs!

Contents: 52 playing cards [26 with 1-2 letter word beginnings, 26 with 2-letter endings], 3 rules cards

[The above adapted from website, archived Sep 2015]
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Word Game

name: Against the Monstrous Horde
description:
Against the Monstrous Horde is a dice game of fantasy combat that is played using a variety of polyhedral dice.

Each player manages a set of polyhedral dice that represents a party of adventurers defending a village against an army of monstrous creatures. The players compete to see who can drive away the most enemies before the battle ends by rolling their dice and using them to attack, to heal, and/or to perform special abilities. Defeating enemies earns a player points, and gameplay ends once one player scores 100 or more points. The winner is the player who achieves the highest score.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Re-rolling and Locking

name: El Alamein: Heavy Tank Battalion
description:
This is a promotional card released for El Alamein along with the Collector's Ammo Box:
- P02 - Heavy Tank Battalion

name: Wurdz
description:
The Wurdz deck has 31 letter cards, 21 wild cards, and 4 rules cards.

On their turn, players draw the top card, say a word, and score its points. After going through the deck the highest score wins.

There are two modes:

Alphabet Game: Say a word that has the names of one or more letters of the alphabet in its pronunciation (not its spelling). If it's a letter card, the name of that letter must be part of it. E.g., if it's 'L', the word "elbow" has the names of the letters L and O in its pronunciation, and scores 2 points.

Word Game: Say a word that has other words as part of its pronunciation. If it's a letter card, the word must begin with that letter. E.g., if it's 'C', the word "cargo" contains the pronunciations of the words "car", "are", "go", and "oh", for 4 points.

The Wild cards specify one or more requirements:

Single: The stated word needs only one other word or letter name as part of it.
Multiple: The stated word needs at least two other words or letter names.
Same: The stated word needs at least one other word or letter name stated at least twice. (E.g. "Ohio" says O twice.)


—user summary

name: F-Life: Dildos & Dolls
description: This expansion adds 50 cards including a bunch of relationship cards, Backstories, and more!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Okanagan Shuffle
description:
Okanagan Shuffle is a word card game apparently produced for and sold in the Okanagan Valley of British Columbia. The picture on the back of the cards is of a wind surfer on Lake Okanagan, and the box features a cartoon of Ogopogo, the legendary creature inhabiting that lake.

The game comes with two decks, each with 51 letter cards and 2 wild cards named for Ogopogo. There are rules for five games:

1. A rummy-like game.
Players are dealt 7 cards, and on your turn you may:
- Play a word of 3+ letters from the hand, 4+ if you haven't played a word yet.
- Take a letter out of any played word of 4+ letters, rearranging the remaining letters to make a word, and using the taken letter with letters in your hand to make a new word.
- Replace Ogopogo with the letter it currently stands for and use it to make a new word from your hand.
- Draw a card. You may use it to do any of the plays above.
When one player uses up all cards in hand, the hand ends and each player gets one point per card in hand. After a certain number of hands, the lowest total wins.

2. A children's game reminiscent of Rack-o.
Each player has 5 cards in hand, and on their turn draws from the draw or discard pile, and discards. The first player to have 5 consecutive letters in hand wins.

3. A Gin Rummy-like game with growing hand size.
Deal N cards to each player, who in their turn draws and discards, and lays down their entire hand to spell a word if they can, after which everyone else gets one more turn to try to do the same. Each player who lays down a word gets one point for the hand. The number N of cards dealt (and hence the length of the target word) starts at 2, and increases one per hand until N=8. The highest point total wins.

4. Themed words.
The dealer declares a theme -- e.g. animals, colors, girls' names, etc. -- and deals each player 7 cards. Players draw and discard as in game 3. The game ends when a player can lay down a word of any length that fits the theme declared by the dealer.

5. Solitaire.
Draw 5 cards, and try to make and lay down a word of 3 or more letters. Draw cards as needed. You win if you can use the entire deck making legal words.

name: Rugpull
description:
A rug pull is a degenerate act in the world of cryptocurrency trading where developers scam investors and traders alike by pumping up the price of a coin and later dumping as much as they can for profit before abandoning their project.

Rugpull is a cryptocurrency trading board game that simulates what it feels like to facilitate or be the a victim of a rug pull. Players will compete to out trade and out mine other players to end up with the highest profit. By managing your risk properly or by being risky biscuit, you must take the necessary actions to come out as the most profitable degenerate.

The main object of the game is to attain as much victory points by collecting money tiles and money cards throughout the game.

Each player will start with a secret coin as well as 30 money tiles that corresponds to the colour of their wallet(player mat)and take turns in a clockwise direction.
