There are 6 different actions but players may only perform up to 5 different actions during their turn (some actions can be performed more than once per turn). These actions can be performed in any order:

Buy a coin (Players who choose to buy cannot sell a coin on the same turn)
Sell a coin (Players who choose to sell cannot buy a coin on the same turn)
Mine money cards
Draw support cards
Activate support cards (You can do this action more than once per turn)
Rug pull (You can do this action more than once per turn)

Money tiles that are collected and taken away are placed on the area of the player mat(wallet) where it says "Total Balance". For the end game scoring money tiles are worth different amount of VP depending on their colour. Money tiles that are the same colour as the wallet is worth 1VP and money tiles that are not white and are not the same colour as the wallet are worth 3VP.Money cards collected are worth 2 points each. The Player with the highest VP wins!

When there is a tie, the player to memorize Proverbs 13:11 ~ "Wealth gained hastily will dwindle,
but whoever gathers little by little will increase it." first will win the game.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Commodity Speculation, Investment, Push Your Luck, Stacking and Balancing, Trading

name: Fable on Your Table: Realm of Goblyns
description:
Realm of Goblyns is a new realm for the Fable on Your Table print-and-play miniatures game which adds new enemies and challenges to the base game.

The threat of the goblyns has always been near; the creatures live in the nearby wilderness, but they typically kept to themselves. But something sinister is driving them into the civilized lands, arming them, training them, coordinating their attacks, and stoking hatred. What was once an uneasy truce has devolved into bloodshed. The mothers of Bandi look to you, hero, to do what is necessary to avert this imminent threat.

Realm of Goblyns includes:

Several new base enemy types: Goblyn warriors, Goblyn archers, Goblyn shamans, Hobgoblyns, evil presences, and assassins.

New large enemies: Goblyn archer towers and the terrifying Apex Goblyn.
Some new scenery to spice up your table play.

The companion web app has been updated to generate dungeons and quests with these creatures.

Download the PDF, print it (we recommend on card stock), assemble the miniatures, and get ready to delve into the dungeon!

—description from the designer
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval, Miniatures, Print & Play
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: La Cigale et la Fourmi
description:
The game theme refers to a tale by La Fontaine: The grasshopper and the ant.
Each player starts with his ant tile in one corner of the board designed as a 9 by 9 grid. On your turn, place one tile of your hand on the board to extend your route and advance your ant on it. Alternatively, with a grasshopper tile, you can block the route of an opponent. By paying a grain of wheat, you can deblock your route. By landing on a space with a grain of wheat, you collect it. The player with the most grains wins.

—user summary
mechanics: Grid Movement, Network and Route Building, Square Grid, Take That, Tile Placement

name: Welcome Aboard, Captain: Charon Wormhole
description:
Learn to play Welcome Aboard, Captain with this exciting adventure that leads you through all the core mechanics of the game.

Welcome Aboard Captain is a solitaire print-and-play tabletop roleplaying game where you play a starship captain, gather a crew, outfit a ship, and head into the galaxy to complete missions.

Charon Wormhole is a special document designed to teach you how to play by introducing the rules step by step as you go through an adventure.

To play, you will need:


This document, accessible in a reader. Do not print it – it's a hyperlinked "choose your own adventure" style document intended to be played on your device.



Paper and pencil. (Index cards recommended.)



At least one set of polyhedral dice: d4, d6, d8, d10, d12. Four sets recommended, but not necessary.
categories: Book, Dice, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Welcome Aboard, Captain
description:
"Welcome Aboard, Captain" is a solitaire science-fiction tabletop roleplaying game.

In this game, you take the role of a starship captain, recruit a crew of bridge officers (science, engineering, etc.), outfit your ship, and head out into the galaxy to go on missions.

The game is a print-and-play game; you only need to print the starship sheet and the bridge officer roster to play, although there are some handy reference sheets to print as well. The game comes with a pre-made ship and crew if you don't want to create your own.

The game features a procedural mission generator, where you roll dice to define a mission for your starship captain, and then you perform a series of "command decisions" that the generator reacts to, allowing a dynamic adventure to unfold based on tables you roll on in the book.

Challenges are met by rolling dice from the ship and crew against threats that the procedural generator creates; whichever die is highest is the one that determines what happens. As you work your way through the mission, you'll be rolling to advance your mission until it is completed, but surprise revelations and other unexpected challenges can throw plot twists into the narrative.

In addition to the core gameplay, there are three "gamebooks" with the game that let you play the game with the same mechanics but through pre-written adventures. One of them, "Charon Wormhole", is a learn-to-play adventure where you are introduced to the mechanics of the game while playing through a tense adventure about taking your first command.

The core game also includes optional extension materials for advanced play, adding excursion vehicles, companions, vignette missions, and nemesis enemies.
categories: Dice, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Das Beste würfeln
description:
An educational game for coffee-traders produced for the biggest coffee trader in Germany "Tchibo".
Try to get the biggest income -
answer questions -
includes 6 beautiful designed car-minis.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Golden Annual Number 3: Great War at Sea – South Seas Mandate
description:
Great War at Sea: South Seas Mandate is based on what US Navy planners foresaw as the opening stages of War Plan Orange, the plan for a Pacific naval war against Japan. It is set in the years just after the First World War and features ships planned but never built: the American Design 150 battle cruiser, the Japanese Type X light battlecruiser, the original design for Japan’s Furutaka-class light cruiser and more.

Great War at Sea: South Seas Mandate includes 50 die-cut and silky-smooth playing pieces, thirty double-sized “long” ship pieces and 20 standard-sized square ones. There’s a 22x17-inch map (on heavy rigid stock), and a booklet with ten scenarios and the background story of the campaign.

-description from publisher's website

name: Alphabet Mix
description:
Alphabet Mix is a word game for English- or French-speaking children. It has 78 letter cards and 2 wild cards, the cards being more like cardboard tiles, 2" x 2". It is a variant of the traditional game Memory.

The 80 cards are laid out in a 8x10 grid face down. The first player states a word of 3+ letters. Then each player in turn reveals two cards, and if either of both of them spell the next letters of the stated word, they add them to the word and score their point values; otherwise they replace unused tiles face down. The word must be spelled in order. The player who finishes the current word states another word, and play continues spelling the new word. Once 5 words have been spelled, all the cards are reshuffled and re-dealt.

The player who achieves an agreed-on total -- 50 is recommended for beginners -- wins the game.

name: Wordy Birdy
description:
Wordy Birdy is a turn-based card game version of "word find" puzzles. Its deck has 66 letter cards and 3 "Wordy Birdy" wild cards that stand for any letter. Letters have a point value; wild cards have 0 points. One copy of each vowel is a "Double word score" card.

Each player is dealt 5 cards, then 40 more cards are dealt into an 8x5 array, face up. Each player in their turn makes a word out of letters in the grid with one card from the hand. The letters in the grid must make a chain of adjacent cards that doesn't overlap itself; the card from the hand can be inserted anywhere in the word, including the first letter. The player keeps those letters and their score, and the dealer fills the holes in the array from the deck, until it is used up. A player may pass if they can see no play.

The games ends after each player has made 5 words, or each player passes in turn. The highest total score wins.

name: Touched On: Hurstbridge Booster
description:
A booster train line for Touched On, allowing 1 extra player to join for a fashionable festive season…

-description from the publisher's website
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game, Transportation
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: Exploding Words
description:
The Exploding Words deck has 69 letter cards and 1 rules card. Each vowel has 3 normal cards, 1 double word score card, and 1 Kaboom card.

Each player is dealt a 7-card hand, and then over 5 rounds, players draw a card then discard a card, trying to have the best words to play. After 5 rounds players in turn lay down the word(s) from their hand.

Kaboom cards cannot be discarded, and they blow up any word they are in, giving it no score. A Kaboom card can be played in one of your words, blowing it up but leaving the other words okay, or you can keep it in hand and play it on top of an identical letter in a word someone else plays after you. If you don't play a Kaboom in any word, yours or someone else's, your whole hand explodes and you get 0 points that hand. 7-letter words are immune to explosion.

After all words are revealed and exploded, players score for their remaining words and another hand is played. The first player who gets a total score of 100 or more wins the game.

name: The Secret of John Nebthos
description:
Secret of John Nebthos A Card Game of Adventure and Fame!

John Nebthos, the world's most eclectic explorer, has mysteriously sent a letter to exploring guilds around the world; an invitation to McGuffin Mountain to rediscover the lost treasures of history locked away in Nebthos' hidden mountain vault. Race against other guild members in the pursuit of fame and treasure as you travel from the four corners of the earth to McGuffin Mountain. Make new discoveries, thwart your opponents, and enjoy some good espresso along your journey, until you breach the mountain to uncover the treasures within...and of course before the mountain inevitably explodes.

A fun ice breaker card game for 2-4 players Ages 12+ 30 Minutes Playtime

—description from the publisher

name: My Words Are Better Than Yours
description:
This game is a card-based adaptation of Scrabble game-play. The deck has 69 letter cards, a majority of which are basic cards and just have a letter score. For each vowel, there are 3 basic cards, and one each of x2, x3, and x4 letter score cards, which multiply adjacent consonants in their word by that amount. There are also 15 consonant cards that multiply the score for the entire word by x2, x3, or x4.

Each player is dealt an 8-card hand. On their turn, a player plays a word from their hand that must use one basic card from the previous player's word if there is one; they tally the word's score and then draw to fill their hand back to 8 cards. A player may also just pass and draw one card.

The game ends after the deck runs out and all players pass in turn. The highest total score wins the game.

name: Countin' Sheep Card Game Combo
description:
This is a pair of children's card games to celebrate and advertise the release of Cadaco's Countin' Sheep line of plushy sheep dolls. The games are:

Sheep Sweep

A version of Crazy 8s. In turn each player plays a card that matches the previous card in either color or name of the plushy doll on the card. If no play is possible, they draw a card and play it if possible. Lucky cards can change the color; Sleep cards make the player to your right skip their next turn. The first player to play all their cards wins.

Go Graze

A version of Go Fish. There are four cards for each of 13 ranks. In their turn a player asks another player for cards of a certain rank; if they have any they must give them all, otherwise they say "Go graze" and the asker draws a card, showing and counting it if it's the requested rank. A successful play lets the player play again. A complete set of 4 of a rank are placed on the table. After all the cards are placed in sets, the player with the most sets wins.

name: Grapple
description:
Grapple is a word game where players combine word roots with prefixes and/or suffixes to make valid words.

There are three decks, for Prefixes, Roots, and Suffixes, each having 50 cards and 2 blanks. Each player is dealt 2 cards from each deck.
During their turn, a player:
- Draws a card from any deck
- Does any of the following, as many times as they can:
--- Lay down a word made from 2-3 cards in the hand
--- Add a card from the hand to a word on the table to make a new valid word which is moved to be in front of them.
--- Take a card from a word on the table, if it leaves a valid word with 2 cards, to make a new word using the stolen card.
- If the player is unable to make any plays during the turn, they discard back down to 6 cards.

The player to empty their hand first wins.

name: Fröbel Tower
description:
"Play: Playing is the highest stage of a child’s development." (Friedrich Fröbel)

This Fröbel Tower is a cooperative game for 2-16 players aged four and over. It is also well suited for adult team building.

The game consists of:

6 beechwood blocks
1 bracket with metal rod
1 plate with 8 holes and 16 cords (each 2 metres long)


For the Fröbel Tower, a large outdoor or indoor play area is necessary.

Object of the game
The construction of the Fröbel Tower is possible only by means of joint, coordinated action. The Fröbel Tower can also be built in a competition between different groups.
The group that can build the highest tower wins the game in this version.

Preparation
Form a circle and place the six beechwood blocks in the middle with the groove facing upwards.

Rules
Each player takes one or more cord ends in his or her hand, depending on the number of participants.
The cords were previously passed through the 8 holes in the plate. Now you tighten the cords and try to hook the bracket into the groove of a wooden block, lift it up carefully and place it gently on another wooden block.
It is important that you hold the cord only at the very end. It must not be shortened by reaching forward.

Together you try to stack the wooden blocks on top of each other until the Fröbel Tower is completed. You have won the game as a team if you manage to use all the wooden blocks and the tower does not fall over during the building work.
When you hook in the bracket, this may cause a wooden block to fall over. Therefore, you should decide before the game starts whether this wooden block can be put back in place or whether it is eliminated from the game.

Game variants

The game is not over until you have dismantled the tower as a team.
You are not allowed to speak during the game. Naturally, this makes building the tower more difficult because you cannot give each other any instructions.
You are only allowed to guide the cord with one hand. This also adds another level of difficulty.
The most difficult way to build the tower is to guide the end of the cord with your "weak" hand. For right-handers it is the left hand, for left-handers the right hand.


—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Real-Time, Three Dimensional Movement

name: Middara: Aboyama, The Rapturasque Resin Kit
description:
Lupercalia beckons.

Through decadence and debauchery these lustful figures can be called from the depths of Earth’s history. Espers made manifest only through esoteric quiet whispers shared amongst the elite.

Such coveted creatures are called upon for far more than combat. Yet, their true names and seals are clutched closely to the hearts of those who covet them most. Jealousy worms its way into the heart, and rots at the very soul of those who know these secret combinations.

Those lucky few able to overhear their betters slip such forbidden knowledge during inebriated tales of past forays find themselves more than excited to let their soul wear away at the chance to even behold such monstrosities.

An exceptionally detailed resin model of The Rapturasque. This Resin Kit provides options for a new Esper that can be summoned by Adventurers and Opponents as well as a new Adventurer that can be used during the Crawl Mode.

—description from publisher

name: Middara: Taiga, Hedonistic Muse Resin Kit
description:
Lupercalia beckons.

Through decadence and debauchery these lustful figures can be called from the depths of Earth’s history. Espers made manifest only through esoteric quiet whispers shared amongst the elite.

Such coveted creatures are called upon for far more than combat. Yet, their true names and seals are clutched closely to the hearts of those who covet them most. Jealousy worms its way into the heart, and rots at the very soul of those who know these secret combinations.

Those lucky few able to overhear their betters slip such forbidden knowledge during inebriated tales of past forays find themselves more than excited to let their soul wear away at the chance to even behold such monstrosities.

An exceptionally detailed resin model of The Hedonistic Muse. This Resin Kit provides options for a new Esper that can be summoned by Adventurers and Opponents as well as a new Adventurer that can be used during the Crawl Mode.

—description from the publisher

name: Middara: Leena and Sarrie, Dream-Animators Resin Kit
description:
Lupercalia beckons.

Through decadence and debauchery these lustful figures can be called from the depths of Earth’s history. Espers made manifest only through esoteric quiet whispers shared amongst the elite.

Such coveted creatures are called upon for far more than combat. Yet, their true names and seals are clutched closely to the hearts of those who covet them most. Jealousy worms its way into the heart, and rots at the very soul of those who know these secret combinations.

Those lucky few able to overhear their betters slip such forbidden knowledge during inebriated tales of past forays find themselves more than excited to let their soul wear away at the chance to even behold such monstrosities.
An exceptionally detailed resin model of The Hedonistic Muse. This Resin Kit provides options for a new Esper that can be summoned by Adventurers and Opponents as well as a new Adventurer that can be used during the Crawl Mode.

—description from the publisher

name: Middara: Jahzara, Deaspiritus Wishmaker Resin Kit
description:
Lupercalia beckons.

Through decadence and debauchery these lustful figures can be called from the depths of Earth’s history. Espers made manifest only through esoteric quiet whispers shared amongst the elite.

Such coveted creatures are called upon for far more than combat. Yet, their true names and seals are clutched closely to the hearts of those who covet them most. Jealousy worms its way into the heart, and rots at the very soul of those who know these secret combinations.

Those lucky few able to overhear their betters slip such forbidden knowledge during inebriated tales of past forays find themselves more than excited to let their soul wear away at the chance to even behold such monstrosities.

An exceptionally detailed resin model of The Hedonistic Muse. This Resin Kit provides options for a new Esper that can be summoned by Adventurers and Opponents as well as a new Adventurer that can be used during the Crawl Mode.

—description from publisher

name: Get Off My Grass!
description: A Tile laying and Resource management game for 2 to 4 players of mowing over some tough turf. Get your 2 mowers back to the house first to win, but which way you take and what you mow over all depends on you!

name: Sushi Skillz
description: A small game that came in a "Welcome to the Orient"-themed Battle Bin subscription box. Players gather ingredients to make sushi recipes for points. Game has no box, just a plastic bag.

name: Mosómaci Almája
description:
The raccoons ran into the city. There, they chat, play at night, and do their best to get their favorite treat, the apple. Housekeepers, on the other hand, don’t really like this night dating; if they can, they confuse the teddy bear.

Make your macid the most skillful! Go ahead and swap the cards to make it harder for the other raccoon!

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: Mondriaan
description:
Mondriaan is a game in which colors and colored areas as well as their number play a very special role.

As simple as monochrome rectangles may be, they can be used in many different ways, which is why totally different game variants await you here.

In one of them, you'll have to keep track of the colors and be quick to react. In the second, on the other hand, it won't hurt if you think a little ahead so that you end up where the most points are.

GAME VARIANT: DICE STUDY

For this variant you need one die and five chips or coins per person. The 12 Mondriaan cards are laid out in the center of the table in a 3x4 grid.

One person rolls a number, while another randomly reveals one of the color cards, if possible at the same time. The two together determine what you need to look for in the cards.

So, if there is a 6 and a red card, you have to look for a card that has six red color squares on it and quickly put one of your chips on it. Whoever succeeds first gets to discard the chip.

Since each combination occurs exactly twice, you can also get rid of two chips per round. If you have no more chips, you win the game.

GAME VARIANT: SPACE COMPOSITION WITH 6 COLORS

For this variant you need two dice and three differently sized game pieces or markers per person, each in one color.

The six color cards are placed face up on the table as a circle. The shuffled Mondriaan cards are distributed evenly to everyone.

Take turns placing one marker on each color card. Never place two markers of the same size on the same card, but place several markers of the same size on the same card.

When both dice are rolled, you take turns performing one of the following actions:
- place a card from your hand on a color card matching the value of a die (if you roll a 6, you can place a card with six red squares on the red color card)

- place one of the upper Mondriaan cards already on the table on another color card, if the conditions there are right.

- place one of your own point markers on another color card

When a person puts down their last card, you calculate your points:
For the color with the most cards on it you get three points, for the next two and then one.
You then multiply these points by the values of your markers, from small to large with one to three.
Whoever has the most points wins the game.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Pattern Recognition, Real-Time, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Model War Kingdom
description:
Long ago, alien beings conquered a world of wild creatures and scattered mystic portals across the land. In time, they left. Now, many millennia later, varied animal kingdoms have arisen -- and learned to use the ancient pathways in their fierce competition!

A skirmish game of cute animals fighting for dominance and survival... and cursing the beautiful land with unwelcome guests.

Player Chose two Creatures from 8 each. And take turn to perform from three Actions for each of their creatures in any order; Move, Attack and place Portals. As well as Upgrading, summoning, casting... in and between Turns.

The Ancients portal's


When you go throught the portals you leave fregment of yourselves in doing so. Fragments that others can pick up on. Fragments from your subconscious mind. And when you gather fragments of others subconscious mind is done so by attaching itself to yours and in the process you can not separate that its yours and that of others since you have no control or awareness. And when it builds up over time its surfaces to the conscious mind as an intuition, a habbit, a memory, as in evolution. You gather them and build on them, develop it, learn it.
It becomes a skill, an ability... a power.

A great Power!

A power that inanimate all other.
A power that can not be stoped and cant stop.
A power that must be destroyed.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Animals, Dice, Fantasy, Fighting, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Storytelling, Variable Set-up

name: Trekkers
description:
Identify pictures of landmarks and sights from different nations shown in the cards while going “trekking.”

—description from the rulebook
mechanics: Lose a Turn, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Book of Skulls: Slayers of Eragoth
description:
Heavy Metal meets Fantasy in Book of Skulls: Slayers of Eragoth

A huge dungeon-crawling adventure where two teams battle to save the continent of Eragoth.

For 2-4 players in 2 teams. Teams act as the others’ opponents, whilst one team controls the heroic Slayers, the opposing team will control the Demons they encounter until it is time to switch to their own Slayers.

The objective whilst controlling the Slayers is to clear the overworld and defeat the final boss first, whilst controlling the Demons your aim is to defeat the opposing team’s Slayers.

Replay value and combat is at the heart of Book of Skulls. During your adventure, you will have access to over 150 unique characters, each with their own movesets.

A game of high interactivity as players have no down time as they cross the continent, always engaged and always with high stakes.

Set your overworld using 10 interchangeable modular maps (levels) that each represent a unique region of Eragoth. A different adventure awaits with each game as any number of levels can be selected and placed in any order, allowing you to customise the duration of your game.

Book of Skulls is fully soundtracked with an original Metal soundtrack which perfectly sets the mood for battling the Demons of Eragoth.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action/Event, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Different Dice Movement, Finale Ending, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Multi-Use Cards, Multiple Maps, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Player Elimination, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: アトラスの後釜 (Atlas Junior)
description:
アトラスの後釜 (Atlas Junior) is a card game from Japan.

The publisher says:
Atlas, the giant that has sustained the world since mythical times, is no match for age.
The time has come to hand over the role to his successor. You are the young ace giants who have put up their hands as candidates for his successor.
The next Atlas is the one who has supported the world as it is gradually passed from one Atlas to the next, standing in his place until the end.
Now, who will show the most outstanding strength?

神話の代から世界を支え続けた巨人アトラスも年には勝てません。
役目を後任にたくす時が来ました。あなたたちは後任候補に手を挙げた若きエース巨人です。
アトラスから徐々に渡される世界を代わりばんこで支え、最後まで立っていた者が次のアトラスです。
さて、最もすぐれた力を示すのは誰でしょうか？
publisher's summary
mechanics: Hand Management, Pattern Building, Player Elimination

name: Dark Matter: A Game of Strategy and Survival
description:
Dark Matter is a competitive sci-fi strategy board game for three to six players. Players will use strategy and diplomacy to earn victory points through expanding your empire with StarBase construction, researching dark matter that will populate in the center of the board through the game, through diplomacy with your rival players, construction and protection of your flagship, and by completing objectives. Offers board and event randomization so that no two games are the same.

—description from the designer
categories: Abstract Strategy, Exploration, Miniatures, Negotiation, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Territory Building, Wargame
mechanics: Action/Event, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Events, Hexagon Grid, Moving Multiple Units, Negotiation, Zone of Control

name: BANKS
description:
In the year 2511 in a society run through Augmented Reality; omnipotent corporations have replaced each continent. A fast paced, cutting edge game known as BANKS is the neo-gladiator approved sport on Earth, with teams embodying each of their corporate spheres. As players you fight for your sphere's personal freedoms and to gain corporate favor.

In BANKS you face up to five various opponents. With the disks distributed over the light rails, your goal at the end of the game is the product of the number of disks in each captured color. Highest score wins, AMASS!

On your turn, move one of your disks in a straight line over any number of open spaces, possibly banking off edges or corners of the board, (like pool). You may stop at any point after moving at least one space.

If, after banking off at least one edge, your disk lands on a space occupied by any other disk (even one of your own disks), capture that disk by replacement. At the end of the game, your score is the number of disks in each captured color multiplied.

—description from the designer
categories: Abstract Strategy, Math, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Multiple Maps, Physical Removal, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Set-up

name: ほしあわせ (Star Memory)
description:
ほしあわせ (Star Memory) is a card game from Japan. The cards show highly detailed photographs of constellations. The constellations are from the 12 zodiac signs.

The deck has 36 cards. 12 are reference cards, naming the constellation and giving a description (in Japanese). The remaining 24 cards are pairs of photographs, mostly being massed starfields with a few bright spots.

The game can be played three ways:

ほしあわせ (Hoshi awase) - a memo game, the 24 starfields are shuffled and dealt face-down. Players take turns turning cards up to make pairs.

ほしかるた (Hoshi karuta) - the description cards are read out, and players try to pick the correct starfield card from 12 face-up.

みつぼしあわせ (Mitsu bo shiawase) - a memo game using all three cards.

黄道十二星座の美しい写真で作られたカードで遊ぶ、星座カードゲーム。

全写真カードを裏向きにして神経衰弱として遊ぶ「ほしあわせ」、各星座の写真カード1枚ずつを表向きにして読み手が読み上げた星座を探す「ほしかるた」、説明カードも含めて各星座3枚ずつを使って神経衰弱として遊ぶ「みつぼしあわせ」の3種類の遊び方があります。
user summary
categories: Card Game, Educational, Memory, Space Exploration

name: Happy Little Trees
description: In Happy Little Trees your goal is to be the first player to discard your personal deck of cards by matching and planting trees according to color and shape.

name: はないちもんめ (Hana Ichi Monme)
description:
はないちもんめ (Hana Ichi Monme) is a bluffing card game from Japan for 2 or 3 players. The title means something like 'flower position'.

Each player has a set of seven cards in their own colour. Some cards are Warabe (children) and some are Ayakashi (weird). If a player can give away all their weird cards by the end, they win. Otherwise, points are calculated.

Each card has a shadow half, and a bright half, on both sides of the card. So a player can look at another player's hand and see which cards are the bright side up and shadow side up. Players arrange their own hands at the start of the game, and cannot change this later.

At the start of the game, all the cards in the player's hand are shadow side up.

Players take turns to offer a card to another player, by drawing the card up a little in their hand. The player offered either takes it or declines it, but either way the card is now turned shadow side down, and cannot be offered away. If the card was taken, the player can place it anywhere they like in their hand. If declined, it stays in the same position as before and cannot be moved.

Once every hand is shadow side down, the game ends. If a player has disposed of all their own Ayakashi cards, they win. Collecting Ayakashi cards from other players does not matter.

Otherwise, players score points. +1 pt for Warabe cards, -1 or -2pts for Ayakashi cards. But if a Ayakashi cards is flanked by Warabe cards, it is worth zero. Then, the most points wins.

The rules allow for a 4 player game using two packs. In this case, it is played as a doubles game, with partners discussing their moves.
user summary

name: Of Light and Darkness
description:
The battle between good and evil is ceaseless. It stretches as far back as the beginning of time, and continues to rage in present day. This is where you come in. It's time to pick a side. Will you be a hero, and command the forces of light? Or, are you a villain, determined to lead those who dwell in darkness? The choice is yours.

Of Light and Darkness is a 2-player game in which you get to play as either good (heroes) or evil (villains). Some cards have special abilities. Others don't. Your goal is simply to have the most of your cards on the table, and connected by sharing a side, when all cards have been used.

name: Falling Down
description: Falling Down is an autumn season-themed game, but it also involves the element of "gravity." During play, you endeavour to make matches between multiples of cards that contain the same imagery, to collect as many as possible. However, the animals can only be collected when they fall out of the bottom of the grid of cards on the playing surface. It's a game of matching, strategy, and turn taking.

name: Zòku
description: In Zòku, you control one of four groups of characters (Preps, Jocks, Nerds, or Misfits), as you try to be the first to assemble a connected group of your peers on the school playground, and push the other cliques out. Each character card has a number that represents its "personality strength" that, during play, determines whether or not it can be used to push other characters around on the playing surface. It's a fun, quirky, adorably schoolyard-themed card game with 68 original characters!

name: Lizards and Lies
description:
Do you want to sow conspiracy or stop it in its tracks? Lizards and Lies is a 2v2 (or 1v1) battler that lets you play with the push and pull of conspiracy theory moving through social media. Play as one of four characters and use unique abilities and cards to influence the network. Platform Moderators and Educators face off against Edgelords and Conspiracy theorists in this asymmetrical board brawler. Will you convince the world that lizards are taking over, or that birds are surveilling society? Or will you shut down these lies?

Lizards and Lies is designed as a serious game meant to reflect the movement of disinformed content (like conspiracy) through social media.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Movement, Chaining, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Zone of Control

name: Hey! That's Not'chyo Nacho!
description:
In Not'chyo Nacho! you are hungry and eager to gobble up your NACHOS! Only there's a problem - the nacho toppings are all mixed up and you want your nachos your way!

You'll have to trade chips with other players (eaters) to match all the toppings on your nachos.

Be careful not to miss one in your haste that is NOT'CHYO NACHO! because you must lay down all 7 of your matching NACHOS first, to win!

Players play simultaneously, in a frenzied atmosphere as they all seek to get a handful of matching NACHOS.

You'll need to get loud and even a little pushy if you've any hope of getting all your NACHOS first!

—description from the publisher

name: Black Hole
description:
An abstract game of losing meteors, the aptly if generically named game of Black Hole revolves around setting your asteroids on paths that will have them ricochet off other asteroids, straight into the pocket in the center.

Every turn you get to move one of your pieces in a straight line orthagonically - like a giant space rook. If they strike another of your pieces, that piece gets hurled to either side in a straight line. Pieces that cross the black hole in the center get removed from play - first to remove four pieces in this way wins the game.

name: Le Corbeau et le Renard
description:
The game theme refers to a tale by La Fontaine: The craw and the fox.
One player gets the fox, the other one the craws placing 5 of his 10 craws on the tree spaces on the first line of the board. The fox player cannot see if a craw has a cheese in its mouth or not. In his turn, the craw player has 5 action points. He may use for each craw at most 1 point. There are 3 possible actions: entering new craws at the base line, advance a craw to a tree of the next line, eating a cheese for as many victory points as the number of the line. This craw is out of the game now.
The fox player may move his fox one space within the fox net. All these spaces are connected with 1 to 4 trees. He may ask a craw on a connected tree to sing. If the craw has a cheese, it is out of the game, if not, it will continue. After all craws are out of the game, the roles change. The player with the most points wins.

name: Wrummy
description:
Wrummy (Word Rummy) is a card game where players collect letter fragments to construct words. The game is played similar in concept to the card game 500 Rummy.

160 cards comprise single letters plus 2- and 3-letter fragments (biography, trigraphs).

[The above from the rules sheet.]

Players are dealt 7 cards, and the top card of the deck is turned over to start the discard pile. In their turn, a player:

- Draws:
—- The top card of the deck.
—- Any card of the discard pile, and all cards above it. This can only be done if the bottom card drawn is immediately used to make a word from the hand.
- Does one of the following:
—- Melds a new word using cards from the hand.
—- Add one or more letter from the hand to a word on the table make one or more new words using all its letters, and claiming the new word if previously owned by another player.
- Discards a card from the hand.

The round ends when a player empties their hand. Players score for all the words they own, and subtract the value of all cards left in their hand. Play until someone reaches an agreed goal total.
mechanics: Melding and Splaying, Set Collection, Spelling

name: Raidziu Loto
description:
A very simple game for learning letters in the Lithuanian alphabet. There are 8 cardboard boards (7” x 8.5”), on which are all the letters of the alphabet, 4 per board, each with a picture; and 64 cardboard tiles (2.5” x 2.75”), each with a letter on it. To play, the tiles are scattered face up on the table; a child takes a board and looks for the letters on the board, and on finding one, takes the tile, covers the letter on their board, and says the letter and the item pictured that starts with that letter. The one who completes their board first wins.

It also says words and sentences can be made with the tiles, and indeed the frequency of the letters looks like it correlates with the frequency of use in everyday language use; but there are no rules for games or activities for spelling words.

name: Auction Charades
description: A fun and extremely competitive version of the classic game of Charades, 'AUCTION CHARADES' brings in hilarious and challenging variations, multi-difficulty levels, over 750 Bollywood and 750 Hollywood/TV movies, all with the exhilarating thrill of an Auction for time! One of the only games that can be played by much larger groups, connects with a very diverse demographic and is always engaging everyone around.
categories: Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Word Game

name: The Maze Explorers: Dark World
description:
You and your fellow intrepid explorers have chosen to venture into a dark unmapped maze.

Using only your wits, a flashlight and a limited supply of batteries you must navigate and expose the hidden maze path. You will encounter artifacts that help or hinder you. You may even find yourself stranded in the dark. Be the hero that exposes the maze path and finds the exit!

Your goal is to create a complete, unbroken maze path between the Maze Entrance and the Maze Exit and be the first Explorer to exit the maze. However, be careful not to get stranded in the maze without flashlight Batteries to light your way.

The Maze Explorers – Dark World is the first in a series of maze worlds. Each world will have its own set of unique artifacts and challenges. Each world will be playable as a stand-alone game or can be combined into a larger meta-world.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Semi-Cooperative Game, Tile Placement

name: Rough!: The Board Game
description:
Earn the respect of your fellow citizens by being the first to gain 12 stars and making it to Starfish Town. But be wary, the landscape is treacherous, and you will have to be prepared to encounter flash floods, lightning, crows, worms, earthquakes, high winds and even bears! This is a turn-based, resource-managing, survival, racing game. This is Rough baby!
Traversing forests, and lakes, mountains and open fields, would be a challenge, but with the aid of a few scattered trading posts, caves and tents, you'll be able to equip and assist yourself along the way.

Each turn a player will be able to roll a custom dice 3 times to hike their pawn across the open grid-like board, gathering resources onto their player mat freely as they go. With every roll of the dice you can get a hike(Move 1 space), a hungry(discard 1 Berry or Fish and Move 1 space), or a disaster(end your turn and draw a Disaster Card). Throughout gameplay you will acquire cards that give you special abilities during future turns, make trades at Trading Posts located on the board for helpful tools and even have the chance to make a friend with a bear.
Player's have a limited amount of space in their backpack, so they have to be strategic with what and how much of each resource to carry along with them.
The most unique mechanic of the game is the Disaster Deck. The backs of the cards are disasters that will happen to the board or all players(everyone at the table sees this side), but the fronts are helpful abilities that only you can see and use. So as long as you are holding on to the cards in your hand, the disasters on those cards will always be a threat to the progress of all players.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Race, Take That

name: Americana Cards
description:
A game celebrating the USA during its Bicentennial year. It has 50 state cards, each with the following info:

The state's name.
The capital city of another state (used for game 1). (The first letters of the state and city names's are large, used in games 3 and 5.)
A silhouette of the state, showing its capital, with abbreviations of neighboring states and water bodies around its perimeter.
Three numbers in the range 1-50, showing the state's:
order in joining the US (blue ink)
rank in size, 1 being largest (black ink)
rank in population (as of 1975) (red ink)



There are also 6 wild cards, show different American icons (Old Glory, Statue of Liberty, US Capitol, the Constitution, Liberty Bell, and 1st moon landing), each worth 25 points.

There are rules for five games:

1. State Capitals. Match the listed capital city on the top card on the table with its state card in your hand, or vice versa; otherwise play a card onto the top of the table pile. If you make a match you get all the cards on the table and score their blue numbers.

2. Build the Country. Play any cards from your hand next to table cards they are neighbors to, as shown on their maps, or play any card to the table if you cannot. A successful neighboring play earns you the maximum of the 3 numbers on the card.

3. Match-Em. Play a card so one of the first letters or its state or capital name matches one of the first letters of the top table card; or just play a card onto the top of the table pile. If you match you keep all the current table cards, scoring the numbers next to the words whose initials you matched, and the same spot in all cards under the top card.

4. Hi-Number. Play a card whose blue number is higher than the last card played, or pass. If you play the last card in the current trick you keep the played cards and score the blue number of each of them.

5. Americana. Play one or more cards so that one large initial of each of them adds to a growing word on the table, or just play one card to start a new word. If you complete a valid word you keep its cards and score their blue numbers. Valid words are those about anything about America: a state or city name, famous person, work of art, invention, etc.

For each of these games, you refill your hand after play, and the target score for a win is 1776.

—user summary

name: Classic Card Game Compendium
description:
Three great card games in one. Take your choice from Pit, the corner the market game; Whot, the fast moving numbers and shapes game; or Lexicon, the classic word game.

You'll have the chance to play all three with the Top Cards Classic Compendium.

[The above adapted from the box bottom]

The rules for the three games are all in a single rules sheet.
The decks of cards have backs not seen in non-Winning Moves editions.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Negotiation, Party Game, Real-time, Word Game

name: Ancient Merchant
description:
When the silk road was expanded, the trade between different cities was developed. Everyday many merchants started to join this trade to achieve money and fame.
In this game the players are playing in the role of merchants who are competing to achieve the place of the best merchant in the world. So they travel to different places and buy goods by Participating the auction. Then they transfer the goods to other place and sell them to achieve fame and wealth.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Auction: Dutch, Auction: Sealed Bid, Auction/Bidding, Betting and Bluffing, End Game Bonuses, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Take That, Trading, Turn Order: Progressive

name: Pawclaw Mini Expansion
description:
This mini expansion can be added to Iron Forest and ICECOOL/ICECOOL2. It comes with 1 flickable miniature and 7 honey barrel tokens.

This mechanical bear is crazy for honey! This mini expansion essentially gives you an extra turn, but with the Pawclaw miniature.

In Iron Forest this mini expansion can be added to any scenario. The team that has most honey tokens acquired at the end of their turn, gets to use the Pawclaw miniature to help achieve their scenario goal.

In ICECOOL each player collects honey barrel tokens, which can be exchanged for an extra turn with Pawclaw to help you get the fish or catch the rascals.

name: Roll for Valor
description:
Roll for Valor is a competitive roll and write set in a fantasy world where the Dwarven Vergar Empire seeks to subdue all other free people. Recruit and muster your volunteer units of elves, orcs, free dwarves, ciar, and humans. You will gain bonuses and unlock ballista and dragons to protect yourselves and your gold. The player with the largest army at the end of 15 days wins. Players roll a pool of dice, earn extra dice, and might even unlock bonuses on 20 sided dice while recording their recruitment. Dragons are powerful allies, but be careful as they may devour the gold you need to muster your forces.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Coverage, Line Drawing, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: The Cinderella Game
description:
Find a a coachman, a crown, and a glass slipper... and win your dream prince for life.

—description from the back of the box

The Cinderella Game is designed with young children in mind. The game comes with a unique two-part game board that lets players create their own adventures. Children will be captivated by the detailed illustration and innovative game play."

name: Lootsville
description:
Lootsville is a strategy game where you roll dice to take all your opponent's loot by moving them around the streets on the board. You first hide your loot in any area of town on the 4 pointed star spots on the board. Place you team on the starts spots and begin play. Be the first to return all you opponent’s gemstones to your base. Your team is one Officer and two Bandits. Work them together to take your opponent's gemstones before they can take all of yours. Guard your part of town while your Bandits loot other parts. If your bandits get caught and get locked up, use your Officer to let them free. The Officer is the only one who have the keys to the jails on your corner of town.

—description from the designer

name: Treasure Monsters
description:
Treasure Monsters is a turn based strategy game where you need to find all your opponent's hidden bags of treasure with pawns that you move to occupy a square on the board. Be the first to return them to your base and win the game! You need to dig through the pile of buff tiles in the middle row of the board to create a way to get to the other side. You use one of your Diggerdo pawns to turn over tiles on your opponent’s side of the game board, digging up treasure in a square. Once you successfully find all 5 bags of treasure in your opponent’s base and use your Gobbler pawn to bring them back to your base, you win the game!

—description from the designer

name: La Scamorra
description:
An abstract 1vs1 strategy game inspired by chess, roshambo (AKA RockPaperScissors), traditional italian card games and the awesome videogame 'Pawnbarian'.

Game is played on a 5x5 checkerboard and each player has 3 different pieces representing the 3 symbols of Roshambo.
Each player also has a deck of chess cards to play.

Similar to a trump game each player has a 3 cards hand from which, in turn, they play a card. They then proceed to move one of their pieces according to the chess moving scheme represented on the card (if you play a bishop you can move any of your pieces as if it was a bishop).

Pieces are captured the same way you do in chess, but following the roshambo logic (eg: a scissor piece can only capture a paper piece).
After a player has moved he draws another card and the turn passes to his opponent.

Pieces captured can be respawned in game using special cards and every capture is a point.

After 15 turns the game ends and the player with the highest score wins. If a player is able to capture all 3 pieces of his opponent before he is able to respawn any of them the game ends immediately by knockout.

Full rules and manual can be found on the official Scamorra site.

name: Takes & Adders
description: Snakes and ladders but using cards rather than dice to move.

name: Adventures of Alice in Wonderland Game
description:
This is a simple race game depicting Alice's fall down the rabbit hole, illustrated with black-and-white scenes from Paramount Pictures' "Alice in Wonderland" (1933), starring Charlotte Henry.

—user summary
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Das Rhön-Spiel
description:
The game is a mixture between dice game and quiz game set in a German area named 'Rhön'.

The game was conceived with the idea of getting to know the natural beauty and sights of the Hessian-Bavarian-Thuringian low mountain range Rhön.

—user summary

name: Ashfall
description:
Ashfall is a 1-4 player deck building sci-fi RPG – take control of a powerful unique character, recruit unique allies, find and buy rare equipment and fill your deck with powerful action cards. Explore diverse terrains from deserts to mysterious alien facilities and make use of Pelagium – a dangerous new resource. The centerpiece is an epic character and narrative driven cooperative campaign; you can also play standalone scenarios.

The Core Lands Protectorate (CLP), an expansionist state based on the southern two continents in the world, has for the past 40 years slowly absorbed all neighboring nations. With its powerful military and vast industrial base, the CLP has faced little organized opposition. Major Mak Yerrym and his group of special operations soldiers is sent to deal with the latest uprising in Artusa, a recently conquered nation. There, he discovers disturbing evidence that threatens to destabilize an uneasy peace between the two superpowers of the world.
The Yarangan Union (YU) is a scientifically advanced nation based in the northern archipelagos, with unmatched naval power - fleets of advanced self-sufficient ships known as Umiaqs powered by Pelagium (a rare and powerful resource). In the past several decades the YU’s Pelagium research has rapidly advanced under the supervision of Toerwahn Tijksyn. With his recent disappearance, research has stalled. His daughter, Mira Tijksyn, is sent on an expedition escorted by members of the secretive YU State Security. There, she begins to understand the source of her father’s discoveries.
As players, take on the role of characters on both sides of the developing conflict and together uncover a vast conspiracy that threatens to bring the world into a devastating war that could destroy both nations, or worse.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck Construction, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Modular Board, Open Drafting, Role Playing, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Schadenfreude: Add-on Ritterorden
description:
Expansion for Schadenfreude that allows for play of Sweets in Wonderland. Uses the same deck and score track

Contains:
1 rulebook
25 knight chips (equivalent to sweet chips)
5 castle boards (equivalent to plate boards)
2 order boards (equivalent to order boards)
1 Unity of the Legion boards (equivalent to tea card)

name: Western Europe Xpress
description:
Western Europe Xpress is a fast paced, card driven, operational game in which players compete to develop the best networks of industry and rails by using multi-purpose cards. The players compete to develop the most profitable board position over six decades.

At the beginning of each decade, 12 demand cards are dealt in a tableau. Each of the three regions, (France, Germania, and the Southeast) scores revenue once its available cards for drafting are taken by the players, so they must balance their timing with their development as they jockey for the best position. Playtime is 30 minutes per player or less once they know the rules.

name: Vrahode: The Enlightened & The Enslaved
description: The game is a solo/co-op game (expansion) for 1-6 players, 14+ and is compatible with Weathervane Games' proprietary 3D terrain system called Harbinger which is used for dynamic multi level spaces. In this 1st expansion for Vrahode: The Calteeryn Ascension (the core game) the prophecy is fulfilled but only now do our heroes know the horrible truths of what lay ahead. Far greater dangers begin to encircle the world of Vrahode and hidden dangers begin to surface and step into the light. Where must the party go to find the help they need to face these new threats? Perhaps the places you fear most will unlock the way forward! New quests in the Underland, new Harbinger tiles, new enemies! All games in the series are part of the Vrahode Game System which invites players to generate their own content adding to the expanding lore of Vrahode!
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Vrahode: Facing The Storm
description: Vrahode is an adventure/dungeon crawl board game series. The game is a solo/co-op game for 1-6 players, 14+ and compatible with Weathervane Games' proprietary 3D terrain system called Harbinger which is used for dynamic multi level spaces. In this 2nd expansion we find at the root of the chaos reigns an entity of immense power. Its reach and influence is ever growing and twisting the minds of everything it touches. Into that maelstrom of corruption is precisely where our path leads us. There will be no rest until this enemy is eliminated because soon its tendrils of control may consume us all! This expansion features new enemies, tons of new quests in in the Overlands, Underlands and at sea! Lots of new Harbinger tiles including the Dungeon Riser which allows you to raise an 18X18" tile up to two levels and making five level dungeons possible! All games in the series are part of the Vrahode Game System which invites players to generate their own content adding to the expanding lore of Vrahode!
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Minimap Resolution, Solo / Solitaire Game, Storytelling

name: Vrahode: The False Gods' Deceit
description:
Vrahode is an adventure/dungeon crawl board game series designed by Jeffrey Irving. The game is a solo/co-op game for 1-6 players, 14+ and is compatible with Weathervane Games proprietary 3D terrain system called Harbinger which is used for dynamic multi level spaces. All games in the series are part of the Vrahode Game System which invites players to generate their own content adding to the expanding lore of Vrahode!

In this third expansion weary from many battles, somehow our heroes manage to raise their heads to the sky again toward where they now know the true source of the danger emanates! With every once of resolve they can muster, and bolstered with more powerful weapons, armor and ruhl (magic) they press on to find and destroy those which seek to control Vrahode and make them slaves. They must end the lies of the enemy and become the sword of the creator in their vengeance! New quests in the Overland, Underland and at sea, new enemies and brutal challenges lay ahead as you battle toward the most complex and challenging multi level dungeon ever created for a board game! It's gonna get bloody!
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Minimap Resolution, Solo / Solitaire Game, Storytelling

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar (Third Edition): Fury of the Deep
description:
The Age of Sigmar: Fury of the Deep set gives you everything you will need to create a battle between the Fyreslayers and the Idoneth Deepkin, it's packed full of enough miniatures to literally start a war as well as rules, lore, Warscrolls and more. Including two never before seen miniatures, Akhelian Thrallmaster and The Auric Flamekeeper. These models will lead the two armies into battle, but who will come out on top is down to you.

Fyreslayers are born from the furnaces deep within mountain vaults, bellowing mighty war cries as they charge into the fray swinging their deadly battle axes. They carry little in the way of armour to protect themselves, instead blessed with the power of their God magical ur-gold runes that are seared into their flesh, allowing their God's power to flow through their veins and provide them with abilities of more resilient skin and increased strength to cleave their enemies in two and shrug off wounds that would slay a normal warrior. What drives the Duardin Fyreslayers ever on is the promise of gold to be won, to fulfil their oaths by vanquishing their enemies and the chance to honour the spirit of Grimnir.

The Idoneth Deepkin are a cursed people. When Teclis took his due of Aelven souls from the captive Slaanesh he crafted a new race that he hoped would embody the virtues of the Aelves from the world that was. He failed. The creatures he created were not untainted by their time within the God of Excess, holding within themselves a deep well of darkness. Horrified at his failure, Teclis attempted to eradicate his newly created children but could not act before they fled, far into the deepest oceans of the Ethersea. There they multiplied only to discover to their horror that the majority of their children possessed withered souls. Few survived beyond birth and fewer still to adulthood so a decision was made. In order to safeguard the lives of those few children that survived the Idoneth would need to graft healthy souls to theirs thus do the Idoneth venture into the mortal realms on raids to enslave living captives to be donors and ensure the future of their race.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar (Third Edition): Order Battletome – Fyreslayers
description:
The Fyreslayers are a culture of duardin whose entire existence revolves around battle, renowned for their short tempers and unrivalled skill with the axe. Many believe these grizzled mercenaries are little more than avaricious barbarians, for they will fight for any who meet their price in gold. The truth is stranger by far – they do not crave plunder purely for the sake of wealth, but to gather the scattered essence of their long-lost deity Grimnir, the ancestor god of battle.

The pages of this book contain everything you need to know about the Sons of Grimnir, who battle across the realms in search of ur-gold, with axes in hand and war-hymns on their lips. Learn the story behind the mythic feats and glorious death of their patron god, discover Fyreslayer Lodges across the Mortal Realms, and meet the duardin who inhabit them.

This 96-page hardback book contains:


A treasure trove of background information on the Sons of Grimnir. Find out how and why the Fyreslayers fight with such furious rage
Incendiary art that shows off the battle-fury of the Fyresayers in all its glory
21 warscrolls and pitched battle profiles for every warrior of the Lodges, from fearless Berzerkers and mighty Magmadroths to the new Auric Flamekeeper
Rules for 4 different Fyreslayer Lodges, plus command traits, artefacts of power, prayers, and battle traits like Grimwrath Oaths and Ur-gold Runes
Path to Glory rules that allow you to take on Fyreslayer mercenary contracts to earn gold and reputation, plus 3 warscroll battalions for use in narrative play
Matched play content including 4 grand strategies and 6 battle tactics to unleash against your enemies
A showcase of glorious Fyreslayer miniatures assembled in the colours of the various Lodges, with guides on how to paint them yourself.


—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar (Third Edition): Order Battletome – Idoneth Deepkin
description:
The Idoneth Deepkin are a mysterious race of aelves who dwell within the oceans of the Mortal Realms, emerging from their watery seclusion to plunder the souls of land-dwellers – a grim harvest upon which their very survival depends. When the Idoneth go to war, they bring with them a phantasmal manifestation of their pelagic home. From this shimmering tide of magic, cold-hearted aelven warriors and ferocious beasts of the abyss surge forth to overwhelm their disoriented prey. In their wake is left only an eerie silence, for any survivors are reduced to a blank-eyed stupor by the obliviating enchantments of the Deepkin.

This book contains everything you need to know about the soul-raiders of the sea, who command the power of the depths and the creatures of the ocean as they pillage spirit-essence across the Mortal Realms. Uncover the genesis of the Deepkin and the nature of their withering curse, and explore the mystifying world of their sunken cities.

This 96-page hardback book contains:


A deluge of background information on the mysterious Idoneth Deepkin, including their arcane origins and aquatic way of life.
Ethereal artwork that displays the majesty of the Idoneth Deepkin
18 warscrolls and pitched battle profiles for Akhelian nobles, soul-starved Namarti Thralls, and vicious sea beasts like the Allopex or Leviadon
Rules for the 6 primary Idoneth Enclaves, plus command traits, artefacts of power, spells, and battle traits such as Forgotten Nightmares and Tides of Death
Path to Glory campaign rules that allow you to plunder the Mortal Realms in Idoneth soul-raids, plus 3 warscroll battalions for use in narrative play
Matched play content including 4 grand strategies and 6 battle tactics to unleash against your enemies
A showcase of abyssal Idoneth Deepkin miniatures assembled in the colours of their Enclaves, alongside guides on how to paint them yourself


—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Axis & Allies: China and France expansion counter sheet
description:
This counter sheet adds Chinese and French units to the original edition of Axis & Allies that was published by Nova Game Designs in 1981. This counter sheet was produced to accommodate scenarios starting in 1939.

—user summary
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Minimap Resolution

name: Olympia: das große Olympische-Spiele Magazin
description:
The players compete in a number of sports from the summer and winter olympics and soccer.

Summer Olympics: 100/200/400/800/1500/5000/10000-meter-run, 110-meter-hurdles, 3000-meter-obstacle-run, high jump, pole vault, long jump, triple jump, discus throwing, shot put, javelin throwing, hammer throwing, decathlon, pentathlon
(For most sports there are versions for men and women)

Winter Olympics: speed skating, ski jumping, ice hockey

Depending on the sport, movement or throwing is determined by drawing cards or rolling dice. Soccer is played on the ice hockey board.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Movement Points, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Draft Beer
description:
Carefully draft your ingredient cards and choose either to use the Ingredient depicted to produce beer or a special scoring condition, unique to each card. Those who gather the Ingredients required in the Happy Hour card get additional points at the end of each round. After three rounds, the player with the highest score becomes the Master Brewer!

This game was an entry to the 2022 54 Card Game Design Contest. Files now available on the Files Section.

3rd place Category Party Games
10th place Category Best Overall Games

—description from the designer

name: Card Rails Exchange
description:
Card Rails: Exchange is all auctions all of the time! Players blind bid to win Railways they can invest in, so maybe they can win big at the end. But sometimes, losing a bid can be a better long-term investment. It just depends on what's in your hand!

Card Rails Exchange is a 3-5 player 90-card train game played in about 30 minutes. Exchange is about trying to balance the bid you're making with the cards in your hand, all so you can invest in the Railway card in front of you. Players get points based on the number of completed Railway cards and which investment cards they used to complete them! Most points wins.

Card Rails Exchange is a standalone game in the Card Rails line.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Closed Economy Auction, Hand Management

name: Dragoborne: Elven Farstriker Promo Card
description: This is a green creature (elf) promo card for the Dragoborne: Rise to Supremacy card game. It differs from the regular card with the same name in that it has no card text.
publishers: Bushiroad South East Asia Pte. Ltd.

name: The Original Game of Alice in Wonderland
description:
This is a trick-taking game comprising 40 cards: 28 pool cards, and 12 with illustrations (patterned on those of Sir John Tenniel) depicting characters including Alice, the Gryphon, the Queen of Hearts, the White Rabbit, the Hatter, the Duchess, and more.
Each player has 24 counters and must contribute 4 to the pool. The game involves dealing out all cards and revealing each player's top card one by one. Different characters provide different rewards and penalties relating to the pool. Revealing certain characters before others can also influence the outcome of the game.

The rule card states that the game was printed with permission of Macmillan & Co., the publisher of Alice's Adventures in Wonderland.

—user summary

name: The Realms of Mindrin Wars
description: The Realms of Mindrin Wars is a War-style card game full of luck and strategy. Players take turns attacking and defending against each other in hopes of claiming victory and snagging some loot. Beware, for contained within these four different decks are Boogy Cards — cards that can help or hinder the outcome of your battle. The Realms of Mindrin Wars has several twists and turns ranging from certain victory to a Gremlish Thief stealing your loot pile.

name: The Maze Explorers: Desert World
description:
You and your fellow intrepid explorers are exploring a hot, dry desert maze. You have a limited supply of water to navigate and expose the maze path and find the way out. You will encounter quicksand, scorpions, and mirages that will fool and stymie you. Can you be the hero of the group by being the first one to expose the maze path and find the exit?

Your goal is to create a complete, unbroken maze path between the Maze Entrance and the Maze Exit and be the first Explorer to exit the maze. However, be careful not to run out of water, get caught in quicksand or encounter a scorpion!

Your maze exploration starts by shuffling all the maze tiles facedown and placing them on the table in front of you, being sure to connect at least one edge of each tile to another. You will then roll one or two dice to move over the tiles, turn them faceup, rotate them, and uncover the maze before you run out of your limited supply of water.

Along the way you will search for the hidden exit while also encountering various artifacts. Some artifacts, like the well, will help you to continue your explorations, others, like the scorpion or quicksand will not!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Semi-Cooperative Game, Tile Placement, Variable Set-up

name: Kodekraker
description:
This is a two player game.
Each player has a console on which he/she can set up a 6 digit code.
The goal is to guess the other players code first. You do this using cards the game provides.

—user summary

name: That Tiles Game
description:
That Tiles Game is an abstract game with Tiles (course) placement when you tried to match the most tiles posible to gain points. Also, you will try to keep the tiles of your opponents and snatch his points.

This game is visually beautiful, with tiles tiles that resemble ornamental ceramic tiles.

—description from the designer

name: 人狼 (JinRoh)
description:
JinRoh, also known as JinRou (人狼), is a Japanese Mafia/Werewolf style game.

There will be 2 teams, villagers and werewolves, and a Host. The Host, who is not on either team, is chosen to lead/moderate/narrate the game. The game alternates between Day and Night phases until the game is over.

Day Phase:
The Host calls for everyone to open their eyes and begin the first deliberations. A time limit may be established if desired. The goal is to determine The Werewolf and banish them from town. Players may “reveal” their identities and deliberate who they believe to be The Werewolf. LYING AND KEEPING SECRETS IS OKAY. The Host will call for all players to point at whom they want to banish. The player with the most votes is banished from the city and can no longer participate in discussions or nightly actions.
Night Phase:
The Host calls for everyone to close their eyes. The Host calls one role at a time to perform their nightly action. The order proceeds as follows “Bodyguard, open your eyes and point at the person you would like to protect. Okay. Close your eyes.” “Werewolf, open your eyes and point at the person you would like to kill. Okay. Close your eyes.” (If there is more than one Werewolf, they will silently come to an agreement on ONE victim.) “Prophet, open your eyes and point at one person to see their identity. (The Host will gesture to indicate if that person is human or werewolf) Okay. Close your eyes.” “Necromancer, open your eyes. You may see the identity of the person who was last banished. (The Host will gesture to indicate if that person was human or werewolf). Okay. Close your eyes.”
Unless they are protected by The Bodyguard, the Werewolf’s victim is killed and removed from the game.
The Human Team wins when all Werewolves are banished from the town. The Werewolf Team wins when the number of remaining Humans is reduced to the number of remaining Werewolves.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Hidden Roles, Traitor Game

name: Dragoborne: Izarco-Tvash Promo Card
description:
This is a red creature (dragon) promo card for the Dragoborne: Rise to Supremacy card game.

This card has an attack value of 6 and an endurance (HP) of 6. The cost to play this card is 7.

The non-promo version has some benefits that this card does not have. Specifically, this card:

When entering the game


Does not do damage immediately. This card only does damage during the combat phase.
Only 1 opposing card takes damage. You cannot spread the damage across multiple opposing creatures.
Does not allow a player to change the value of one of his/her die to 6.


When destroyed

The card is removed from the game but no damage is dealt to the other player.
publishers: Bushiroad South East Asia Pte. Ltd.

name: Dragoborne: Dragolord's Intervention Promo Card
description:
This was given for October Shop Tournament Participation. The card is a yellow spell (light) promo card for the Dragoborne: Rise to Supremacy card game.

This spell allows the player to draw 3 cards. If the player has a yellow banner, the cost to play this card (6) is reduced by 2 for every 1 shown on the player's dice.
publishers: Bushiroad South East Asia Pte. Ltd.

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Warcry – Slaanesh Sybarites
description:
The Hedonites of Slaanesh revel in the brutal carnage of battle, giving praise to the God of Excess and indulging in their every whim. They can be found throughout the Mortal Realms, and their presence in the Eightpoints has a malign influence on the mortal cultists who fight for survival in that blasted wasteland. They seek out combat not only for the thrill of battle but also to impress these mortal warriors with the virtues of their god.

With more ranged warriors than any other warband, the Sybarites can keep their enemies at arm’s length until they choose to unleash their frightening martial prowess in the swirl of melee combat. Though few in number, their warriors are skilled and versatile. When used well, they can eviscerate their opponents, but their lack of armour means you have to hold back until the moment is right to spring your traps. The kit includes a mix of heavily armoured elite warriors that will carve through even the toughest fighters, along with loads of archers. You’ll also find fighter cards to bring along Seeker cavalry, Slaangors, and mortal heroes.

Contents:
16 Miniatures
‣ 5 Myrmidesh Painbringers OR Symbaresh Twinsouls
‣ 10 Blissbarb Archers (1 can be built as a High Tempter)
‣ 1 Blissbrew Homonculus
Hedonites of Slaanesh Wound Divider and Abilities Cards
19 Fighter Cards
84 Tokens
10 Round Bases (28.5mm)
5 Round Bases (32mm)
1 Round Base (25mm)
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: 珠霊祭の夜 (Syureisai No Yoru)
description:
In 珠霊祭の夜 (Tama Tamamatsuri No Yoru), roughly Night of the Pearl Festival, the players are buying and selling gems through a mancala mechanism.

Each player has a board divided into six sections, one for each of the colors of gems. On their turn, a player choose all of the cubes in one section, picks them up, and distributes them as in mancala.

The color of the space where the last cube is placed and the number of cubes there determines the actions a player may take. Specifically, the color of gem they can buy or sell and the maximum number they can buy or sell.

After the distribution occurs, a market adjustment card is triggered from a face up pool which likely adjusts the value of a single colored gem up one, but may trigger a more volatile move.

The game ends after a number of times through an event deck or when a player has accumulated a certain amount of money. The players each get the same number of turns and the one with the most money wins.
publishers: Sai Hate Denpatō (さいはて電波塔)

name: Munahhemana: The Chosen One
description:
With the Lord of the heavens and the earth echoing the commands to the Holy Prophet (PBUH), a divine revelation came about 1400 years ago. This advent had been promised in the Abrahamic religions, including Christianity. His name was "the Chosen One" and has been narrated in various languages throughout history. The name commenced its journey from the ancient Syriac language with Munahhemana (ܡܢܚܡܢܐ), passed by Greek with Periclutos (περικλυτος) and then landed in the Gospel of John with Paraclete. This name has since remained in the hearts and minds of generations to come. In the Gospel of John, the Prophet Jesus (PBUH) said, "I am announcing the coming of someone who, if I do not leave you, will not come… “He will teach you everything and recollect what I have told you”… “When he comes he will bring justice and equity to the world". Ultimately, the Chosen One, named Muhammad (PBUH), appeared in the Arabian Peninsula. He, along with his companions, migrated to Medina to build the Abrahamic civilization.

Munahhemana needs citizens who will help him build the new civilization with their production and economics, dedication and obedience, intelligence and politics, and science and wisdom. In the Game of Munahhemana, various challenging events and important missions occur. Herein, only tribes with specific characteristics can support Munahhemana. They must find the balance between the strengthening of their tribes’ power and carrying out missions assigned to them.

ROUTINE, CO-OP or SOLO. You can choose and play any of these three modes. In routine mode, you compete with other players, while in co-op mode, you collectively work together, and finally, in solo mode, you work alone to play the game.

—description from the publisher
categories: Arabian, Card Game, Children's Game, Civilization, Medieval, Religious
mechanics: Closed Drafting, Cooperative Game, Melding and Splaying, Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement

name: Hangman: Einstein Edition
description: Classical Hangman Game with 160 words. There is a paper with two possible words. The player(s) choose 1 or 2 and the game master player for this round split of part with the words. Now the player(s) can for example choose an „e“ and the game master can tell them that it is on 1,3,6. It’s easy because under every letter is a short number so you can directly say the position. Quick good vacation game.

name: Hová bújtál, katica?
description:
The beetles that live in flower meadows are in great danger. A hungry bird could fly by at any moment and, if it spots them, it could eat them. But the beetles have learned how to become almost invisible in the grass. Help them hide too!

A fun development board game that's great fun for younger children, so the whole family can play together.
