The aim of the game is for each player to collect and hide 4 beetles under the grass. Since the beetles are different sizes, the plants that hide them are also different sizes. The ladybird can be hidden by the smallest grass, while the potato beetle can be hidden by the medium size and the deer beetle by the largest.

name: 复苏：破封 (Recovery: Break the Seal)
description:
The Resuscitators resuscitate in this era. The Human Restart Seal Array attempts to reseal the Resuscitators. After the Resuscitator noticed the seal formation, they decided to lead the army to attack the city. The City Manager only needs to defend the city to win.

复苏：破封 ("Recovery: Break the Seal")is an asymmetrical two-player card game. One player playing The Resuscitators use rule like Smash Up. Other player playing The City Manager use DBG rule against The Resuscitator.

The Resuscitators must defeat the battlefield within a limited time to win. Conversely, the City Manager only needs to hold to win.

—description from the designer

name: 八雲さんはトリテしたい (Yakumo-san Wa Torite Shitai)
description:
八雲さんはトリテしたい (Yakumo-san Wa Torite Shitai), roughly translated as "Yakumo wants to play a trick-taking game", is a trick-taking game for 1 to 4 players themed around eyeglasses.

The game includes a board which pictures a pair of glasses with spaces around it for players' pieces. The winner of a trick chooses a card from the trick and advances their marker a number of spaces corresponding to the rank. The different spaces are worth a different number of points.

Additionally, the 0 card causes each token to immediately advance 1 space.

The game can be played for one hand or over a series of hands. In both methods of scoring, the winner will be the one who best maximizes the point value of where the piece is on the glasses board when the hand ends.

name: Απίθανοι Ήχοι (Incredible Sounds)
description:
A game for children who are called to recognize sounds that are being played to them by the provided two CDs. They are then marked by token on boards and on the end the one who has identified the most sounds correctly wins!

—user summary

name: The Post of the Past and at Present
description:
Typical roll and move game about the post delivering history around the world (from Europe, Asia, North America, Africa).
The first player, who cross the route with 41 stops first, wins the game.

—user summary

name: Kampfgeschwader vorwärts!
description:
Military strategy game based on aerial bombing raids. One of many propaganda-based wargames published in Nazi Germany before WWII.

The board is on heavy cardstock and depicts various terrain features with a superimposed grid for movement of units.

The game comes with 28 toy figures made of tin: 20 aircraft (6 twin-engine bombers and 4 fighters for each player) and 8 anti-aircraft guns (4 for each player). There are also 12 round paper counters (6 for each player). Each unit has a value on the bottom to represent the impact of capture.

—user summary

name: Gerrymander
description:
Players will be a politician and they will be gerrymandering the board. The player with the most district wins.
This turn-based game introduces the concept of gerrymandering in the most relevant way. These days, the game is highly sensitive, and there is a need to educate more people about the repercussions of democracy

The players will start with some cash to purchase the corruption cards to change and manipulate the voters on the board. Once the players finish their money in the campaign phase, they will start the gerrymander phase with the district pieces they purchase in the campaign phase.

—description from the designer

name: Space Rally
description:
Take a seat in a spaceship and race through solar storms and asteroid fields to victory.

Each person controls a spaceship and tries to reach the finish line first over 3 stages.
But the opponents will not watch idly as you steer your spaceship smoothly across the finish line. They will literally put obstacles in your way: Asteroids.
So you'll have to shoot your way through the asteroids or navigate around them. However, asteroid fragments are rich in rare metals. If you collect the fragments during the race, you can exchange them for upgrades to your ship at the end of the stage.
Besides, you'll have to contend with solar storms, which you should avoid in any case.

Pick up your dice, choose an action from your multi-use cards and fly to victory.

Will you be the first to reach the finish line and get fame and glory?
Find out in: Space Rally

–description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Multi-Use Cards

name: Forest Trails
description:
As forest developer, your role is to improve the visitor experience and attract as many people as you can to come and enjoy the beautiful forest. How many visitors can you attract?

An engaging, role and write game where players will take on the roll of Forest Developer and design and map out interesting forest trails, take visitors past scenic view points and carry out surveys to find out what facilities visitors require to keep people coming back.

Game Play

Trail parts (start or end markers, paths etc) and the type of trail to draw are chosen from options revealed through 2 dice rolls. Map out trails that will appeal to 4 types of visitor (4 different coloured route types) and fit in as many trails as you can on your forest map.

Surveys of visitors along partly finished (or finished) trails will enable you to discover what visitors need and keep them coming back.

Reach a build point along your survey track and you can add a facility building. These attract even more visitors who you can survey again to improve facilities even more. Watch your score build up as you try to fit in up to three types of buildings for each path type. This engine building, puzzle system enables rewarding strategies to be discovered for higher points.

Points (visitor points) are earned by the length of trails, what building / facilities they have on them and what objectives have been met.

Discover new maps and new ways to optimize trails. Play as 1 of 4 different characters. Each character role, such as Forest Educator, has unique bonus abilities / actions, objectives and end game visitor bonus point achievements.

-description from designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Drawing, End Game Bonuses, Multiple Maps, Network and Route Building, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: The Wordbuilder Set
description:
The Wordbuilder Set has two games for "onset and rime" [word beginnings and endings] practice.

Initial Blends SPRING

This has a deck of 64 cards, 2 each for 32 different 2-3 letter rimes (e.g. an, ack, ing, ock), and 2 dice which have a total of 12 2-letter onsets on them (e.g. br, tr, pl, st). Players are dealt 7 cards each. The dice are rolled and players try to match either of the onsets seen with one of the rimes on a card in hand, which is discarded if successful. The first player to empty their hand wins. There are two modes: taking turns and simultaneous play.

Wordbuilder

The deck has:
- 48 cards with both a word that can act as a rime (e.g. age, eat, ice, old), and 1-2 letter onset
- 8 joker cards, each with 6 different 1-2 letter onsets
- 8 YOU LOSE cards

Players are dealt 4-7 cards each, as agreed, and the dealer plays a word card from their hand. On their turn a player does one of these:
- Play a word card. If there is another word card atop the discard pile, the new card's onset must make a valid word with the previous card's rime.
- Play a joker card, such that one of its onsets makes a word with the rime on a word card atop the discard pile. Then the player may play any other card except another joker.
- Play a YOU LOSE card, which makes the next player draw two cards and skip their turn.
- Draw the top card of the deck.
To go out and win the hand, a player must play a YOU LOSE card along with their final card. Otherwise, if they play their final card, they draw the top of the deck.

name: Psych! Party Game
description:
OUTWIT YOUR FRIENDS
Make up fake answers to real trivia questions and score points when you psych out your friends in this hilarious party game based on the popular app.

BRING TO YOUR NEXT PARTY
Choose a category and read the question, make up an answer and pin it to the board, then wait and see who you psyched out. Win even more points if you pick the right answer.

4 FUN CATEGORIES
Features 4 different categories for you to psych out your friends: Is That A Fact, Word Up, Movie Bluff and The Truth Comes Out. Shuffle them all together for a more random game.

Includes: 1 Gameboard, 2 Paper Pads, 200 Cards, 1 Magnetic Pin Board, 8 Movers, 1 Magnet Sheet, 1 Sticker Sheet, Instructions.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Party Game, Trivia
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Player Judge, Real-Time

name: Shogun Dynasty
description:
Shogun Dynasty is a fast and fast paced card game of different clans in Japan struggling to take power over all Japan as the Shogun. Using only 20 cards, it is extremely portable and can be played almost anywhere.

Shogun Dynasty is played as a series of games. Players are knocked out of a game until the winner is determined. The winner of the series is the first to win 3 games or to win a game with the Emperor.

Players have a hand of one card. On their turn they draw one card and play one of their two cards, keeping the other as their hand.

Cards can be played face up or face down, with different effects. Cards played face up take effect immediately. Cards played face down take effect at the start of the player's next turn. And players may discard the face down cards of other players before they take effect.

Card effects may knock a player out of the game. At the end of the game, the remaining player with the highest ranking card in their hand wins.

-description from designer
mechanics: Deduction, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Score-and-Reset Game

name: Inferno: Card Game
description:
Inferno is an “anti-pick up” styled survival strategy card game. The aim is to be the last surviving player, to do this you will need to collect cards to help you avoid negative events. By picking up cards, it also increases your chance of encountering dangerous events. The cards which help you navigate the deck do not only help you avoid danger, but can strategically place your opponents into danger.

Their demise is your survival.
There can only be one survivor!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Move Through Deck, Multi-Use Cards, Player Elimination

name: Squadrons: Star Citizen Strategy Card Game
description:
Squadrons is an immersive strategy collectable card game which lets you command your favourite ships from the Star Citizen universe and compete with other players both in duel and multiplayer matches.

Squadrons is very catchy and beginner-friendly, but with increasing game experience it offers a very multi-faceted game.

The resource system was deliberately minimized with a focus on tactical action, rousing space battles and dogfights.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Dice, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Deck Construction, Dice Rolling

name: Sonderburger Seeschlacht-Spiel
description:
The players take turns to roll and move. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. The first player to reach the harbor of Sonderburg (space 100) wins the game.

Plastic sailships were available as supplements to bags of Harry-Sonderburger bread.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: 1:0 für Babette
description: The players move the ball on the game board according to the results of a spinning top (with results from 1 to 6). When a player loses control of the ball, the other player gets his turn. After a predetermined time the player with the most goals wins the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Aeronautica Imperialis: Companion
description:
Aeronautica Imperialis – Companion is an expansion book for Aeronautica Imperialis games.

The perfect addition to any Aeronautica collection, it contains new rules, aircraft, and factions for games of Aeronautica Imperialis, as well as collating previously published content from White Dwarf magazine into one handy volume.

Inside you will find:
- Rules for fielding a Necrons force in games of Aeronautica Imperialis, including three aircraft profiles, along with upgrades and Ace Abilities
- Rules for fielding the full force of the Asuryani in games of Aeronautica Imperialis, including four all-new aircraft profiles: Vampire Raider; Vampire Hunter; Nightshade Interceptor, and Hemlock Wraithfighter.
- Rules for fielding all four Adeptus Astartes aircraft, collated in print for the first time
- A collection of aircraft profiles for existing factions not previously available in print, including the Marauder Pathfinder, Marauder Colossus, as well as rules for Looted aircraft for the Orks Air Waaagh! and Gue'Vesa Auxiliary aircraft rules for your T'au Air Caste
- New and exciting ways to play, including expanded damage rules, allowing for more detailed air combat, new Ace Abilities, Limited Ammunition rules and a dedicated set of matched play scenarios
- A suite of campaign rules allowing players to track the progress of their squadron over a series of games from rookies through to highly skilled Aces.

Please note that you will need a copy of the Aeronautica Imperialis rules in order to fully use the contents of this book.

-description from publisher's website
categories: Aviation / Flight, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Movement Points, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: The Card Game
description:
A samurai push-your-luck, set collection game. Take to the Dojo and Roll dice, allocating them to the available Virtues. Learn enough Virtues of the Bushido Code to impress one of the visiting Daimyo in order to win!

Many of the Virtue cards dynamically alter the game when collected. Focus tokens can force a player to reroll any die at any time - and each of the Daimyo have a special ability to help or hinder training!

name: Beaver Brawl
description:
A beaver card game where players compete against each other simultaneously and try to cut down the opponent's trees!

Beaver Brawl requires players to develop alliances in the early game and play in a smart way to avoid the infamous Beaverona card(which would eliminate the player from the game).

After the Beaverona is drawn, the game becomes a pure strategy card game where attack and defend actions need to be performed at the right time not to overexpose the player.

Every player starts with 4 cards in their hands and plays a combination of them every turn to defend their tree or attack someone's tree.

They draw from the deck the same amount of cards they played.

When a player draws the Beaverona or loses all its trees, it is eliminated from the game.

The last player standing wins!

name: Local de Ensayo
description:
It's your time, now you can become the author you've always wanted and set up the group you've always dreamed of for the next COAC (Cadiz's Carnival Contest). But be careful, the rest of the authors will have their mission, to annoy you and to lead a better group than yours.

This card driven game lets you get a band together to compete in Cadiz's (Spain) most prestigious contest.

This is a filler game for anyone who wants to dare to put together a group for the next COAC. You can play from 2 to 6 players and being 7 years old is enough to be able to join the game, which will last between 15 and 30 minutes.

Each turn the player plays a card from their hand of three. This could be a voice from the chorus, an instrument, or some improvement to these. Once you have four diferent voices and four instruments, you can call for the end game. At that point, players count their points and the winner is decided.

Player may, instead of playing card to add to their band, play them for their special effects, affecting other players or even calling for an early end of game and point count.

name: Jok
description:
Jok dice game:
Each player gets 1 meeple and starts at space 1 of the section of his color. The Players take turns to roll and move. On the roll of a 6 the player gets an extra roll. If a meeple gets on a prime number (framed spaces), the gets a "Jok"-token (joker). Each player may only get two tokens per game. The tokens may be used any time in the players turn to move the meeple up to 6 spaces forward. If a player already has 2 tokens or chooses not to tame one, he may move his meeple equal to the checksum of the prime number it occupies.
Whenever a meeple gets on a number that can be divided by 11 (black spaces), it gets set back by the product of both digits. The 11 only counts as a prime number.
The first player to exactly reach space 100 wins the game.

Knight's move:
Each player gets 4 meeples which start at spaces 1, 2, 18 and 19. The meeples are moved in turns according to the knight's move in chess. All numbers that can be divided by 11 (black spaces) may not be occupied. The first player to get all his 4 meeples on space 100 wins the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Square Grid, Track Movement

name: Malzkaffee-Spiel
description:
Each player gets 15 pawns (cups or packs). Starting positions are the first 3 rows above the red stars. The cups are placed on the pink spaces with the corn on one side and the packs on the blue spaces with the cups on the other side of the board.
The goal of the game is to get 6 pieces on the red stars on the opposite side of the game board.

Movement is 1 space per turn diagonally forward. Orthogonal movement is only allowed to reach a red star. Opponent pieces are taken by jumping over them to an empty space behind them. Pieces on a space with a letter are safe and may not be jumped over.

—user summary
mechanics: Grid Movement, Race, Square Grid, Static Capture

name: Secret Cardinals
description:
Secret Cardinals is a ‘take that’ player elimination game of Vice, Virtues, and hidden Roles within Roles. Eliminate political opponents and survive the power struggle from within the 15th century church through deception, sabotage, and calculated choices. For each turn, clever players will need to strategize their actions wisely to deduce who their political rivals are, acquire gold for its power, or gamble their advantage on the role of the dice. Use gold to purchase indulgences, gain virtues by giving charity, or pay a bribe to find rivals guilty of vice. Each turn brings unexpected dangers and new ways to win.

Rome, 1418. The Papal standoff that had split the church for decades has just concluded, but tensions still linger from when three rival popes simultaneously claimed to be the one true pope. Each claimant was backed by a competing power of Europe: Rome, Pisan, and Avignon. Driven by politics rather than theological disagreement, the church was thrown into turmoil. To find a compromise, a fourth Pope was chosen to succeed as the legitimate head of the church. As a result, the other three claimants were deposed, jailed for heresy, or excommunicated for their disobedience. In order to maintain a delicate network of alliances among the ruling powers, the new Pope has secretly named his choice for a new Cardinal from among these powers to honor this player’s service while keeping them safe from the political machinations of the competing Kingdoms.

Adversaries with hidden agendas and hidden roles are looking to eliminate their opponents and win the game. An upstart with an agenda wants to be acknowledged as the Secret Cardinal and is looking to eliminate the competition. A rival Roman Cardinal is not keen to recognize the influence of the new Pope and the fanaticism of their Devoted Follower creates a dangerous situation for anyone trying to upset the status quo. No one is safe from the Heretic infiltrators, as they work to limit the growing influence of the church, even as the are being hunted by the an overzealous Inquisitor who is determined to root out anyone suspected of heresy. Lastly, interlopers associated with the neighboring monarchy have not forgotten their candidate for Pope was excommunicated and have sent a Royal Spy from Avignon to cause trouble.

Players will see similarities to Bang and One Night Ultimate Werewolf, with unexpected action cards and new ways to win with roles within roles.

—description from the designer
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Medieval, Party Game, Religious
mechanics: Deduction, Hidden Roles, Kill Steal, Take That

name: Scattered Nexus: Comic Calamity
description: The second installment of the Scattered Nexus card game, a battle-style card game based on indie comics. Using shuffle building you make a team of three comic factions to defeat your opponent. This set expands player options by featuring 6 new comics: Aurora, Edge, Next Reaper, Little Warrior, and Plume.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting

name: Ich will nicht
description:
Each player chooses his goal. Either he tries to get rid of all his cards or to collect two sets of cards from 1 to 6.

At the beginning each player is dealt 8 number cards and 2 "Ich will nicht (I don't want to)"-cards. The remaining "Ich will nicht"-cards are laid out in the middle of the table. The "ich will nicht"-cards are used as dummies when cards are exchanged to fool the 3rd player.

Each player has the following options to play his turn:


The player rolls three dice. The result determines which cards he may give to his left neighbor. He may choose as many cards as he wants as long as their combined value does not exceed the result of his roll.
The player declares "Ich will nicht" and does nothing.
The player takes 1 or 2 "Ich will nicht" cards from the Table
The players places 1 or 2 "Ich will nicht" cards from his hand on the table.
The player calls a number (1-6) or "Ich will nicht" cards. His left neighbor must show his hand. If he has more than 2 of these cards, he has to give one or both of the surplus cards to the active player and has to pay 5 coins for hoarding cards. In the other case the active player has to pay 2 coins for falsely accusing the other player.


—user summary

name: Human Punishment: Social Deduction 2.0 – The Beginning Promo Cards
description:
7 additional ID cards added as a bonus to Human Punishment: The Beginning. They represent the characters from the prequel and have unique abilities.

Human: Dryden, Jayden
Machine: Feykah, Havoc
Outlaw: Nova, Dee Coy, Kuro

name: Game of Treasure Island
description:
A spin-and-move game based on Robert Louis Stevenson's classic novel, you must take Jim Hawkins through his travels from the Admiral Benbow Inn at the top left of the board to Bristol England in the top right. The spaces are arranged in columns which you move up and down.

This game was originally released in 1923 by Stoll & Edwards. It was reprinted twice: as part of their "Two-Games-in-One" line in the late 1920s, and revised (with new multicolor board art) as Stoll & Einson's "Treasure Island" in 1934.

name: Lost in the South Seas
description: A spin-and-move game based on Daniel Defoe's classic novel "Robinson Crusoe," this was originally released in 1924 by Stoll & Edwards. It was reprinted twice: as part of their "Two-Games-in-One" line in the late 1920s, and revised (with new multicolor board art) as Stoll & Einson's "Marooned in the South Seas" in 1934, part of their "Playjoy" line.

name: Superheroes of Centerville
description:
Superheroes of Centerville is a cooperative board game for 1-4 players who work together as superheroes to defeat a swarm of villains attacking the Centerville City Hall. The villains rush towards the center of the board while the superheroes use their powers to hold them back and defeat them. There are 16 superheroes and 4 villain groups to choose from. Each superhero has a unique set of powers, and each villain group has a unique mix of abilities.

Each player gets a hand of energy cards which they use to activate their hero's powers. They must use the cards efficiently to have enough power to stop the villains. There are also stunt cards which can be used to change how a power works.

Each superhero has a different set of powers. Some superheroes are similar to each other and others are very different. Playing each requires figuring out their strengths and weaknesses and devising tactics that work for them.

The villain groups are giant insects, zombies, ninjas, and robots. Each has a different balance of movement and strength, requiring different tactics to defeat them.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Stalingrad: Operation Winter Storm
description:
Expansion from "CounterMoves" c2003 regarding attempt to relieve the German 6th Army surrounded at Stalingrad.

Includes 4 pages of history and rules and die cut counter sheet.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, World War II

name: The National Game of the American Eagle
description:
This is a simple spin-and-move game which, like the famous "Mansion of Happiness," adapts the basic format of the 63-space Game of Goose to an Americanized morality theme: in this case, ascending to the American presidency through government. Green spaces are blanks, but white spaces provide some positive or negative quality or trait: "Patriotism," "Firmness," "Hypocrisy," "Duplicity," and so on. An accompanying rulebook provides instructions for most of these spaces, which usually involve advancing or retreating to another space or losing a certain number of turns.

Colored counters (discs) and an 8-sided teetotum are also included.

name: Jeepers! Creatures!
description:
Jeepers! Creatures! is a game where 2-4 players take turns spinning to see if they match the bodies and arms of three creatures before everyone else to win the game.

Players spin and if the arrow points to one of their figures. If the spinner does not land on one of their creatures, they pass their turn. However, players that have the spinner land on their space are able to exchange multiple arms depending on if they can match the colored dots on the bottom of the figures and they can combo exchanges together.

The first player to match all three of their monsters with the correct arms wins the game.
mechanics: Memory, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Bezzerwizzer Bricks: Stå upp! Vi är gul och blå!
description:
A quiz game about the swedish national football team.
Contains 60 questions and a category tile to make this an expansion for the big Bezzerwizzer games.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: The Game of Quizzer Questionnaire
description:
The Game of Quizzer Questionnaire is a questionnaire game from Stoll & Edwards, basically a precursor to such titles as Trivial Pursuit. Players use a spinner to randomly select a question from an included book that pertains to geography, history, government, science, or "every day facts of interest." The game book is advertised as including "Over 1,000 Questions and Answers."

The game also includes a box of colored chits, called "Pawns," that are used to cover spaces on a tile and thus show a player's progress toward winning.

—user summary

name: Picture Building Game
description:
Picture Building Game is a simple, self-explanatory game for small children, to "unconsciously learn to distinguish between the different colors, also the simple numerals" (according to the ad copy).

Four different colored 7" x 9" cards are included, each with a 3x3 grid of spaces numbered 1-9. One card goes to each player. Four color pictures of children at play, cut into rectangular pieces, are also in the box. Each disassembled piece has a colored number on the back assigning it to a specific square on a specific card.

The object of the game is to use the included "indicator" (spinner) and compile a complete picture on your card.

—user summary
mechanics: Pattern Building, Roll / Spin and Move, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid

name: Moral Conflict: Family Edition
description:
Find out who’s the goody-two-shoes and whose antics are deserving of a time out in this hilarious game of “most likely to”! Each card lists a different scenario, anything from “who’s most likely to accidentally drop something in the toilet?” to “who’s most likely to claim to have been abducted by aliens?”.

Players take turns to read out the cards and nominate a player using their whiteboard paddles. The player with the least nominations at the end of the game is the winner and can claim their title as the most well-behaved of the bunch!

-description from publisher

name: O Homem que Mordeu a Caderneta de Cromos
description:
The game is based on telling strange and bizarre stories, based on the cards that come out, corresponding to the questions: “where?”, “Who?”, “What?”, “To whom?”, “With what? " it's because?".

In O Homem Que Mordeu a Caderneta de Cromos, players set out in search of bizarre stories to tell when they land in the right house, and try to make their listeners laugh, so that they can earn prestigious coins. The possibilities are endless! Put creativity to the test and tell the best story!

The game takes place with the roll of a dice that moves us forward on the board. Through the house where we fall, we exchange our cards for others of the same color, changing the title of our bizarre news.
When we hit the "Está na Hora" house, we started to invent our story based on the title we were building in front of us.
We have time counted by an hourglass and if we get away with it within that time and we manage to convince the other players, we win a prestigious coin.
At the end of the game the player with the most prestigious coins wins.

It is the same game as O Homem que Mordeu o Cão but with a 70's/80's theme.

name: Last Say
description:
This revolutionary educational card game is winning hearts and minds by bringing out our inner wordsmiths! Last Say is a game that uses player creativity to create phrases from drawn cards. You'll have to get clever to make a great sentence. But be careful! Other players can steal your phrase and win the points!

Objective:
Get the ultimate Last Say by winning the most points!

Contents:
180 Cards

How to Play:
Set up:
1. Each player draws 9 cards (3 of connecting words, and 2 each of nouns, verbs, and adjectives). Layout the cards on the table facing up (it does not matter if other players see your cards). After of your turn, replace used cards.

Play:
2. First player forms a sentence with their cards. When using a connecting word you can choose any of the 3 shown on the card.

3.Following players form a new phrase or steal by adding to a previous phrase. They may also replace their unwanted cards.
When it's the next turn of a player who's phrase was stolen, the last player who stole it collects the cards and wins the points. If nobody stole your phrase by your next turn, you win the points. It's a battle to get the

LAST SAY!

How to Win:
4. When one of the decks of cards is finished, count your points to see who won.

Points:

+ 1 Point: Does not include all the colors.

+2 Points: You steal by adding on to a phrase.

+ 3 Points: Includes all the colors.

name: Absurdia
description:
Welcome to Absurdia! This card-based party game for 3-8 players will be sure to challenge you and your friends with absolutely absurd scenarios and arguments, with endless combinations of cards and infinite fun to be had! The goal of Absurdia is to be the first player to win 3 Question Cards. Two players face off each turn and play Hero and Support Cards that best answer the question. Each player gets 30 seconds to give their absurd argument as to why their cards answer the question better than their opponent's. The remainder of the group then votes on the winner, who wins the Question Card! The questions are ridiculous! The heroes are unlikely! The attributes are ludicrous! Get ready to flex your imagination and dive into the oddest of scenarios, because here at Absurdia we live by one motto:
It's time to get weird!

-description from publisher

name: Dim Those Lights
description:
This is a variation on a ring or ball toss game. The ability to have dimmed headlights was brand new and somewhat controversial in the early '30s, so it made for a trendy subject. The game includes a stand-up board or target with lithographed art showing three cars surrounded by a squad of five motorcycle cops. The headlights of each vehicle are labeled with a point value of 10 or 20 and each has a cupped tin tray underneath to catch a small disc and hold it in place.

The goal is to take your set of heavy cardboard discs - red or yellow - and score points by tossing them at the target and covering the headlights of the three cars. However, misjudging your aim and covering the headlights of the police motorcycles will instead accrue negative points!

The winner of the game is the first player to reach 100 points.

name: The Game of Heck
description:
This is a card game from Stoll & Edwards. Essentially a set collection game, "Heck" is played with 12 numbered cards dealt out to players at the start. Three special Heck cards are placed face-up in the center of the table. The object is to get a continuous sequence of cards in your hand: six if there are two players; four if there are three players; and three if there are four players.

Players throw three dice, each with 1-4, a star, and a crescent moon on its faces. Whatever number is rolled, they may "call" for that card, and if another player has it, they must give it. Throwing three stars allows a player to call for any card they want to help make a continuous sequence. Throwing three crescents allows them to draw a Heck card and use it as a wild card in a sequence.

The first player to complete a sequence wins the game, "by Heck!"

name: Blood of a King
description:
In Blood of a King the object of the game is to wound your opponent's King 3 times. Each player starts with a deck of 12 cards, 10 Warrior cards numbered 0-9, 1 King card numbered 10, and 1 Witch card numbered 11. A round begins by each player dealing out five card onto the play surface from left to right. The cards have a silhouette of an Axe or a Shield along the long edge of the card. When the edges of the cards line up they will either match axes, shields, or have no match. The number of Axes is your attack strength, the number of shields your defense. If you have more Axes than you opponent has Shields, you have wounded their tribe. See what their highest numbered card is. If it is a Warrior, remove the card from play. If it is the King, give them one of your matching wound cards. If it is their Witch, remove their Witch from play, but also remove your lowest Warrior card.

If the initial draw of cards results in a tie, each player plays another card to the right of the last card played. Count Axes and Shields again, and follow the above results.

If your tribe is going to be wounded by your opponent you may CALL UPON THE BERSERKS! When you Call Upon The Berserks you may draw one card and play it to either end of your row of cards. You may do this only once per round and the Berserk card will be removed from play after the round.

Continue playing rounds until one player has received the three wound cards from their opponent.

—from the publisher
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Pattern Building

name: Bow-o-Wink
description: This is a tiddledy winks game in which the aim is to snap the counters into the open mouth of one of three dog characters with oversized heads.

name: Bunker Golf
description:
This is a miniature golf game from E. E. Fairchild. The board has a "tee-off" space in the center with nine areas - the nine golf holes - radiating out from it. The goal is to play all nine holes in the lowest number of strokes.

The game comes with a miniature metal club (approx. 4 inches long) and two metal balls.

name: The Novel Game of Stop and Go!
description:
The baby is hungry! The first player to get to the Milk Man and then back home with a bottle of milk will win.

Fundamentally this is a movement game, using two traffic cop spinners that tell players how many spaces to move, what direction they can go, and whether or not they can turn. According to the All-Fair catalog, the game "teaches traffic rules with great gusto and lots of fun."

Players use little metal cars as tokens and are allowed to share spaces. Both the Milk Man and the Policeman (the entrance to Home) must be reached on exact spins.

The game was published with a double-sided board that has a checkerboard on the other side.

name: Túlélők Viadala
description:
Túlélők Viadala is an exciting quiz, trivia game in which survival is at stake. In a playful way, the game provides knowledge for solving unexpected situations that occur in everyday life, for which ordinary people may not be prepared.

During the game, you have to survive disaster situations hidden in the skin of different characters: in the event of a winter power outage lasting several days, after a plane crash in the jungle, or just during a zombie attack. In the first part of the game, the characters test their survival skills with quiz questions about emergencies and disasters. With correct answers, they get tools that they can use during the survival situation in the second part of the game. This is where the misfortune takes place, the stages of which can bring more and more plagues.

name: DC Comics HeroClix: Justice League Unlimited Starter Set
description:
Batman, Superman, Wonder Woman, The Flash, Green Lantern, and Martian Manhunter band together for this brand-new HeroClix starter set!

This boxed-set is a great way for 1 to 4 players to learn HeroClix! Play with the contents of this starter set or combine it with other HeroClix figures for even more fun!

This starter set contains everything up to 4 people need to play HeroClix.

—description from the publisher
categories: Collectible Components, Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Miniatures
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: DC Comics HeroClix: Harley Quinn and the Gotham Girls Fast Forces
description:
The DC Comics HeroClix: Harley Quinn and the Gotham Girls Fast Forces features 6 HeroClix figures with all-new dial designs, focusing on the Thrillkiller storyline from Elseworlds. This pack is perfect for Harley Quinn and Batman fans alike and an excellent product for new and established players!
This Fast Forces features Harley Quinn, The Joker, Batgirl, Robin, Batman, and a GCPD Officer.

Fast Forces packs are designed for quick play and easy team building, for both tournaments and casual games.

—description from the publisher
categories: Collectible Components, Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Miniatures
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: DC Comics HeroClix: 15th Anniversary Elseworlds Starter Set
description:
With the 15th Anniversary of HeroClix, WizKids is excited to reveal DC heroes as seen in the pages of Elseworlds!

The DC Comics HeroClix: 15th Anniversary Elseworlds Starter Set includes the most iconic DC heroes. A great introduction to HeroClix for rookies, a useful teaching tool for experienced stores, and a fresh look at iconic characters for HeroClix veterans!

—description from the publisher
categories: Collectible Components, Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Miniatures
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: The All-Fair Baseball Game
description:
This is a partly mechanical, and rather complex, baseball game for two players, boasting a metal playfield inside a wooden frame.

A "hidden" trigger allows the pitcher to fire the ball, while the batter has a spring-loaded bat attached to the frame which can swat at the ball. Indented cups in the board at the various bases and home plate, as well as the outfield, allow the ball to come to rest and the play to be scored.

The game also includes a set of lead baseball player figures which can be moved around to represent the progress of taking bases, and so on.

name: The Capital Cities Air Derby
description:
Inspired by the interest in the flight of Charles Lindbergh, this is a race game to be the first aviator making a non-stop flight from New York to San Francisco.

The game includes a long bi-fold board of a map of the United States, with the various capital cities highlighted. Parallel game tracks in four bright colors (green, orange, yellow, red) cut through the center of the map, with little "detours" through various cities.

—user summary

name: Hi-Way Henry
description:
This is a race game based on cartoonist Oscar Hitt's 1926 comic strip of the same name. Players control tourists going for a cross-country trip in their busted-out old jalopy. Much of the appeal comes from Witt's sprightly graphics.

Movement is controlled by dice (cubes), but the brightly colored board includes a built-in tire spinner that can cause a sudden "blow-out."

—user summary

name: Kombi-Rechenspiel
description:
Five matematical symbols (+ - : x =) and one number card are placed on the table. Each player is dealt 6 number cards. The goal of the game is to get rid of ones cards by using them to form equations by combining them with the card on the table to equal the number card on the table.

If a player can't form an equation, he draws up to 3 cards from the deck. If he still isn't able to form an equation, the next player takes his turn.

The first player to get rid of his cards wins the game.

—user summary

name: Todo Sobre Mí
description:
Game to socialize and generate empathy with all the participants. Ideal for teenagers and adults who want to have fun trying to know what the rest of the participants think. The more you know the players, the more chances of winning, and if not, they will have to risk their answers, making the game even more fun.

Ideal for teenagers and adults who want to have fun trying to know what the rest of the participants think.

After reading the question aloud, the rest of the players choose the answer they think is correct, then the answers are read and scored. The winner is the one who guesses the most, showing more empathy with others.

name: Yoguis y Yoguinis
description:
A game to learn Yoga while playing. A beautiful invitation to practice yoga and feel all its benefits.

It consists of a board tour where as the players advance they can draw different cards. Each of them has different Yoga postures and breaths to learn and practice. Several game options are proposed, all with the aim of learning and practicing this beautiful discipline that is yoga.

The first to reach the end of the board gains access to the medallion that turns them into a guide to help the others perform the postures until they reach the end of the board.

name: Súper Viaje de Emociones
description: Súper Viaje de Emociones is a game to talk about what happens to us. It contains a board, where the route is a trip that is made with all the participants and the Bigotes Cat as a companion. Upon landing in different boxes, the players raise a card that invites them to express their emotions in different ways. The first to arrive becomes the emotional guide of the game!

name: Rix Olympia Regatta Spiel '72
description:
The players take turns to roll and move. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. The first player to pass space 55 wins the game.

Sail ships for this game were included in 500g packages of Rix bread.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Ali Baba und die 40 Räuber
description:
The players take turns to roll and move. On the orange spaces the player may move an additional number of spaces forward, only on number 99 he has to move 9 spaces backwards. On the violet spaces the player may only move further when he rolls a 6. If a player gets on space 100 he has to go back to space 1.

The first player to reach space 97 or 105 wins the game.

The game was published on a sheet of paper.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Im Zick Zack Kurs aufwärts
description:
The players take turns to roll and move. On some spaces the player automatically moves forward or backwards. On some spaces the player may roll again.

The first to reach space 128 wins the game.

The game was published on a sheet of paper.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Regatta
description:
Each player gets 6 sailing boats. The players start on opposite sides of the game board and have to reach the opposite edge of the game board. The players take turns to roll 2 dice and move.
On the roll of a 5 and a 2 the player moves one boat from space 5 to space 2 in the next row and another boat from space 2 to space 5 in the next row. On the roll of a double the same boat may be moved two times. If a boat has passed the middle of the game board it moves two rows: for instance from space 5 to space 2 in the next row and from there to space 5 one row further. If a boat reaches a destination space the player gets a bonus move.

The first player to get all 6 of his boats to the opposite side wins the game.

The game was published on a sheet of paper.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Square Grid

name: Bower
description:
You have a mere 9 months to prepare! Your nest is drab and bare, sticks and leaves won't draw anyone's eye. Collect trinkets and tokens from the forest floor to increase the appeal of your nest. It doesn't have to be perfect, it just has to be better than that other guy's.

Bower is a competitive 2 player, pick-up and deliver game with engine building upgrades and push-your-luck scoring elements. Gameplay revolves around strategic pathfinding and turn optimisation. On your turn, your opponent will first populate the forest with berries and trinkets using the seed deck. You may then alter the paths through the forest by rotating the 7 central tiles, before moving your Bowerbird along its current path, collecting the trinkets you pass over. If you can return your bowerbird to the nest, you score points depending on the number of trinkets it returned with. You also earn a powerful crest to enhance your future turns. The player with the most points from their bower and personal goal cards is the winner.

Note: Great Bowerbirds (endemic to Australia) have a fascination with anything green or white. The Males will collect as many discarded toys, plastic scraps, stones, bones and shells as they can find to decorate their nest (Bower), in the hopes of scoring a partner during the November-January mating season. Young males will even work together on a “practice” nest, to ensure their skills are properly honed.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: End Game Bonuses, Map Deformation, Pick-up and Deliver, Track Movement

name: Holosseum TCG
description:
Sci-Fi Trading Card Game about reality benders fighting in a galactic battle royal to save their home world from complete annihilation. reduce your opponents life to 0 before they can do the same to you.

Holosseum TCG is built around the simplicity of a card limiting mechanic not a mana system. This allows a much deeper complex and engaging gameplay. You will be pulling from a card pool over 200 distinct cards. Each game is as much a galactic turn-based tale you can share with friends, as it is a battle for your planet.

Holosseum TCG is a Sci-Fi/ cosmic horror trading card game set in an indeterminate time and a galaxy pretty close by. As a Grid Runner, you'll represent your team in a galactic gladiator competition. The competition takes place in a planet sized arena, the Holosseum. Ran by the Dimmu, an ancient species of reality bending beings from a previous universe, the fate of the competition rests in your hands! The Dimmu have chosen 5 Teams to fight for their lives and their fates in the Holosseum. Use the very essence of reality to cast cosmic spells and summon grotesque entities from mysterious realms; this is a competition you'll want to win.
categories: Collectible Components, Fantasy, Horror, Science Fiction

name: Baby Penguin Racing
description:
Race to the bottom of the iceberg to be the first penguin to reach the pool party and win the last piece of cake! There’s a pool party happening at the bottom of the iceberg and some of the penguins are late! Players move their penguin down the iceberg by speeding ahead on ice slides and avoiding big ice cracks to be the first penguin to reach the pool party and win the last piece of cake.

In Baby Penguin Racing kids race down the different levels of the iceberg, while trying to avoid ice cracks that will send them backwards and jumping onto ice slides that will speed them ahead. Players move along the board by using their numbered cards to move ahead. Use the cards strategically to avoid obstacles, land on bonuses, and slow the other penguins down. The first penguin to reach the pool party wins!

Baby Penguin Racing has bright and colorful images and scenes that make this game a fun and creative way for kids to learn new skills like strategic thinking, communication, and basic counting. Limited reading and counting, and image-based play make this the ideal game for kids ages 4+ to play!

-description from publisher

name: Pirates Gold!
description:
Subtitled "A Treasure Hunt for Buried Loot," this game is - surprisingly - a variation on Parcheesi. Players follow a zig-zag path to get their four pirates to the Treasure Chest at the center of the board first.

This game is present in the 1928 "All-Fair" catalog, but clearly predates it by at least one year. It was no longer listed in the catalog by 1930.

name: About Us: Boomer+ Edition
description:
About Us, Boomer+ Edition is about Canada's Baby Boomers PLUS their peers a few years older. Through our research partner, we conducted an online survey of this demographic group and asked oodles of questions on a variety of topics, covering many aspects of their lives. Their answers? You'll have to play the game to find out!
Guess:

What % of the Boomer+ population has gone skinny dipping?
Which Boomer+ age group is most likely to have been hypnotized?
Which Boomer+ gender is more likely to have a tattoo?
There are 180 questions and answers in this tabletop game! Feeling confident?

—description from the publisher

name: Baby Duck Racing
description:
Swim to the end of the bathtub to be the first ducky to plug the bathtub drain and save playtime! The bathtub plug has been pulled and the water is draining, but the bath toys want to keep playing. Players race the duckies across the bathtub to reach the plug and become the hero of playtime while avoiding popping bubbles and trying to speed ahead on slippery soap suds!

In Baby Duck Racing kids race across the bathtub, while trying to avoid obstacles like popping bubbles, using the slippery soap suds to speed ahead, and dropping obstacles to slow the other duckies down. Players move across the board by using their numbered cards to move ahead. Use the cards strategically to avoid obstacles and land on bonuses while staying ahead of the other duckies. The first ducky to reach the bathtub plug and save playtime wins!

Baby Duck Racing uses bright and playful images and scenery to make this game a fun and imaginative way for kids to develop skills like strategic thinking, communication, and basic counting through hands-on play. Limited reading and counting, and image based play make this the perfect board game introduction for kids ages 4+.

-description from publisher

name: About Us: Grown Up Girls Edition
description:
About Us, Grown Up Girls Edition is an _oh! so-much-fun_ party games everyone can play at the same time, Created from amusing (and _amazing!_) data about the female species, it combines grown up girl guesswork with good-old fashioned retail therapy. What could be better for your next girls' get together?

Think about what grown up girls dream about or what type of movie role would like to play? Or what pick-up line works best? You may be in for a surprise!

—description from the publisher

name: Brothers Bond: Board Game
description:
Based on the Eisner-nominated webtoon by Ryan Benjamin and Kevin Grevioux. Chris Dias (Naramata, Ultramodern5) designed this cooperative tabletop game which allows two to four players to assume the roles of the characters from Brothers Bond and journey across a mystical land, partaking in numerous adventures in hopes of saving the world. Each game resides within a larger connected campaign where heroes travel across the land, engage in high-pitched action, and progress a story towards an epic climax. Along the way, characters develop and improve between sessions, carrying over skills and choices to later games.

The story of Brothers Bond centers on Yoshi, the young, arrogant crown prince set to inherit an empire.

After falling into trouble with his father, the one man he fears, Yoshi runs from home. Picked up by two blind wandering samurai, Yoshi grows up to learn honor and strength. He then decides to return to his homeland to claim his birthright and save his people from a demon invasion.

—description from the publisher

name: Brokers: The Stock Trading Game
description:
Brokers is a game where players role play as an intern investing a client's retirement fund. Each round of the game, players are presented with the current market conditions and must make strategic decisions on what to buy, sell, or hold in order to increase the value of their client's portfolio. Players must push their luck to squeeze out as much money as possible before the inevitable market crash as only cash on hand is important once the market tanks. Do you have what it takes to beat out the other interns and impress the boss? Try it out in Brokers: The Stock Trading Game.

Setup includes randomly selecting 3 event cards including the Market Crash event and mixing them. Then 5 or 6 cards (depending on the number of players is add on top of these 3 cards. This is the event deck. The Stock Summary Sheets are placed in the play area and the price deck for each is shuffled and the top card of each is played face up on top of the corresponding Stock Summary Sheet. A marker token is placed on each Stock Summary Sheet for on the price listed on its current price card. The Energy stock does not have a price deck and instead has its marking token placed on 155. Each player is given a set of action cards which includes 3 buys, 3 sells, 2 praises and 2 critiques. Each player is given a starting portfolio of $150, and share of 2 Retail, 2 Venture Capital, 2 Energy, and 2 Manufacturing stock certificates. Players receive additional $150 on turns 2 and 3. One player is selected as the Lead Intern.

The game is played in up to 8 or 9 rounds depending on the number of players and each round an event is played which alters the rules of play for that round. Each round players secretly plan which 3 action cards they will play and players reveal their actions together. The player with the Lead Intern card starts playing 1 or 2 action cards for a single stock type and each player does the same taking turns going clockwise until all actions are played. The action cards players choose influence the order of decisions that the other players make. As players buy shares the price increases for the next player. As players sell share the price of decreases for the next player. If a player plays a praise card, the price increases by two values. If a player plays a critique card, the price decreases by two values.

Once all actions are played, players collect exclusive roles for fulfilling specific portfolio requirements. The Major Retail shareholder role gives the player double dividends for retail shares. The Major Manufacturing shareholder gives the player an extra sell action each round. The Major Venture Capital shareholder role gives the player a free share of Venture Capital each round. The Most Diversified Portfolio role give the player an extra $25 dividend for having at least one of each stock and the greatest number of stocks among all the players.

After roles are collected or redistributed, players collect dividends for owning the stocks in their portfolios, and then the Lead Intern card is passed to the next player clockwise. The game ends at the end of the round when the Market Crash event occurs. At that point, the player with the highest cash score (not share value) wins the game.
mechanics: Market, Prisoner's Dilemma, Push Your Luck

name: DC Comics HeroClix: Batman and His Greatest Foes Fast Forces
description:
The DC Comics HeroClix: Batman and His Greatest Foes Fast Forces features all-new dial designs including Batman along with the most iconic characters from his rogues gallery— The Joker, Harley Quinn, Mr. Freeze, The Riddler and The Penguin. As a bonus, the DC Comics HeroClix: Batman and His Greatest Foes Fast Forces Pack includes an exclusive 3D Harley’s Hammer object with card!!

HeroClix Fast Forces packs are designed for quick play and easy team-building for both tournaments and casual games.

—description from the publisher
categories: Collectible Components, Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Miniatures
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: DC Comics HeroClix: World's Finest Booster Brick
description:
The DC Comics HeroClix: World’s Finest set features heroes and villains from the Superman/Batman comics as well as three major sub-themes of the Metal Men, the misfit heroes of the Doom Patrol and a mystical sub-theme that includes well-known magic users such as Jason Blood as well as a collection of generic magic/supernatural characters such as witches, warlocks, apprentices and demons.

Each DC Comics HeroClix: World’s Finest Booster Brick contains ten (10) 5-figure booster packs.

—description from the publisher
categories: Collectible Components, Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Miniatures
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: CSI Board Game
description:
This is the first CSI board game to include all THREE SHOWS in one game (CSI, CSI Miami and CSI New York) and the first CSI board game to feature UNLIMITED GAMEPLAY.

There is a different outcome every time you play the game.

As a CSI team member, you roll dice to travel through the streets of Las Vegas, Miami and New York looking for the evidence and suspect you need to solve your case.

To solve a case, you must complete one of your three CASE CARDS. To complete your CASE CARD, move around the board to collect all three pieces of EVIDENCE on the card, collect (recruit) one of the three CSI TEAM MEMBERS on the card, and find your SUSPECT.

Take the completed case to the corresponding DETECTIVE on the CASE CARD to put your SUSPECT in jail and win the game.
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Conquest: Spires vs Hundred Kingdoms – Two Player Starter Set
description:
Dive into the world of Conquest: The Last Argument of Kings with the Conquest: Spires vs Hundred Kingdoms – Two Player Starter Set With proposed scenarios designed to ease you into the system of Conquest, the box contains three warbands and a commander unit for each faction, allowing two players to clash on the field. Whether you rally the might of the Hundred Kingdoms or command the twisted creations of the Spires, the objective is one and the same: conquest.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Queue, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Deities of the Old Kingdom
description:
The heretic pharaoh Akhenaten has abandoned you and the other old gods. He worships only his new Sun God, Aten. The people follow their leader blindly, leaving you weak and crumbling.

By influencing the six Domains of Egypt, you and your rivals will slowly take back some of your powers. Through common spells and mighty enchantments, you will eventually have power enough to bring forth an eclipse powerful enough to stop the Sun God and his favored pharaoh. All while struggling to be the most powerful god by the end. 

Deities of the Old Kingdom is a puzzle game about manipulating a dice grid to gain the resources you need.

Each turn, you'll roll three dice and push some of them into the 5x5 dice grid. Connect as many symbols as possible to gain the resources you need. Spend your resources to unlock enchantments and - by the very end - your own unique Eclipse spell.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Connections, Dice Rolling, Pattern Building, Set Collection, Slide/Push

name: Vikingskip
description:
Inspired by the Norse sagas and the many vibrant cultures of the Viking Age, Vikingskip challenges players to build the ultimate Longship. Choose your captain, gather a motley crew, and use any means necessary to out-sail and out-wit your fellow players in the quest for plunder.

The strategic heart of Vikingskip' is about racing to see who can amass the most loot over four rounds by raiding and trading with historic Targets and surviving dangerous Longships.
Each turn players strengthen and refine their Longship by drawing rooms and placing them.
As ships get longer, players can amass larger crews with a wealth of skills, strengths, and cultural backgrounds.
As ships get stronger, so do the longships that hunt you!

Players interact with each other by discarding cards from their Longship, playing Action cards from their hand, and raiding Trade routes controlled by other Captains. Action cards can disrupt, and even intercept other players. A clever captain can indirectly kill a greedy opponent, saddle them with a dodgy crew or build a Longship that can snatch victory from the jaws of defeat.

After the fourth round is over, players tally their banked loot and subtract any fallen Captains from their final score to determine the winner.

—description from the designer

name: Survivance 2885
description:
Survivance 2885 is a skirmish game for 2 to 4 players. Clans of 10 miniatures will confront each other through multiple scenarios or in a campaign mode. The game features a new FATMAX EDITION game system based on 10-sided dice, a new and original alternate activation, an evolution over the course of the game, multiple powers to customize your clan, optional managed non-player characters to spice up your games, various degrees of injuries. These are only a few examples of a game that is very accessible in its rules but whose tactical depth will give you a lot of pleasure.

—description from the designer

Une planète reculée de la galaxie est touchée par un virus foudroyant. Ce monde est la plaque tournante du commerce dans cette zone de l’univers, toutes les races y sont présentes et font des affaires. Placé en quarantaine stricte, sans gouvernement et avec 70 % de la population terrassée par le virus, ce haut lieu d’échange est devenu en quelques mois un territoire hostile et inhospitalier. Les habitants se sont regroupés en clans qui luttent pour leur survie. Les échauffourées sont légion.

Le décor est posé ! Survivance 2885 est un jeu d’escarmouche de 2 à 4 joueurs. Des clans de 10 figurines vont s’affronter à travers de multiples scénarios ou dans un mode campagne. Au programme un nouveau système de jeu FATMAX EDITION à base de dé à 10 faces, une activation alternée inédite et originale, une évolution au fil des parties, de multiples pouvoirs pour personnaliser votre clan, des personnages non-joueurs gérés optionnels pour pimenter vos parties, divers degrés de blessures. Ce ne sont que quelques exemples d’un jeu très accessible dans ses règles mais dont la profondeur tactique qui s’en dégage va vous donner beaucoup de plaisir.

—description from the designer (French)
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Variable Player Powers

name: 触覚あわせ (Tactile Match)
description:
In Tactile Match, players are touching 3D prints of enlarged produce textures feeling for matches.

Specifically, the game comes with 2 each of the textures of corn, strawberries, melons, and other produce; one each in black and white.

Each player has a hand of tiles for which they are feeling for the match from the center of the table. If a match is found, the player earns points. Alternatively, if the player finds either of the "expensive melons" in the center, they immediately earn points.

The game may end in a number of ways, and the player with the most points wins.

name: DC Comics HeroClix: World's Finest Fast Forces
description:
The DC Comics HeroClix: World’s Finest set features heroes and villains from the Superman/Batman comics as well as three major sub-themes of the Metal Men, the misfit heroes of the Doom Patrol and a mystical sub-theme that includes well-known magic users such as Jason Blood as well as a collection of generic magic/supernatural characters such as witches, warlocks, apprentices and demons.

—description from the publisher
categories: Collectible Components, Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Miniatures
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: ブンプ星人 (Alien Plotter)
description:
In Alien Plotter, players place aliens they encounter along two axis, such as big/small or friendly/unfriendly. In each round, one player places 2 aliens face up as an example of how they interpret the axis labels, and 3 face down. The other players in turn order attempt to guess one of the face down aliens. The alien on the board is then revealed, and both players earn points if the guess is accurate.

Each player has a chance to lead a round, and the player with the most points at the end of the game wins.

name: Mono
description:
Players race to empty their hands. In turns, players attempt to play a card by matching its color, number to the topmost card on the discard pile. If unable to play, players draw a card from the draw pile and pass their turn. The special cards can spice things up a bit.

Mono card game is based on UNO and SOLO, is a public domain card game played with a standard deck of playing cards.
mechanics: Hand Management, Lose a Turn, Matching, Take That

name: Provenance
description:
In Provenance you assume the role of an amateur antiques dealer. The aim of the game is to make as much profit as possible by buying and selling antiques. Take advantage of market trends to sell your items when there is a higher demand, but be careful not to hold on to or hoard too many items as that comes with hefty storage fees.

Spend time researching items to make safer buys, but don't wait too long as the item may be bought by a more daring dealer. Does your item have a secret royal connection? Or is it a piece of junk?

Provenance is a 2-5 player card game that uses a unique 'Provenance deck system' to determine the worth of the thirty item cards in the game. Provenance is simple to play, but offers plenty of tense choices from start to finish.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Commodity Speculation, Events, Market, Negotiation, Trading

name: Screen Test: Stranger Things
description:
Tune in to Stranger Things and get ready to play. Your game card says "flickering lights." On the screen, the Demogorgon threatens and the Upside Down looms. Yes, the lights are blinking. You've got the card! Shout it out and earn points to win.

With 300 cards featuring Stranger Things characters, places, actions, and dialogue.

—description from the front of the box

Netflix subscription, compatible device, and Internet connection required.

—description from the front of the box

name: Zombie Escape
description:
The story:
You find yourself lost and alone in an unfamiliar neighborhood, surrounded by zombies. You need to find shelter and you need to find it fast. You see a main house with a car in the driveway and you decide to take a chance; hoping you can find shelter and safety. You start your search with the car in the hopes of finding keys to the house or to some well needed supplies. It’s a start and with more zombies heading your way, it might be your only chance.

Synopsis:
Zombie Escape is a game with dice rolling, placement and movement. You must enter and search multiple locations to find supplies and shelter from the zombie horde. Once you reach the main house you must clear it of zombies inside and out to give you a final place of safety to win the game.

—description from the designer

name: Kakuro Master
description:
In this mixture of Sudoku and Crossword the Players try to gain Points by putting the numbers best on the playmat. Each number can only placed once per column and row. The sum per row and column must match the given checksum.

—user summary

name: 15 Dice of Civilization
description:
15 Dice of Civilization is a two-player dice game in which you roll the dice to place a die. The goal of the game is to complete your civilization board with proper dice color and value. A game round starts with the roll of six action dice with which you perform various actions in order to place your civilization dice on the board in the right order and value.

If you have two base boxes, you can play the game with more than two players.

name: Who Knows?
description:
How well do you know what everyone else knows? Bet wisely or guess right to score big!

The multiple choice answers are shown but the question remains a mystery!

The host for the round guesses what the question could be and bets on who wont know the right answer...

Then the question is revealed. Players who answer correctly, win the point token they were given. Whoever gets it wrong loses the points to the host!

At the end of the game, whoever has the most points, wins! If there is a draw, the team with the highest single token wins.

—description from the publisher

name: Sisco
description:
Goal of the game: To discover a word composed by the game leader and thus win the maximum number of points.


The game master forms a word from 5 vowels and 5 consonants, and arranges the letters in the letter holder. The other players will try to discover the word by guessing its letters.
Each player in turn rolls the Letters die which allows them to suggest a vowel or a consonant.
Each time a letter is correctly guessed, the game master opens the corresponding flap of the letter holder and the player who guessed it scores the points on the letter tile.
Then, whatever the result of their guess, they roll the Sisco die, which can give them a second chance to play, or even better, let them guess the word or double their points.
The players must find the word very quickly because the game master scores the total points for the word each round of turns.


After each player has a turn as game master, the player with the highest score wins.

—description from the back of the box (modified)

name: Monster Lands 2
description:
Monster Lands 2 is the sequel to Monster Lands, a competitive dice-placement game that combines resource management, worker placement, and fun combat, ranked #6 in Tom Vasel’s all time Top 10 of Dice Placement games and awarded Best Game by Spanish Authors 2018.

In Monster Lands 2 we “turn the tables”. Instead of playing with clans of mercenaries against marauding monsters, you now swap roles, taking on the role of hordes of fearsome monsters who fight off attacking humans. YOU are the monster player! Instead of looking for the favor of the Queen, you now work towards becoming the most infamous horde, competing to win the approval of the Great Entity of the Beast realm and be named Megalomonster.

Your hordes are made up of different types of monsters, the most powerful of which are your champions. Each champion (represented in the game as card) has an ability and brings along further monsters (represented as dice or tokens) to be used in battles and other assignments. Send your champions to perform different tasks in your territory, have them lead battle against the “evil” humans, or fight it out with your fellow monster hordes for rewards in the champions’ arena. You can acquire mutations, armor, reinforcements, health berries, chillies, and more, all with a dice placement mechanic that not only requires planning of the right timing, but also of the right dice/tokens to be used in each job. Lots of new and different places await you, making Monster Lands 2 a very rewarding experience for Monster Lands 1 players, while at the same time working perfectly stand-alone (you don’t need Monster Lands 1 to play Monster Lands 2).

Wait, did we tell you that your monsters include mulfins? The mulfins, those little buggers, tend to explode, so be warned when handling them. But then again, your monsters still feed on their remains if they do explode ... after all, a monster has to eat.

Who is going to be the most infamous monster horde?
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Dice, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Worker Placement with Dice Workers

name: The Dance
description:
The Dance is a game for two to six players. Each player controls a vampire clan attending a grand ball at a palace in the late 19th Century. Each vampire family is represented in play by an avatar, a game piece representing the family member selected to move about the dance floor and attempt to gather support from dancers to expand influence and solidify power.

—description from the introduction

The Dance was published in issue five of One Small Step's rebooted "Ares Magazine."
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Choco Battle
description:
Children's game about collecting chocolates with different flavours.
Game includes two game variants - Easy for kids from 4 years and Full Choco Battle for kids from 6 years.
In your turn you can either play a pair of chocolates(cards) with the same flavour or ask one card from one of the oponents.
When you are successful you gain one piece of chocolate to your player board.
During the game you can use some jokers which introduce little bit of bluffing and memory to the game play.

name: Marvel HeroClix: X-Men House of X Fast Forces
description:
Wolverine, Domino, Beast, Marvel Girl, Forge, and Sage handle the problems that Krakoan diplomacy can’t. With this Fast Forces, your opponent will soon be the one with the problem!

With the ability to suppress opposing powers, utilize Stealth, and great tactics, this thematic team will help you bring the excitement, subtlety, and action of X-Force to the tabletop!

—description from the publisher
categories: Collectible Components, Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Marvel HeroClix: Fantastic Four Future Foundation Fast Forces
description:
Reed Richards assembled the Future Foundation because an entire generation of geniuses would do more good than he ever could.

The Future Foundation Fast Forces brings all of the most well-known characters to a visible SKU: Mr. Fantastic, the Invisible Woman, The Thing, the Human Torch, Spider-Man, and Dr. Doom!

This is one of the best looking Fast Forces ever! With an increased scale and superior paint jobs, make sure to add this set to your HeroClix collection!

—description from the publisher
categories: Collectible Components, Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Miniatures
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Nerds Dancin' Dice Game
description:
Everyone knows that Nerds are active little candies that roll, bounce, & dance their way onto taste buds. Nerds Dancin' Dice is a goofy, Nerd-rolling challenge for up to 4 players where Nerds-shaped dice are rolled for hilarious fun.

—description from the publisher

The instructions could be more clear, but basically you're rolling the nerds to achieve the desired positions on the prompt cards. Everyone rolls at the same time and whoever gets the combination first wins that round.

"Faceplant" cards are also part of the deck, though it doesn't really explain them well.

It's inspired by, but different from, Pass the Pigs. There are specific objectives each round. The colors are arbitrary, it seems. Only the positioning counts.

—user summary

name: Marvel HeroClix: X-Men Xavier's School Fast Forces
description:
Celebrate the release of Marvel HeroClix: X-Men Xavier’s School with this all-new Fast Forces Set!

The Marvel HeroClix: X-Men Xavier’s School Fast Forces includes six figures with all-new dials, ready to play as a 300-point team! Not only does it feature fan-favorite mutants like Cyclops, Beast, Iceman and Jean Grey, but it also contains two characters never-before-seen in HeroClix – Rusty and Skids!

Once a player already has a Starter Set, a Fast Forces is a great way for them to build a thematic team.

—description from the publisher
categories: Collectible Components, Comic Book / Strip, Dice
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Marvel HeroClix: Avengers Black Panther and the Illuminati Fast Forces
description:
Celebrate the release of Marvel HeroClix: Avengers Black Panther and the Illuminati with a new Fast Forces set featuring characters of Wakanda. Look for Ayo, Black Panther, Nakia, Okoye, Shuri, and White Tiger to represent Wakanda in this exciting new Fast Forces release. Wakanda Forever!

Once a player already has a Starter Set, a Fast Forces is a great way for them to construct a thematic team and build their collection!

—description from the publisher
categories: Collectible Components, Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Miniatures
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Zombies Want Pizza
description:
ONE PLAYER IS THE ZOMBIE, THE REST ARE PIZZA CHEFS - The chef with the most disgusting pizza wins! The losing chefs are eaten for dessert.

USE WEIRD INGREDIENTS TO MAKE THE WORLD'S MOST DISGUSTING PIZZA - Cards have ingredients such as dead flies, skunk spray, nose hair, dirty underwear, and more. Mix them to make the grossest pizza the world has ever seen!

—description from the publisher

name: Marvel HeroClix: Avengers/Defenders War “Marvel Knights” Fast Forces
description:
The Marvel HeroClix: Avengers/Defenders War “Marvel Knights” Fast Forces Pack includes 6 all-new dial designs featuring Daredevil along with other Marvel Knights characters including – Luke Cage, Iron Fist, Jessica Jones, Punisher, and Elektra! This Fast Forces Pack is an excellent product for new and established players offered at an impulse-friendly price point!

HeroClix Fast Forces Packs are designed for quick play and easy team-building for both tournaments and casual games.

—description from the publisher
categories: Collectible Components, Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Miniatures
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Marvel HeroClix: Avengers Infinity Fast Forces
description:
The Marvel HeroClix: Avengers Infinity Fast Forces includes six figures with all-new dials, ready to play in many different combinations! This Fast Forces features classic Avengers like Black Panther, Iron Man, and Hawkeye, as well as the Colossal Giant-Girl on a 2×2 base!

Once a player already has a Starter Set, a Fast Forces is a great way for them to build a thematic team.

—description from the publisher
categories: Collectible Components, Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures
