mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Marvel HeroClix: Captain America and the Avengers Fast Forces
description:
Celebrate the release of Marvel HeroClix: Captain America and the Avengers with a new Fast Forces set featuring characters of Avengers and Living Legends representing the lineage of Captain America and Citizen V. Look for Captain America, Isaiah Bradley, Citizen V, Hawkeye, Iron Man, and Winter Soldier in this exciting new Fast Forces release.

Once a player already has a Starter Set, a Fast Forces is a great way for them to construct a thematic team and build their collection!

—description from the publisher
categories: Collectible Components, Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Spinball
description:
Spinball is a simple action game for two players. First, all balls are removed from the holes. Then the two opponents choose one of three color combinations. Then the balls are thrown apart by operating a lever and end up in the holes. If balls that don't match the color have fallen in, remove them again. The winner is the first to get the balls in the holes that match their chosen color combination.

—user summary

name: Star Quest: Conquest
description:
A turn-based Strategy game set in space. Conquer planets and overwhelm your opponents by controlling resources. Manage your resource points to build an army capable of controlling the galaxy.

From the start of your turn you'll gather your resource points for the round. You can spend them on placing new troops, buying new ships, or upgrading your research and development. Then use these troops to fight or take over new territories.

You can move as many troops into an area with opponents on it. After the movement phase begins the attack. Each player will roll dice for attacks. The dice roll required depends on the type of unit attacking. Most units require a 5 or a 6 on the dice for a successful hit. Each player will learn from these experiences to deploy a more effective strategy as the game moves on.

Over time the territories you take away from your enemies will lessen the amount of Resource Points they get per turn, diminishing their ability to fight back. You can win by getting the opponent to surrender (ends a game faster) or you can play it out, and chase them through the map to destroy the troops they have left and end the game. Moving a fleet ship costs 10 RP, so the opponent will eventually run out. You win when the other player is unable to make any moves.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Pieces as Map, Resource to Move

name: Backscore
description:
Backscore is a perfect-information game played on a 7x11 grid, in which each player controls a five-piece team and coach in a heavily abstracted sport scenario. Points are scored by moving a neutral 'ball' piece back into a section of one's own back row, having pieces kick it about.

Play is progressive - that is, the first player moves one piece, the second moves two, and thereafter each turn involves moving three pieces. Moves are 'slides', much like a queen in chess, but each piece must move as far as possible - meaning that the challenges of the game are less about speed (action is quick and can range rapidly around the board), and more about strategizing to keep good control over one's pieces and setting up good positionings.

Backscore is a more-complex descendant (different enough that it escapes being a plain variant, but close enough credit is important to give) of Neutron by Robert Krauss.

—description from the designer

name: Chip & Collect
description:
Bird battle with other greedy flocks using your Chip & Collect skills. Glide and grab chips and seaside Bonus Food, avoid bad food and an evil plastic bag! But don't drop the lot! When all the chip cards have been collected, the flock with the most Chip points wins.

The game is played in rounds that start with a bird battle of skill. The winning bird attempts to grab and hold seaside food worth chip points, and drop any Bad Food that will deduct chip points. The same player starts the next round and repeats the process until beaten in battle, where their turn ends. Their turn also ends if all Chip cards are dropped, only bad food is held, or all bird cards have been used or discarded.

name: ArchRavels: Magic Socks
description:
The knitting scene goes crazy when a family of crafting gnomes comes to town with magic socks to trade. How will your skills expand when your feet are full of magic?

In ArchRavels: Magic Socks, you can trade items for enchanted footwear that doesn't just keep your toes warm: it gives you special rule-breaking powers.

This expansion also introduces two new character types, the Expert and the Maker, along with everything you need to play them. Take this opportunity to expand your table to welcome 5 or 6 players simultaneously! Don't worry, the 5-6 player rules keep the game about the same length, despite adding 50% more crafty goodness!

Finally, the Magic Socks expansion also includes some all new Special Projects to add a bit more variety to your knitting circle.

-description from publisher
mechanics: Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Rehbein: Klug für uns
description:
Dennis Rehbein is a local politician of the German town Hagen.

Each of the 23 square cards shows 4 pictures in a grid 2 by 2. Each picture shows one of 4 politicians of the CDU (German party). Before the game begins, each player chooses one of these politicians. 3 mission cards face up show each an arrangement of several pictures. On your turn, draw a card and add it to the display. If you meet the condition(s) with your politician, you collect 1, 2 or 4 victory points for the according mission card(s). The player who reaches 12 victory points, wins.

—user summary

name: Durch unsere bayerische Heimat
description:
On a map of Bavaria you travel on a web of roads using the spaces by rolling the die. Some spaces trigger an event causing earning or losing money. As there is no mandatory route, you may try to avoid negative spaces. You must visit the 7 capitals of the Bavarian regions, then return to your starting town. Among the first 3 players meeting this condition, the richest one wins.

—user summary

name: Mixture Mischief: Black Cat promo card
description: Black Cat promo card, the card increases the difficulty level of the Mixture Mischief game by adding additional Cat Card

name: The Worriers
description:
The Worriers is a psychological cooperative game in which 1 to 4 players become characters with unique skills.
In this game you have to try on the role of an anxious person, look at the world through their eyes and realize how many challenges stand in their way every day!
At the beginning of the game each player has 3 life tokens (the total amount of points is 12), 3 challenge cards and 3 bonus cards. Superclass cards are postponed until the final stage.
Class cards remain implicated in the challenge deck and drop out to players randomly during the game itself. Also in the game there are goal cards that are in the challenge deck (they come to players during the game). After receiving the goal, you put it in front of you next to the class card.
Each turn, one challenge card should be played with a dice roll. If the number that falls out is greater than the number indicated on the challenge card, then the card is played and can be put away in a discard or folded into a set of goal cards.
On each card, there are symbols in the upper left (bonus cards) or right (challenge cards) corner. On the bonus card - a positive or negative bonus. On the challenge card - the number of bonus cards that must be used to draw the card. If there are still not enough points, then life points are taken away from you according to the number of uncovered points (the total number of bonuses and challenges on the table is 8, 5 fell on the cube, 3 life points would be taken away from you).
Players need to collect the complete set indicated on the goal card. After reaching the specified condition, the player receives a random superclass card, loses health points and continues the game. The game ends when all players have fulfilled the conditions indicated on the goal cards (or by agreement).

name: ArchRavels: Rivals
description: Even the world of fiber arts can get a little competitive sometimes. This mini-expansion introduces new rules and components for crafters with slightly sharper knitting needles.

name: ArchRavels: Awards Season
description: Your friends and family love your fiber arts projects, but now it's time to show your work to the wider world. That's right, it's AWARDS SEASON! This mini-expansion for ArchRavels provides the components and rules for solo play. Find out if you have what it takes!
mechanics: Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: ロンデルラミィ (Rondel Rummy)
description:
You are a Venetian jeweler. Make a bracelet with Venetian glass beads known as “rondelles.”

In Rondel Rummy, players compete to make bracelets. Players begin each round by adding beads to either side of their empty metal hoop. Once everyone has a full bracelet, players take turns exchanging with the beads on a metal tray.

In order for a bracelet to be complete, the beads must create a rainbow with every available color or a symmetrical design. When the hoops are closed, players can strategically rotate their beads. After a player completes their bracelet, the other players may each make one more exchange. Points are scored based on the number of colors on a complete bracelet. Rounds are repeated until a player or players score 5 points, winning the game.

The components are tactile and interactive. Bright beads and metal hoops make up the bracelets. Beads are held in a soft bag and displayed on a metal tray. Players keep track of their points using colorful finger rings. The components and engaging rules make for a unique experience.
mechanics: Mancala, Ordering, Pattern Building, Score-and-Reset Game, Set Collection
publishers: natriumlamp games (ナトリウムランプゲームス)

name: Sute Sute Railroading
description:
Sute Sute Railroading includes several methods of play (Simple, Regular, or Advanced), a few variants, and rules for a bonus game. The rules include the designer's typical sense of humor, with tie breaking rules related to how many of the designer's games you own and a prohibition on asking them when a certain one of their designs will finally be released.

The "Simple" rule set seems to be identical to their 2010 release, Sute Sute Marketing.

The "Regular" rules involve playing cards to a network of cards on the table. A player earns money equal to the increase in value of a train's network. The player then draws 2 cards. When the deck is exhausted, scores are calculated. The player with the most cards ("shares") of a company in their hand receives money equal to the company's value (stations); the player with the second most shares takes each share which belonged to to the player with the most shares.

After each company's accounts have been settled, players earn 1 yen for each card they have, and the player with the most money wins.

name: Kingdoms Forlorn: Ten Thousand Succulent Fears Expansion
description: A major Expansion for the Kingdoms Forlorn, this set expands on both Core Game Kingdoms and includes a 2 new sub-Kingdoms, Jura the Stronghold of the Saints, and Knight Campaign with over 50 hours of content.

name: Kingdoms Forlorn: Red Kingdom of Eshin Expansion
description: A major Kingdom expansion for the Kingdoms Forlorn, this set includes a new Kingdom (Red Kingdom of Eshin) and a new Knight Campaign with over 50 hours of content.

name: Kingdoms Forlorn: Barony of Bountiful Harvest Expansion
description: A major Kingdom expansion for the Kingdoms Forlorn, this set includes a new Kingdom (Sunken Kingdom of Utrebant) and a new Knight Campaign with over 50 hours of content.

name: Last Chance Saloon: A Murder Mystery Game
description:
It’s last orders in the only saloon in town, and there’s more to kill than just time!
Will the richest rancher in the Wild West be dead before sundown, or will you be able to save his skin?
The year is 1885 and death will cast its shadow over the quiet town of Ghost Creek unless your sleuthing skills are able to stop it! Inside the Last Chance Saloon, six people nurse their drinks, each lost in thought. A traveling fortune teller decides to stop and quench her thirst. Suddenly, she’s struck with a vision: Avery Rogers – Ghost Creek’s richest man – will be dead by the end of the day, and at the hands of someone in the saloon! Set in the Wild West, this murder mystery will immerse you and your dinner guests in a world of revenge, blackmail and bandits! Will you be able to unravel the clues and motives to pinpoint the would-be murderer, all before coffee is served?

-description from publisher

name: Secrets of the Silver Screen: A Murder Mystery Game
description:
Ruby Bloom is Hollywood’s leading lady. But away from the flashing lights of the paparazzi and her throng of adoring fans, she is a notorious bully, prone to explosive outbursts, vile tantrums and outrageous demands. Ruby is found poisoned in her dressing room on the set of her latest movie. From short-fused director Chuck Demeyer to long-suffering PA Jane Madison, there’s no shortage of people who want Ruby gone; but who finally killed her, and why?
Set in the Golden Age of Hollywood, this immersive murder mystery will see you and your fellow dinner guests become both murder suspects and detectives. Will you be able to unravel the clues, pinpoint the motives and solve the murder before coffee is served?

-description from publisher

name: Chicken Hunter
description:
In Chicken Hunter, players simultaneously reveal cards from their hand, aiming to score points. There are no restrictions on what cards players can reveal (e.g. does not need to be a straight, or x-of-a-kind).

In each round, two hands will be rewarded with points. First, look at the players who revealed the fewest number of cards. This player earns points equal to the number of cards they revealed multiplied by the sum of the face value of these cards. (In the case of a tie, the tied players first discard one card each.)

Then, from the remaining players, look at the player with the lowest face value sum of the cards revealed. This player scores points using the same calculation.

Afterwards, players draw up to 6 cards and repeat the process.

The game lasts until a player achieves a preset threshold and at that point the person with the most points wins.
mechanics: Auction: Sealed Bid, Betting and Bluffing

name: Der strenge Schupo
description: The players take turns to roll and move. They have to get their 4 cars to the parking lot of their color to win the game. Before each turn the traffic police man in the middle of the board is rotated to block one direction of movement.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Square Grid

name: West of Souls
description:
West of Souls is innovative solo or cooperative fantasy adventure for 1-6 players. Enter the world of Eloria, plagued by darkness and monsters of a vitriolic nature. You and your party will explore and make decisions that directly affect the world’s infrastructure and future. The vastly branching storylines and numerous NPCs found in West of Souls ensure unique game play and future replay ability.

Enemy encounters and agonizing choices abound in this game and even the simplest of decisions may alter the world as you know it. Players will take up the mantle of an unlikely hero who, through motives of their own, have decided to stop Eloria’s impending doom. Be it gold, valor, or a deep empathy for the world around them, the players must work together to gain victory over scenarios and continue on their journey.

As players progress through the ever-changing world, they will develop their abilities, gain increasingly effective gear, and unlock additional skills specific to their character. Following each completed scenario, player choices will determine the future direction of the party’s quest, guaranteeing player involvement in the development of their own story.
The game is split into scenarios that are comprised of an exploration and journey phase, and each turn is split into a time of day (morning, mid-day, dusk, night). In the journey phase of the game, characters with travel throughout the game map discovering locations, triggering events, battling monsters, interacting with the world, and talking with NPCs to gain information about their quest and Eloria’s tainted past. Action point-based turns are used within West of Souls. Each player will have a defined number of actions that may be completed on their turn (unless you have unlocked a skill or found some gear that says otherwise). Once enough information has been gathered and players are in the correct location, the exploration phase begins.

One unique aspect of West of Souls is that the exploration phase is a hybrid of non-linear narrative, card-based battle encounters, and dungeon crawling. In addition, all characters in play do not have to enter the same exploration together, allowing for multiple explorations to occur simultaneously. Within the exploration phase, players will be forced to make harrowing choices, complete skill checks, and defeat beast to move forward. Vital story elements, lore, and history will be revealed to the players as they progress through the game.
While death is an option in West of Souls, a player is never permanently removed from the game. The main resources in this epic journey are time and stress. If your team does not accomplish their goal within the allotted time frame, Eloria is cast into ruin. Likewise, if the encounters prove too much for your party and your stress level reaches a breaking point, you will lose the game. Victory is achieved at the end of each scenario as players defeat enemies of increasing difficultly and complete the necessary tasks.
This flagship game from Sky Monster Games is an ambitious story telling odyssey that maximizes the use of battle mechanics in combination with non-linear storytelling and character customization.

-description from designer
categories: Adventure, Dice, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Cooperative Game, Deck Construction, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Push Your Luck, Storytelling, Team-Based Game

name: Wer hat gut gelernt?
description:
The answer cards are evenly dealt among the players, which take turns to roll and move one lone pawn about the game board. When the pawn stops on a space the player reads the question printed on the space. The player who thinks he has the right answer card gives the answer. If the answer is right the player gest a commendation, if not he gets a rebuke. The game ends when the pawn reaches or passes the last space. The player with the most commendations wins the game. But for each rebuke six commendations are substracted

—user summary.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: The God Game
description:
The description on the box says "PLAY GOD!!! Start your own religion! Persecute non-believers! Send followers to heaven! Riotous spoof and FUN for 12 YEARS and older."

It plays like Sorry! with a few twists and turns.

It has a National Lampoon vibe. Adult themes. Irreverent. Edgy.

It was made by the American Publishing Corporation in Waltham, Massachusetts. This famous company no longer exists, but its infamous products live on. They made drug and sex themed board games, puzzles in cans (including Playboy centerfold puzzles), and politically incorrect books about how to fish, how to ski, and how to play golf. For example, one of their games is "LSD Ludicrous Systems Development: A Psychedelic Happening Construction Kit."

—user summary

name: Patty Stack
description:
Whip out the spatulas and get to the grill! In Patty Stack, your goal is to construct the most delicious hamburger. You’ll score points for well-played cards, but be careful – you’ll lose points for any card you can’t play! Build your burger and then eat your hard work to find out how you stack up against the competition. It’s medium rare to find a game this well done.

Patty Stack is a dice-drafting and card placement game. On your turn, you will select a dice from the table and place a patty card on your patty stack that matches your die value. You can never stack two cards next to each other with matching values or matching toppings. You will score points for the cards you successfully stack, and will have a point deducted for cards you are unable to stack successfully. You spend the game stacking your patties, and then "eat your burger" to determine your final score.

-description from designer
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Dice, Print & Play
mechanics: Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Open Drafting, Pattern Building

name: Soll + Haben mit Schlau & Lau
description:
Both players get the same starting capital and agree on a fixed playing time. Each player gets one meeple and both start at the same starting space. Movement is like a rock in chess, any number of spaces in any orthogonal direction. Each space allows for a business transaction and the players use double entry bookkeeping to manage the ballace of their business portfolio.
At the end of the game the player with the highest profit wins the game.

The game was most likely published in the early 60s.

name: Escape the Lich King
description:
Escape the Lich King is a cooperative 20 card game of Dungeon escape through discovery and attack. A party of three stalwart adventures have overestimated their worth while exploring the nearest dungeon and find themselves desperate to escape alive.

Pursued by hordes of monsters and the Big Boss, the party must find their lost weapons while fending off the horde. To escape the dungeon, they must each find one of three potions that will help teleport them out of the dungeon. If enough monsters set on the trail of the party, they notify the Big Boss who moves in for the final attack to stop them from escaping.

If the party can fend off the monsters while fleeing the dungeon and all drink the three potions together, they can escape the dungeon with their lives.

Player Win conditions:
The three players win if they each have a character card, a matching weapon card and a potion card showing. Then all three players will drink from their potions during the Cleanup Phase to teleport out of the dungeon and win the game.

Big Boss win conditions:
If the total value of all revealed monsters is greater than 10 at the end of the Battle Phase, the players lose and the Big Boss player wins.

-description from designer
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Cooperative Game, Hand Management

name: Crossbars
description:
A combinatorial abstract strategy game played on a square grid.

Players alternate placing stones on empty spaces.

Capture diagonally sandwiched enemy stones (custodian capture), flipping them to your color.

After the board is full, whoever has the longest straight "bar" in their color - horizontal for white, vertical for black - wins. Ties cascade to second longest, third longest, etc.

name: A Game of Thrones: The Card Game – Ice and Fire Draft Starter
description:
All cards in this Draft Starter have a set symbol designating it as part of this Draft Starter; a white snowflake imposed over a red sun. All draft card sets are manufactured through Fantasy Flight Games's in-house print-on-demand method, and are packaged in a clear plastic clamshell.

From Fantasy Flight Games's item description page:

"The Ice & Fire Draft Starter features 22 fixed cards that serve as the foundations for your Ice & Fire draft decks. An essential mix of House cards, locations, and plot cards accompany rules for draft play and a “draft only” agenda. The Ice & Fire Draft Starter is made available to you via Fantasy Flight Games in-house manufacturing, and you may reuse the contents of your Ice & Fire Draft Starter through any number of Ice & Fire draft events."

Note that the total card count is 25 cards; 19 game cards, 3 double-sided house cards (one house on each side), and three rules and draft information cards.

To play, each player involved must have one Draft Starter AND its matching Draft Pack. I will add the Draft Pack and the second Draft Starter and Draft Pack if this item is entered into the database.
mechanics: Closed Drafting, Deck Construction, Hand Management, Negotiation, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: A New Frontier
description:
Take control of one of six unique Corporations and vie for dominance in the Alpha System by utilizing a mix of different actions and resources. Focus on building up your infrastructure and set yourself up for a strong finish or go for fast and immediate rewards. Use your Influence in the council chamber to make sure things progress according to your wishes, or resort to outright aggression to dominate the competition.

A New Frontier is a highly engaging conflict game where your ability to gauge your opponents is key to victory. Since players can interact with all other players, regardless of position, conflicts are plentiful, but also quite undramatic. There is no player elimination, and you also cannot “gang-up” on someone, at least not from a conflict perspective. Conflicts are multi-phased, with ample opportunity to outsmart your opponents.

A New Frontier has nearly no hidden info (the obvious exception being player fleets) and few random elements, and with only 5 turns every decision counts. The goal of the game is to become the most dominant Corporate Republic in the Alpha System, which is achieved by having the most Victory Points by game’s end. All types of actions can potentially lead to Victory Points allowing for multi-pronged strategies. In addition to Actions and Credits, players must balance Prestige, which represents their organization’s goodwill and reputation, and that is essential for certain aspects of the game.

The game is centered around four ore-rich planets, with each player being present at every planet. This is where players harvest ore for income, build ships and upgrade mines, as well as carry out attacks against each other. In addition, there are four support areas/phases (Exploration, Politics, Marketing and R & D), where players can choose to diversify in order to gain advantages and Victory Points. Each Turn starts with a Planning Phase where players hiddenly set their strategic plan for the whole turn by using the resources at their disposal. Players then make tactical decisions during each Action Phase within the framework of their strategic plan.

Depending on chosen strategy, a player will normally amass between 30-60% of their Victory Points during the game, and the rest during end game scoring.
mechanics: Action Points, Auction: Sealed Bid, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Delayed Purchase, Secret Unit Deployment, Simultaneous Action Selection, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks, Variable Player Powers

name: Travels in the Land of Glyph
description:
This game uses the Glyph deck to simulate a story-telling, problem-solving experience with simple matching mechanics.

During gameplay, the player will resolve obstacles by matching them with cards that share the same minor suits and that make narrative sense. Items will be picked up and placed in an inventory; characters can be befriended and join the player for a while.

An attempt to recreate the feel of a classic computer graphic adventure game using only cards, relying on your imagination to do most of the work. Also see Quest for the MacGlyphin for a more game-y, goal-oriented approach at a similar goal.

—description from the designer

name: Kringa
description:
This is based on a true story: for 16 years, the town of Kringa has been terrorized by an evil Strigoi named Jure Grando. While the families struggle to survive day-to-day, they must gather the courage and tools to defeat the undead fiend!

Kringa is a cooperative horror worker-placement game with a strong push-your-luck component.

Players start with a family of four workers - each with unique abilities. Assign workers to locations to collect resources. Use resources to craft helpful items, hire helpers and overcome dangers. As dusk descends, you can choose to risk danger and stay to gather more resources, or return home to feed and protect your family with blessings and hexes.

As night falls, Grando stalks Kringa. If Grando stops at a location or home, unprotected workers will fall sick or even placed in the village's crypt. If the crypt fills up, the players lose.

Players have a limited time to discover how to destroy Grando by fulfilling the secret holder's objectives. Once a secret is discovered, you will learn one of Grando's weaknesses. Ready the weapons and set up a trap to lure Grando in. If you manage to successfully spring the trap and defeat the evil Strigoi, you win! If you fail, you doom Kringa to a fate worse than death!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Finale Ending, Push Your Luck, Solo / Solitaire Game, Sudden Death Ending, Turn Order: Claim Action, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: Otter Creek
description:
In this simple memory, matching game for very small children, you are a baby Otter, trying to eat as many delicious treats as you can as you swim home to Momma Otter.

Race up the creek, looking for tasty treats. Find a pair and SPLASH! you move towards Momma!

The player with the most pairs of treats, at the end of the game, wins!

—description from the designer

name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar (Third Edition): Chaos Battletome – Skaven
description:
For centuries beyond counting has the race of malevolent ratmen known as the skaven plagued the Mortal Realms. Arrogant, avaricious and utterly without mercy, the skaven seek to annihilate every other sapient creature – expanding, multiplying, and consuming everything in their path until they alone rule over the decaying husk of reality. Those who defy this vision are overwhelmed by swarms of frenzied, red-eyed warriors, weaponized plagues, monstrous beasts and lightning-spitting war machines. Arise, Children of the Great Horned Rat!

Within these pages you'll find everything you need to know to command verminous Skaven hordes in your games of Warhammer Age of Sigmar. Pore over the treacherous history of the Horned Rat's many attempts to conquer the Mortal Realms, learn about the internecine squabbling of the various Great Clans, and delve into the gnawhole-riddled depths of their teeming Under-Empire.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Vac Tour
description:
Vac Tour is an Australian promotional board game for the Vacuum Oil Company that was established in Australia in 1895. The game was a supplement to Vacuum Country Journal.

A simple roll of the dice and move game that sees players move cardboard cars through rural Australia that have kangaroos and Emus among Vacuum Oil depots and signage. Players cannot overtake on any curved roads.

Fist to reach the finish square 100 by exact throw is the winner.

—user summary
publishers: Vacuum Motor Oil Company Pty Ltd

name: Team de Torite
description:
Team de Torite is a team-base trick taking game for 4, 5, or 6 players. Much of the game resembles a must-follow, no-trump, partnership game with bidding for the number of tricks a team will win. However, the game has a few twists.

In addition to a base of 4 suits, the game includes a fifth "special" suit of cards which constitute the trump cards and the lowest value card. Trump cards of the same value will cancel each other in a trick if present in even numbers, leaving the last one played to win a trick if an odd number are played.

The teams place their bets on a board where if one team bids a high number, the other team will be limited from bidding a specific low number. Additionally, each of the values a team can bid has a multiplier for how it will pay out, and the teams are placing chips face down on the different spaces, giving a different weight to their confidence in each of their bets.

The team with the most points when one team reaches 150 points wins.

name: Indoor Tennis
description:
Indoor Tennis is an interesting mix of darts and the game of tennis. Produced in Australia during the War years, the game sees two players standing either end of a miniature tennis court holding bomb shaped darts ready to throw towards each other.

The court is similar to traditional tennis courts with each side having 3 sections, with a larger "Center Court" and two smaller "Left and Right Service boxes", close to the net.

A player (the server) throws their bomb shaped dart into the others court. If successful the other player (receiver) returns a dart. If the receivers dart lands in the opponents same boxed area they win the point. I.e. Server throws dart into Left Service box of receiver. Receiver then successfully throws their dart into left service box of Server. If the receiver is unsuccessful the point goes to the server.

The game follows the scoring of traditional tennis i.e 15:30, deuce and faults. Play is stopped after an agreed time with the winner winning the most games.

—user summary

name: Die Eroberung Des Weltraums
description:
Die Eroberung Des Weltraums is a roll and move space race from the earth to the moon.

Large plastic astronauts lift off and go into earth orbit before crossing space and going into a moon orbit. A player lands on the moon and then returns to Earth. First player to successfully land on the moon and return is the winner.

—user summary

name: Pixel Planes
description:
As colonels of the Pixel Planes Squadron, you must direct all of your planes into formation as quickly as you can.

Demonstrate your superior leadership in this fast and furious game. Planes are all over the place, so try to keep your head!

In this 3-6 player, real-time game, players can play a card that matches the plane type or colour or both. They just can't play two cards in a row. Be the first player to get rid of all of the cards in your hand to win the round.
Win five rounds to win the game!

One game takes roughly 10-20 minutes to play. It is recommended to have a pencil and paper handy to keep track of who wins each round.

Components: 50 cards, and an instruction booklet housed in a 54 card tuck box.

-description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Card Game, Children's Game, Real-time
mechanics: Matching, Pattern Recognition, Real-Time, Score-and-Reset Game, Speed Matching

name: Mystic Hollow Painters
description:
Welcome to Mystic Hollow!

It’s time to freshen up the village by giving the mushroom houses a fresh coat of paint. On a player's turn they must play a paint card, rest, or rush (playing two paint cards). The card they play must be added to the matching neighbourhood. Finish painting a neighbourhood first to score. You get more points for using the same colour paint multiple times.

The first player to 7 points wins the game!

Components: 4 Location Cards, 4 Character Cards, 60 Paint Cards, and an instruction booklet housed in a 72 card tuck box.

-description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Matching, Set Collection, Turn Order: Progressive, Variable Player Powers

name: Big Time Curling
description:
Curling is a winter team sport popular in Canada and other “snowy” countries. Competitors throw 44-pound granite stones (or "rocks") down an ice sheet into a bulls-eye target area (the “house”) at either end of the 155 foot playing surface. Teammates often furiously sweep the ice with brooms to affect a thrown rock’s speed or trajectory. This is a finesse sport.

In Big Time Curling two players each hold an 8-card hand composed of three types of cards: Guards, Draws and Takeouts. Guards are blocking stones that make it harder to throw (or "draw") a stone into the bulls-eye ("house") or remove ("takeout") one. After all 16 cards have been played a round ("end") is completed. The stone closest to the center of the house determines the winner of the “end”.

The winning team scores a point for each rock closer to the center than the opponents’ best rock -- while the opposing team doesn’t score at all!

All cards are reshuffled and a new round is played. After ten rounds the game is complete. The player with the higher score wins.

-description from designer

name: Murder Show
description:
The Crime has already been committed. Now you have to match the case you need for your Murder Show! Players make up a ridiculous Murder Show and hope that the Investigator has a matching case. Players give the Culprit, Victim, Weapon, and Place in this certifiable Party Game!

Each turn players will draw four square cards and choose only one side of each card (Culprit, Victim, Weapon and Place) to build their "Murder Show". If their Murder Show best matches one of the two "Case" files the Investigator has, they will win the Case as a point! The first to 5 Cases wins (or do they).

-description from publisher

name: Mallow Mayhem
description:
Chaos has broken out at the campsite! Critters have crashed the s'mores party and they are just the cutest! Roll dice to "fling" Mallows at Critters trying to match what types of Mallows they may like at the right time of day and Tame them! Earn points if it is a Mallow the Critter happens to Love or Like!

Over 5 rounds players will take turns using Mallow cards to try and tame the Critters that are in the Row of Critters. Gain points at the end of the game for critters in your Love and Like score zones; however, be careful as Critters in your Shoo zone will subtract points! Highest score at the end of five rounds wins.

-description from publisher

name: Bible Astronomy Game
description:
Bible Astronomy is a card game where there are 16 sets of Astral bodies to collect, such as the sun, planets, star facts and constellations. Each set (or book) is 4 cards. There are also premium cards with Biblical quotes and astronomical facts.

Cards are dealt out and books are called for like the game of Authors. Some books are worth more than others, i.e Sun and Earth are worth 20 points, while other books are worth 10 points. Premium cards when drawn are worth 5 points. Extra points are gained by either Biblical matches such as the Star of Bethlehem card and earth card or if holding the moon, earth and sun books, a player calls out "eclipse passed" to score 60 points.

Whoever has the largest number of points at a predetermined time is called the winner

—description from the publisher

name: Quest for the MacGlyphin
description:
This game uses the Glyph deck to provide a path placement "quest" type of storytelling experience, with critical decisions being taken narratively and relying on the player's discretion rather than fixed mechanics.

During gameplay, the player will create a path from a starting card to an ending card, following simple path placement rules. Every new path carries with it a situation where the player must intervene in some way by matching minor suits from their reserve piles; the details and outcome are decided entirely at the player's discretion. Some cards will be discarded out of the game, while others will join the player's reserve for future use.

A companion piece to Travels in the Land of Glyph, and an attempt to use the same storytelling mechanics in a more game-y fashion, goal-oriented.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Matching, Solo / Solitaire Game, Storytelling

name: Des Herrn Fix von Bickenbach Reise um die Welt in 77 Tagen
description:
The players take turns to roll and move. The first player to reach space 77 wins the game. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

The game was made about 1880 from Dr. Hoffmann for his grandchildren. It was published 1985 by the Struwwelpeter-Museum with the financial help of "Nordmark Arzneimittel GmbH".
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Robinsons Reise und Abenteuer
description: The players take turns to roll and move. On some Spaces events hinder or benefit the players. The first player to reach space "U" wins the game.The rules are printed on the game board.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Western Twilight
description:
The empires of Europe have been expanding their influence across the world throughout the 1800s. They have fought countless petty wars that have spurred their military and economic growth. Their influence and conflicts extend around the globe, and the aristocracy have no wish to see it end...but change is coming. Great alliances are forming, and the nations of Europe are consolidating their power for the final struggle. Will one nation's imperialist dreams raise them up as the world's sole power, will the world leaders form a great League of Nations to end all wars, or will the century old rivalries pull the world into the most horrific war ever seen?

As the leader of one of the five great powers in Europe, you will compete to spread and protect your influence around the globe using military, economic, and diplomatic might. Use the press to sway public opinion to force nations into alliances or war, and upgrade your empire's capabilities by establishing control over important regions of the world. You must be careful, though, because the world is on the brink of all-out war and it could spell the end of the West's dominance.

In Western Twilight, you will perform actions using your personal rondel, with opportunities to upgrade it with enhanced and new abilities for a unique engine-building experience. Compete with the other nations of Europe for control of territories around the world by competitively drafting cards to place your nation's military, economic, or diplomatic influence markers. You must be cautious because every action you take can bring the world one step closer to the war to end all wars.

Western Twilight can end in three ways: diplomatically, economically, or militarily. Each ending will change how your different influence markers will score, so you must steer the world down the path you are most prepared to win, whether that be peace or war.

—description from publisher
mechanics: Action/Event, Area Majority / Influence, Rondel, Set Collection

name: 暗战三国 (Three Kingdoms In The Dark)
description:
暗战三国 ("Three Kingdoms In The Dark") is a card game based on the Chinese classical novel, Romance of the Three Kingdoms.
The object of this game is to find and defeat the group of opponents by talking, voting and using card abilities. It refers to two classic game ‘Legends of The Three Kingdoms’ and ‘The Werewolves of Miller's Hollow.’
The game flow is similar as Werewovers. The phases are divided into Day and Night. The players close their eyes and wake up separately to use ability in the Night. They start talking in sequence in the Day and using card ability. They vote together after everyone finishes speaking in sequence.
The difference is:

Each player can hold 2 characters’ cards, one character card is primary identity and another one is vice identity.
Each player has 2 health points in the beginning.
The player can disclose only one character card in the Day in the whole game and use that ability.
There are 3 roles in the games: the Ambitiousness, the Royal and the Civilian. There are two groups. One group is the Ambitiousness, another group is the Royal and the Civilian. There are four kingdoms: WEI, SHU, WU and QUN.
In the Night, the Ambitiousness launch two night attack which will damage totally 2 health points on one or two players.


—description from the designer
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Murder/Mystery, Party Game
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Command Cards, Cooperative Game, Role Playing, Team-Based Game, Voting

name: Chronological
description:
Chronological is a historical, educational, trivia game where players place the concepts depicted on Tech Deck cards chronologically and name inventor & invention information on the card.

OBJECTIVE – Players place concepts shown on Tech Deck cards chronologically in place and name inventor & invention information on the cards.
GAME PLAY – Each turn, one player reads the concept title of a Tech Deck card. A player must name inventor & invention information on the card. Then, the player places the card where they think it should fit chronologically in a timeline formed by other cards already in play.
MODES OF PLAY - 
Cooperative play – In cooperative play, all the players get to name and contribute their knowledge in naming the inventor & invention about the card. They collectively discuss where the card should be placed and where they think the card should fit chronologically into the timeline.
Competitive Play – In competitive play, the active player score points based on how much information they got correct on a card.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Educational, Party Game, Trivia

name: Merchant Rhodes
description:
In this set collecting card game, players assume the role of merchants from different civilizations competing with each other in a great market. You must buy your opponents goods and sell your own to collect the cards you need, all the while trying not to give the other players too much of an advantage. Each player uses different currency, only one of which has value in their homeland. Players must strategize the best trades in order to end the game with the most sets of identical item cards.

—description from the designer
categories: Ancient, Card Game, Economic, Educational, Negotiation

name: Forbidden Psalm: A Dead Festival
description:
Can your warband survive A Dead Festival? A Forbidden Psalm mini-expansion for the spookiest of months. Battle a scorned lover, a thing from another planet, and the long dead. Solo play, co-op, and much more in this deadly addition to the world's best miniatures game*. A miniatures game expansion of death, zombies, things from space, and evil trees. Based on and compatible with MÖRK BORG.


according to the author's 8-year old.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Forbidden Psalm: Dungeons & Death
description:
In the dark corners of an inn called Discord, tall tales of horrific places were told: caves made from the skulls of giants, statues to long-dead gods, and a pie shop where the meat is indeed murder.

Do you dare plunder the depths of such wicked places?

In Dungeons & Death you will find:


Three Scenarios created from fantastic terrain by the Forbidden Psalm Community.
Rules for exploring dungeons.


—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Tarax World Champion Cricket Game
description:
Tarax World Champion Cricket is a game produced by the Australian soft drink company called Tarax.

The game is played with 2 players with a fielding team and a batting that play for 8 overs (8 balls per over) in total.

The bowling and batting teams are each dealt 8 cards per over. The cards are coloured which have to be matched to coloured sections of the playing field. The batting team must match the colours from the bowling team and can score runs over the 4 overs. After 4 overs the teams swap. The winner is the team that has scored to most runs after their 4 overs.

—user summary
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Relative Movement

name: Fantastic Women
description:
Play the game. Change the game.
Make sure your kids know who paved the way for women while playing this fun and engaging trump card game!

Discover some of the bravest and most inspirational women out there with these stunning portraits by Daniela Henríquez.

Compare notes on 32 of the most courageous women ever, from Malala Yousafzai and Rosa Parks to Marie Curie and Amelia Earhart. Get ready to inspire the next generation of changemakers and groundbreakers while playing this fun and informative game!

name: Dick Tracy Detective Game
description:
Dick Tracy Detective Game is a simple spin-and-move race game, published by Einson-Freeman as part of their "Funland" brand.

As players advance around a board picturing the east coast of the United States, a comic book-style story unfolds, telling how Dick Tracy foils a swindle by his enemy, the Stooge. Landing on black spaces, with special instructions, either advances or sends each players back. The first player to reach the finish line and arrest the Stooge is the winner.

The E-F editions included a spinner and four player counters, depicting Dick Tracy (red), Chief Brandon (yellow), the Stooge (blue), and Junior (green).

—user summary
publishers: Einson Freeman Pub. Corp., John Sands Pty Ltd

name: Halloween Adventure
description: An exciting new Halloween-themed adventure. 18 new, Halloween-themed creatures and encounter cards for the Adventure Builder game.

name: めぐるめぐみ (Meguru Megumi)
description:
In this co-operative game, players play cards to circulate water. They discuss with each other in order to prevent sewage from overflowing or running out of water, and treat the sewage so that it can be returned to nature and used again.

—user summary

Meguru Megumi is a board game where you can enjoy learning about the mechanism of the water cycle and the importance of water resources.
It is used not only for playing at home, but also for elementary school classes and training for companies and local governments.

For those who are playing the game
When you don't get it right, think "Why didn't it work?" and discuss it to make the game more enjoyable and deepen your understanding of the water cycle.

The game has been developed by the Japanese "Carrying Water Project" and 66 ［ロクロク］ / "66 RokuRoku Games". It has been published in cooperation with Kansei Kogyo Co., Ltd. and the Japanese "Pipeline Management Research Institute".

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: Word Trap
description: A word game whose object is to form words of specified lengths, built around two-letter combinations. The game is a spiral book of sheets; each player has a sheet to fill in, so any number can play simultaneously.

name: Kiribati
description:
The wonderful island of Kiribati, like many islands in the Pacific, is threatened by climate change.
In the foreseeable future, Kiribati will be washed over by rising sea levels and sink.
People can be evacuated by ships and boats - but what about the animals?
Fortunately, numerous turtles swim from west to east between Kiribati and the rescuing mainland, and Kiribati's animals can save themselves by jumping from turtle to turtle.
But beware. Turtles have their own ideas. They may well swim deeper, or submerge completely. This makes the space on their shells smaller and smaller until it disappears completely.

Kiribati is a small tactical game. The goal is to move all his animals to the mainland. The first to do this wins the game. The game ends immediately.

Each Player try to be the first reaching the mainland with all your 5 animals by using dice and action cards.

Kiribati can be played in three variants (children, family, professional).

Each round the player rolls two dice. The number of dice decides where and whether the player may insert a new turtle or let it swim further, or whether a turtle rises or dives. Next, the player may place one of his animals from the island on a turtle. The player's third action is to move all of his animals one turtle further. Each animal (kagu, rabbit, coala, lizard, monkey) has its own properties for movement.
Additionally, the player may play an action card and annoy teammates or defend himself to other teammates.

In the professional variant, events can occur at the beginning of each round. The professional variant is played with victory points.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Take That

name: The School Escape
description:
You and your friends hate your boarding school, but only one can escape. Return all your items so your backpack can fit through the vents and don't get caught by Ms. Crawford or there will be consequences. Explore the school to find shortcuts and rooms to return your items. Sabotage your friends, or now known as enemies. Risk it all or you might just stay in school.

You can either explore, move, return items or escape through the vents. When someone explores the staff room, Ms. Crawford emerges. If she catches you, she will give an item causing you to be 1 step further from victory.

This game was made by a 14 year old with a passion of board games. It took him a total of 5 months to make. He got the idea while eating some mushroom soup. His biggest obstacle making this game was the art and the photoshop since he never used any of them. He hopes that you will love his game and has a goal to make sure every single person on the planet loves board game.

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Children's Game, Fighting, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Events, Grid Movement, Lose a Turn, Modular Board, Movement Points, Multi-Use Cards, Race, Take That, Tile Placement

name: 99 Rules
description:
The king has once again proclaimed the mastery of the king's guard. Adventurers flock from across the country to take part in the championship. Not only does the winner of the Championship earn glory and honor by serving in the King's Guard, he can change the rules of the Championship forever.
Only masters in the melee, ranged-attack, and magic classes have a chance to be victorious.
Will you triumph?

First Rules are:
Play a card
Draw a card

But after each stage, new rules and actions are added that make the game more exciting.
Sometimes the rules are only in play for a short time and are then replaced by another rule.
Action guaranteed!
The best thing is: You determine the rules and actions that come into play.
In the Book of Winners there are far more than 100 rules and actions. But less than half of them find their way into the game.

—description from the designer

name: Cult of Dionysus
description:
Cult of Dionysus is a truth or dare style party game of strategy, skill, and chance, in the form of a classical sculpture called a herm (a 4-sided column with a bust on top). The column is made of 72 6-inch wooden blocks, each featuring a unique ancient Greek name and corresponding prompt infused with history and mythology. Players take turns pulling blocks, doing what they say, taking penalties, and trying not to topple the bust of Dionysus. After each topple, the herm is rebuilt from the rubble and gameplay continues until no blocks remain. The player with the fewest penalties at the end wins. Each game lasts 1-3 hours.

—description from the designer
categories: Action / Dexterity, Educational, Mature / Adult, Mythology, Party Game
mechanics: Acting, Communication Limits, Memory, Physical Removal, Stacking and Balancing

name: THE 仮想通貨 (THE Cryptocurrency)
description:
Increase your assets by buying and selling while predicting the ups and downs of the values of 6 types of cryptocurrencies!
Will you be a "billionaire" who earns 100 million or a "melter" who goes bankrupt?
You can learn about the concept of cryptocurrency while playing!

name: Black Coin
description:
Black Coin is a an auction game about collecting the most assets. Each round players participate in two sets of auctions.

In the first auction, a set of cards is revealed face up. In turn order, players point at the cards they want, and in reverse turn order, they either withdraw from the auction, or bid with face down coins.

Any players that withdrew from the card auction then participate in a second auction for the coins that other players bid in the first auction of the round.

There is a special coin token which allows a player to automatically win any auction they are involved in. However, if when refilling the card market a police card is revealed, they conduct an inspection and any player caught holding the black coin must discard a certain number of card they had won.

The game ends when a certain number of police cards have been revealed, and the person with the most points wins.
mechanics: Auction: Sealed Bid, Push Your Luck

name: Forgotten Willows
description:
The Realms of the Willows has been at peace since the Great War. That is until now... The evil wizard Alzod has returned to claim the Realms by casting a spell of Shadow Dragons upon all the lands. Alzod has trapped all of the Realm Leaders and the beauty of the Willows has been forgotten. Only the Fairies of the Willows have the power to see beyond his Dark Magic. Together the Fairies must find and use the magical power of Realm Artifacts to free the Leaders and defeat the wizard.

Forgotten Willows is an action selection game for 2-4 players ages 12+ to save the Realms of the Willows. As well as a battle among the Fairies to be the best. On your turn you may perform 2 of 4 actions. At the end of the game, you will receive points for Freed Leaders, Collected Dark Magic, and Defeated Shadow Dragons. The Fairy with highest total is the winner.

—description from the designer

name: Weather Report
description:
In this game, God decides the weather on a whim. Let's guess the weather for 5 days by asking God questions that can be answered with "Yes" or "No”.

Weather Report is a deduction/20 questions style game where the goal is to guess what the weather will be for the week. One player plays God and secretly decides 5 days worth of weather, the weather forecasters can ask 10 questions to deduce what the week’s weather will look like. You can play in 4 modes: God vs 1, God vs team, God vs many, and Perfect Weather.

Perfect weather is slightly different, with only 8 questions given but with 7 of the weather tiles that were not used revealed.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Questions and Answers, Team-Based Game

name: Batman Henchmen
description: Joker is recruiting Henchmen to help him pull off a series of money heists across Gotham and you’ve been selected! Play as a team to complete the crimes, but if you play smart you’ll end up with the best loot and send the other Henchmen looking for a new job! First Henchman to reach $1M wins.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Pluzzables: Muskoka
description:
Pluzzables are “playable puzzles” - a collection of puzzles you play as games after assembly. Additionally, several web apps come with the game for simpler "match and claim" or discovery games.

The Muskoka edition is a puzzle of the 1949 vintage Imperial Oil Road Map of Muskoka, Ontario (Canada's famous cottage country). After assembly, the puzzle becomes a board game where players use web apps to play "What's Missing Muskoka" and "Claim to Fame".

"What's Missing Muskoka" is a competitive game that tests players visual skills in finding locations on the map that match the image displayed and determining what is missing from the image. One image and six possible answers are displayed. Pick the right answer garners one point. Pick the wrong answer and they lose three points.

In "Claim to Fame", players work fast to claim territory. The first player to claim three or four adjacent locations is the winner.

These are games of speed and skill.

As a bonus, kids learn about Muskoka.

—description from the designer

name: Citywide Delivery: Muskoka
description:
Citywide Delivery: Muskoka is one of a series of city- and region-centric delivery-type games.

Today is curbside pickup day and your fellow neighbours are eager to share unwanted items. As a local resident, you get to pick up random secret gifts and deliver them to secret locations around your town while delaying your neighbour’s deliveries. Watch out for “porch pirates” and opponents trying to thwart your progress.

The pizza add-on optionally lets players deliver pizzas to secret locations, but first having to locally source the ingredients.

After placing secret items across Muskoka, players get pickup and delivery cards. They use trucks to collect items and deliver them to gain points. The winner will have delivered the most items at the end of a predetermined time period like one hour.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action/Event, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Worker Placement

name: Bundle Bugs
description:
Players take turns playing cards into their tableau to match card patterns chosen during game set up. Players must also play cards into their opponents tableau during the game.

Each of the 6 card types, represented by beautiful original oil paintings, has a unique ability.

Play your cards carefully to keep your scoring opportunities plentiful but try to avoid helping your opponent!

Comes in a small box and is quick to set up, play, and pack up.

—description from the designer

name: Manöver Spiel
description:
Each player has 15 soldiers, 4 tanks, 2 planes and 1 commander. The commander is placed into the capital city (marked with a flag). The other units are placed anywhere within the first 4 rows in front of each player. The different units move and capture in different ways. Spaces marked with a square may not be entered and spaces marked with a "x" are obstacles. Units standing on obstacles may not capture other units.

The goal of the game is to take the capital of the opposite player or to capture all his units.

There are simplified rules for younger children.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Square Grid, Static Capture

name: Skeletons
description:
"A tame
little game
about the contents
of our closets."

Skeletons is a social party game that gradually coaxes some non-invasive secrets out of the players, and ultimately reveals that we all possess a membership card in the brotherhood and sisterhood of similar embarrassments.

You'll combine cards to form a sentence in order to investigate your friends, then collect points for each “skeleton” you find in the collective closet.


Separate the green deck and the red deck (they have the same colored back) and place them face-down. All players draw 4 cards from each deck.
The player who owns the game goes first. On your turn, choose a green card and a red card from your hand, so the words at the bottom form a sentence (the skeleton). Read the skeleton aloud.
All players (including you!) discard one of their cards face-down in the center of the table, forming a loose pile – the closet. They place a green card (“Shhh”) if the skeleton is true for them. Place a red card (“Nope”) if it is not true for them. Be honest in your choice; the answers are anonymous. After placing a card, draw back up to 8.
When all players have put a card into the closet pile, loosely shuffle it face-down. Dramatically re-read your skeleton sentence and then one-by-one reveal the cards from the closet, saying “Shhh” or “Nope” as appropriate. Only the color of the cards in the closet matters for scoring, not the text at the bottom.
You score a point for each green card in the closet pile and place them in front of you as spoils. (If ALL the cards in the closet are green, you get NO points and they are placed face-down at the bottom of the green deck.) The red cards in the pile are placed face-down underneath the red deck; each of those fails to give you points.
Turns proceed clockwise and the game ends when players have no more secrets left to reveal. The players with the most scored points are the best at snooping out skeletons, and should be regarded with caution.


—description from the publisher

name: Szilaj: A titkos küldetés – Butch LePray
description:
This is a promo card for the base game, published in issue 100 of JEM ("Magazine of Players").
At the end of the game you get 1 point/horse cards in the inventory of other players.
categories: American West, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Dorasure Mincas: Another World Trio De Undeads
description:
Adventurers are not the only ones who take on the mighty dragons.
Somewhere in the world, or perhaps someone from another world may be taking on the dragon today, unnoticed.
This is a story of a slightly different kind of adventure.

強大な魔獣ドラゴンに挑むのは、冒険者たちだけではありません。
世界のどこか、はたまた別の世界からやってきた誰かが、今日も人知れずドラゴンに挑んでいるかもしれないのです。
これはそんな、いつもと少しだけ違う冒険のお話。
categories: Adventure, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Dr. 野口っち トリテ (Dr. Noguchi Trite)
description:
In Dr. 野口っち トリテ (Dr. Noguchi Trite), the players are apprentice virus researchers and while their boss, Dr. Noguchi, is away on holiday, it is up to the three researchers to save the world - through trick-taking!

It is a may-follow, cooperative, trick-taking game for exactly 3 players. The game uses a deck of 4 suits of cards, with 1 suit for each of the research areas the players will be pursuing, and 1 for the virus.

Each player is assigned a role and will only be able to cure one of the types of viruses. Each virus has a different mechanism for how it can be researched/weakened, and how it will be cured.

For instance, the red virus is weakened when the player in charge of the red researcher leads a trick with the red 1, 2, or 3, and wins the trick. Later, if the red researcher can win a trick where they lead the red 4, and the sum of the three cards played to the trick are greater than the virus' strength at the time, then the red virus is cured.

The players win if they can cure the three viruses. They lose if they have not cured the three viruses at the end of the third hand.
publishers: るりるりゲームズ (ruri ruri games)

name: The Fifteen ( ザ・フィフティーン)
description:
The Fifteen is a TRPG game in which players have 15 minutes to explore a locked room, find clues, solve a mystery and escape from a closed space. Otherwise, a cruel fate awaits them.

The time limit to collapse is 15 minutes. Here comes an escape TRPG that starts from an extreme situation.

—description from the publisher (translated)

手軽に、それでいて本格的にホラーTRPGが楽しめる『The FIFTEEN』(ザ・フィフティーン)。
プレイヤーに許された時間は15分。
プレイヤーは密室を探索し手がかりを見つけ、
謎を解き明かし閉鎖空間から脱出しなければならない。
さもなくば、待っているのは残酷な運命――。

崩壊までのタイムリミットは15分。
極限状態から始まる脱出系TRPGがここに登場。

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Dice Rolling, Real-Time

name: Grim Reaper (グリムリーパー )
description:
The game has been revised and expanded for the Japanese edition.

The theme changes to a fantasy world, and each player takes on the role of a sorcerer who hunts demons that haunt the kingdom. The player who collects the most monster parts wins the game.

The game is now played on cards, so the order and composition of the areas change each time, requiring a different strategy each time.

テーマがファンタジー世界に変わり、各プレイヤーは魔術師となって王国に出没する魔物を狩る役目となります。倒した魔物の部位を城に持ち込む事で、国王から報償金を得ることができ、これを最も集めたプレイヤーが勝利します。

エリアの種類が増え、カードに変わったので、並び方や構成が毎回変化するようになったため、毎回異なる戦略が必要になります。

name: Witch Hunt 1649: The Dregs of Days
description:
'We are come to the dregs of days, where it is counted virtue to point out the imperfections of our brethren'. -Zachary Boyd, 1629

Scotland, 1649. The last decade has seen bouts of warfare, outbreaks of plague and seismic political upheaval. The religious authorities are keen to stamp down on sinful behaviour, and witch trials are gathering pace…

In The Dregs of Days, players take on the role of neighbours in an East Lothian village. Players are allied in pairs, so gameplay blends competition and cooperation.* The aim is to develop your holding (home) by buying assets from a shared pool. Let your welfare or reputation drop too low, or get convicted of witchcraft, and it's game over!

Fate cards give players scenarios to navigate, while assets can be used defensively or to attack other players. Optional Story cards offer additional historical context, and each game will feature at least one witch trial, in which accused players try to defend themselves against damning allegations. Gameplay is straightforward while still being moderately strategic. Be prepared for unruly livestock, belligerent neighbours and tales of Satanic orgies, brought to life through colourful quotations from historical records.

Produced by a team at the University of Warwick, Witch Hunt 1649 comprises two fun and educational games. The aim is to provide a sensitive, non-sensationalised exploration of the witch hunts, promoting understanding of the historical backdrop and empathy for victims. The games are available for sale or free download/online play. All proceeds are donated to charity.

Alliances do not feature in 2-player games, and are optional in 3-player games. In games with an odd number of players, one player will be unallied.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Educational, Party Game, Renaissance
mechanics: Alliances, Events, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Open Drafting, Player Elimination, Team-Based Game

name: Witch Hunt 1649: Lying Lips
description:
'woe be to seditious tale-tellers, to lying lips ... It is upon such wicked instruments that the great God hath promised to rain fire and brimstone'. -Simon Grahame, 1609

Scotland, 1649. The last decade has seen bouts of warfare, outbreaks of plague and seismic political upheaval. The religious authorities are keen to stamp down on sinful behaviour, and witch trials are gathering pace…

Lying Lips is an easy-to-learn, fast-paced game with two phases. In the trading phase, players swap assets, aiming to collect particular combinations. Meanwhile, gossip about witchcraft spreads around the village, represented by the dangerous Rumour card. Holding on to this card gives you a chance to control the village's narratives and seize victory, but it's a risky strategy! In the trial phase, players take on roles. Can the trial commissioner and jurors identify the scandal-mongerer?

Lying Lips reflects the importance of words in the witch hunts: accused witches often had a reputation for slandering or cursing others. Optionally, the second phase of the game can be used as a framework for a role-play of a trial.

Witch Hunt 1649 was developed by a team at the University of Warwick. It comprises two fun and educational card games, which can be bought or downloaded/played online for free. All proceeds go to charity.

—description from the designer

name: お花見！場所取りバトル (Ohanami! Bashotori Battle)
description:
Become a flat employee working for a company and make the Hanami a great event. The company with the most "excitement points" wins.

Players choose the company they belong to.
The tiles on the main board can be placed randomly and each company you choose has a different special effect, so you can play each game with a different strategy.

Every card you see is so "strong" that you can't help but think "strong".Anyway, the card effects are flashy.

It is a game of fisticuffs that is refreshing whether you lose or win.

—description from the publisher (translated)

会社で働く平社員となって、お花見を盛り上げましょう。
「盛り上がりポイント」が一番多い会社の勝利となります。

プレイヤーは、自分の所属する会社を選びます。

盛り上がりポイントは、所有しているエリアの桜の本数や、カード効果で獲得します。

カード効果により
陣地を奪って奪われてのはちゃめちゃバトルが繰り広げられます。

手札上限の中で、どのカードを残すかが悩ましいところです。

メインボードはシリコンでできており、上に乗せたタイルが滑らないようになっています。
メインボードのタイルをランダムで配置できることと、選んだ会社ごとに違う特殊効果があるので、1ゲームごとに違った戦略でプレイできます。

どのカードを見ても「強い」と思ってしまうほどに
とにかくカード効果が派手です。

パーティゲームでありながら、しっかりとバトルができ
世界観にぴったりとはまっているカード効果やキャラクターは
使うだけでも楽しさがあります。

負けても勝っても清々しい、そんな殴り合いのゲームです。

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Dice, Party Game, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Closed Drafting, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That, Team-Based Game, Tile Placement
publishers: タニシクラフトワークス (Tanishi Craft Works)

name: トゥルース・アントゥルース (Truth Untruths)
description:
Game Overview

A game of count-up, in which the players try to deduce the sum of the cards dealt and the face-down cards.

The game is a count-up game in which players try to increase the number of cards to be declared.

By playing each other's cards, the players can enjoy "the fun of gradually approaching the truth" and "the fun of deceiving the opponent's guess by bluffing.

The balance between "the fun of getting closer and closer to the truth" and "the fun of deceiving your opponent's guess by bluffing" is appealing.

ゲームの概要

配られたカードと伏せられたカードの合計を推理しながら、

宣言するカードの枚数を上げていく、カウントアップゲームです。

お互い手札をプレイする事で、「徐々に真実に近づいていく面白さ」と

「ブラフで相手の推理を惑わす楽しさ」の、バランスが魅力です。
publishers: 楽カフェゲームズ (Raku Cafe Games)

name: Farm Frenzy
description:
In Farm Frenzy each player has to make their own farm work by speed-drafting cards that need to be matched to produce tokens which in return are used to resolve contracts.

The game is high-speed and uses a common market concept where players can discard cards they don't need or can't use to the middle of the table and other may pick them up to use them. Of course, players gain points if other players used their cards, and so on.

Each player has their own deck that consists of the same number and types of cards, with the exception that each deck has a unique back representing the given player's faction.

When the game starts, each players will lay three cards from the top of their decks to the player board's farm area. Then the game really begins. There are no turns, the game is being played in real time. Players will reveal new cards, one by one, from their decks and try to pair them with cards they have laid down on the three farm spaces or any of the cards from the middle of the table where the common market is. Remember: using a card from another faction will win that faction extra points at the end of the game, so pay attention who discarded what card!

Players will try to match cards: One Hatchet paired with a Apple Garden will generate one Apple Basket token. One Scythe paired with a Grain Field will generate a Flour token. And finally, one Food Basket paired with a Pig Farm will generate one Pig token. Of course, there are variations of these cards in your deck. Once a player has enough tokens to resolve a Contract Card, they can do so and score it. Once a player has solved all their ten contracts, the game will end, and the exciting and nail-biting scoring will begin; you gain points from scored Contract Cards and one points from each of your cards the other players used.

That game is a true draw and pair bonanza!

—description from designer
mechanics: Matching, Pattern Building, Real-Time, Sudden Death Ending

name: Hack.Jack
description:
A 2-5 player hacking themed black jack deckbuilder. Players play cards from the top of their deck trying to get the sum of their played cards as close to the value on each job.

Buy new codes to add to your deck from one of 5 different suits. Each job has a unique event to try to capitalize on building your deck towards specific suits.

Players can activate those new code cards to knock the job value down, force players to play cards, or shuffle in troublesome antivirus scans into their deck. Whoever is the most notorious hacker at the end of the Final Hotshot hack, is victorious.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deck Construction, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building

name: Pit of Arms
description:
Pit of Arms is a fast paced and competitive tabletop miniatures board game for 2 players. Inspired by tactical role playing video games, Pit of Arms players lead a team of hand picked gladiators and ruffians to do battle in the pits.

The game is played on a grid based arena, using collectible miniatures and their accompanying character cards. Players take turns rolling action dice allowing their gladiators to perform brutal attacks and cunning abilities.

Victory is achieved when a player concedes or only one player's gladiators remain standing in the arena.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action/Event, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: OMG I'm Famous
description:
OMG I'm Famous! is the party game that gives you the chance to get verified, build influence, and be the first to reach 1 million followers. It's time to ditch your boring non-famous friends and social-climb your way to the top

Use "Problem Cards" to sabotage other players and prevent them from gaining followers

Use "Remedy Cards" to save yourself and keep gaining followers
The first person to 1 million followers wins!

Includes 105 cards with original illustrations. For 2-6 players ages 17+

description from publisher's website

name: Tarock
description: Traditional three-player trick taking game from Bavaria, Württemberg and Berlin, which adapts Tarock to be played with a pack of 36 German or French suited cards. For every hand players bid how many points they could take. The highest bidder announces trump and plays alone against the other two.

name: Victory at Sea: USS Enterprise
description:
Ships in Class: Yorktown, Hornet, Enterprise

Built in a series of three, only the USS Enterprise survived the war, with the USS Yorktown sunk during the Battle of Midway, and the USS Hornet during the Battle of Santa Cruz. The USS Enterprise went on to become the most frequently decorated US carrier of the war, even earning the British Admiralty Pennant, the only ship outside of the Royal Navy to do so. She was finally put out of action in 1945 by a kamikaze attack that severely damaged the hanger deck.

-description from the publisher's website
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: Blood Red Skies: Kawanishi H8K Emily
description:
The Imperial Japanese Navy (IJN) developed a number of flying boats as they were uniquely suited to conditions in the Pacific theatre due to their long ranges, heavy load carrying capacity, and the ability to land anywhere. The H8K, named 'Emily' by the Allies, was by far the most modern and successful flying boat deployed by the IJN and was rated as one of the best to see wartime service. A total of 167 H8Ks were built and they saw extensive use for patrol, reconnaissance, bombing, and transport duties. Its heavy defensive armament and robust airframe made it a difficult opponent for Allied flyers.

-description from the publisher's website
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Medieval Champion
description:
Medieval Champion is a fast paced dueling card game for 2 or 4 players. Invoke a set of unique champions into a duel that will include combat, magic, treasures and trickery!

Each champion has a set of skills and attributes that modify how you use action cards. There are also fun items and special artifacts that will help boost your champion to victory.

Each card is hand painted with designs in ink and watercolour, then digitally remastered into the final product. This adds to the vintage feel!
mechanics: Move Through Deck, Multi-Use Cards, Player Elimination, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Invasie van de plantenplagen
description:
Each player plays the role of a plant pest; for example an insect, virus, or fungus. During the game, they try to spread to all the regions of the world; the pest that's in the most regions at the end wins the game.
