On a player's turn, they first add a number of their playing pieces to the board, and then they can move a number of pieces to neighbouring countries. Finally they can evolve their species by "upgrading" one of their genetic characteristics (e.g. the number of pieces they can add each turn, the number of pieces they can move, and the climate zones that their species can live in).

The game 'Plant pest invasion' was published on the occasion of the UN International Year of Plant Health (2020).

name: ビビッドパニック コンガラッチョ (Vivid Panic Kongaraccho)
description:
High-Speed Brain Frustration Action with 60 Seconds to Win! The mysterious creature from outer space, Kongaracho, is causing panic in the brains of the human race! Look at the colors, look at the letters, and make quick decisions to eliminate Kongaratcho before anyone else does!

The keywords are "speed" x "color" x "confusion"!

The keywords are "speed" × "color" × "confusion"!
The keywords are "speed", "color", and "confusion"!

The big brains can't beat the kids...!
This is a game that can be played seriously regardless of the age of the players
That is "Vivid Panic Kongaraccio"!

What is Kongaracho...?

Kongaraccio.
They are dangerous people who satisfy their appetites by confusing people.
They may look pop, but they are dangerous if left unchecked!
Some say they came from outer space.

They can be defeated by colliding with them according to certain laws!
But the rules change from day to night.

The rules change rapidly, and you'll be rewarded for defeating them before anyone else does!

60秒で勝負が決まるハイスピード脳みそイライラアクション！宇宙からきた謎の生物コンガラッチョが人類の脳ミソをパニックに陥れる！色をみて文字をみて、素早い判断で誰よりもはやくコンガラッチョを退治しよう！

■キーワードは「 スピード 」×「 色 」×「 混乱 」!!

あべこべな色がハイスピードに交差するパニックバトルを制し、
賢いとろ～りやわらか脳をゲットしよう！

カタイ頭の大人が、子供に勝てない…！
参加プレイヤーの年齢に関係なく本気で遊べるそんなゲーム
それが「ビビッドパニックコンガラッチョ」!!

■コンガラッチョとは…？

コンガラッチョ、
彼らは人を混乱させることで食欲を満たすキケンな奴ら
ポップな見た目をしているが、放っておくと危ないぞ！
宇宙からやってきたなんて話もあるらしい。

彼らは一定の法則に従って衝突させることで倒すことができる！
ただし昼と夜とでその法則が変わるんだ。

目まぐるしく変わるルールの中で、誰よりも早く彼らを倒しきるとご褒美がもらえるぞ！
categories: Card Game, Educational, Party Game, Science Fiction, Sports

name: Frog Safari
description:
As a frog scientist it is up to you to collect 3 frogs from the jungle! They could be red, green or blue, small, medium or large and can be found in the swamp, the forest or the lake! The player who collects 3 frogs with the most matches in color size and location wins the round. The explorer with the highest frog scores after all the rounds wins!

You must collect in your pocket 3 frogs of your choice. When you find a frog you want to collect this round remove it from your hand and place it in front of you, locking it in your pocket. Once you've locked in your 3 frogs, you start the clock on your opponents. They must now complete their pockets swiftly to collect as many points as possible before the round ends.

As players draw from the deck they can keep or discard the frog they find, if they do, it's up for grabs by your opponents! You can also steal, snatch or switch frogs with your opponents!

-description from designer
mechanics: Catch the Leader, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Turn Order: Pass Order

name: Le Secret des Templiers
description:
Le Secret des Templiers ("Secret of the Templars") is an escape game for 3+ players with a game master who'll hide some hints in the room and give clues when the other are blocked. For more roleplay, each player can have a specific role, such as treasure guardian, grand inquisitor, etc...

Together, the players have to solve puzzles to find the Holly Grail.

name: Kuflibingó
description:
Classic bingo game with Kufli graphics.
The rules have two variants.

One is for 3+ years olds. You flip a tile and if you see that picture on your board you can take it and continue flipping until you flip one that you don’t have. Turn down that tile and it is the next players turn. You win if you collect all the pictures first.

The other is for 4+ years olds. It is a quick reaction bingo game. Each player flips one tile at the same time. If you see one that you have on your board you have to be the fastest to touch it. Yoou can collect multiple tiles in one round, one after the other. You win if you collect all the pictures first.

name: Justice League Snaps
description:
A card game with DC Characters : WonderWoman, Superman and Batman, but also villains, such as The Joker or Harley Quinn.

It's a speed game where you are trying to get rid of your cards as fast as possible. When placing cards, each card placed must be same color, same character or same number than the previous one. Placing a Villain will give a penalty to your opponents.

name: Maja: Polli Hop
description:
In the beehive a party is organized to honor the Queen Bee. Maja and her friends want to bring her the best honey from the Corn Poppy Meadow. But Maja must plan carefully, each friend can only carry three pollen balls. You have pollen balls of a color, roll the die and must place a pollen ball to one of Maja’s friends or Ant Paul. You try to place your pollen in 3rd place as often as you can. If you manage that in all boxes, you earn a Maja Chip and win after three rounds with most chips.

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: Android: Netrunner – Overdrive Runner Draft Pack
description:
This is the Runner's draft pack for the Overdrive event. Draft packs contain 40 cards separated into 4 randomized boosters of 10 cards each. After the selection process, each layer builds a deck from their pool of drafted cards and use those decks to compete in a tournament.

Afterwards, the draft pack may be used in another draft event or the player may use the cards in the Android Netrunner game.
publishers: Fantasy Flight Games, Wizards of the Coast

name: Peg It
description:
The board is set up with the 14 RED pegs in the holes ringed with Red, 14 BLUE pegs in the holes ringed with Blue, the YELLOW KEY peg in the Red Star, and the GREEN KEY peg in the Blue Star.

The game is won by the player who first positions his KEY peg in the diagonally opposite square or blocks any further move by his opponent.
A player may move over his own or the opponent's single pegs in one or more successive steps as in "Draughts" or from hole to hole in FORWARD or DIAGONAL direction only. No side or backward movement is allowed. KEY pegs may be moved ONLY along the straight arrowed line from STAR to SQUARE, and only the KEY pegs should be placed in the squares. No pegs are to be removed from the board.

name: Imperamus
description:
Imperamus is an all-encompassing, strategic Euro-Ameri experience which transports players to the early days of the Roman Republic, at the very beginning of their conquest of the Italian peninsula. Players take on the role of noble Roman families who must balance competition with cooperation to expand the borders of Rome and create a civilization that can stand the test of time for centuries to come. This narrative game promotes constant player interaction across all four branches of command - military, legislature, diplomacy, and economy.
At its core, Imperamus is a card-driven, deck-building system supported by traditional worker placement, resource management, and engine building. Players must balance crucial decisions as military leaders and statesmen to build their own local influence while supporting the formation of the Legions for the expansion of Rome as a whole. Along with the ability to customize their decks with recruits from Rome and surrounding societies, each family has a unique power to guide their strategy. Additionally, players will vote on both in-game laws and out-of-game scoring conditions, creating a new mechanical framework for each campaign!
While the group has a common goal to gain the support of the people and ultimately give rise to the longest lasting empire in history, only one family will leave a legacy for the ages. The player with the most glory at the end of the game wins!
mechanics: Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Negotiation, Variable Player Powers, Voting, Worker Placement

name: Stradivari
description:
Each player is a member of the Italian family Stradivari. The Stradivari were violin makers known for the creation of the prestigious music intruments: the Stardivarius.

In Stradivari, players will have to gather materials to craft music instruments to score points.

Players will be able to gather materials by placing their workers on the game board. During the course of the game, players may upgrade their workers to make them gather even more materials when they are placed on the board.

The players with the most points at the end of the game is the winner.

name: Live a Live
description:
Based off the video game of the same name, Live-A-Live was exclusively available as part of the Japanese-only Collector's Edition when the remake released on the Nintendo Switch.

The winner is the player who reduces the opponent's two characters to zero life by selecting four of each of the eight main characters in the game and making full use of the three techniques each has.
mechanics: Action Queue, Command Cards, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection, Square Grid, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Dark Age: Skarrd
description:
Mutants. Psychics. Cannibals. Monsters. The Skarrd are all these things and much more. For generations the barbarian tribes have evolved and transformed into the survival-of-the-fittest cults. Samaria has suffered the raids and ambushes of the Skarrd for as long as they have hunted for flesh to fill their bellies and machine parts to replace their own failing bodies.

The Skarrd are a savage horde that has broken into several distinct cults based on how their teachings and ideals force them to evolve and survive the hellish environments of Samaria. The cults focus on what drives and strengthens them, turning each sect within the greater Horde into a distinct family of brutal, barbaric marauders. There is the sado-masochism of the Blood Cult, the conversion from flesh to machine within the Cult of Metamorphosis, the body ravaging poisons f the Toxic Cult, and now the animated death and nuclear powers of the newly risen Cult of Decay. All are strengthened by the Horde, but each in their own way.

Over a decade since his exile from New Ashkelon, Saint-turned-Father Johann has been gathering all of the Skarrd under his collective banner at the dreaded Fort Retribution. Something tremendous and horrifying is happening within the Skarrd and there is only one thing to be assured of - they might be the only ones to survive it.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Dark Age: Forsaken
description: As the last bastion of advanced human civilization on Samaria, the Forsaken consider it their holy duty to erradicat all menaces to human existance. Aliens, heratics, and abominations abound across the planet, and the Forsaken have taken up arms in a holy crusade to wipe the world clean in the Forsaken God's name.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Boarding Pass
description:
Weather-wise it's such a lovely day!

The vacation of your dreams is about to start. Jump on your plane and fly over majestic mountains, lush fields, sparkling oceans and magnificent cities to explore all your destination country. Discover exceptional landmarks and collect miles, but do it efficiently before your journey ends.

What are you waiting for? Pack-up and get your Boarding Pass.

Players randomly collect a boarding pass card describing the landscape they need to fly over with their plane to earn points. Starting from their base airport, players will try to create a suitable flying route collecting landscape cards from the compass board and placing them on their own flight path accordingly to the cardinal point they collected that card from.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Drafting, End Game Bonuses, Map Addition, Modular Board, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Point to Point Movement, Tile Placement

name: The Heron in Flight
description:
The Heron In Flight explores the German operation, “Fischreiher” (Heron) to take Stalingrad off the march during the period of mid-August up until mid-September 1942. Failure to encircle Soviet forces west of Stalingrad ensures that an urban brawl for the city will ensue. Both sides are challenged to meet different objectives.

The Germans must utilize their Sixth Army to destroy the three Soviet armies in the land bridge between the Don and the Volga before they can fall back into Stalingrad. Historically, this attack was coordinated with operations by the Fourth Panzer Army that attacked from the southwest and which was to form the southern arm of a gigantic pincer. Supporting the attack are aircraft of the Fourth Air Fleet which ruled the air.

The Soviet player must not only ensure sufficient forces escape the intended German encirclement, but maintain constant pressure on the overextended Sixth Army with a series of counterattacks from north of Stalingrad to relieve pressure on the defenders of the city. The Soviets are also tasked to retain bridgeheads on the Don which will be their key for future operations.

Designed by Mark Stille, this game includes 1 and ½ maps with 420 counters. Units are at the division/brigade level for the Soviets while German and Axis Allied forces are depicted from battalion to division. Each turn is two days.

The game system is based on his earlier Wintergewitter design and emphasizes the effect of air power and a command and control system which makes players plan ahead to conduct operations and carefully weigh where their offensive efforts will be expended.

Maps - One and 1/2 full color 22"x34" hex mapsheets
Counters - 420 standard 1/2" die-cut pieces
Rules length - 14 pages
Charts and tables - 2 pages
Complexity - Medium
Playing time - Up to 4 hours
How challenging is it solitaire? - Average

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Simulation

name: Necromunda: Underhive – Orlock Gang Tactics Cards
description:
This set contains 26 cards or use in Necromunda games.

Inside you will find:

18 House Orlock Gang Tactics cards and 8 blank Fighter cards, each proudly stamped with the logo of House Orlock - the House of Iron - ideal for marking out Champions and Leaders in your gang deck!

You will need a copy of the Necromunda Rulebook and Necromunda: House of Iron to use the contents of this pack.

These cards are not the same as the Orlock Gang Cards and Orlock Vehicle cards. They are a bit different.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Science Fiction
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Command Cards

name: British Royals Murder Mystery
description:
Tonight will be a night of shock, scandal, death and deceit- so just another day in the life of the British monarchy.

Transport your guests to the palace as you host your very own murder mystery. Will you unmask the killer and be knighted, or will you fail and end up banished from the kingdom forever?

The box contains:
Host instructions
12 character biography cards
12 reaction cards
12 round 1 clue cards
12 crime scene props
10 MIS report cards
1 accusation notepad
1 notepad
Solution cards
Awards for best and worst actors

name: Necromunda: Book of the Outlands
description:
Necromunda: Book of the OUtlands continues to expand on the game, introducing a wealth of new rules to add even more variety, scope and excitment to your battles on Necomunda.

Inside the book you will find:

Ash Waste Nomads and Ironhead Squat Prospectors Gangs. This includes rules for creating and running gangs of the mysterious Ash Waste Nomads and Iron Squat Prospectors. Included are profiles for the fighters of both gangs, such as the mystic Stormcallers of the Ash Waste Nomads capable of controlling Necromunda's storms while riding into battle on Dustback Helamites.

It also has rules for assembling a gang that calls the wastes their home, including mounting your gangers on bikes and hiring crew to man your vehicles such as an Orlock Iron Rider, Scum Race or Guild of Coin Hauler.

Finally it has a comprehensive ruleset to allow to create your own vehicles to traverse the wastes in and assert your gang's dominance. It has full vehicle rules.
categories: Adventure, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Alliances, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Baulöwe
description: The players are managers of construction companies and have to fulfill three contracts: to build a subway station, a hotel (with a partner) and a shopping center. They take turns to roll one or two dice and move their pawns around the game board. On some spaces the players draw different kinds of cards with business transactions, on other spaces events directly hinder or benefit the players. When all three contracts are fulfilled, the player changes to the inner track for marketing, human resources and planning to develop their business and take out their competitors upon reaching the "Baulöwe" space. When all players have arrived on the "Baulöwe" space or have been taken out, the remaining player with the highest profit wins the game.
mechanics: Contracts, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Aventuras del Oeste: Los Indios Atacan
description:
Using the cards, players will free their four tokens, located in each of the four sections: INDIANS, CAVALRY, , COWBOYS and CARAVAN, making sure that no other player catches them. The first player to do so wins the game.
—description from the box (translated)

Por medio de las tarjetas, cada jugador habrá de liberar a sus cuatro fichas situadas en cada uno de los cuatro apartados: INDIOS, CABALLERÍA, VAQUEROS y CARAVANA, procurando al mismo tiempo, que ninguno de los otros jugadores le atrape. Gana la partida el que lo consigue en primer lugar.
—description from the box

name: Houdini's Secret Room
description:
The 150-year-old house that belonged to the most famous illusionist Houdini is now a museum. You decide to go there and learn some of his greatest tricks and illusions. Walking around, your curiosity leads you to a secret room, one in which no one has set foot for over a century. As you enter the room, the door slams shut, leaving you locked inside while the walls start closing in slowly.

On the table is Houdini’s testimony, which says:
“You are the chosen one who managed to enter this secret room. Whoever finds a way to break out of it will have the privilege of becoming my heir.”

The key, which unlocks the door, is hidden somewhere in the room. However, in order to find it, you must solve some challenges first. Houdini left you a pencil, glue and scissors, along with six different cards, which will help you solve the challenges ahead. If you want to get out of this room, you need to get inside the mind of the greatest illusionist and start thinking like him.

Can you escape and become the next Houdini?

You have 60 minutes before the walls crush you, so you better hurry up—the clock is ticking!


This amazing game is designed to help all creative people throwing a next-level experience for their loved ones. We created a thrilling story with beautifully designed puzzles that brings the escape room excitement right into your living room.Players will enjoy in:
- Crafting 3D figures, cutting, gluing, and folding paper.
- Experience mind-reading tricks and see for themselves how powerful some mind-reading techniques can be.
- Getting out of mazes.
- Six distinct characters.
- Hints with rhymes and exceptional art design.

Escape Room is more than just solving puzzles — it is all about the whole experience. To help you transform your space into an engrossing, captivating escape room, our game kit includes more than just the puzzles. In your download, you’ll also find posters and invitations that heighten the immersive power of Houdini’s Secret Room and bring the mystery much closer to you.

name: Trojan War
description:
In Trojan War the players are divided into Greeks and Trojans where they try cooperatively but at the same time and individually to be crowned the winners of the game, conquering as many victory points as possible both for themselves and overall for their team. In the game players use legendary heroes such as Achilles, Hector, military units such as Myrmidons, Dardanes, figures such as Helen of Troy, Cassandra, structures such as the Walls of Troy, the Trojan Horse, all under the watchful eye and the moods of the Gods of Olympus!

The game lasts 6 rounds, in each round players try to earn victory points by doing actions such as technology, exploration, supply, sacrificing for the favor of the gods, visiting the oracle and duel. Each round ends with a duel between 2 legendary heroes.
Winer is the player with the most victory points at the end of the game.
Winning team is the team whose players have collected the most victory points at the end of the game !!!

name: Prophets of Doom
description:
The end of the world is coming - but do you know exactly how it will happen?

In Prophets of Doom, players will take on the roles of Doomsday Cult founders. Each cult has their own unique powers to use as they build their compounds, recruit followers, and try to avoid unwanted attention.

On each turn, players will draft cards that they can use to:


Build an addition to their compound.
Discard to invoke one of their abilities.


A cult's abilities are used to collect resources, attract followers, complete projects, build vaults, and recruit officers to help prepare for doomsday.

After every round of play, players can use the locations they have built within their compound for their unique and powerful rewards.

As the game progresses, players will be able to gain "foresight" into the end of the world. If they get enough of this resource, they can take a peek at the impending apocalypse and develop a better idea of how to plan for the end of everything.

After the final round, players can use the resources they have collected to strengthen their defenses one last time. Whoever does the best job keeping their compound and followers safe will be the winner and will lead the remains of humanity as the ashes fall.

—description from publisher
categories: Card Game, City Building, Deduction, Horror
mechanics: Closed Drafting, Multi-Use Cards, Variable Player Powers

name: Nabla Operator Game
description:
This game is an exciting math battle game. The goal of this game is to make the opponents zero-dimensional. You use cards with various operators and functions for the goal.

At the beginning of the game, each player has 3 "bases "(1, X, X ^ 2). In your turn, you can perform an operation or add a function to their field from their hands. You can choose between attack or defense.

When you choose Attack: Differentiate the opponent's base and erase it.
When you choose Defense: Add your own base or strengthen it with integration.

The base disappears when the result of the operation becomes 0 or diverges.

It seems difficult, but once you learn how to play it, you can always play this exciting game.

name: Saropoly
description:
Saropoly is a satirical board game about the music industry published by British independent record label Sarah Records as their fiftieth 'single'. It was packaged as a 7" single but contained a fold-out board and a wooden die.

Players take on the roles of four contemporary record label bosses - Alan McGee (Creation), Tony Wilson (Factory), Richard Branson (Virgin) and Ivo Watts-Russell (4AD) - who must travel around the city of Bristol, south-west England, to collect the eight essential ingredients required to publish a Sarah Records EP, with the first player to do so and successfully return to the Sarah Records head office being the winner.

name: BrainBox: Tierkinder
description:
Each card shows pictures from chicks to caterpillars to puppies, calves, foals and fawns. On the back of each card are six questions about the animals on the front.

The object of the game is to study a card for 10 seconds and then answer a question based on the roll of a die. If the question is answered correctly, the card is kept and the person with the most number of cards after 5 or 10 minutes (or the deck is completed) is the winner.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Trivia

name: Forbidden Psalm: Rotten Bits
description:
From the bleak corners of the world comes forth a collaboration of the darkest kind: Westfalia Miniatures and KRD Designs bring you a new way to experience the Forbidden Psalm. Based on the MÖRK BORG MINIATURES range by Westfalia, Rotten Bits provides you with:


a new mini campaign for Forbidden Psalm
new warband options and mercenaries
new monsters


—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Forbidden Psalm: Forbidden Wilderness
description:
From the tales of old, and beasts of a time forgotten, comes forth a collaboration of the deadliest kind: Geektopia Games, creators of the Fearsome Wilderness board game, and KRD Designs, the mind behind Forbidden Psalm, team up to bring you new horrors for Forbidden Psalm! Featuring creatures based on the Fearsome Wilderness miniatures range and board game, Forbidden Wilderness features classic cryptids from American folklore, stated up and ready to roll, including:


the Dingmaul
the Dungavenhooter
the Jackalope
the Jersey Devil
the Wampus Cat
and 19 more!
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Räuber und Gendarm / Schwarzer Mann
description:
Räuber u. Gendarm
Each player has 8 tokens. The robber player places his tokens on the 8 gray spaces. The gendarme player starts from the red spaces. Movement is one space per turn or one or more jumps over friendly or opposite tokens. Opposite tokens are turned over to change sides and may be placed on any free space.
The game ends if one player has no more tokens or if one player can't move anymore. The player with the most tokens left wins the game.

Schwarzer Mann
The black man player gets 2 tokens and places them on gray spaces. The children player places his 14 tokens on the red spaces on one side of the board. The children may move only, the black men may move or jump. If a black man jumps over a child, it's token is turned over and transforms into a black man. The game ends, if 7 of them reach the red spaces on the black men's side of the board or if the black men transform all children. It also ends, if the black men block the remaining children so that theay arent able to reach their destination spaces. After two games with changed roles the player who has moved the most cildren to their destinations wins the game.

name: QUINS
description:
Objective: Complete the word QUINS to win.

Preparation: Deal 5 cards to each player.
Start: The youngest player will start the game.

Function: In each turn the player will roll the dice to perform the different actions.

Actions: Reveal Card, Change Card, Steal Card, Place Bomb, Explode Card, Lose Turn, Protect Card and Change Game.

—description from the designer

name: Nooblings
description:
The King is in search of a new Champion of the realm!

Take on the role of challengers vying for the title of Champion and defeat the other players to prove you are worthy!

Players must select a class, each with their own unique abilities. The classes are:
- Knight (take less damage)
- Ranger (escape more easily)
- Wizard (spells pack an extra punch)
- Merchant (save money on items)
- Cleric (restore health over time)
- Assassin (deal more damage)
- Noble (get an extra item when you land on the castle)

You will take turns rolling and traveling around the board, landing on different space types (note: if you land on another player you may attack them). The rulebook has a standard setup shown, but is customizable so that you can add, reduce, and mix up spaces for variety and replay-ability. The space types are:
- Monster (fight an NPC)
- Random Event (something happens)
- Shop (buy or attempt to steal items)
- Tavern (restore health)
- Castle (start here; get a gift from the King when you pass)
- Arena (battle another player as if you just landed on them)
- Bandit (pay to steal from another player)

The objective of the game is to defeat the other players in combat and earn points, with the first to reach the predetermined number declared the winner, or play last-man-standing in which the last player surviving is the winner and crowned Champion. Players may choose to team up if they wish, but can always end their truce at any time without notice.

When you land on another player you will have the option to attack and engage them in battle. In battle, you will take turns either rolling to attack or rolling in an attempt to flee, and may strategically utilize a wide variety of items and spells to gain the upper hand. Battle only ends when one player is defeated (their health drops to 0), or when someone rolls for a successful escape.

Items are purchased (or stolen) from the Shop. These include a huge variety of weapons, spells, trinkets, gear, consumables, and more. You don't have to show what items you have in your inventory unless it is actively equipped (like a weapon), so you never know what your opponent may have in store should you attack them and vice versa; Could be some paltry Moldy Boots and a Vegetable Stew, or an epic spell like Meteor Strike and a healing potion or two. Card-play is an integral part of Nooblings, and knowing when to play a certain card could mean the difference between victory or defeat.

On your quest to become champion, you will encounter a variety of dangerous monsters and may choose to either stand your ground and fight or attempt to run away. If you successfully defeat a monster you will receive loot (gold coins) which can be spent to purchase items, rest at the Tavern, and more.

Random Event cards are drawn and flipped over when you land on a Random Event space. Something will immediately happen. These could be good or bad, can affect one or multiple players, and sometimes you might have to make an important choice which could change the tide of the game.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval, Mythology
mechanics: Bribery, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling, Events, Kill Steal, King of the Hill, Lose a Turn, Negotiation, Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move, Semi-Cooperative Game, Trading, Traitor Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Le grand marais
description:
A tile laying game set in 1003 in Maillezais abbey (West of France), sold in the marais poitevin local tourist shops.

You have 3 tiles in hand and on your turn you must lay one, each type of tiles has a different scoring system. The game proposes various scenarios (set up and scorings) that tell the story of the Marais poitevin.

name: Opetellaan taitoja
description: Learn different skills by doing fun and engaging tasks. If you succeed at the task you'll receive the card which can be used to purchase puzzle pieces - first one to complete their puzzle is the winner!

name: Bolyai Értékadó Társasjáték
description: There are number and formula cards. Players need to play such number cards to formula cards that the formula completes. The last player wins the rounds.

name: Hyper Ball
description:
Hyper Ball is a fast-paced, hard-hitting futuristic sports game. It is played with two teams of four power armoured athletes in a walled arena. Points are scored by throwing or kicking the ball into the opposing team’s goal.

Players alternately activate their team members and spend action points to manoeuvre them around the arena. Whenever a player wishes to throw the ball they must flick a disc at the relevant target on a separate dexterity board to determine if the throw was successful.

Every team member has a number of power points stored in their armour’s battery which can be spent on either; generating additional action points, re-flicking missed throws, knocking down opponents or activating special abilities. Depleted batteries can be recharged when the athletes use the “rest” action.

At the end of a pre/determined number of turns the team with the highest number of goals will be declared the victors.

-description from designer

name: Orphan Annie to the Rescue
description:
Orphan Annie to the rescue is a Spin-and-Move game for 2 to 4 players.

Each player takes a counter for his Orphan Annie. High Spin plays first. Spin dial in turn moving that number of spaces from the start.

Some of the spaces are marked with indicators that vary the moves. When a counter lands on:

+ 'A' -- advance 2 spaces

+ 'T' -- lose one turn

+ 'x' -- proceed to a large 'X'

+ 'B' -- move back 5 spaces

and so on. Landing on a red space around the lake allows the player to attempt to rescue Sandy, who has broken through the ice, and by being the first to do so they win the game.

name: Ubrique
description:
It is the early 20th century. Top international brands are flocking to Ubrique in search of skilled artisans to craft their most luxurious wallets and handbags. You run a small workshop with your family, hoping to become one of Ubrique's top manufacturers.

Players will begin with single family-owned workshop. They will then begin taking orders from European brands, requesting a set of either wallets or handbags. In order to complete these orders, players will have to purchase the right amount of leather skins, and outsource as many workshops as needed.

During the course of the game, players will also encounter opportunities to upgrade their production, whether it's improving revenue from specific cities, requiring less skins for certain products, or simply by acquiring new workshops.

The game ends when a player buys a target amount of workshops (this could be from 2 to 5, depends on the total players and the desired game length).

The game features beautiful thematic art, and uses exclusively cards in different sizes and formats. It's easy to learn, and apt for beginners and veterans alike, putting their time and economical management skills to the test.

It is a portable, short, fast-paced game that simulates Ubrique's leather goods production history, as it begun with modest individually-owned workshops, and grew to a town with major factories that work closely with top European brands.

The game also used insider expertise and consultancy from the designer's father, Inaki Xalabarde, who is a leather goods fashion designer himself, and has lived and worked in Ubrique sporadically.

-description from designer

name: The Gilded Carcanet
description:
"An ancient treasure has been said to be buried on a small island outside the coast of Turkey. Little is known about it and its existence has been heavily debated in the archeology community. Professor in archeology, Bartholomew Wilson, has always dismissed the idea as a myth. Until now.

Armed only with a mysterious letter and a cheap souvenir from his old friend Edward, Bartholomew and Oscar set out on an epic adventure. Even though they find a very helpful item along the way, adventuring is not easy and their path turns out to be full of challenges to overcome.

The Gilded Carcanet puts you in the shoes of Bartholomew as you try to piece together the answers to the many mysteries of the Aegean Sea. In each chapter, you will face a challenge to solve for our duo to continue their quest."

Prof. Barty and Oscar Quin are waiting for you to join them on their lifetime adventure. Logic puzzles, assembly, folding, decoding, brainstorming, and a lot of fun are ahead of you. If you want to put your IQ to the test, don’t hesitate to try it out.

We’ve got your back with well-balanced hints for each challenge and a walkthrough explanation to make sure the game will run smoothly even if you get stuck.

name: Moji Challenge: Animals
description:
Moji Challenge: Animals involves 165 challenges (3 difficulty levels) across 55 cards to get all your parties going. Play in pairs or in teams, choosing from a huge range of game varieties. Find out what sort of animal lurks inside you: Are you a tiger or a pussy cat?

The rules are simple. Each challenge completed successfully wins you fame points. The first player or team to score 15 fame points wins.

—description from the publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Party Game

name: バラバランス (Balabalance)
description:
Balabalance is a dexterity game where players must balance a stack of wooden components in one hand while continuing to play the game with their other hand.

The game uses a dice similar to that in the game LCR which determines where a piece should be placed: the hand of the player to your left, the player to you right, or the middle.

The first player who is not able to maintain the balance of their stack loses.

name: Professor Swen's Lab
description:
An evil scientist, who hates winter and snow, invents a device that is destroying all the snow in your city.

You find his lost, top-secret diary, which might lead to his lab. Now you have a chance to turn off this machine and bring back the magic of winter.

Are you brave enough to break into his lab and figure out how to stop this madness?

You have 1 hour before the evil scientist returns to the lab. Better hurry up — he can be very hostile!

name: Troll Tanks
description:
Troll Tanks is a fast, fun and simple, yet strategic 2-player turn based tabletop game with some cardboard craft chucked in for good measure. The aim of the game is for each player to expand their territory to obtain new tanks, battle enemy tanks and ultimately capture the enemy base.

The game is played with a deck of 54 square terrain cards and 10 tanks, and oh yeah the tanks are made out of toilet rolls.

—description from the designer

name: Championship Immortal
description:
Championship Immortal is a last-man-standing, tactical, and strategic fantasy themed board game for 2-6 players.

Held only once every thousand years, the greatest warriors in all the realms compete to obtain the title of CHAMPION IMMORTAL.

Play as one of six unique character classes, each with thier own deck. Play cards to move around the board, attack, and use other abilities. Collect item powerful item cards, outmaneuver your opponents, and use tactical advantages of the board to defeat the other players. And with a fully modular board, every play of the game is different.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Deck Construction, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building

name: The Naval SITREP: The Journal of Naval Miniatures Wargaming #1
description:
The Naval SITREP is published twice a year by the Admiralty Trilogy Group. It supports the Admiralty Trilogy game system with scenarios, articles on history and technology, and rules expansions & corrections.

The Naval SITREP Issue #1 was published in October 1994.

Table of contents:

Features

Scenario: Beta Convoy
ACSC Reading list
History of Italian Carriers
Planning Strike Packages
WWII Tactical Comms
Command at Sea Logs
Alerts
Book Reviews
Product Updates
Platform Specifications:
French La Fayette class
Russian MIG31M Foxhound B
Italian Aquila CV
Italian Re 2001
categories: Aviation / Flight, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: Cubitos: Ryzykowny Wyścig
description: Two additional promo tracks to Cubitos.

name: Wooka Booka Island
description:
A mysterious door appeared in your room out of nowhere! As you walk through it, suddenly you find yourself on the wondrous island of Wooka Booka. There are four animal kingdoms and only one treasure chest. You have a chance to find this long-lost treasure, but first you need to pass the challenges of every kingdom.

A escape room kit for kids. Focused on puzzles, cooperation, and creativity.
A role of game master is used:
"1. Setting up the game, and
2. Playing the role of Lau Kamau – the friendly giant guardian.

This role will allow you to guide the kids, monitor their progress, and help them if necessary. And because we made a special guide for you, your job will be a piece of cake!"

name: Cube-Tac-Toe
description:
Cube-Tac-Toe is a game of strategy. Two players build a CUBE, made up of 27 small cubes, from the ground up, competing for Cube-Tac-Toe points as they build. Three in a row is a Cube-Tac-Toe point. The player with the most Cube-Tac-Toe points is the winner.

—description from the instruction sheet

Published in the early 1980s by Rhombics, a maker of wooden puzzles, the pieces are made out of light Maple and dark Walnut.

name: China, LLC.: Qing Dynasty and Guomindang 1644-1949
description:
China, LLC. is a game of China from the establishment of the Qing Dynasty in 1644 CE to the end of the Chinese Civil War of 1949 CE. Philip Jelley uses the same system as the popular Rome, Inc. in which you run China like a business, expanding its corporate power across China, Manchuria, Mongolia, Xinjiang, Tibet and the Southern and Eastern Seas until it becomes the largest, richest, most populous entity in the world. From the height of power, the Qing CEOs became increasingly detached from reality, confined to their palaces, and dominated by managerial eunuchs while their vast empire is beset by internal rebellions and new barbarians from across the far seas. Can you succeed where they failed? Even if Qing fall, you have a second chance as the Guomindang (Chinese Nationalist Party) struggle to bring order out of the chaos of a crumbling empire.

Statesmen may become emperors, governors, rebels, and enemy leaders and are rated for their Military, Administration, Popularity, and Intrigue abilities. Each has a special ability, allowing them to defeat their historic foes, assassinate rivals, and influence foreign affairs. For example, the Emperor Qianlong has two Military, five Administration, two Popularity, and four Intrigue abilities, and the Conquest special ability, making him an indifferent general, but excellent bureaucrat even if he was reluctant to embrace popular reform, who expanded the Qing Empire to its greatest extent. Less useful is the Empress Cixi with one Military, two Administration, two Popularity, and four Intrigue abilities, and the Assassin special ability, whose habit of killing emperors destabilized the Qing Dynasty.

The map has provinces grouped into ten commands, each with their own governor to collect taxes, crush insurgents, fight wars, or perhaps assassinate the emperor, or launch a rebellion. Victory is determined by annexing provinces, defeating wars, financing massive prestige projects, and establishing the Mandate of Heaven. Cavalry, infantry, and fleets are used to fight wars and garrison provinces, expanding direct control, or creating vassals in outlying provinces. Enemy leaders and wars move from province to province until defeated, encouraging revolts, causing unrest, reducing income, but fighting them could lead to disaster. Unequal Treaties imposed on China by foreign powers robbing her of provinces, prestige, and cash and changing the rules as they expand their own empires.

Each turn represents 5-10 years, with 10 turns in each scenario. The four scenarios start in 1644 CE, 1735 CE, 1820 CE, and 1889 CE which may be combined into campaign games. You need to blend military acumen with careful administration, as well as intrigue, making the most of what you have each turn, just like any modern-day business. China, LLC will give you a new perception of how war is a cost, business is a benefit, and empire is somewhere in between. It’s up to you to find a balance, or heads will roll. China, LLC comes with one full color 22" x 34" mapsheet, 280 full color 1/2" die-cut pieces and around 12 pages of rules. Players should average from 3 to 4 hours per scenario.

-description from designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Events, Point to Point Movement, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Victory at Sea: USS Arizona
description:
Ships in Class: Arizona, Pennsylvania

Length: 600 feet
Displacement: 39,224 tons
Speed: 21 knots
Crew: 1720
Commissioned: 1916

1941: Sunk at Pearl Harbor

-description from the publisher's product information card
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: Victory at Sea: Kirishima
description:
Ships in Class: Kongo, Hisi, Kirishima, Haruna

The Kongo class, dating from 1912, was rebuilt between 1927 and 1931 and was thereafter re-rated as a battleship. Armed with eight 14-inch guns in dual turrets and a secondary battery of sixteen 6-inch guns, the Kongo was further rebuilt in the late 1930s. Hiel and Kirishima were lost off Guadalcanal. Hiel was disabled after taking fifty or more hits from 8 inch and smaller shells, and finally sunk by air-launched torpedoes. Kirishima was shattered by battleship gunfire, while Kongo was torpedoed by a submarine, and Haruna sunk by an air raid on Kuro.

-description from the publisher's product info card
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: Poker d'Enfer: Recueil des Variantes card
description:
Promo card given by the French gaming magazine Jeux sur un Plateau, June 2006, No 38.

The new card enables the higherst visible Poker card to be used as the Joker

name: Kennst du Nürnberg?
description:
The players take turns to roll and move. They start at space 1 on a tour through Nürnberg and have to reach space 106. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players or the players lose or gain game coins. After the end of the game the player with the most coins wins the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Murder of the Black Rose: A Puzzle Magazine
description:
Your help is needed to solve a murder at a rose show!
A well known rose show judge lies next to her beloved rose bush...

Solve fun puzzles, riddles and ciphers to unravel the mystery and catch the killer! Murder of the Black Rose is an escape-room style murder mystery in a magazine format.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Akvárko: Promo 2
description:
"Albi exclusive" promo cards - preorder bonus for customers who purchased the game on the website of the Czech publisher/distributor Albi.

This promo pack contains 6 Sawbwa Barb (Sawbwa resplendens) cards.

ADDITIONAL RULES: At the start of the game each player takes one card of Sawbwa barb. Players can put it into their fish tank anytime during the game.

ABILITY: Sawbwa is a wild card. You can put it everywhere around the grid or cover another fish in your fish tank. You can score Sawbwa barb as exactly one type of fish you need and score the points according to its condition.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Closed Drafting, Open Drafting, Pattern Building

name: 18 Holes: Course Architect – Kickstarter Promo
description: Special Kickstarter promo which includes new goals, prime locations and designer discretion cards.

name: GA-GA
description:
You can either win by calling "Miyabi" proudly or get defeated by other player's "Miyabi-Gasane!".

The goal of the game is to "avoid getting drunk" as much as possible while discarding or picking up the four elegant cards {Mai=dance, Cha=tea, Incense, and Fan} and the slightly disturbing cards {Ogre and Tsurugi=sword}. The game ends when one player becomes too drunk; The least drunken player wins.

A single game consists of multiple rounds. The flow of rounds are as follows.

Seven cards are dealt to each player.
According to the rules, the player reduces the total of the cards in his/her hand. If the total of the cards in his/her hand is under 7, he/she can call "Miyabi" and challenge to win the round.
Everyone reveals their hand.
If the total of the cards in hand is higher than the player who called "Miyabi", he/she loses and gets the total of the cards in his/her hand as drunkenness points.
If any player has a total of the cards less than the player who called "Miyabi", he/she succeeds in "Miyabi-Gasane" and wins. The player who called "Miyabi" will get his/her total of the cards plus 30 drunkenness points.


The game ends when any player reaches 109 drunkenness points or more. A player with the lowest drunkenness point becomes the winner.

Once you play GA-GA, you will become addicted: The exhilarating feeling of discarding many cards at once while keeping an eye on other players' faces, reading a flow of the game, deep strategic thinking, and so on... Please enjoy this beautiful and glittering Japanese board game!
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: LastFairyTale: Story of Grim and Anderson
description:
LastFairyTale is an asymmetric strategy card game with a concept that grants the wishes of the characters in the fairy tales we saw as children.

The characters from the Brothers Grimm and Andersen fairy tales we are familiar with each have their own wishes in their story. These wishes were realized as 'victory conditions' for each character.
Each character has their own unique character action to reach the 'victory condition', and it is a game in which the character's actions interfere with the opponent and reach the 'victory condition' first.

However, in most games with 'various types of characters', the problem of balance is always on the rise. There were always strong characters or cards, and when everyone played with strong characters and cards, the interest in the game would diminish.

This game is the first board game used to balance the game, introducing AI to play this game in the testing phase.
LastFairyTale's optimized AI based on Hanabi Play artificial intelligence performs test play through an average of 30 million simulations per turn.
After training the AI ​​through these test plays, it goes through millions of battles to find the best play. Through this tests, we can check this character's strengths and weaknesses in advance, and find the best-balanced character action.

—description from the publisher

name: Akvárko: Promo 1
description:
"Albi exclusive" promo cards. They can only be obtained at events organized by the publisher Albi, distributor presentations, contests, etc.

This promo pack contains 6 Peaceful betta (Betta Imbellis) cards.

RULES: Shuffle all six cards into a deck with all other fish and creatures. The general rules are without any change.

ADJACENCY: This condition will be fulfilled when the Peaceful betta is surrounded by at least 2 plants for getting 5 points or 3 and more plants for getting 9 points.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Closed Drafting, Open Drafting, Pattern Building

name: Kangaroo Disco Mania
description:
Kangaroo Disco Mania is a fun, family friendly game centered around matching icons on custom cards to get the most points for the craziest moves. Each card has charming, custom artwork centered around animals doing the Disco. The game typically plays in 10-15 minutes and has multiple game modes to scale the gameplay in the interest of maintaining that quick-paced play. All modes except the solo mode have a built-in timer made up of cards, called the "song", that can be claimed for additional points but also shortening the game time.

The core of the game is centered around matching arrays of icons along the tops and bottoms of the cards to get the most points. It is a simple enough concept to allow younger family members to play, however the ability to continue playing if you set up "perfect matches" allows strategies to pull off crazy and long combinations that will keep more experienced players having fun alongside them. In addition to its quick gameplay, the game lacks a true "fail" condition and players who go out on their turn are turned into audience members with a new set of actions that can still influence the rest of the "dancers" still playing for points.

-description from designer
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Humor, Party Game

name: WQRDLES: A Tactile Wordle-Like Multi-Player Word Deduction Game
description:
A Secret Word Deduction Game
Updated August 18, 2023

WQRDLES is a word guessing game for two or more players, generally aged 7+. Each player must guess their own word, one which an opponent has provided for them. All players play at once - no moderator is required.

COMPONENTS
• Dry erase decoding boards
• Dry erase markers
• Dry erase racks.
OVERVIEW
The goal of WQRDLES is to guess your own secret word - one secretly created by an opponent.
Each player thinks of a word, writes it down in secret and hides it from an opponent.
All opponents can see all secret words, except their own.
Players write down words to query against their own secret word. Any opponent compares the word against the secret word and encodes an answer in the form of X’s and O’s.
“X” means the letter is in the secret word but in the wrong spot
“O” means the letter is in the secret word and in the right spot.

INITIAL SETUP
1. Give each player a decoding board, a rack and dry erase marker.
2. Each player thinks of a five-letter word and secretly writes it on their rack.
3. Each player passes their rack upside down to the player on their right.
4. Each player carefully flips over their new rack so that it is visible by all players except their self.

GAME PLAY
Players write down a five-letter “query” word on their decoding board and pass the board to any player to decode.
The receiving player decodes the word against the other player’s secret word and returns the board.
The receiving player now examines the result and decides upon the next query word to use.
All players play simultaneously and game play can be quick.
 
DECODING & MARKING MATCHING LETTERS
Each player will be decoding the query word of an opponent. You must accurately mark each letter of the query word against the letters in the player’s secret word.
Mark an “X” for a letter that is in the word but in the wrong spot. Fill the square for a letter in the identical position.

For example, the secret word is HOUSE.
The query word is SHAPE.
Three letters are in common and the “E” is the only letter in the correct place. Fill in the box for the “E” and mark the other letters with “X”.

Optionally, indicate that the secret word is lower than SHAPE by marking “<”.

PLAY IN ROUNDS
At the start of each round, clear your decoding board, except for your score. Continue with game play as above.

SCORING
When a player guesses their word, the value in the leftmost box (1-6) is their score for the round. Add that number to the existing score and mark the current score on their decoding board.

TRACKING MISSING LETTERS
Mark the A-Z letters at the bottom of your decoding board that you have determining are not in your secret word.

ENDING THE GAME
The game is over once five rounds have been completed. The player with the highest score is the winner. In the case of a tie, erase your board (except for the score) and play one more round.

INCORRECT DECODING PENALTY
If a player incorrectly decodes their word, they cannot receive any points for that round. It is very important to be accurate in decoding your opponent’s word.

ALTERNATE WAYS TO PLAY
1. For an easier game, use four-letter words.
2. Use the < and > markers as additional clues.
< means the secret word is alphabetically lower than the query word (eg BACON < STRIP), in other words, “go lower”.
> means the secret word is alphabetically higher than the query word (eg WAGON > TRAIN ), “go higher”.

STRATEGIES
To narrow down and home in on your secret word, pick query words that alternate the known letters.

-description from designer
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Party Game, Real-time, Word Game

name: Jeu de Paume
description:
A trivia racing game commemorating the 200th anniversary of the French Revolution.

Answer questions correctly and move toward the center of the board. First to get there and answer three questions correctly, wins.

name: 300 Pop Questions: 80's
description:
A simple quiz game with 4 variations. All the games described fundamentally are won by the player who scores the most points after a pre-agreed time.

In all the slightly different games, you get two points for a correct answer. If you cannot answer the question, it is offered to the next player for 1 bonus point. The questions relate to pop music in various decades depending on which box you bought.

name: 300 Pop Questions: 70's
description:
A simple quiz game with 4 variations. All the games described fundamentally are won by the player who scores the most points after a pre-agreed time.

In all the slightly different games, you get two points for a correct answer. If you cannot answer the question, it is offered to the next player for 1 bonus point. The questions relate to pop music in various decades depending on which box you bought.

name: Machine of Death: The Game of Creative Assassination – Webcomics Chums
description:
115 expansion cards (of all types) created by 20 top webcomics artists, including Jeph Jacques, Zach Weinersmith, Ryan North, Andrew Hussie, Meredith Gran, Dylan Meconis, Jess Fink, R K Milholland, KC Green, R Stevens, and OTHERS!

Machine of Death: The Game of Creative Assassination is a storytelling game set in a world in which a machine can predict how a person will die with 100% accuracy with only a small blood sample. However, the machine delights in being vague and twisted. A card reading "Old Age" could mean you die in your sleep at age 120, or it could mean you're run over tomorrow by an elderly driver who forgot to take his pills today. Players of the game take the role of assassins, who must use the various tools at their disposal -- from storytelling to a slew of items available from specialty Black Market shops -- to create a situation in which a target is killed in a way in line with their Death Prediction. The Machine of Death Game uses this basic idea, of assassins working in a world were cause of death is known to create various game modes.

The General Gameplay of most modes works like this:

• A target is assigned, and given certain details (including Death Prediction, and possibly extra details like a favourite food or crippling phobia).
• Players – assassins – are given Black Market Gift Cards. This is their inventory, what they have to use in order to accomplish their goal: killing the target.
• Players use the Gift Cards to devise a plan.
• The plan is greenlit, either by a Chief player, or via consensus, depending on game mode.
• The timer starts and the plan is put into action. This is represented by dice rolling to beat a "difficulty score." An unlikely plan hinging on a single item may need to roll a 6 for that item, but a rock-solid intricate plan may need to only roll a 2 for all Black Market Gift Cards used.
• The plan is revised, in case of failure of one or more dice rolls. The details of this portion vary greatly from mode to mode, but involve either replacing Black Market Items, creating a new viable plan with the existing items, or calling in "Specialists"
• The target is either killed or escapes. Again, depending on mode, this is either the end of the round or the game.

Game Modes:


Head-to-Head Mode that's very similar to Cards Against Humanity or Apples to Apples. There's a judge ("the Chief"), who decides whose assassination plan is the best, and gives them a chance to try it out. Designed for 4+ playes.
Co-op Mode, where you players are a team of assassins, and have to come up with a plan together to kill targets that the group comes up with.
Co-op can be diced further: you can play individual rounds, or Mission Mode, where targets are predetermined and have different levels of difficulty. There's also the more strategic Chief Mode, where there's no timer, but the Chief can rate your plan's likelihood of success and let you take risks on whether it'll work or not.
Cutthroat Mode, where players can actually assassinate each other (should you want a more competitive version)
The Day Off Mode, which isn't about murder at all but rather draws upon your bevy of assassin skills to accomplish tasks like "opening a stuck jam jar" and "transplanting a tulip bulb."
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor

name: Tail of the Dragon (fan expansion for Tide of Iron)
description:
The Japanese attack on Pearl Harbor on December 7, 1941, was the impetus for the United States’ entrance into World War II

Tide of Iron: Tail of the Dragon, a custom fanmade expansion for Tide of Iron, features the introduction of the Japanese army and the Pacific Theatre battles, including new terrain tiles, new rules, new units, new scenarios, and fifteen new geomorphic double-sided map boards.

—description from the designer
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Töchterpensionat auf Reisen
description:
The players take turns to roll and move. They start at space 0 (home). Whoever reaches space 120 (Frankfurt a. M.) first, wins the game. At some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

The game was published as a supplement in "Das Kränzchen, 2. Jahrgang".

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: The Long Road: Action Cards
description:
Nine additional action cards released as stretch goals during the kickstarter campaign. The following cards are included:

"Breakdown"
"Stragglers" x2 cards
"Forget That!"
"Refugees" x2 cards
"Lost"
"Command Decision"
"Soften Them Up!"

These new action cards expand gameplay by adding new, unplanned events to challenge players. They were packaged together but outside/separate of the core game box.

name: Dragonvault
description:
Dragonvault is a fantasy card game for 2-8 players created by The Dragonfather. First Edition was a limited run and all current decks are Second Edition.

Each player chooses a champion. Then, they take turns drawing from a central deck, collecting treasure and facing greedy dragons, dangerous traps and other perils.

name: Loop House
description:
Loop House is a deduction micro game. The current version is for 3-4 players. Players act the invited visitors to the house and attempt to find the most valuable itmes in the house.

In each turn, players choose one action card from their hands and show the cards simultaneously. Then, perform the played action card by the room order. The players may take one item from the room, or use one item in hand, or exchange the items from the room.

After 3 rounds(days), the player with the most valuable items win the game.

-description from designer

name: Atererozoic
description:
Atererozoic is a micro game for combining with the Ai drawings. Players attempt to find out the most powerful creatures and the unique artifacts. The player with the most victory point is the winner.

During the turn, players may either choose to draw a card from the deck, or choose the opponent to battle, if the active player have two hands.

Before the battle, the defender may perform the power of the artifact first. Then the attacker may perform their artifact. Then both players evaluate the streghth of both creatures and determine who win the battle.

—description from the designer

name: Detective Ray vs P the thief
description:
Detective Ray vs P the thief is a mirco game for 150 bg convention. The concept is from my 5 years old son. Keep the core the game and extend the game play by creating 2 more expansions for the game.

Base game:
Start player flips the card. If the flipped cards are 3 in row, the the active player win the game. If not, the opponent close the eyes and the active player must reorganise the flipped cards and flip them over. The game continues unitl the end confidtion is meet.

Tool Expansion:
During the setup, the players randomly choose a tool card. They can use the power of the tool card the whole game.

3/4 players Expansion:
Add 7 cards to the base game. The players may guess who is the thief during the turn.

Mission Expansion:
During the setup, the players randomly choose 2 mission cards. If they flip the cards set as same as the mission card, the players finish the mission card and gain one victory point. The player who is the first player gain 2 victory points wins the game.

—description from the designer

name: A General Game of Pyrates!
description:
A General Game of Pyrates is a solitaire game of swashbuckling adventure set during the golden age of the buccaneers and pirates roving the Caribbean Sea between 1630-1730. You will lead your crew and become the most wealth or famous (or both!) pirate crew sailing the Spanish Main. You will need to track prizes, divvy up plunder, and piece together treasure maps to chart your route to Fame and Fortune, all while trying to avoid the hangman's noose!

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Nautical, Pirates, Print & Play

name: Seasons of a Tree
description:
A trick-taking game where the trump suit can change with the seasons. Anytime you cannot follow a suit card (i.e. Summer) you can play a card of the next season (Fall) to change the trump.

But beware the Ax cards; if a trick has one of those, you lose all the trees in that trick!

—description from the publisher

name: Kingdomess
description:
Kingdomess is the micro card game for 150 bg convention.

The players attempt to build the most prestigious kingdom by laying kingdom cards. During the game, they may attack opponents' kingdoms by laying their cards onto the opponents' kingdom cards. The greatest king is the one who have the most victory point in the end of the game.

In player's turn, player either player one card from their hands, or upgrade one card which is not stacked by the other cards. The required resources are paid by removing the cubes in their own kingdom.

The game ends when all players pass.

—description from the designer

name: Andromeda Run
description:
A card game where players race to complete the Andromeda Run, with as much cargo as possible. Players command a Flagship with different strengths and weaknesses, expanding their fleet and capabilities as they overcome obstacles and events to race to the finish, set in the Andromeda Galaxy.

Every turn players take turns in drawing cards, and playing them. These cards could take the form of distance traveled, upgrades to their ship, cargo or extra ships for their fleet. Events occur which the player or players (depending on conflict mode or not) overcome for rewards.

The Game ends when a fleet arrives at the target distance traveled. The players are given bonus points depending on how far they have traveled or how much cargo they have brought with them. The highest score wins.

-description from designer

name: Railway Rivals Map E: Atlantic & Lake Erie (1980/85)
description: Game board size: 59,5 x 41.5 cm

name: Geomondo
description:
It's possible to know the most amazing corners of the world in a simple and super fun way!
Geomundo, a boardgame that teach us new things about different world territories.

How to play Geomundo?
Take a card and try to find out where that particular place is.
If you get it right, you will be able to answer a question related to the geography or culture of the place being presented in the card.

If you are right, you win that card and add a point on your passport “stamp”.

So, in addition to having fun, you'll learn new information about cities, monuments and countries that are part of Geomundo's 90 photos journey!
mechanics: Die Icon Resolution, Questions and Answers

name: The Naval SITREP The Journal of Naval Miniatures Wargaming #2
description:
The Naval SITREP is published twice a year by the Admiralty Trilogy Group. It supports the Admiralty Trilogy game system with scenarios, articles on history and technology, and rules expansions & corrections.

The Naval SITREP Issue #2 was published in January 1995.

Table of contents:

Folloup Strike Packages Udbina
Command at Sea Errata
Haarpoon IV scenario: Korean Counter
Tomahawk Targeting
Viking Forge Productline
Carrier Homeporting changes
Platfor Specifications:
French Charles de Gaulle Class
French Rafale M
US Fletcher Class
US SBD-4 Dauntless
categories: Aviation / Flight, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Nautical, Wargame, World War I, World War II

name: Heists in Hyperspace
description:
Get the crew together - we're going on a Heist!
Heists in Hyperspace is a tabletop card game for 2-4 players. As Captain, assemble your treasure-hunting crew and make the right decisions to claim Treasures before your rival Captains do!

Each game spans three Expeditions. Each round, players take turns choosing an Encounter card to land on. You begin at the Intergalactic Bazaar, gathering and equipping your crew of Mercenaries, before setting course for the perilous corridors of the Treasure Vault.

A Vault Card is selected at the beginning of each game. Each Vault brings its own unique twist to the table, creating interesting ways for players to sabotage, deceive and outmaneuver their opponents.

After the third Expedition, the player who has gained the most Renown - through heisting Treasures, hiring notorious mercenaries and fulfilling their Ambitions - is the most accomplished Captain, and is declared the winner!

—description from the publisher

name: The Naval SITREP: The Journal of Naval Miniatures Wargaming #3
description:
The Naval SITREP is published twice a year by the Admiralty Trilogy Group. It supports the Admiralty Trilogy game system with scenarios, articles on history and technology, and rules expansions & corrections.

The Naval SITREP Issue #3 was published in April 1995.

Table of contents:
Command at Sea Scenario: A raider´s battle
Kitbash Corner
Russian subs: the next generation
Command at Sea Errata II
The Convergence Zone
Convention schedule
Platform Specifications:
Russian Project 636 sub
US MV-22 Osprey
German Komoran Raider
German Ar 196
categories: Aviation / Flight, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Nautical, Wargame, World War I, World War II

name: Wild West Rush
description:
Wild West Rush is a racing game where the players are characters from the Old West. Each character has a special ability that gives him/her an advantage during the game and the objective of the game is to be the first player to complete two laps around the board.
The players roll the dice and move forward the number of squares indicated by the value of the dice. When they land on a trapped square, the players must fulfil the consequence of the square. The players decide when they want to use their special ability, as long as they do so on their turn and before they roll the dice, and furthermore, the players can only use their special ability once during the entire game.

—description from the publisher

name: Solar Century
description:
Solar Century is a heavy strategy game with combinative card play that aims to capture the political theatre of interplanetary colonization on a grand scale.

Players act as the Council of the Imperator who rules the solar system. Each turn marks the passing of ten unified solar years.

Starting the game, the Council drafts four colonies who send their leaders to explore and conquer planets. Players wield influence over these colony leaders to initiate actions and they have a century to prove themself to the Imperator or take over its Seat.

Each round has three phases:
- AUDIENCE: ask the Imperator to send agents to a region of the solar system,
- COLONIZATION: either make alliances or wield influence on an ally to initiate and action up to two times,
- SOLSTICE: develop a colony and prepare for the next turn.

A player within the Council wins with
- the most influence over the colony, which controls at least six planets at the end of a round (absolute win) or
- the most victory points at the end of the century (capital win).

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Civilization, Economic, Political, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Territory Building, Wargame
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Closed Drafting, Modular Board, Pieces as Map, Trading, Turn Order: Stat-Based

name: Someecards The Game
description:
Introducing the adult party game from somewhat internationally acclaimed humor brand Someecards.
Compete with your friends and frenemies to create the funniest Someecards.
Each box contains 75 Someecards, 360 Caption cards, and 1 Instruction card. With 27,000 possible combinations you'll have years of fun.
It's the game where everyone's a winner, except for the people who lose.

name: The Maze Explorers: Arctic World
description:
Find your way out of an arctic maze using your wits, fishing pole and a limited supply of fish.

You and your fellow intrepid explorers are off to explore an arctic maze. Using only your wits, a fishing pole and a limited supply of fish you must create and navigate a maze path to find the way out. You will encounter twists and turns, polar bears and ice. You may even find yourself stranded on an ice floe, but you can be the hero of the group by being the first one to expose the maze path and find the exit!

Your Goal: Create a complete, unbroken maze path between the Maze Entrance and the Maze Exit and be the first Explorer to exit the maze. However, be careful not to get stranded in the maze without fish to eat and to keep the polar bears away!

Exploring the Maze:
Your maze exploration starts by shuffling all the maze tiles facedown and placing them on the table in front of you, being sure to connect at least one edge of each tile to another. You will then roll one or two dice to move over the tiles, turn them faceup, rotate them, and uncover the maze before you run out of your limited supply of fish.

Along the way you will search for the hidden exit while also encountering various artifacts. Some artifacts, like the fishing holes, will help you to continue your explorations, others, like the polar bear, are not so helpful!

This is a fun, easy-to-learn game that's different each time you play. Winning this game will require you to adapt your strategy at various stages in the game.

The Maze Explorers Trilogy!

The Maze Explorers is a series of worlds each with its own set of unique artifacts and challenges. Each world can be played on its own or combined into a larger world (see the "Related Games" at the top of this page). Stay tuned to the keithkunstgames.com web site and watch for the "Multi-World Explorer" update that will allow you to play the combined version of all three worlds.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Semi-Cooperative Game, Tile Placement, Variable Set-up

name: The Naval SITREP: The Journal of Naval Miniatures Wargaming #4
description:
The Naval SITREP is published twice a year by the Admiralty Trilogy Group. It supports the Admiralty Trilogy game system (Fear God and Dread Naught, Command at Sea and Harpoon) with scenarios, articles on history and technology, and rules expansions & corrections.

The Naval SITREP Issue #4 was published in July 1995.

Table of contents:
Harpoon Scenario: Split Personality
Command at Sea: 2nd Edition Gun Rules
KItbash corner: The Canadian Rivers
Platforms Specifications:
German type 212
Indian Mig 21-93 Fishbed
US Elco PT boat
US MArtin M139HW
categories: Aviation / Flight, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Nautical, Wargame, World War I, World War II

name: Shugo
description:
Shugo is a lite strategy game set in a fantasy landscape where players can choose among mythical warrior factions in order to control the battlefield.

For a player to win, they must set a straight line (horizontal, vertical or diagonal) with the cards of their deck in a 5x5 square.

In each turn, the player can play a warrior or action card. Warriors will be put on the battlefield, trying to complete the straigth line. Action cards will improve conditions to reach the winning goal or will make obstacles for the oponent.

Depending on which faction you play as, your attack strategy will greatly differ:

Amazons: A tactical and aggressive faction, whose main focus is to destroy enemy warriors, removing those cards from the battlefield.

Knights: A protective faction that relies in resistance and pushing over other cards from desired positions in the battlefield.

Wizards: A strategic faction that alters the battlefield to win their objectives, locking desired positions or displacing warriors across the battlefield.

Undead: A dreadful faction that bases its power in Turning enemies into skeletons at its service.

—description from the publisher

name: Coloring Battle Cards
description:
Coloring Battle Cards is a Trading Card Game that uses very simple rules and cards you can color and battle with your friends.

Each player requires their own deck to play.

(Description from the starter deck packaging)

Each player's deck consists of attack cards and defense cards, ranging in value from 1 to 5, and a single Character card representing the player's persona during the game.

On each player's turn, they draw up to 3 cards in hand, then they may choose to play an attack card and select an opponent to attack. The defender may then choose a defense card to play. If the defense card equals or exceeds the attack card, the defender takes no damage. If the attack card is greater, the difference between the attack and defense card is discarded from the top of the defender's draw pile as damage. A player may make up to three such attacks on their turn, then discard any cards they do not want to keep.

Play proceeds left around the table. Each player whose draw deck is emptied is eliminated, and the last player with cards in their draw pile wins.

name: Escape from Arrow Caverns
description:
Turn the cave to your advantage in Escape from Arrow Caverns, a single-player strategy game which challenges the player to search for buried treasures while planning their escape route out of a collapsing cave network. You'll need to plan carefully as you help a team of spelunkers through an increasingly-perilous maze of unstable caverns.

During the player's turns, there are several phases. They first direct their team of spelunkers to explores the cave's caverns using limited movement cards. They must follow the arrows on each cavern's floor. Second, each spelunker surveys their occupied caverns by rotating the arrow. But be careful--once each cavern can only be moved once! Third, each spelunker excavates their caverns to search for buried treasure. However, each time a cavern is excavated, it becomes unstable! If they linger on that cavern in the future, the entire cave will collapse, and the player will lose!

Finally, after revealing all four of the buried treasures, each spelunker must return to starting Daylight cavern and escape before the end of the seventh turn. If they can do this, then the player wins!

Can you explore the cave, excavate all four treasures, and lead your team to safety before Arrow Caverns collapses?

—description from the designer
mechanics: Grid Movement, Map Deformation, Map Reduction, Modular Board, Resource to Move, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid

name: 1マス先は闇 (The future is a closed tiles)
description:
Backgammon-based board game
The first player to complete a circle of 28 squares from the beginning to the end wins!
