To move forward, use the tiles from 1 to 4 and the dice.
When a tile is used, the square advances by the number of the tile.
Then, the used number tiles are temporarily disabled.
(The number of ways to move forward narrows as the game progresses).

The effect is activated by flipping over the square you have advanced.
There are 14 types of effects, including ”the effect to advance oneself by one square” and ”the effect to change the opponent's position” and so on.
Aim for the top while activating the various effects!

There is one important thing to remember!
What happens if you pass the goal?
Let's go around again to get to the end.

—description from the publisher

name: ゴモクタイル (Gomoku tile)
description:
This is a game of Five-in-a-Row in which five or more stones of the player's own color.
There are squares with an "X" on them, which are obstacles for both players.

The background of the tiles can be white or gray.
When placing a tile, the color of that square has to be checkered.
It is possible to be on the verge of a fifth square, but not be able to place it because of the tiles.

—description from the publisher

name: BelloLudi Pikes
description:
This ruleset simulates battles in the period of 1530 to roughly 1660 AD. A time when tremendous changes took place in the field of warfare. The advent of gunpowder transformed the way in which armies fought on the battlefield, bringing more and more gunpowder weapons to bare. Slowly changing from massed troop formations to more linear tactics. Empires were forged, colonies were taken and feudal warfare slowly gave way to more national conflicts. These rules can be used for the English Civil War, the various Wars of Religion, the 80 and 30 Years’ Wars and many others.

-description from publisher's website
categories: Book, Miniatures, Pike and Shot, Wargame

name: Radio Game
description:
This card game, not dissimilar from gin rummy, includes 56 cards: 48 cards bear the call signs of real radio stations throughout the USA, as well as some international stations; there are also four S.O.S. cards and four "Listening In" cards, which have special rules. The winner is the first to score 500 points.

The game was copyrighted 1923, but had already been relegated to a list of budget (30 cent) party or family games in the 1925, 1927, and 1928 Parker Brothers catalogs. It does not appear again following the 1928 catalog.

Note: national radio broadcasts were new and trendy in the early 1920s, inspiring many games with similar titles. This is NOT the same game as Game of Radio (1924), Milton Bradley's Radio Game (1925), or All-Fair's Toon-in Radio Game (1925) or Radio Game for Little Folks (1926), all of which are separate and distinct products.

name: Reversal
description:
Reversal is a Reversi game.

This is mixed elements of shogi pieces. Some tiles can be flipped over by pinching both ends of the tiles, while others have a unique way of flipping over. It is hard to decide which tile to use and when. It is a game where reversals occur with every move.

There are two main types of tiles:
Normal tiles: Tiles are turned over if the end of the row or column is a tile of your color, just like in reversi.
Ability tiles: Tiles are turned over in the direction of the "▲" or "line" on the tile.
The color of the tile to be flipped over is not distinguished.
If your ability tile is flipped over, you lose points and it becomes a tile of your opponent's color, but you can find the difference.
Also, each ability tile has its own points.

There are two rules you can play by

(1) Point rule
At the end of the game, the player with the higher point total of the ability tiles of his/her color that are turned over wins!

(2) Majority Rule
The player with the highest number of tiles of his/her color on the table at the end of the game wins!

—description from the publisher

name: Dice-ki
description:
"The die is not cast."
Dice are used as pieces, but no dice are rolled.
It is a Shogi-like board game focusing on the position of the "●" on the die.

The premise of this game is "number of dice rolls = points upon winning".

There are three conditions for winning
(1) The total number of die rolls won exceeds 10.
(2) Two consecutive dice with the same number of dice are taken.
(3) Taking 3 of your opponent's dice.

The first player to achieve this wins the game.

However, this game is unique in the way the dice are moved.
The position of the "●" on the die's eye is the range of the die's movement.
For example, if the die is a 4, it is a die that moves one square to each of the four corners.
If the die has a "●" in the center (1, 3, or 5), it will advance one square to the opponent's side.

When and how many squares are to be advanced, and which way the dice are to be turned?
This is an abstract game where you have to make careful decisions.

—description from the publisher

name: The Naval SITREP: The Journal of Naval Miniatures Wargaming #5
description:
The Naval SITREP is published twice a year by the Admiralty Trilogy Group. It supports the Admiralty Trilogy game system (Fear God and Dread Naught, Command at Sea and Harpoon) with scenarios, articles on history and technology, and rules expansions & corrections.

The Naval SITREP Issue #5 was published in October 1995.

Table of contents:
Command at Sea scenario: Graff Spee's greatest battle
Korean counter correction
Northeast gaming group
Merchan ships size classes
HNR: Request for Submissions
China's small step foward
Wake isand defense update
Surface ship torpedo defense
Scenario component checklist
Kitbash corner an upgraded Graff Spee
Platform Specifcations
Chinese Zhanjiang class
Chinese F-8 II Finback B
German Graff Spee
British Short Sunderland
categories: Aviation / Flight, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Nautical, Wargame, World War I, World War II

name: Mafia: Miasto intryg
description:
1920s, USA. The inhabitants of the small town of Sales do not know that there is a mafia in their midst doing its dirty business. Will the citizens manage to expose its members in time and foil their plans? The winner is the person remaining in the game, or all the members of the winning faction. Mafia - City of Intrigue is a social game for a group of 7 to 19 players, full of secret identities, bluff and manipulation.

—description from the publisher

Lata 20. XX wieku, USA. Mieszkańcy małego miasteczka Sales nie wiedzą, że wśród nich działa mafia, która czyni swoje brudne interesy. Czy obywatelom uda się w porę zdemaskować jej członków i pokrzyżować ich plany? Wygrywają osoby pozostałe w grze, lub wszyscy członkowie zwycięskiej frakcji. Mafia - Miasto Intryg to gra towarzyska dla grupy od 7 do 19 graczy, pełna sekretnych tożsamości, blefu i manipulacji.

—description from the publisher (Polish)

1920er Jahre, USA. Die Einwohner der Kleinstadt Sales wissen nicht, dass die Mafia in ihrer Mitte ihr Unwesen treibt. Wird es den Bürgern gelingen, ihre Mitglieder rechtzeitig zu entlarven und ihre Pläne zu vereiteln? Der Gewinner ist die Person, die im Spiel bleibt, oder alle Mitglieder der siegreichen Fraktion. Mafia - City of Intrigue ist ein Gesellschaftsspiel für eine Gruppe von 7 bis 19 Spielern, voller geheimer Identitäten, Bluff und Manipulation.

—description from the publisher (German)
categories: Deduction, Mafia, Murder/Mystery, Negotiation, Party Game, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Alliances, Communication Limits, Deduction, Hidden Roles, Negotiation, Player Elimination, Player Judge, Role Playing, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: Growbot Smash
description:
Combine cubes into robots!

Smash smaller robots in front of you, block the smaller robots behind you!

First person to make it around the board wins.

Burn cubes to move faster!

A roll-and-move game with some meaningful decisions. Given away for free on 1st August ('Bezday') 2022 to anyone subscribing to Bez's mailing list.

Includes rules for a legacy-style campaign where the board evolves after each game.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Roll and Safari
description:
You are on a safari trying to photograph and research animals. Travel around the map to get in the best position in order to take the best picture.

The game is played over 13 rounds, with players playing simultaneously, trying to earn the most points by moving around the hexagon map and photographing animals.

Each Round you will roll 3 dice and then use those dice to move your safari car a certain direction, travel a specific distance, and then photograph in a certain direction. Try to move to the best spot and angle your camera the best direction to get the most points.

Visit Watering Holes to score extra points, photograph the round's featured animal to gain extra bonuses, and collect camera lenses to upgrade your camera and increase your photograph distance.

With just three dice and one printed paged, you will have a blast on your safari adventure rolling and photographing beautiful animals.

-description from designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Pluzzables: Movies
description:
Pluzzables are “playable puzzles” - a collection of puzzles you play as games after assembly. Additionally, several web apps come with the game for simpler "match and claim" or discovery games.

The Movies edition is a puzzle of a large collection of vintage movie posters. After assembly, the puzzle becomes a board game where players use web apps to play "Movie Madness", "Movie Match" and "Claim to Fame".

With the "Movie Match" web app, players compete to find specific posters in the puzzle shown by the app. However, something is missing and players must correctly tap the matching button to score. Score one point for every correct match. Lose three points for a miss.

With the "Mad About Movies" web app, players claim movie posters matching certain attributes.

—description from the publisher

name: Citymagine
description:
Citymagine is a cooperative boardgame in which each team manages one of the six neighbourhoods that together constitute a city.

Starting with urban problems (mobility, supply, pollution, promiscuity - sometimes accompanied by a lack of social ties), the participants reflect on their consumption patterns.

What is their project for society? What kind of world should we build for tomorrow? How can we invent other ways of living? Through these questions, "Citymagine" proposes to tell a new story for their city.

By involving their citizens, each neighbourhood will have to cooperate with other neighbourhoods to establish connexions between them to avoid hazards and to realize (common) deeds to decrease the ecological danger level of the planet to make it habitable again.

—description from the publisher

Each team starts with a number of inhabitants (meeples) and a number of hexes representing activities, which can be from the neighbourhood (use the team's inhabitants only) or common (inhabitants from other neighbourhood can participate if you manage to convince them).

Each round, teams can develop activities (placing an hexagon in the neighbourhood for each activity), each of them requiring a number of inhabitants; some inhabitants will only be needed to launch the activity (and can be reused next turn) while others will be occupied with the activity until the end of the game. At the end of each round, new inhabitants from the neighbourhood are recruited (1d6), allowing the teams to develop their neighbourhood further. After 5 rounds, players win if they manage to lower the ecological danger (whose level is represented on the wheel) to zero. There is an optional module (a kiosk) which requires an extra condition to win the game: 18 connexions between neighbourhoods must be made.

—user summary

name: Pluzzables: Road Trip
description:
Pluzzables are “playable puzzles” - a collection of puzzles you play as games after assembly. Additionally, several web apps come with the game for simpler "match and claim", discovery or educational (math) games.

The Road Trip edition is a puzzle of 330 vintage North American license plates. After assembly, the puzzle becomes a board game where players use web apps to play several games like:

Road Trip: Find differences hidden between the puzzle and images shown in the app.

Plate Collector: Claim territory by matching contiguous plates to attributes revealed by the app.

License Plate Math: Find plates that match simple math equations generated by the app.

—description from the publisher

name: AMBUSH
description:
AMBUSH is an abstract board game designed largely on the use of the primitive shape - Triangle

The core object of AMBUSH is to colonise as many of your opponent's game tiles as possible.

You have to surround an opponent's triangular tile with 3 pieces of your own to colonise.

Build a prism token of yours on the opponent tile to signify your colony.

—description from the designer

name: Carnival Connect
description:
Carnival Connect is a light-medium weight game, where neighbouring players must work together to build a shared Carnival, despite having different agendas!

Neighbouring players must plan and co-operate together if they are to put together just the right combination of colours, rides and train tracks to bag multiple bonus objective points. However, every player has their own scoring agenda in the form of the types of rides to build. Not only does the Carnival have limited space, but each round an old ride must be demolished to make way for new development.

How far will players be willing to demolish their scoring rides for a common goal? What negotiation skills and mind games will they bring into play? And how long will they work together amicably before the thought of demolishing their neighbour's high scoring rides becomes a juicy option?

At the end of the game, players are awarded points for the bonus objectives their Carnivals have bagged, combined with the number of rides from their scoring agenda that they have built into those Carnivals. The player with the highest total score wins!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Modular Board, Negotiation, Pattern Building, Semi-Cooperative Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: The Naval SITREP: The Journal of Naval Miniatures Wargaming #6
description:
The Naval SITREP is published twice a year by the Admiralty Trilogy Group. It supports the Admiralty Trilogy game system (Fear God and Dread Naught, Command at Sea and Harpoon) with scenarios, articles on history and technology, and rules expansions & corrections.

The Naval SITREP Issue #6 was published in January 1996.

Table of contents:
Harpoon scenario: Sea of Fire part 1
Miura SLT specs
The Laws of the Navy
F-8 II Finback folloup
Mounting aircraft miniaturees
Sighting torpedo launches
CVBG components
Helmet-mounted sights
Naming ships
Corrections:
Graff Spee Form 10
Platform Specifications:
Japanese Kongo Class
Japanese F4EJ Kai
categories: Aviation / Flight, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Nautical, Wargame, World War I, World War II

name: Lehigh Valley In A Box
description:
Romantic covered bridges, rich Moravian heritage, and a door to the beginning of the industrial revolution, welcome to the Lehigh Valley! A treasure of nostalgia, culture and modern industry, she is also a region of natural splendor. Music is celebrated, wine is relished, and colors are born here. In this valley lies a one-of-a-kind sense of challenge on the Appalachian Trail, in the Velodrome, and in the river itself. The Lehigh Valley holds within it the glory of all that was, all that is, and all that will be. Advertising space was not for sale on this game. The board includes authentic landmarks only.

Uses the same mechanics and rules as standard Monopoly.
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Klettermaxe
description:
The wall of the house is divided into 64 spaces, of which 32 are represented by windows. There is climbing on the 32 sections of wall. The following are involved in the game: 4 police officers and Klettermaxe (cat burglar).
At the beginning of the game, the 4 policemen are hanging on the four lowest wall sections. Klettermaxe can start wherever he wants.
Klettermaxe and each policeman climb alternately by 1 space. Klettermaxe can go back and forth. The cops can only go forward.
If Klettermaxe manages to slip through the police chain, he wins. If he is trapped in such a way that he can no longer make a climbing move, the policeman who made the last move is the winner and may play Klettermaxe in the next game.
The game can be played by 2, 3 or 5 players, with 2 players one takes all 4 policemen, with 3 players 2 take 2 policemen each.

The game was published about 1950.

—user summary
mechanics: Grid Movement, Square Grid, Variable Player Powers

name: Make Your Words Count!
description:
Make Your Words Count! Game
Object of the Game: To be the first player to 100 points/high score by using the cards in hand (5 or 7 cards dealt) to make words.

How to Play: Choose a dealer.

Community Vowel cards (A, E, I, O, U) will be laid out by the dealer on the playing board.
Each Community Vowel can be used once per round when making words.
Dealer will then shuffle remaining cards & deal 5 or 7 cards to each player to make their best word.
After dealing cards to each player, the remaining cards will be placed faced down in a pile to pick from each round.
Each round, players will make their own words by using the cards in their hand and/or Community Vowels on the playing board.
Each player will display their created words to earn points based on value of each card.



Keep track of the scores. For example, if you have the letters W, R, D, S & T in hand & the Community Vowels are A, E, I, O and U, you can make W O R D S from the letters in hand and O from the Community Vowels. Since W = 4, O = 0 (Community Vowel), R = 1, D = 2 and S = 1, the point total equals 8 (i.e. 4+1+2+1) for the round. Each player will have 30 seconds to make a word each round.
For the next round, pick up the number of cards used from the pile.
You can discard up to two cards per round (can still play the round).
Use all cards in hand = 20 more points!
Go to alphaearlapps.com for word lists.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Word Game
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Solo / Solitaire Game, Spelling

name: Spy Sight
description:
There are spies in our midst. Your mission: to use strategy, suspicion and logic to expose your opponent's spy before your spy is captured!!!

Uncover pieces by jumping over them. Use your Suspicion cards wisely to hazard a guess when you think you've spotted your opponent's Spy location.

Confuse your opponent by moving your pieces around and most of all protect your Spy from being exposed!

Use courage, intelligence, suspicion and logic to find and expose your opponent's Spy and WIN!

name: Game Against Wolf
description: A "Teen Wolf" themed adaptation of Cards Against Humanity using the same game mechanics.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Judge, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: The Naval SITREP: The Journal of Naval Miniatures Wargaming #7
description:
The Naval SITREP is published twice a year by the Admiralty Trilogy Group. It supports the Admiralty Trilogy game system (Fear God and Dread Naught, Command at Sea and Harpoon) with scenarios, articles on history and technology, and rules expansions & corrections.

categories: Aviation / Flight, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Nautical, Wargame, World War I, World War II

name: Ein lustiges Pilzesuchen
description:
All 40 mushrooms are placed on any red dots on the game board.
The players take turns to roll and move. The goal of the game is to collect as much musrooms as possible. When all mushrooms have been collected, the colors on the bottom are revealed and the players get different points for each color. The player with the most points wins the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: The Naval SITREP: The Journal of Naval Miniatures Wargaming #8
description:
The Naval SITREP is published twice a year by the Admiralty Trilogy Group. It supports the Admiralty Trilogy game system (Fear God and Dread Naught, Command at Sea and Harpoon) with scenarios, articles on history and technology, and rules expansions & corrections.

The Naval SITREP Issue #8 was published in July 1996.

categories: Aviation / Flight, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Nautical, Wargame, World War I, World War II

name: Maul
description:
Maul is a competitive two-player card game with a fantasy theme, based on a tournament between two rival teams. Each team is comprised of 10 players that have varied skills and attributes to suit their position/role.

Players battle through 6 rounds of full-contact action, with the team holding the Detonator at the end of each round gaining points. The team with the most points after 6 rounds wins.

The play area has 5 slots on each side that are available for players, and the location of the cards in relation to each other determine how they can interact. Turn-based actions such as passing, supporting, and hitting are taken, and can be backed up with Boost cards that have different effects on play or players!

—description from the publisher

name: Above the Clouds!: Red Stars
description:
Red Stars is an Aircraft Pack expansion for the "Above the Clouds!" air-combat miniature wargame rules. Red Stars provides the Russian aircraft performance displays (APDs) required for the encounters of the Russo-German Air War during 1942-1945, as well as some new German APDs for aircraft which were used nearly exclusively on the Russian front.

Red Stars includes the following 20 APDs:
Soviet: Il-2, Il-2 Type 3M,Il-2M, Il-4 (aka DB-3F), Il-10, LaGG-3, La-5, La-5FN, La-7, MiG-1, MiG-3, P-39 Kobra, Pe-2, Yak-1, Yak-3, Yak-9, Yak-9U

German: Fw-189, Hs-129, Ju-87G

name: U-Boot-Krieg
description: The players take turns to roll and move. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. The first player to reach space 50 to sink the "Warsprite" wins the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: The Naval SITREP: The Journal of Naval Miniatures Wargaming #9
description:
The Naval SITREP is published twice a year by the Admiralty Trilogy Group. It supports the Admiralty Trilogy game system (Fear God and Dread Naught, Command at Sea and Harpoon) with scenarios, articles on history and technology, and rules expansions & corrections.

The Naval SITREP Issue #9 was published in October 1996.

Table of contents:
New Russian SSBN Class
Command at Sea Scenario: Looking for Trouble
Egyptian Romeo Update
Harpoon IV Rules Summary
If you have an earlier edition of Harpoon...
Command at Sea Corrections: Air Attack Tables
Platforms Specifications:
Australian FF HMAS ANzac
Taiwanese Ching-Kuo Fighter
British Carrier HMS Indomitable
British Skua Dive Bomber
categories: Aviation / Flight, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Nautical, Wargame, World War I, World War II

name: Dragonath
description:
Dragonath is an asymmetric strategy wargame for 2 players in which you will control a civilization with their own abilities and outplay your opponent in search of your Dragon’s Favor.

The multiple ways of gaining and losing Favor ensures each match is always unique. Customize your Reserve of Legions and Settlements and summon the Legends: powerful characters with a Mission that provides an additional way to gain favor points.

Conquer the randomly generated map and boost your strategy with economic and military feats.

When playing Dragonath you will enjoy a challenging and dynamic wargame set in a vibrant fantasy world.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Zone of Control

name: Helorian Battles
description:
Helorian Battles is a points based deck construction card game where two-players battle for territory in Heloria!

Points based deck construction is the very core of this game. Two players agree on a maximum point total before playing, and they both construct decks not to exceed this point total.

Every card in the game takes one action to play. This means players can play their most powerful card on turn one if drawn. Each player gets 3 actions & 3 attack actions each turn to play cards and attack opponents.

Players may also expand to additional locations for more health, creating a dynamic battlefield of multiple locations to attack end defend.

The first player to reduce their opponent to zero health at the end of their turn wins.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Deck Construction, Hand Management, Interrupts, Take That

name: Stollis
description:
Stollis is an abstract tile laying & pattern recognition game in which 2-6 players try to align their polyomino shaped pieces with pieces that have been previously played to gain points. Players should pay attention to what pieces your opponents will play on their turn, so they don't set their opponents up for more points.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Modular Board, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: Splatter
description:
Splatter! is a trick taking card game based off of the theme of the ever-classic amphibious arcade game. But the twist is that instead of playing the frog, you are the car. For that matter, all players are cars-competing to splat that blasted frog!

Players play tricks, earning and building up their stock pile of ammunition and weapons to better help them splat that frog once and for all. Of course the frog, Splatter, comes with 6 lives so he can handle quite a bit. Players earn victory points by winning the trick when they are in position to do so (by being next to the frog when they win a trick). If a player wins a trick and is next to the frog, they eliminated one of the frog's lives and earns a pink wedge victory point.

The game is over after 10 rounds or when the frog is out of lives, whichever comes first. Whoever has the most 'froggy bits' (pink wedge pieces) wins the game!

—description from the publisher

name: Um die Kopje
description:
The playing consists of a square grid, on which two enemy commandos face each other. The one in A is the red command, the other in B is the blue command. In the middle is a kopje to fight for possession of. The winning command is the first to occupy the 5 squares framed with the color of the command. 9 figures of each color are required, which are placed on the spaces marked by colored discs. A move consists of either moving a piece one space, in any direction, or letting the piece make a single jump or a continuous jump. Only your own pieces can jump up to the squares of your color, where you have to pass between the enemy pieces, you naturally also jump over the opponent's pieces. If a command has succeeded in occupying one of the 5 squares of its color with one of its figures, the opponent loses a figure. Pieces that have already been placed on the squares of his color may not be removed. So it can only happen five times that one opponent takes pieces from the other, and that's the end of the game, because the command that only has 4 pieces left in the field can no longer occupy the kopje completely.

The game is set during the second Boer War (South African War 1899-1902).

—user summary

name: The Naval SITREP: The Journal of Naval Miniatures Wargaming #10
description:
The Naval SITREP is published twice a year by the Admiralty Trilogy Group. It supports the Admiralty Trilogy game system (Fear God and Dread Naught, Command at Sea and Harpoon) with scenarios, articles on history and technology, and rules expansions & corrections.

The Naval SITREP Issue #10 was published in January 1997.

Harpoon Scenario: ASW in the 90's
1997 convention schedule
Harpoon IV Correction Annex: M3 Sonar Range Bands

Platforms Specifications:

Swedish JAS 39 Gripen fighter
American Airship USS Macon
American F9C Sparrowhawk
categories: Aviation / Flight, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Nautical, Wargame, World War I, World War II

name: Clash of Deck N°6
description:
Clash of Deck is an evolving do-it-yourself card game. This is the fifth expansion of the game. Each month, a new expansion is released, which allows you to create new decks and thus increase the replayability of the game.

In Clash of Deck, you play as a Sorcerer Lord whose objective is to take control of the safest islands of the Erret Archipelago. To do this you will have to fight other Witchlords.

This expansion is made up of 16 new cards as well as 2 new visuals of Bridge cards. In this stand-alone expansion, you can pay HP to summon cards, gain mana more easily and heal thanks to new powers.

name: Clash of Deck N°7
description:
Clash of Deck is an evolving do-it-yourself card game. This is the fifth expansion of the game. Each month, a new expansion is released, which allows you to create new decks and thus increase the replayability of the game.

In Clash of Deck, you play as a Sorcerer Lord whose objective is to take control of the safest islands of the Erret Archipelago. To do this you will have to fight other Witchlords.

This expansion is made up of 16 new cards as well as 2 new visuals of Bridge cards. In this stand-alone expansion, you will counter-attack, combine cards and inflict overkill damage to the tower, thanks to new powers.

name: Cellulose: A Plant Cell Biology Game – Coconut Scenario
description:
New Scenario for Cellulose that adds a push-your-luck scoring mechanism to building carbohydrates. Each player has a Coconut that they can fill with Carbohydrates as they build them. At the beginning of each round, players score points for Carbohydrates on their Coconuts and roll a dice. Any player with at least as many Carbs as the dice rolls must move 1 of their Carbs to the Cell Wall, then discard the rest.

Initially released with Dice Tower Kickstarter.

—description from the designer

name: Zirkus Hoppla
description: The players take turns to roll and move. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. The first player to reach space 50 wins the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Fest-Schießen
description:
The small colored circles and the figures in the lower right and left corners are cut out; the former serve as game pieces, the latter as disc figures. Each player pays 10 tokens into the till. The players take turns to roll and move. Whoever hits a disc center first receives 2 tokens from the till, places the figure that shows this number on the upper edge of the disc and moves his token onto this number. Those who hit the center of a disc that is already occupied, remain there until the next throw and receive 1 token from the till as a consolation prize.
If a player gets to 48, he has to start over and loses the disc figures he already has placed, but not the tokens he received for them.
The last throw must show so many points that you just reach 70, otherwise the player returns from 70 as many squares as he rolled over 70. Whoever gets to 70 first gets 2/3 of the contents of the till, the rest goes to the person with the most disc figures.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Track Movement

name: Guardians vs. Kaiju
description:
In the future of 21xx, kaiju threaten the existence of humanity. Emerging from the earth, sea, and cosmos, these gargantuan monsters can only be stopped by Guardians, human piloted mechas and Earth’s last hope.

Guardians vs. Kaiju is a tactical tabletop micro-game that simulates battles between giant robots (mechas) and giant monsters (kaiju). One player takes on the role of a Guardian and one takes on the role of a kaiju as they customize their avatars and battle for supremacy.

With a piece of printer paper, a friend, and a handful of six sided dice, you can take part in gargantuan combat inspired by Into the Breach and Steve Jackson's OGRE.

name: Peer-to-Peer
description:
Peer-to-Peer is a team vs team semi-cooperative deck-building game using the Second generation (2021) Tech Deck, a 21st century deck of playing cards. Players divide into two teams and share a play deck and group hand. Each individual player has asymmetric abilities from their venture (Tech Deck cards) that can develop over time. Teams compete to assist customers from the Customer deck. Successfully assisted customers can be used to: 1. build up their team's deck, 2. develop individual ventures, or 3. score. Rules for odd-number of players and solo-play are included. The theme of the game is a 21st century modern setting. Players on a team cooperate together. Teams may choose to cooperate and negotiate and assist customers (semi-cooperative) leading to lively group discussion and dynamics. The game uses simple math and card melds to determine who successfully assists customers. There are three mutually-exclusive competing objectives: 1. to develop your team's deck, 2. to develop individual player's venture and 3. to score customers. Teams compete to assist customers and then the team must choose how to use that customer card towards these three objectives.

OBJECTIVE – Teams are trying to score points from assisting customers while building up their team’s deck and ventures.
GAME PLAY – During a turn, players can uses game effects from their hand cards and their ventures. Both teams try to assist customers in the customer row drawn from the customer deck. The game ends when there are no more cards left in the customer deck.

-description from designer
mechanics: Deck Construction, Matching, Melding and Splaying, Semi-Cooperative Game, Team-Based Game, Turn Order: Pass Order

name: The Naval SITREP: The Journal of Naval Miniatures Wargaming #11
description:
The Naval SITREP is published twice a year by the Admiralty Trilogy Group. It supports the Admiralty Trilogy game system (Fear God and Dread Naught, Command at Sea and Harpoon) with scenarios, articles on history and technology, and rules expansions & corrections.

categories: Aviation / Flight, Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Nautical, Wargame, World War I, World War II

name: The Greatest Day: Utah Beach
description:
The Greatest Day: Utah Beach is the second of three volumes in the Grand Tactical Series that covers the Battle for Normandy in June of 1944.
The Greatest Day: Utah Beach includes a wide array of scenarios from the beach landings, to airborne troops seizing Carentan, to cutting the Cotentin Peninsula. There are small 8.5”x11” scenarios up to full campaign games stretching across the entire peninsula.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Volcano Dice Game
description:
For this dice game you will need 6 dice and three chips or tokens for each player. You don’t even need a paper and pen to keep score.

Lucky Charm
First, everyone picks a number to be their lucky charm. It is okay for more than one player to have the same lucky charm number. Once the number has been picked, it stays the same for the whole game. Next, the first player rolls all six dice trying to roll a 6. If he is successful, the dice with 6 on it is set to the side and play moves on to the next player. Instead of rolling a 6 a player can also use more than one dice to add up to the number. For example, if rolling for a six and no six was rolled but a 4 and a 2 were rolled they can be used to add up to six. In this case, both the 4 and 2 dice are set aside. Next, the player on the left rolls the remaining dice to try to roll a 5. Play keeps going in this fashion until 1 is reached. If 1 has been reached and rolled, then play starts over at 6 with the next player.

Missing the Mark
On the other hand, if a player does not roll the number that she is trying for and can not add any dice to make the number, she is in jeopardy. She is standing on the edge of the volcano, waiting to see if she will survive or be sacrificed. She has one turn to roll the same dice that she just rolled and try to get her lucky charm number. If she rolls her lucky charm, she is safe. Play starts over at six with all six dice with the next player. If she doesn’t roll her lucky charm then she is sacrificed and thrown into the volcano. She loses one of her chips. Play starts over with all six dice and then next player.

When a player loses all of his chips, then he is out of the game.
Play continues until all the players but one have run out of chips. This last player is safe. The Volcano Powers are satisfied with the sacrifices. This player is the winner.

name: OLIGOQUOTY
description:
The theme of this game is investment capitalism. Purchasing minor, major, or complete equity control in apartment housing regions and company sectors (i.e., airline services, legal and accounting services, and two different public services) will help a player win the game in multiple ways.

For example, a player with a designated sum of cash on hand and no loans or who owns two complete sets of equity control in an apartment housing region or company sector and no loans wins. Other winning methods involve parameters outlined in the ruleset and agreed on by players before the game starts (i.e., timed games or when players wish to stop playing).

First, players use a 12-Sided-Die to roll and move around spaces on the game board. Then they choose to buy or pass on investment opportunities. These choices affect their passive income (salary) and income from other players (penalties). Along the way, the owned investments grow, and players may collect additional revenue from drawn cards (one free set and one set that is not). Players may also collect cards that can get used in place of rolling the 12-Sided-Die.

Fear not the dilemma of non-trading players HODL'ing (holding on for dear life). A significant equity control (50%+) allows players to take over entire housing regions or company sectors by rolling the 12-Sided-Die higher than a competitor.

Please do not play it like Monopoly, or you may lose. So be the one who wins intelligently and earn the right to boast about your strategy (and luck).

—description from the designer
mechanics: Investment, Loans, Ownership, Roll / Spin and Move, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Moji Challenge: Fantasy
description:
Moji Challenge: Fantasy involves 165 challenges (3 difficulty levels) across 55 cards to get all your parties going. Play in pairs or in teams, choosing from a huge range of game varieties. Become cold-hearted zombies, decadent vampires, wild werewolves and many more!

The rules are simple. Each challenge completed successfully wins you fame points. The first player or team to score 15 fame points wins.

—description from the publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Fantasy, Party Game

name: Monsters
description:
Monsters is a 20 minute tactical cardgame for 2 mages who control ugly to fight each other. Main mechanism is card drawing and unique abilities.
Game is play in rounds. Every round you will play cards under your command to defeat opponent by reducing his healthpoints to 0.

name: Moji Challenge: Classic
description:
Moji Challenge involves 165 challenges (3 difficulty levels) across 55 cards to get all your parties going. Play in pairs or in teams, choosing from a huge range of game varieties.
The rules are simple. Each challenge completed successfully wins you fame points. The first player or team to score 15 fame points wins.

Classic deck cards will help your parties go off with a hilarious bang – you will become eMOJI masters capable of expressing all sorts of feelings and emotions.

—description from the publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Children's Game, Humor, Party Game

name: Crystal Age
description:
Crystal Age is a fantasy strategy board game where you control a powerful hero and embark on a dangerous journey, defeating exotic creatures to acquire their abilities. Will you be able to face the powerful lords of corruption?

Crystal Age is for 1 to 4 players with an approximate duration of 30 minutes per player. It will have three different game modes: solo, cooperative, and PVP.

In the past, a colossal crystal fell from the sky into the center of the land of Ansel, forming a huge crater. It began to change nearby biomes, and the creatures that lived there became more powerful and hostile. The kingdoms sealed the crater with 4 magical guardians, and surrounded it with a giant wall to prevent the spread of this strange disease, called corruption.

You are a Hero graced with power from heaven and you feel the call of the crater....

Now tell me... Will you use your power to help end the corruption? Or will you submit to the greed and doom of being the most powerful hero of Ansel?

Welcome to Crystal Age!

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Animals, Card Game, Dice, Exploration, Fantasy, Miniatures
mechanics: Alliances, Command Cards, Cooperative Game, Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, Finale Ending, Modular Board, Multiple Maps, Player Elimination, Point to Point Movement, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Hierarchia
description:
Hierarchia is a card game. Look at the beautifully illustrated characters, learn about the church hierarchy, think logically and have fun.

Gra karciana "Hierarchia" to ciekawa propozycja dla tych, którzy lubią spędzać czas w gronie najbliższych, znajomych i przyjaciół. Przyjrzyj się pięknie zilustrowanym postaciom, poznaj hierarchię kościelną, logicznie myśl i dobrze się przy tym baw.

name: Pyramiden-Bau
description: The game board consists of four pyramids broken down into individual small pyramids. At the beginning of the game, each player makes a throw and places his piece on the small square of one of the four pyramids that has the same number. This space, occupied at the beginning, forms the foundation stone of the pyramid to be built by the player and the number indicated on it shows the "base number". The player who rolled the base number 1 is king or queen and begins. There can be multiple kings in the first game. However, if no 1 is thrown, the next lower number begins. Corresponding to the rolling, the game piece is then placed as many spaces further sideways as eyes have been thrown. When the end of a row is reached, the player moves on to the next higher row until he reaches the top of the pyramid. If a player throws his basic number, he is not allowed to move, but rather has to wait until it is his turn again. If the player rolls more points than he needs to fill the capstone, he must move back from the top of the pyramid by as many squares as he has rolled points too many. This is repeated until he manages to get to the keystone. The king or queen make an exception to this. These may occupy the capstone immediately as soon as they reach it or have rolled beyond it. Whoever is the first to finish building his pyramid receives the first prize and becomes king for the next game with the basic number 1. Whoever throws the basic number 1 in the next game must exchange it for 2, since the king number is then only one player may own. If several players finish in a round, the one who threw the lowest cornerstone at the beginning of the game has priority, i. h. started building the pyramid with 1 or the next lowest square.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Square Grid, Track Movement

name: Der Hochtourist
description:
Each player pays 5 coins in the till and take turns to roll and move. Only one die is used. If a player rolls 6 eyes, de don't move any further, but pays a penalty because he is too eager. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. Only the one who throws 1 and thus comes to space 1 can start the journey.
The first to the summit of the Zugspitze gets half the contents of the till. Those who have reached the summit can start their way back without any obstacles. Only those who get to 5 are eliminated from the game due to fatigue. Whoever gets over space 1 first gets all the rest of the till.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Loonie Bashin'
description:
This game was inspired by various mini-games which used to be published now and again in White Dwarf Magazine. I have a fondness for the Orc and Goblin Army in Warhammer Fantasy Battle. One of the most powerful units was the Goblin Ball and Chain Fanatics which were available to Night Goblin troops. The inspiration and some of the base mechanics totally come from this game. It is random as hell but would make a great convention game.

Every now and again, in-between Waaaagh’s, the Gobbo’s get restless – what better way to kill time than by setting the Ball and Chain Loonie’s loose in a make-shift arena? Six goblin fanatics are placed into a small arena. Once the fanatics are let loose nobody has much control, but carnage shall happen, and if that fails then perhaps exhaustion at the very least.

Don't take things too seriously. Fanatics will die. Enjoy the ride.

This is a free to download game and can be found online inside the HeroHammer Fanzine in Issue #3.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Fan Expansion, Fantasy, Miniatures
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Move Through Deck, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Player Elimination, Stat Check Resolution, Variable Set-up

name: Mission Space
description:
In Mission Space players compete to be the first to get over 25 points by completing missions. Missions are either swinging around the Moon, orbiting the Moon, or landing on the Moon; the more difficult a mission is the more points are scored for successfully completing it. Points are also awarded for having fuel remaining and for rescuing players who run out of fuel.

The game is played by randomizing a mechanical "computer" and proceeding through a series of checkpoints - players landing on the Moon go through all checkpoints (there are 21) and players doing simpler missions skip some of them. At each checkpoint players simultaneously choose lettered navigational points and then the computer dial is turned to show the correct answer. Players who choose the correct answer skip one (in some cases two) checkpoints, while other players have to spend fuel to get to the correct location.

At certain checkpoints players consult a probability table to see how likely it is they can complete their missions given their remaining fuel. At these times they can choose to downgrade their missions.

description:
The Naval SITREP is published twice a year by the Admiralty Trilogy Group. It supports the Admiralty Trilogy game system with scenarios, articles on history and technology, and rules expansions & corrections.

name: Der erste Ball
description:
One player is the ball mom or party giver. Prepared are a number of giant-size flowers made of cut colored tissue paper, and also all kinds of headgear: pointed caps, hats, helmets, etc. The former for the participants who are to dance as ladies, the latter for those girls who are to dance as gentlemen. There are also a number of cards on which the names of the players are written. The mother of the ball is given a large cap of tissue paper, stands at the table on which the game is spread out, all the others stand in a large circle around her, each a few paces from the other; every second player gets a ball. The mother of the ball counts: 1, everyone throws the ball to the neighbor to the right at the same time, quickly turns to the left and catches the ball from the neighbor to the left, if the space is too narrow, one is enough the ball to the third or fourth. If you caught, the ball mother sets your marker on space 1; it means the first step to the ballroom; all players who drop their ball remain outside. The ball mother counts: 2, and the ball game is repeated, having previously determined the type of catch; once, twice, etc. clapping hands, jumping, spinning, hitting the ball with the wrong hand, etc. Each time she has to pass the marks of the lucky catchers, whoever drops the ball stays on the same space. If you drop three times in a row, you have to go back and start over, if you drop twice, you step back 2 spaces.

Whoever is first to number 50 wins the game. He or she dances as a gentlemen, receive a hat and opens the ball with the ball mother. The second party entering the ballroom dances as a lady, they have a large flower stuck in their hair. This continues alternately till the ball mother determines that there are enough couples in the ballroom and the ball game is to end.

After the game those who are left behind are wallflowers and have the obligation to sing or play the music for the others to the dance to. The ball begins with a big polonaise, the music moves ahead, the dancers in pairs behind. As the conversation progresses, the dancers now and then have to throw balls to the musicians at the command of the ball mother; if the catch is successful, they swap roles with the dancers on one or two tours. Finally, a large cotillon with the distribution of paper flowers and medals previously made of tissue paper.

name: Die Reise zur Kränzchen-Tante
description:
The kränzchen-sisters have decided to pay a joint visit to the kränzchen-aunt and, since they live scattered all over the world, to pick each other up in order to arrive together in Stuttgart. Whether this is successful will be determined at the destination. The journey begins at space 1 at home. At the beginning of the game, each player pays 20 tokens to the till; one or two dice are thrown in the usual manner and one advances from number to number.
One of the travelers is elected as chairperson. As soon as she continues her journey, she has to ask each of the people throwing the dice 3 questions about the last route covered: which countries she passed, which mountains or rivers she crossed, what curiosities could be seen, what natural or artistic products the countries contain, etc etc. Whoever answers a question incorrectly must pay a fine of 2 tokens; who misses 2 questions 4 tokens and goes back to the previous station; if you leave all questions unanswered, you have to pay 6 tokens and go back to your home town. If the chairperson is guilty of an oversight by asking a question incorrectly or failing to judge the answer, the same penalty applies.
If you go abroad, you will receive a travel allowance of 5 to kens from the til, but has the obligation to answer the questions in English or French. Anyone who gets close to the border or port has a one-day stay due to customs clearance and is not allowed to play the dice once. In the cities marked with yellow numbers, the passenger missed the connection; this holds the same until she is replaced by another traveler who also stops here. But on the next roll she has as many spaces to go back as the dice show eyes. In the residence cities, whereby only Berlin applies in Germany, travelers receive 10 tokens to buy a travel gift for loved ones at home. Should the till ever go bankrupt, the players are obliged to contribute 5 tokens again. Whoever arrives in Stuttgart first receives the contents of the till.
At the end all the players write a poem from the town where she got stuck, in which she describes the journey and the gift she bought. It happens in such a way that the winner begins with a long piece of paper and, after writing it down, folds it in such a way that only the two final words of the last two lines remain visible, to which the next one has to rhyme and so on. After the last one has finished her verses, the chairperson reads out the entire poem, which, if it is well done, may in fact be sent to the aunt so that she can see whether the dear maids have had a pleasant journey.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: UNO: Cricket
description:
UNO themed around the sport of cricket.

WHAT MAKES IT DIFFERENT FROM TRADITIONAL UNO:
Two special wild cards:

"Wild Draw 4/6" card - acts as a Wild Draw 4 card, but when played on top of any other wild card becomes Wild Draw 6

"Wild Bouncer" card - whoever plays this card names a color, and the next player must play an Action card of that color. If they cannot, they draw one card and skip their turn.

name: Celebrity Who Is It?
description:
Think you know your celebs? In this game of famous, faces each player picks a card, then by asking your opponent questions, you have to try and guess which celebrity card they are holding. The difficulty is that they can only answer yes or no!

Celebrity Who Is It? is a two-player game suitable for everyone aged 6 years and over. To start you separate the cards into three packs. There is a purple pack, a red pack and a blue pack. Each pack should have 24 cards. Each player should take one pack and the third pack should be shuffled then placed in the centre of the table. Each player lays out their pack of cards picture side up on the table in front of them so that each of the celebrities is visible. The youngest player should take the top card from the stack in the centre of the table then the second player should then take the next card from the stack. Then the guessing begins. The first person to guess the opponents' card correctly wins, but be careful as an incorrect guess means an automatic win for the other player.

Everything you need to play Celebrity Who Is It? comes supplied in the printed gift box, which is handy for safely storing the cards when the game is not in use.

name: Onmyodo
description:
Explore the mystical world of Japan in the Heian Period, in this solitaire adventure card game. Journey across ever-changing lands and meet fellow Travelers from history and legend. Encounter tricky and treacherous yokai and gain arcane, powerful items. Learn the many Magics that form the forgotten practice of Onmyodo! Historically, Onmyodo was a practice of magic and mysticism that incorporated aspects of Shinto, Buddhism, Chinese Elemental Magic, Astrology and much more. The game references much of this rich history and tradition, mixing characters from legend with real-world archetypes from the Heian Period.

Designed as a solo adventure and storytelling game, Onmyodo can also be played with a small group of players, who collaborate to undergo the challenging journey.

The game employs the use of Tani cards (regions) that are arranged in a diagonal pattern to form a constantly evolving scroll. By forming certain patterns of card features, players can trigger various special items, weather effects, heavenly blessings and more. How long can your Travelers survive, what adventures will unfold, and what missions may they undertake along the way?

While the game is played as an open-ended story, specific Quests can also be integrated for even further challenge.
mechanics: Chaining, Cooperative Game, Multi-Use Cards, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Storytelling

name: Murder Mystery Party: The Diamonds, The Dagger and One Classy Dame
description:
An entry in the Murder à la carte mystery dinner party games.

Gamse includes:

Party planner with recipes and menu including music and decorating tips
Character Booklets for all suspects, includes their roles and background information


The story is set in October 1942 in Casablanca, an oasis of peace in a world at war. Civilians, combatants, and refugees of all nationalities live together in a state of tense suspicion but not even Casablanca is immune to personal tragedy. Last night the Mayor of Casablanca was murdered in his own home and now the killer is coming to dinner! A Hollywood Star, a Gestapo Officer, an American Journalist, a Danish art dealer and a French bureaucrat are just a few of the dinner guests suspected of his murder!

The anticipation, mystery and excitement begin before guests have even arrived as each of the guests, or suspects, will receive their invite and suggestions for suitable dress. This all starts to set the scene for the forthcoming crime - and by the end of the evening, one of the guests will be exposed as a killer!
mechanics: Acting, Cooperative Game, Deduction, Role Playing
publishers: Paul Lamond Games Ltd, University Games

name: Into The Rift
description:
Into the Rift is a 3v1 tabletop game where three players (the heroes) battle their way through custom layout dungeons created by the fourth player (The rift dweller).

Hero's winning objective: Defeat the rift dweller at the very end of the game, by traversing 3 dungeons that become longer and more difficult as more floors are completed. Players will defeat monsters, find hidden rooms and relics, and become stronger as they reach the end to defeat the Rift Dweller in combat. At least one player has to be alive in the end for the heroes to win.

Rift Dweller's winning objective: Kill all three of the hero characters before you yourself are defeated. Choose one of 3 bosses kept in secret until the final room is revealed. Construct dungeons by placing room cards that may or may not be booby-trapped or infested with monsters.

Dungeon mechanics:
Each floor begins at the entrance card, which is the first card flipped face up. Connect other rooms to this by placing room cards face down. Once players decide where to go, the room they select is flipped, revealing the next obstacle.

Every room has a maximum monster value. Monster value is determined by the monsters placed in said rooms. Each floor can only have a set number of rooms, which increases as floors progress, and also must include at least one beneficial room.

The final floor has a boss room hidden in the layout, and cannot be connected to the entrance, nor have multiple rooms connected to it (to avoid finding it too fast)

Currently in Open beta! The steam link -> also has a google form for giving your thoughts and opinions:
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=28461...
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Stat Check Resolution, Team-Based Game, Tile Placement, Turn Order: Stat-Based

name: 2nd Ragnarok
description:
This is a doujin expansion that was only sold a game shows in Japan. It includes rules, charts, and counters (need assembly). Ownership of LotGH Ragnarok is required.

The expansion recreates the second and final Empire invasion of the Alliance.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based, Science Fiction

name: Legend of the Galactic Heroes: Super Gaiden Rampage of Haruhi Suzumiya ~ Sagittarius Day
description:
This is a doujin kit that comes with rules and counters that you have to assemble. They were only sold at game shows.

The game is based on the anime "The Melancholy of Haruhi Suzumiya" Episode 11. In it, they fight a Legend of the Galactic Heroes-style battle against one another.

The scenario uses the Tsukuda LotGH system. it comes with 2 unit sheets (sticker mounts), 2 character sheets, a simple monochrome map, chart, and rules summary.
categories: Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based, Science Fiction

name: Runes & Regulations: Ursa Minor Promo Card
description:
This card was available as a convention promo starting November 2019.

Card text:

Ursa Minor
Trigger - Ursa Minor is the only Mythical Creature on your Lawn at the beginning of your turn;
Effect - Cast a Spell
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: Deception: A Game of Lies
description:
Deception is an equally hilarious and inquisitive strategic game designed to determine the ingenious interrogator and masterful deceiver.

Players shuffle identity cards and then a story theme is selected. Each player takes their turn telling a story from their own lives. "Confessor" cards tell true stories, "deceiver" cards tell a lie. It's up the "Judge" each round to select who is who.

Interrogation and strategic questioning is employed to help pick out who in the group is lying. The winner will come down to the person who can tell the best stories, who can spot a liar, and who can deceive everyone in the room.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Deduction, Player Judge, Storytelling, Team-Based Game

name: フィジカルディスタンス (Physical Distance)
description: In Physical Distance, you place your workers into different rooms of a co-working space to try to help the Global Health Organization develop a vaccine. There are no restrictions on where you can place your workers, but placing them too close to other workers increases the chance that they will get sick and be unable to work this round.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Worker Placement

name: Murder Mystery Party: Murder by the Mob
description:
Murder by the Mob Murder Mystery Party game includes an optional DVD and CD. Watch the short pieces of film to reveal clues about the murder. play the CD of themed background music to create just the right ambience for your investigation!

Chicago in the late 1920’s is overrun by the mob, most of whom have been invited to 'Spudsy' Malone’s party. However, when the Don welcomed everyone to celebrate the invention of his new potato alcohol drink, he wasn’t expecting any of them to ‘do him a favour’ and shoot him in the chest. Host your own party to find out who whacked the big potato!

Contents include party planning supplies.

name: Join My Group
description:
Players have fun learning the positive actions and pitfalls that lead to co-operative learning group success or disaster.

Players are randomly assigned 'group members' that will either help or hinder the players quest to complete a project (reach the end of the track). You can trade 'group members' with other players or with the unused deck.

Players then draw cards which will have various Actions or Suggestions related to the 'group members'. If the card mentions one of your 'group members' then the results of the card effect you. Move ahead on the track, move back on the track, etc.

Player wins by getting to the end of the track first. Like Candyland or LIFE.
mechanics: Action/Event, Move Through Deck, Track Movement, Trading

name: Bully Busters
description:
Players have fun while learning that all students can stop bullying... whether they find themselves in the role of the target, the bystander, or the bully.

Players draw a 'Sitiation' card that presents a bullying situation. They roll a die to see which player will be the Bullying Target, the Bully, or the Bystander. Based on your advice from 'Target Advisor', 'Bully Advisor', or 'Bystander Advisor' cards you will answer questions.

Your answers to the questions and die rolls will score you points (+/-). Most points at the end wins.

name: Mal Adetta
description:
This is a doujin expansion for the Tsukuda Legend of the galactic Heroes system. It is a fan-produced game that was only sold at Game Market and other Japanese shows.

It includes material to recreate the battle of Mal Adetta, including rules and counters (some assembly is required). You must have a copy of the main rules to use this.
categories: Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based, Science Fiction
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid

name: No lo Testeamos... La Caja
description: A promotional Ludoty Box micro-expansion with additional cards for We Didn't Playtest This At All.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Party Game

name: Civicomania
description:
This game allows a simulation of Swiss politics.

In the first phase of the game, each player builds up their parliamentary forces by answering questions.

In the second phase, each player has to give his opinion on a political issue. He must convince the other players, and then a vote takes place, the result of which depends on the forces in the parliament, which can be modified by chance cards.

—user summary

name: Real War Tactics
description:
Real War Tactics is a tactical turn-based game strategy, an imitation of a military conflict, where the commander will win, having assessed the situation, who will be able to make the right decisions and strategically place his combat units.

Each player will have to introduce various combat units into the game, move them around the game map, engage in close combat or make artillery attacks on enemy units.

The goals of the game are to destroy the field commander, destroy or capture the enemy headquarters.

Two or more sets of the game can be combined and take part in a grand battle.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Movement Points, Zone of Control

name: Tribes of Dieu Trading Card Game
description:
TODTCG is a game about the spirit of remembrance! Play casually or competitively in different ways with any single tribe or multiple tribes & archetypes to create unique synergies, combos & field moves from your front or back row!

Each tribe represents a different theme & playstyle. The goal is to defend your tribal, then summon & sacrifice creatures & spells to reduce your opponent's tribal life points to 0, whether through battle or alternative win conditions.

TODTCG consists of 4 phases. Gathering, Preparation, Command, & Combat.

There are 8 card types that are put into 3 groups. Source Type (Chosen & Tribals) Creatures (Members, Spirits & Beastials ) & Spells (Strategy, Field & Armaments). Chosen & tribals are core cards. They are almost linked together. Chosen are flipped to protect the tribal card. Tribals act as turn by turn buffs effecting battlefield & style of play. Strategy cards are instant cards. Once you use them, they are exhausted and sent to the graveyard unless stated otherwise. Field cards activate when placed and stays in the spot they are placed until they are destroyed by attack or condition. They can be activated for multiple turns. Armaments are cards that attach to other cards as armor with special buffs. When attacked players can chose to defend with a card that isn’t exhausted.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fantasy, Fighting

name: The Naval SITREP: The Journal of Naval Miniatures Wargaming #21

name: Flip Burger
description:
A puzzle-like card game of making burgers. Players use their ingredient cards and bun cards to make burgers that fit the menu card set.

Players need to flip bun cards and set them to right position.
And use ingredient cards to match menu cards set.
(flip, overlap or just side by side)

No special order：
Common(單)

Special order：
No meat(X肉) No Sauce(X醬) or No Vegetable(X菜)

First complete(also correct)player can take the menu card(text-side) as one point.

Flip new menu card to make new set. The game ends when only one menu card is left.

—description from the designer

name: SALVAGE: Deep Space
description:
SALVAGE: Deep Space is a co-operative legacy tabletop game for up to four players that places emphasis on customization, narrative, and teamwork.

To uncover a compelling narrative woven from the results of their own choices, players will group together to perform missions as Salvage Suit Pilots in command of fourteen foot tall Exo-Mechs. During these incursions, gameplay will take the form of tactical-combat where players make decisions and roll dice in support of individual miniatures that navigate hexagonal tiles to salvage technology, combat adversaries, and unlock additional story details and twists. The player objectives are dependent on each individual mission where success or failure will be largely determined by a team’s willingness to work together and adapt to an evolving board state.

When not performing missions players will be prompted by both systematic and random story cues through a choose-your-own-journey style narrative book. These prompts will be evaluated for success or failure against a team’s Qualifications: attributes that were chosen during the pilot creation process. Successful navigation of these moments may result in additional missions, unlocked technology that can be bought and applied to your pilots, and additional Exo-Suits.

SALVAGE: Deep Space is a sprawling, legacy-style game that is ultimately won through completion of its story. How it is completed and the subsequent results are up to the choices of the players and their crew of pilots.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Communication Limits, Cooperative Game, Legacy Game, Role Playing

name: Carked It!
description:
Carked It! is a hilarious Australian-made card game that will help get you ready for your final days!

[Carked It!: Australian slang term: When something/someone has died ]

The game aims to make having conversations about dying and death something to enjoy, have fun with, and even have a giggle or belly laugh over

Play with a group of 3-6 friends and choose what you want to happen before and after your death from a selection of ridiculous proposals. The best proposals put forward will be crowned as winners. From learning about gilded skulls, becoming a tree egg, and deciding between death by lawnmower or by helicopter blade, to serious things like doing a will and writing posthumous revenge letters to your enemies - open up interesting and funny conversations about your inevitable end, while you still can!

—description from the designer

name: Die Schwammsucher
description:
Up to six people can participate in this game, each paying 12 tokens into the till. You roll a die and move your piece according to the number of eyes thrown. Pay attention to the mushrooms shown. Those marked with + are poisonous; if you come up with such a (red) number, you pay 2 tokens into the register and pass one roll of the dice. The other mushrooms are edible, including the ink cap when very young; if you come up with one of these digits, you receive 2 tokens from the register.

Whoever reaches space 50 first, gets 2/3 of the till, the next one gets the rest.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

description:

—description from the designer

name: Killers: The Card Game – Cults Expansion
description:
A whole new way to play Killers - the card game. Cults is a 130 card Expansion where you create your cult, meet their Win Conditions, and grow your cult. With 10 different Cults to create you'll have all the messed up fun bringing your cult to the world.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Dice, Educational, Expansion for Base-game, Horror
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Set Collection

name: Psycho Chess
description:
Psycho Chess board game is a four-person Chess game. It is an exciting game with lots of action coming from every direction. It is a strategic game but unlike standard chess, it is much more hectic. Each player has a full set of Chess tokens (16 pieces). The standard chessboard has been modified to accept the added pieces. All tokens move the same as standard chess, but some specific rules are different. It is a crazy game since not only do you have a competitor in front of you but also one on each side.


Four brightly colored chess armies, Red, Green, Blue, and Purple battle it out on this modified chessboard. Each army has a full set of sixteen tokens, making this game PSYCHO.
It is PSYCHO as you fight your way across the board to victory. Unlike classic chess, here the first two Kings are taken.
If you lose your King early, all is not lost. You enter the Deadwood zone and become an antagonist. You have the opportunity to take other opponent’s tokens as well as get your King back.
The last two Kings play a more traditional game, but until the third King is in checkmate, it is anyone’s game.


64 Tokens, four different armies, Red, Blue, Purple, and Green

The first two Kings get killed. Last two fight to Checkmate. You are not out when your King is killed, you become an antagonist with a chance to return.

—description from the publisher

name: Psycho Checkers
description:
Checkers taken to the next level, you control two armies as you navigate across this checkerboard, The yellow army plays on the colored squares and the black army on the black square, Yellow and black play completely separately until one becomes a KING. Kings either yellow or black can attack each other.

We added dice to regulate the play. One die tells you how many Checker tokens you can move each turn while the second die tells you how many moves each token can move during that turn.
If you roll 2 & 2, you can move 2 tokes twice, in this case you can move one space to set up a jump.

Can you make it through the Psycho Zone!

—description from the publisher

name: Jumpin' Jimmy Q
description:
This modified Checker game where you get 7 tokens and need to go through a narrow pass to enter the "fighting Zone" where up to four different armies have to pass through each other to get to the other side to become Kinged.
The trick is to remember which way each checker is permitted to move, since star checkers can only move forward, yet there are 4 different directions

—description from the publisher

name: Anchor Bay
description:
Anchor Bay is a competitive pirate themed board game.

Players embark in the randomized map and battle monsters, navigate events, find items, and recruit crew members. Players battle each other using a dice and target mechanism.

Each player has a ship card which is split into a grid. Each square in the grid corresponds with a stat. When attacking, the player places a bullseye shaped grid over their opponent's ship card and rolls. Each spot on the grid corresponds to a number. The receiving player's stats are reduced if their ship is hit.

The first player to return enough gold to their hideout wins.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action/Event, Area Movement, Catch the Leader, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Events, Modular Board, Push Your Luck, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Farm Warriors
description:
Farm Warriors is a fun, educational board game where players grow, harvest, and deliver the crops to the city to save citizens from city-wide attacks.

Several cities on the planet have been infected by terrible illnesses and we are counting on you and your healing crops to save us!

In this game, all players become farmers.

Each round of the game, a city would send a news alert describing what the evil doers did to infect their citizens and which winning crops are needed to heal the citizens. Now the race to save the world is on! Farmers would race each other around the boardgame and collect resources to grow the winning crops. Make sure to dodge the wild farm attacks and make smart trades with the other farmers. The round ends when a farmer harvests one of the winning crops before the other farmers. The winning farmer receives a city trophy and prize money for saving the citizens.

Whoever saves the most cities will be titled the ultimate farming warrior.

Let's save the world, one crop at a time.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement, Trading
