name: Vabang Junior
description:
What do you associate with the picture on the card? You probably know lots of answers! What is your first association? If you know, quickly press the button. Now you and the other players only have a few seconds to show your reflexes! The participants' task is to earn 10 cards by coming up with their own associations to the pictures on the cards. The player who gets 10 cards first is the winner!

—description from the publisher

Co kojarzy Ci się z obrazkiem na karcie? Z pewnością znasz mnóstwo odpowiedzi! Jakie jest Twoje pierwsze skojarzenie? Jeśli wiesz, szybko naciśnij przycisk. Teraz razem z pozostałymi graczami macie tylko kilka sekund na wykazanie się refleksem! Zadaniem w grze jest zdobycie 10 kart poprzez wymyślanie własnych skojarzeń do obrazków na kartach. Gracz, który zdobędzie je jako pierwszy, zostaje zwycięzcą!

—description from the publisher (Polish)

Was assoziieren Sie mit dem Bild auf der Karte? Sie kennen wahrscheinlich viele Antworten! Was ist Ihre erste Assoziation? Wenn Sie es wissen, drücken Sie schnell die Taste. Jetzt werden Sie und die anderen
Jetzt haben du und die anderen Spieler nur ein paar Sekunden Zeit, um eure Reflexe unter Beweis zu stellen! Die Aufgabe der Teilnehmer besteht darin, 10 Karten zu sammeln, indem sie eigene Assoziationen zu den Bildern auf den Karten finden. Der Spieler, der zuerst 10 Karten hat, ist der Gewinner!

—description from the publisher (German)
mechanics: Action Timer, Matching, Real-Time, Speed Matching

name: Catan Scenario: Fenni's Shearing Season
description:
It's shearing season and Fenni needs your help to shear her fluffy friends.

If you collect enough wool and present it to Fenni, you can move her around CATAN. In exchange for you helping her friends, she will give you Minigames that you can use to collect more resources - while chasing the robber away wherever she goes!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Income, Modular Board, Network and Route Building, Random Production, Trading

name: Red Card Rugby
description:
A print-and-play card game (with small board for the position of the ball on the pitch) based on the game of rugby union.
The game is won - as is rugby itself - with the most points (5 or 7 for a try, 3 for a penalty) over two halves. Players each play cards representing an attack (if they have possession of the ball) or defence. The deck represents the clock, so as it runs out, so does the 40-minute half.

—description from the designer

name: Marble Bobsleigh 2nd Edition
description:
Marble Bobsleigh is a dexterity game that let people of all ages play Winter Olympics indoor.

When the trigger-marbles give a ‘Go’ sign, all players quickly and precisely release their player-marbles to let them roll down the tracks to go into the finish area. Only one player can reach the goal.

Experience the dynamic and energetic play of the bobsleigh game on your table!

In Marble Bobsleigh 2nd Edition, the game board has reduced in size. Now, this game is compatible with smaller table. The game board has totally a different shape of tracks. It was more of straight lines with corners. Now, it is in a spiral form. Plus, the point system has been revised.

name: The Haunted House: Gemblo
description:
The Haunted House: Gemblo is an abstract strategy game. The original game Gemblo is themed with the Haunted House.

It includes character and ghost cards which can twist the game play. The ghosts give players extra points when they are captured.

—description from the publisher
categories: Abstract Strategy, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Grid Coverage, Hand Management, Tile Placement

name: The Haunted House: Toc Toc Wood Man
description:
The Haunted House: Toc Toc Wood Man is a simple dexterity balance game with 3-dimensional components.
This game is the Haunted House version of the original game, Toc Toc Woodman (Click Clack Lumberjack).

It includes ghost cards with the ghosts from the Haunted House animated movie.
Those cards give the players extra points or trigger special abilities when bark pieces are dropped on them.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Moji Challenge: Party Set
description:
Moji Challenge is an exciting, fast-paced card game for all those who love naughty and crazy parties!

Join your friends in taking on fun MOJI-roles and wacky challenges of three different difficulty levels! If any of you manage to succeed, you will gain “FPs” – Fame Points! Moji Party Set contains:

The MOJI CHALLENGE: CLASSIC DECK allows you to become eMOJI masters and discover how amazingly entertaining it can be to express different emotions in all sorts of situations – especially when THE emotions and situations do not match or are totally inappropriate!

The MOJI CHALLENGE: ANIMAL DECK will help you reveal your true, hidden nature! Are you a tiger or a pussycat? Discover for yourselves by meeting humorous challenges or else passing them onto your friends with a wicked smile!

The MOJI CHALLENGE: FANTASY DECK will help you turn into all sorts of monster creatures, such as: anemic zombies, decadent vampires or bloodthirsty werewolves! Worlds of wicked challenges await each and every player!

Only one of you can be victorious – at the end, the winner will set the final MOJI-challenge for all the other players!

—description from the publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Children's Game, Party Game

name: The Haunted House: Sealing Talisman
description:
The Haunted House: Sealing Talisman is an unplugged coding & puzzle game.

Ghosts are running all over the place! Help Shinbi and Geumbi to capture the ghosts!

Players program the movements of Shinbi & Geumbi figures so they can get to the destination.
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Puzzle

SAMs vs. Ballistic Missiles (First Cut)

Book Reviews:

The Fauld Disaster,by Nick McCamley

name: Das Eiserne Kreuz
description:
The game is set 1870 during the German-French-War. There are the following 8 factions for 8 players:

blue-white-red.................France
black-white....................Preußen
white-green....................Sachsen
black-yellow-green.............Sachsen-Weimar-Eisenach
blue-white.....................Bayern
black-red......................Würtemberg
yellow-red-yellow..............Baden
red-white......................Hessen

Each player has his own track ans starts at space 1. Whoever gets on space 50 (iron cross) first wins the game.
Movement is determined by drawing cards. There are 10 cards: One card for each faction, a card for the North German Confederacy (NGF) and a cord for the iron cross.

If a player card is drawn, the player in question moves 1 space forward. If the NGF-card is drawn, all players move 1 space. A player standing on space 24 may only move to the iron cross, if he draws the iron-cross-card.
mechanics: Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Waldi geht durch die Stadt
description: The players take turns to roll and move. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. The first player to reach the destination spaces wins the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: In Search of the Dragon's Treasure
description:
Each player chooses a Knight in the color of their choice (red, blue, green, or yellow) and picks a weapon to place on their knight. then they spin the wheel. determining turn order from highest to lowest spin, ties re-roll.

You then spin the wheel to move around the board, journeying toward the dragons cave to steal the treasure. following instructions on tiles you land on. when you reach a spot that says stop, you must stop there till your next turn. multiple players can occupy the same space.

When you reach the colored squares in front of the dragons cave, you stop on your color. on your next turn, you must try to spin your color. you cannot proceed until you get your color, which grabs you a bag of gold to place on your knight. you then immediately spin again and move that many spaces.

The first player to reach Avalon Castle wins the game.

—user summary

name: The Night Stalker
description:
A man has been brutally murdered.

A deranged serial killer is on the loose. The killer is known as The Night Stalker, because they only strike at night.

You are a detective, tasked with tracking down and arresting the killer. To do this, you will investigate crime scenes by collecting clues and evidence, to build your evidence dossier to arrest suspects.
You have narrowed down your list of prime suspects to four people. One of these is the Night Stalker. Through a process of elimination, your goal is to determine which suspect is the killer, and arrest them.
Time is running out. If you have not found and arrested the killer amongst your suspects before the game ends, the Night Stalker wins, and disappears into the shadows.

This game was an entry in the 2022 Solitaire Print and Play Contest, and is a low ink prototype for play testing.

—description from the designer

name: Shadows of Brimstone: Mine Artifact – Olde Bell Promo Card
description:
Olde Bell - Mine Artifact - Promo 551

Once per Adventure, you may ring the Olde Bell to cancel a Darkness or Growing Dread card. Then choose another Darkness or Growing Dread card and cancel it on the D6 roll of 4+. You max contiune to choose and cancel cards like this until you fail one of the rolls.

This was available from the Roll to Move 2022 sale at the Flying Frog webstore for orders over 100$.

name: B-Low
description:
The object of the game is to be the player with the lowest score. Points are scored by adding the point value of your cards when each hand ends. The game ends when one player's score totals 100 points or more.

Each player is dealt four face-down cards. On their turn they will either draw a card from the deck or take the top-most discarded card. They will either switch it with one of their four cards, trying to make it lower (if drawn), or discard it. If the discard is selected, they must switch it with one of the four cards. All four cards are always face-down, forcing the player to remember them.

This continues until the deck runs out or someone has collected the one B-Low card and calls for the end of the round. Points are totaled by cards saved, lower is better.
mechanics: Closed Drafting, Hand Management, Memory, Move Through Deck, Trick-taking

name: Inky's Fortune
description:
Inky the Octopus dozed off while guarding his gems. Can you sneak the treasure away without tickling his tentacles?

​Slowly and carefully, players must try to twist and turn a gem from its hole without startling Inky. If they succeed, they keep it! Each squiggly gem provides a different challenge!

When all gems have been collected, the player with the most WINS!

name: Wie bin ich?
description:
The goal of this interesting psycho game is to analyse the other players by means of 36 characteristics. The player who can judge himself in the same way as the others would judge him will win.

—user summary

name: Sackl Zement
description:
This is a memo game:
All cards are put face down on the table. Then you turn as many cards as necessary face up until each color and each shape can be seen at least once. Then all players try to remember the cards, turn them face down again and roll the dice. If one player has a matching card, he places it face down without looking at it on the corresponding field of his tray. But be careful! If you make a mistake, the bag of cement is threatened and your cards go to the next player.
The winner is the player who has the most valid cards at the end.

—user summary

name: Air-Kwire
description:
An unashamed remake of a classic 1960s 3M Business Strategy game. Instead of building hotel chains, you will be creating airline empires across the good ol' USA. Start with small range Ford Tri-Motor aircraft and work your way up through a longer range Douglas DC3s and then ultimately the max range Boeing 247 aircraft as your airline adds more and more city routes. Outwit your opponents with your shrewd stock moves and become the wealthiest air baron. It's all here.

Air-Kwire is a FREE Print & Play game from Deer Valley Game Company.

—description from the designer
categories: Aviation / Flight, Economic, Print & Play, Territory Building
mechanics: Investment, Ownership, Stock Holding, Tile Placement

name: Le Quiz en Vrac
description:
What is the real name of Daredevil? In what year was the first Nintendo released? Who are the members of the Justice League? The geek galaxy is vast, test yourself with Studio Vrac on TV series, movies, literature, video games, manga, comics, comic books! Even your WTF spirit will be challenged! Each team (of two or more players) chooses one of the four characters that will give them a special power. Players roll the die to advance, each correct answer allows them to roll the die again to advance. The goal: to reach the finish line with the maximum number of points.

Each team (of two or more players) chooses one of the four characters that will give them a special power. Players roll the die to advance, each correct answer allows them to roll the die again to advance. The goal: to reach the finish line with the maximum number of points.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Team-Based Game

name: Frog Hop
description:
Frog Hop comes with two game modes: co-op or versus.

In both games players try to catch as many bugs as possible before the frog timer runs out. Players turn over a disc and try to find the pictured bug from the lake using frog tongues.

The player with the most points (bugs) wins.
mechanics: Action Timer, Cooperative Game, Memory, Set Collection, Slide/Push

name: Paranormal Detectives: Companion App
description:
The companion app provides the game with many more stories to solve. The stories are all unique to the app and not found in the base game. The app only has stories and nothing else. A physical copy of the base game is still required to play.

These stories have the same format (standard information block, graphics, font, etc.) as the physical story cards in the game. Some stories are marked with the "Parental Advisory" warning, just like stories in the physical game.

There are 35 stories, but that may change with updates.

Stories can be marked as played - the electronic equivalent of setting aside a story card once it's been played.

There is also a "Random Story" button that selects a random story from among those in the app.

name: Three
description: Line up three of your colored balls into one of three specific configurations on a modular board made up of wooden rings to win.
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Pattern Building

name: Mobile Suit Z Gundam Tactical Card Game
description:
In this tactical card game based on the Mobile Suit Z Gundam television series, players assemble a fleet of random spaceships, mobile suits (mecha), and pilots with the goal of eliminating their opponents' forces.

Each player starts with 4 random Ship Cards (or 3 in a 5-6 player game) and 8 Special Cards (Mobile Suit (MS) Cards, Pilot Cards, and Event Cards) to form their fleets. On their turn, each player draws one Special Card from the deck and has the option of playing an MS with a Pilot from their hand to their fleet, playing an Event Card, attacking an opponent's Ship with their own Ship or MS, or attacking an opponent's MS with their own MS. In combat, each player rolls a number of 6-sided dice equal their unit's Combat Strength and score a hit for each die roll less than their Hit Number. When a unit is destroyed, the victor takes the card and adds it to their score pile.

The game ends in one of three conditions, decided on by players before the start of the game:
a) The Special Card deck is depleted.
b) One player loses all the spaceships in their fleet.
c) Only one player has spaceships in their fleet.

At the game end, each player tallies up their score based on the opponent Ships, MS units, and Pilots they destroyed in combat. The player with the highest score is the winner.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Risky Kittens
description:
In Risky Kittens, players are visiting an animal shelter full of cute and cuddly kittens… until their claws come out. Push your luck as you pet adorable kittens while trying to avoid getting scratched!

Each round, draft kitten cards. The more scratches you have, the sooner you get to pick your kitten! Roll to pet your kitten earning hearts and scratch stickers. Each kitten has a unique ability! Convert hearts to Purr Points, but if your kitten scurries away, you'll lose your hearts!

Track your scratches by applying scratch stickers to your hand! After 6 rounds, the player with the most Purr Points wins!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck

name: 孤高の信長:1570 (Solitaire Nobunaga: 1570)
description:
Solitaire Nobunaga: 1570 is a completely solo game depicting the fierce battles fought by Oda Nobunaga from the first year of the Genki era to the Honnoji Incident.
The game system uses the draw-driven system adopted in Issue 31, Bunroku: Campaign in Korea. The system is simple: draw cards from the deck one at a time, and the generals corresponding to the drawn cards either move or attack. The system allows the warlord to move around and attack, but with enough unexpected enemy behaviour to make it hard to believe it is a solo game.

Number of counters: 162
Map: 1 A2 size
Cards: 16 full-colour

Game period: First year of the Genki era (1570) - Tensho 10 (1582) approx.
Unit size: One warlord / 1,000-2,000 people

Playing time: 1 - 2 hours
Number of players: 1 player (solo play only)
Difficulty: 2 (5 being the highest)

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: Vent
description:
Read the wind (vent) and cross the islands.

Place tiles to change the conditions of islands from one moment to the next, and lead migratory birds to the furthest edges of the world.

This is an abstract game with a puzzle element that allows players to connect islands so that migratory birds can move all at once.

In addition to basic and expert rules for two players, three to four players can play in team games.

vent means wind in French.

name: Killers: The Card Game – World of Serial Killers
description:
This is a collection of Serial Killers from around the world. From South America to Asia serial killers are an international phenomenon. This expansion adds an additional 70 killers, 20 weapons, 10 new scenarios, and 10 new victims.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Murder/Mystery

name: Heroes Love to Lie
description:
Heroes Love To Lie is a hidden role playing game of deduction and bluffing. The game is played with cards representing various characters (Heroes) and works on the principle of secret identities.

In Heroes Love to Lie, players secretly take on the role of Heroes whose goal is to battle the monsters of the kingdom. In order to avoid being unmasked or to fight the greatest creatures, Heroes will have to lie about their identity to triumph. Will you be the mischievous Goblin, the cunning Elf, or the unbeatable Knight?

The goal is to be the last Hero in the game or to obtain 4 Glories to win the game.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Deduction, Hidden Roles, Interrupts, Memory, Player Elimination, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Dead or Alive: Expanded Edition
description:
An expansion which adds 10 new characters. The Game Master cards included are used in conjunction with the Game Master cards in Dead or Alive.

1 Werewolf
1 Citizen
1 Fortune Teller
1 Dark Shaman
1 Cosplayer
1 Psycho Killer
1 Vampire
1 Mentalist
1 Magician
2 Lovers
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Murder/Mystery, Party Game
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Deduction, Hidden Roles, Player Elimination, Role Playing, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: 花子さん いますか？(Hanako-san imasuka?)
description:
Toilets at night are full of dangers! Hanako appears in the toilet of the old school building! It is said that anyone who finds out about the rumor will be cursed and will be taken to the spirit world after seven days. In order to break her curse, she has to go to the bathroom of the old school building for seven days and open the door while saying "Is Hanako-san here?" Safe if no one is in the toilet. But what if I really met Hanako-san...?

How the game is played: There is a deck of cursed cards, a deck of events, a deck of days and a row of face-down cards (doors). Each player must open a door (turn over a card), it can be empty, it can be an event (an event card must be drawn) or it can be Hanako-san (a cursed card must be drawn). After seven days, the player with the least curse points will win the game, and the player with the most curse points will be chased by Hanako-san.

Based on the Japanese urban legend.

夜のトイレは危険がいっぱい！
旧校舎のトイレには花子さんが出る！？
その噂を知ってしまった人は呪われ、７日後に霊界へ連れていかれてしまうという。
呪いを解くためには７日間旧校舎のトイレへ通い、「花子さんいますか？」と言いながらドアを開けなければならない。
トイレの中に誰もいなければセーフ。
でももし本当に花子さんと出会ってしまったら……？

name: Kinkopoly
description:
A Monopoly-derivative with no money but with tasks to do if you want to have the toys.

You start on Consent and move your player token clockwise around the board. Unless you get a switch card that tells you to go the other direction. As you travel around the board, you’ll land on kinky toy spaces (like sling, safe word, and chaps). When you get there, if the toy is unowned, you’ll read the card silently to yourself and decide if you want to attempt the challenge. If you don’t want to attempt to earn it, simply say “that’s not my kink,” and end your turn. If someone else owns the toy you land on, though, watch out! You might be in for a spanking, owe them a massage, or have to fetch them a drink. Don’t worry though, you may always opt out of consequences with a handy safe word token. If you abuse the privilege, though, you may be sent to the dungeon, where you’ll have to voyeur your friends having all the fun.

A player wins by collecting the most toys. Each toy card is worth a point, and having all the toys of a color gives a bonus point.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Diamonds & Dinosaurs
description:
A group of competing adventurers take on a dinosaur filled jungle in search of the biggest diamonds you’ve ever seen. Get them fast and get out quick as dinosaurs move across an expanding map every turn. The map is built as players explore the island so no two games will play the same. Use your actions wisely and make use of items found throughout the jungle. Be the first to collect four of the massive gemstones and make it back to base camp for evacuation! Explore the jungle, gather diamonds, avoid dinosaurs, will you be the first one out?

At the start of a players turn, they draw 2 map cards to expand the map and 1 item card as they search the jungle. Players get 3 actions on their turn. Actions may be used to either move or pick up diamonds. Movement requires a player to roll 2 dice which allows them to move to a space with a number equal to or lower the number they rolled. The spaces are cards that are laid out by the players every turn so the map will always be different.

The first player who collects 4 diamonds and is able to get them back to base camp (the central starting card) is the winner.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Different Dice Movement, Events, Modular Board, Multi-Use Cards, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Mageling: Rise of the Ancient Ones – Apotheosis
description:
Apotheosis - noun - the highest point in the development of something; culmination or climax.

Mageling: Apotheosis enables players to customize their strategies by evolving their scrolls. Like the enchantments of the Rise of the Ancient Ones expansion, evolved scrolls are not meant to change the game radically. Instead, they are meant to add new possibilities to the gameplay and obscure strategies to discover.

By visiting the new locations in Apotheosis, players can collect a new resource, Time Shards. Time Shards are used during the refresh phase to trade in scrolls in a player's grimoire for more powerful versions.

name: Cold Waves: The Atlantic & North Sea 1739-1748
description:
Cold Waves is the final game of a set covering the War of the Austrian Succession at sea (plus the concurrent War of Jenkin's Ear). Though relatively unknown, these conflicts, raging from 1739-1748, comprised the first "world war". The primary naval actions took place in three theatres: the English Channel and Bay of Biscay, the Caribbean, and the western Mediterranean. Forces also clashed in India, along America's eastern seaboard, and in the Pacific. Cold Waves examines the European Atlantic coasts, the Channel, and the North Sea, where tedious blockade duty and convoy hunting was laced with the ever present fear of amphibious invasion – something both sides tried more than once.

Cold Waves is a two player strategy game. You command either the British or Bourbon (French and Spanish) fleets. Orders are handed down to you from your Admiralty, and you must try to fulfill them within the framework of the wider war, which is represented by a set of events. Your opponent will have orders of his own to fulfill, but with his spare forces he will be attempting to foil your plans. Success will earn you Prestige (victory points). You must decide when and where to commit resources, where to feint and where to strike, organising your 'sail' (ships) into squadrons, and your squadrons into flotillas commanded by leaders (commodores and admirals). Maintaining sufficient forces at battle readiness is critical, but very difficult, since ships constantly suffer wear and tear – a battle may be won and the campaign lost. Scenarios are one year (16 turns) long, playable in 3-4 hours (the number of counters actually in play on the map is quite small). The campaign game consists of a number of years pre-chosen by the players.

Every ship that appeared in the theatre is accounted for, as is every leader of note. (Although by the basic rules ships are generic 'SPs', players can use the OOBs to add detail and even fight battles using their favourite tactical system.) Squadrons are rated for movement and the number of sail they can contain. Specially named squadrons represent the great ships, like the 112-gun Real Felipe, which successfully beat off a simultaneous attack by three British ships of the line. Other counters represent special assets, like fireships, frigates, and galleys. These can be 'played' (like cards) to conduct special tasks such as search and shore bombardment. Leaders are ranked, and rated for skill and personality.

—description from the publisher

name: Klassequizen
description:
Klassequizen is a trivia game related to the Norwegian television show of the same name.

One player reads a question aloud, and all players answer simultaneously using chips. The card is flipped and answers are revealed.

The twist of the game is that multiple alternatives might be correct, and a player scores points for each correct answer. However, if any wrong alternative is chosen, the player is awarded no points.

name: Hot Punk Machine: Tormenta de Metal
description:
Trading card game with a sci-fi/dark fantasy theme. You build a 40 card deck, you can chose any card from the available cardpool to build your deck.

Using your intelligence and your creativity, you will duel with you opponent using the deck that you built, with your cards you have to reduce your opponent's life points to 0 or make him run out of cards to win the game.
mechanics: Deck Construction, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Trading

name: CityBusiness Lappi
description:
This is the Lappi version of the CityBusiness game series.

Unlike most games in the series, this one is not centered on a single city/town but rather a wider geographic area - in this case, the whole of Finnish Lapland.

CityBusiness is a series of games, each of which is basically a light version of Monopoly localized to a city/region of Finland. The games promote local companies, councils, educational institutes etc.

The main differences between these games and Monopoly are:


Instead of a "street" each square on the board represents a local business.
There are no hotels or houses, but each square has two title deeds instead of just one, allowing two players to jointly own any location on the board.
The majority of the event cards are trivia questions about the locality the game is set in.
While the effects of the first two corner squares (Go and Jail in Monopoly) remain the same for every edition (Go and Stock Market Crash), the effect of the other two corners varies from edition to edition and is the only real difference between them (except for the trivia content, of course). They are typically also local businesses but without title deeds and thus no rent either, but some special effect instead, such as pass a turn or get an extra throw.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Income, Loans, Lose a Turn, Ownership, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Track Movement, Trading

name: CityBusiness Oulu
description:
This is the Oulu version of the CityBusiness game series. Oulu, up in the northern Bay of Bothnia, was formerly known mainly as a seaport especially for the tar trade, but is now the 5th largest city in Finland and the hub of the 4th largest urban area, known for it's university and the vigorous industrial and business growth of the area, especially in new technologies.

CityBusiness is a series of games, each of which is basically a light version of Monopoly localized to a city/region of Finland. The games promote local companies, councils, educational institutes etc.

The main differences between these games and Monopoly are:


Instead of a "street" each square on the board represents a local business.
There are no hotels or houses, but each square has two title deeds instead of just one, allowing two players to jointly own any location on the board.
The majority of the event cards are trivia questions about the locality the game is set in.
While the effects of the first two corner squares (Go and Jail in Monopoly) remain the same for every edition (Go and Stock Market Crash), the effect of the other two corners varies from edition to edition and is the only real difference between them (except for the trivia content, of course). They are typically also local businesses but without title deeds and thus no rent either, but some special effect instead, such as pass a turn or get an extra throw.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Income, Loans, Lose a Turn, Ownership, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Track Movement, Trading

name: CityBusiness Turku
description:
This is the Turku version of the CityBusiness game series. The southwestern city of Turku is the oldest city in Finland (founded 1229), was the capital before Helsinki until 1812, and still is the 6th largest city and the hub of the 3rd largest metropolitan area in the country, the capital of it's region, and an important seaport with shipyards.

CityBusiness is a series of games, each of which is basically a light version of Monopoly localized to a city/region of Finland. The games promote local companies, councils, educational institutes etc.

The main differences between these games and Monopoly are:


Instead of a "street" each square on the board represents a local business.
There are no hotels or houses, but each square has two title deeds instead of just one, allowing two players to jointly own any location on the board.
The majority of the event cards are trivia questions about the locality the game is set in.
While the effects of the first two corner squares (Go and Jail in Monopoly) remain the same for every edition (Go and Stock Market Crash), the effect of the other two corners varies from edition to edition and is the only real difference between them (except for the trivia content, of course). They are typically also local businesses but without title deeds and thus no rent either, but some special effect instead, such as pass a turn or get an extra throw.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Income, Loans, Lose a Turn, Ownership, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Track Movement, Trading

name: Blood Red Skies: US Ace Pilot – Richard Bong
description:
Richard Ira Bong was the United States’ top scoring and most highly decorated Ace of the Second World War.

He joined the Army Air Corps Aviation Cadet Program in May 1941 and a year later was training on the new Lockheed P-38 Lightning twin engine fighter. When war broke out, Bong was sent to New Guinea and won a reputation for aggressively battling enemy aircraft at any opportunity, making Ace with five aerial victories in his first four engagements. By October 1944, Bong had a total of 30 victories and received the Medal of Honor and a ban on more combat flying. Despite orders, Bong pushed his score to 40, plus seven probables, before he was sent home in January 1945. Tragically, Bong lost his life test piloting the new generation of jets later that year.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Doctor Who: Exterminate! The Miniatures Game – The Pting: Soldier of Fortune
description: Blessed with a toxic skin, vicious claws and an all-but-insatiable hunger for all manner of inorganic matter, the diminutive Pting can be a menace to interstellar travellers as the Thirteenth Doctor found during The Tsuranga Conundrum. Pting are believed to have been impossible to kill, and could even survive in the vacuum of space. They could even eat a bomb and barely be affected when it detonated other than temporarily sating its rapacious hunger.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: The Haunted House: Magic Mirror
description:
The Haunted House: Magic Mirror is an innovative puzzle game that uses reflected images in the mirror as the main mechanism. It is the Haunted House version of Mirror Garden.

Some changes have been made from the original game.

(1) The level of difficulty has been adjusted, so younger players may also play the game.
(2) Each player gets 3 semicircular ghost boards instead of 2 semicircular garden boards from the original game. Now, there are more options.
(3) Players just have to figure out the order of the ghosts in a line rather than to figure out the whole formation of the flower beds in multiple layers.

How to Play:
1. Each player takes one foldable mirror and three ghost boards.
2. Open a puzzle card and players simultaneously try to create the same image on the puzzle card with the mirror and the boards.
3. They can do this by laying 1 to 3 ghost boards on the table (may overlap one another) and then place the mirror along the lines separating each sector.
4. Once it is done, the player calls out the code and checks the answer sheet, if it were correct the player gains a point. If it were wrong, then the other player gets the point.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Puzzle
mechanics: Layering, Pattern Recognition, Real-Time, Simultaneous Action Selection, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: The Haunted House: Confusing Circle
description:
The Haunted House: Confusing Circle is a speed matching game that helps children to practice addition.
“Collect ghosts with Shinbi’s powerful magic circle and magic dice before they disturb the peace of Shinbi Apartment!”

How to Play:
(1) Set the board and place ten ghost cards on each side of the decagonal board.
(2) A player rolls two dice. Then, all players simultaneously look for the ghost cards correspond to both dice.

One die tells the number of ghosts and the other one tells the number of wisps that should be on it.


(3) After spotting the cards, add up all the number on the board where they are attached. Shout out the total!
(4) If the math is right, the player takes all those cards. Each card gives 1 point.
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Math, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Pattern Recognition, Real-Time, Simultaneous Action Selection, Speed Matching

name: The Haunted House: Raon
description:
The Haunted House: Raon is a word game using Korean alphabet, Hangul, tiles.

How to Play:
(1) Make a face-down deck with a boss card and ten ghost cards.
(2) Place the Hangul tiles face-up in the center of the table.
(3) Open the top card from the deck.
(Each card tells you what kind of words to make)
ex: a word start with ‘¬’ or ‘ ’, a word related to ‘plants’
(4) Use the tiles in the center to make words under a given condition.
(5) Players get points depend on the order they finish.

The biggest difference from the original Raon game is that there are now ghost cards to defeat!
The ghosts and the bosses can be defeated by making specific types of words written on each card.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Word Game

name: A Most Dangerous Rescue
description:
A Most Dangerous Rescue is a race between you and the Yovuz Ustalar Gang as you attempt to rescue precious artifacts before the Yovuz Ustalar can use them for nefarious purposes. As you race across the globe searching for each artifact, you fight against members of the Yovuz Ustalar. Your travels take you to the ends of the earth and to the Boss of the Yovuz Ustalar. The world won’t be safe until you defeat the Boss or ensure that all the artifacts are out of the Yovuz Ustalar’s reach.

This is a solitaire card chase game, in which you will go from site to site to fight the 4 evil gang members one by one, trying to defeat them before they gain 4 powerful artifacts. Each gang member has its own strategy, so you should plan your game accordingly to their appearance order.

The game evolves around "scenes", when each turn is represented by a unique scene card. Each scene offers 4 different strategies to pick from. Strategies includes actions like "attack and research", "attack and invest", "research and fortify" etc. The evil gang member always choose his strategy first, according to his own preference and his resources, and then the player gets to retaliate.

The player needs to destroy all gang members, one by one, before time runs out. The player loses if he fails to defeat the boss before running out of time.

Occasionally, a powerful artifact will be found in a scene and the players should secure it before the Evil Yovuz Ustalar will be able to collect it.

Part of the 2022 pnp solitaire contest.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Print & Play
mechanics: Action Timer, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Investment, Race, Resource to Move, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: L'escroc
description:
The card game combining announcements, trumps and tricks, to play as a team or independently.

Find the techniques of Belote, Tarot and other great classics in this L'escroc game with an additional feature: the powerful joker L'escroc who can intervene in the game at any time and modify the final outcome!

Rules for several different variations with different win conditions included.

name: Walt Disney's Mickey Mouse and his Friends
description:
Walt Disney's Mick Mouse and his Friends is a simple roll and move game where players begin at Micky's house and travel around a path that passes famous Disney movie settings and characters, such as Geppetto's toy shop, Cinderella's Castle and Goofy's Ice Cream shop.
Landing on a certain space by the roll of the dice can make a detour off the main path and take a short cut. First to return back to Mickey's home is the winner.

The larger boxed game was published by the National Game Company in Melbourne, Australia, credited to have been the first large-scale Australian manufacturer of locally-designed board games. The game appears an oddity in respect to other National board games in relation to the topic chosen, the use of the Shield logo when most boxed games used the Oval Logo and the suspected late year of publication around 1952 based on the board having Cinderella's Castle with the Disney movie released in 1950.

—user summary

name: Weiß Schwarz: Eren – Undercover
description:
Promotional card awarded by Brotherwise Games, LLC at Gen Con 2022 at their Booth 331.

This is a Character card ("CH") for Eren: Undercover from the Final Season of Attack on Titan.
He has a Level of 0 and Cost of 0 with no Counterattack.
The Card Number is AOT/SX04-P03 PR. That means: it is from the Attack on Titan Set, is part of the Schwarz side, Release is 04, and the Rarity is Promo.
Eren has a blank Trigger icon.
His Power is 3000.
He has 1 Soul Point.
He is given 1 Characteristic: Eldian.
He is associated Green for "Recovery."
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game

name: Weiß Schwarz:  Making the Best Memories
description:
Promotional card awarded by Brotherwise Games, LLC at Gen Con 2022 at their Booth 331.

This is an Climax card ("CX") for Making the Best Memories.
The Card Number is KMD/W96-PE04. That means: it is from the Miss Kobayashi's Dragon maid Set, is part of the Weiss side, and Release is 96.
This is a Continuous Climax card.
The Special Trigger is Door. Thus, its description is: "All of your characters get +1000 power and +1 soul.
When this card triggers, you may choose a character with [Soul Point] in its trigger icon in your waiting room, and return it to your hand or put it into your stock)"
It is associated Yellow for "Speed."
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game

name: Witt
description:
Witt incorporates the single piece movement and the jump and capture mechanism of checkers along with allowing players to jump their own pieces as in chinese checkers. There are multiple objectives that individually could be an agreed upon as a single win condition or in various combinations where all are needed to win.

The possible winning objectives are:

get a single peg to the row behind the opposite black line on the board (penetration).
get a single peg into the opponent's starting area, and keeping it there without capture for a single turn (occupation).
achieve a score of 13 (kept on two tracks on the side of the board) where a point is scored at the beginning of each turn for each of the player's pegs in the opponent's territory, even if it survived from a previous turn (accumulation)
at the beginning of the player's turn, has a single peg in the opponents territory that has all 8 surrounding holes empty (isolation).
eliminate all of the opponent's pieces (elimination).


There are also rules to prevent blocking (3 pegs of one player in a row) and to get players' pieces out of the set up area (one player cannot have more than 4 more pegs than the other in the set-up areas).
mechanics: Grid Movement, Pattern Movement, Point to Point Movement, Square Grid, Static Capture

name: The Game: The War Between the States
description:
The War Between the States is a gigantic timeline of facts, develops study skills, strengthens research skills, and promotes the practice of critical and creative thinking skills. The multidisciplinary approach forces relationships between the Civil War and the following disciplines: mathematics, social science (history, politics, economics, and geography,) fine arts (art, music, drama, and dance,) language arts (creative writing, literature, and language,) science , and the occupational arts.

The game consists of a 'board' of over 346 spaces, which are displayed in sequential order all around a classroom or other large room. Each player will create their own pawn to move, based on some historical item from the period: a cannon, a horse and carriage, a Southern Belle figurine, etc.

The goal of the game is to complete all the activities through the end of the war. The player with the highest score wins. No additional points are specifically assigned for speed, but players who do finish before other players are done may go back to the beginning of the board and play through more spaces to earn more points.

Each player takes their turn independently; they do not have to wait for others to catch up. Each space on the board contains either an activity, a quiz, a research project, all in chronological order starting in the 1830's and ending at the surrender of the Confederate forces in 1865. If a player cannot complete the task in the space after a reasonable amount of time, they are allowed to move either one space back or forward, and try again.

Each player has a Personal Score sheet and a Witness Tally sheet. When a player completes the task on a board space, they are scored on a scale of 1 to 5 according to the completeness of the effort. Witnesses are assigned for each session, and they function as rules enforcers while other players are taking their turns. Witnesses also earn points for monitoring other players, and log their activity accurately on the Witness Tally sheet.

The game ends when either all players complete a course through the spaces to the end, or a pre-determined time limit has been reached.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Llamas Unleashed: Guard Llama Promo Card
description:
Kickstarter exclusive card for Llamas Unleashed included for to anyone who preorders Llamas Unleashed through Backerkit during the Unstable Unicorns Control & Chaos campaign.

Card Name: Guard Llama
Card Type: Magical Llama card
Card Text: Goat cards in your Field cannot be destroyed.

name: A Seita
description: A Seita is a game of strategy surrounded by a theme of Lovecraftian horror, with a bit of humor, where each player takes the role of a cultist leader, disputing the control of a conflituos cult. And to be the new cult leader they have to command their followers to the objective of summon up an ancient terrible god.
mechanics: Action Queue, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Take That, Worker Placement

name: Oh My Words!
description:
Can you rise to the challenge and come up with the best description, name or sentence using a maximum of three words to be the Top Duck?

If you think you've got the feathers, then Oh My Words! is the perfect game for you.

Oh My Words! can be played by three or more players, and is suitable for anyone older than the age of six.

You must have sense of humour and like words.

How to Play


Each player draws 6 Word cards from the game box.
A nominated Judge is selected. The Judge doesn't participate in a round, only imparts wise judgement.
The nominated Judge draws a random Challenge card from the game box. This will either be a Describe, Create or Finish the sentence challenge.
Each player must respond to the challenge using a maximum of 3 Word Cards. They place their cards down and say out their response. Suffixes can be used to modify the words. Hints are provided on the Word cards.
The Judge chooses the best response. This could be the most accurate or funny response. The Judge has the power to decide.
The winner gets a point and can keep the Challenge card.
The next round starts by players topping up their Word cards to 6 and selecting a new Judge.
Play for as long as you want and at the end the player with the most points / Challenge cards wins!

name: Party or Naughty
description:
The rules are simple.

Grab pen and paper.
Write down all the names/teams on a sheet of paper.
Toss all party, naughty and joker cards together and take turns drawing a card.

The player who draws the card reads out the assignment. When the task is completed, the player receives the corresponding number of points after their name or team.

However, if the player does not complete the task, he must drink what the card indicates.

The team or player with the least number of points loses and must draw one of 5 loser cards. The team or player who reaches 20 points first wins and the team or player with the least number of points at that point loses.

If you are playing in teams, there is mutual discussion as to who on the team should draw the loser card and also execute it.

—description from the designer

name: Storyteller
description:
Storyteller is a co-operative boardgame with one Game Master, called the Storyteller, and up to three other players called “Adventurers”.

The Storyteller is the player who controls the enemies in the game, and who narrates the story and encounters throughout the game, all of which are written on their own cards.

The Adventurers engage in different encounters across the world, either combat or exploration. Combat encounters are solved using an Adventurer’s skills, attributes and items. Exploration encounters are less harmful, and mostly involve a short riddle, or a decision to be made that has immediate consequences.

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Fantasy, Medieval, Video Game Theme

name: North Africa: Mid War Forces
description:
A source book for Flames of War detailing the desert campaigns of North Africa for all combatants (British, America, German, and Italian).

It has been a while since we turned the spotlight on the war in the desert, but that is about to change with the release of the North Africa compilation and the accompanying starter and army sets.

Whether you are returning to the Mid-War period or starting from scratch, everything you need is now easily accessible in one place. The North Africa compilation includes all of the existing Mid-War books for the war in the desert:

Afrika Korps, 90th Light, and Death from Above for the Germans,
Armoured Fist and Red Devils for the British,
Avanti and more from Death from Above for the Italians, and
Fighting First and All American for the Americans.

In addition, we’ve brought back many of the odd and unusual tanks from the Mid-War Monsters book from ten years ago.

The book really does have everything a beginner needs: history and background, interesting formations, organisational information for building a force, and game stats for playing the game. Each army has a painting and basing guide, along with a beautifully illustrated catalogue of the available models. It is a one-stop gaming resource for the fighting in the Western Desert leading to the decisive Battle of Alamein and the close-fought battles in Tunisia that finally sealed the fate of the Axis in North Africa.

Each country has its own section, starting with a guide to some of the major battles they fought, their unique special rules, and the organisation of their forces. Each country has a selection of formations that you can field. These usually include light and medium tanks or self-propelled guns, and various types of infantry including armoured infantry in half-tracks for the Americans, paratroopers for each country, and rangers and commandos. This is followed by a selection of anti-tank guns, artillery, anti-aircraft guns, and aircraft to support your core formation. All-in-all, there are 33 different formations to choose from, or to mix and match to create your unique force.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, World War II

name: Birth: 4D
description: 4D was an expansion for the game Birth which added rules and components for a fourth player.

name: Ryan's World: World Tour
description:
It’s the ultimate race around the world! Hit the skies in hot air balloons with Ryan and the Combo Crew! In this adventurous and educational board game, you will visit all seven continents: Africa, Antarctica, Asia, Australia, Europe, South America, and North America.

Spin the spinner, take turns moving your hot air balloons across the board, and collect stars along the way! The player with the most stars in the end wins. Along the way, you will learn about capital cities, flags, national flowers, and what makes each country unique! With collectible Micro Figures, Micro Figure Cards, and more, your world tour with Ryan and the Combo Crew is full of epic surprises. Each game comes with 2 collectible Micro Figures. Collect all 53! Each figure celebrates something signature to each country.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Génération Mimes
description:
PLAYABLE FROM 4 YEARS: Génération Mimes is a board game accessible to the youngest thanks to these children's cards with images which also allow non-readers to play. It is also an EDUCATIONAL GAME because it allows the youngest to consolidate their vocabulary.

3 LEVELS OF DIFFICULTY FOR A GREAT GIFT: This board game has been designed for everyone to have fun: it is an ideal gift for children and adults alike! It's a card game that will allow beginners and mime experts to have a good time!

BONUS: HILARIOUS CHALLENGES: Act out with your eyes closed or your hands behind your back! Not easy to mimic with the challenges we have created for you for this card game! A board game mechanic that changes and allows you to go crazy with friends in the evening.

A SIMPLE BOARD GAME: The rules are accessible to all: One of the players mimes, the one who guesses wins the card and will have to mime in turn. The first to 10 cards wins the game! Play classic mode or team mode for even more fun!

A TIMELESS CONCEPT: this mime game is one of the most entertaining games to spend time having fun. Whether you are with family or friends, here to laugh or to win, Génération Mimes is the solution to have a good time!
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Humor, Party Game

name: Toublitou
description:
On your turn you will:

Announce the number of question cards whose answers you think you can remember. Beware, each Question card randomly contains between 2 and 5 questions

Listen and memorize in one go all the answers to the questions asked.

Restore the answers without making mistakes and respecting the initial order.

Let memory win!

There are 3 types of themes, fun, smart and personal

There are 6 lifelines to spice up your games

name: Defiance of the Gods
description:
Defiance of the Gods: The Rift is a board and card game that requires players to choose a side, Asgard or Olympus, use their deck to defend and attack strategic locations on the battleground with swords, death rays, force shields, warships, the Hammer of Thor, the Head of Medusa and so much more… Compete for control and destroy your opponent’s capital or ruler to win!

Defiance of the Gods has been designed so that players may build decks with the cards straight out the box. We have printed some cards less frequently, they are called Singularis cards and represent very powerful Gods, Generals, Weapons, Treasures, Locations, Terrains, Tactics, etc. These cards can only be used one per deck and as such offer some of the most powerful effects in the game. In one box you will find 275 cards with multiples of staple cards included to help you build your deck and one of each Singularis card in the complete set for the specified edition.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fantasy, Wargame
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Deck Construction, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Line of Sight, Move Through Deck, Movement Points, Player Elimination, Real-Time, Turn Order: Progressive

name: Το Ράλλυ του Ντόναλντ (Donald's Rally)
description:
A Disney-themed board game, which was released in Greece by Ο.Β.Ε.Π.Κ. toy company. It can be played from 2-10 players and the winner is the player who reaches the final spot first.
During the game, if a player reaches a spot/number with a red circle, he must follow the orders that mentioned in the instructions booklet. The winner of each round collects a beautiful Disney card with his/her beloved character.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: The Ratcatcher: The Solo Adventure Game – TouRat Peculiar Rat Promo
description:
This little bugger has wandered far and wide searching for magic cheese. But beware he hasn't stopped wondering and will cause new townships to be placed as he explores the kingdom of Brie at your expense.

This rat causes new townships to be placed as he explores.

From the Drop Bears Kickstarter campaign.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers

name: ArchRavels: Dinos Theme Pack
description:
Expand the crafty world of ArchRavels with the new DINOS Theme Pack! Featuring 5 brand new adorable item tokens & crafting patterns: Pteradactyl, Anklysaurus, Triceratops, Stegasaurus, & T-Rex!

Mix 'n match these new patterns with your base game by using the included Projects+ Cards!

Let's Get Crafty!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: ArchRavels: Cuddles Theme Pack
description:
Expand the crafty world of ArchRavels with the new CUDDLES Theme Pack! Featuring 5 brand new adorable item tokens & crafting patterns: Otter, Red Panda, Koala, Aye Aye, Buffalo!

Mix 'n match these new patterns with your base game by using the included Projects+ Cards!

Let's Get Crafty!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: ArchRavels: Cryptid Theme Pack
description:
Expand the crafty world of ArchRavels with the new CRYPTIDS Theme Pack! Featuring 5 brand new adorable item tokens & crafting patterns: Jackalope, Chupacabra, Sasquatch, Mothman, & Nessie!

Mix 'n match these new patterns with your base game by using the included Projects+ Cards!

Let's Get Crafty!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Meet Me At The Creek
description:
In Meet Me at the Creek, players must try and get their Goaties out of their "HOME" area by rolling a 3 or 33 (BILLY BONUS) and to the finish area before anyone else..

Players can then create blockades and race to see who can get all 4 Goatees around Red Daisy Way, Hide & Seek Rd., Ice Bridge Ave., and Hellbender Dr., in an effort to be the first to grab a beer, tap their feet and Meet Me at the Creek.

There is plenty of strategy with 12 Ole' Slew foot safety areas and Away From The Mire landing strip. What a Goatie good time for all!

There are additional instructions for an 18+ adults version of the game to played which can be downloaded for free.
mechanics: Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Take That

name: Bin Off
description:
Go head to head with your friends in a battle of the bins. Collect waste cards, sort them into the appropriate bin, and claim the most sorted bins to emerge victorious!

Learn while you play! Bin Off is designed with real-world recycling and waste management strategies.

Strategy for all ages, with adjustable rules and quick games!

—description from the back of the box

name: The Adventure Zone: Kind of a Big Deal
description:
Put the petal to the medal! The Bureau of Balance has uncovered new locations to explore, Relics to claim, and Villains to battle. You'll need careful planning- and exceptional luck- to overcome these challenges, but Im sure you're up to the task that lies ahead. You're going to be amazing!

Be surprised by Hurley and Garyl! Impress your friends with The Pocket Spa, the Gustmaster 3000, and the legendary Free Cheese! Combine these new cards with the base game for more adventures in the Adventure Zone.

Whats Included in the expansion:

6 new mission cards:
Two Villains: The Gang and The Giant
Two Relics: The Sword and The Sash
Two Locations: The Race and The Carnival
60 Challenge cards - ten for each mission card
10 Fantasy Kostco cards
3 Surprise Cards (Help for Hurley, Ride the Binicorn, and G'Nash Lends A Hand)

name: Retail Strife
description:
A family fun game where you and your fellow coworkers navigate through a year of employment at a department store. You will track your performance, attendance,and number is f credit card promotions. But most importantly help customers! See who can get the highest wage increase by the end of the year.

Based roughly on the Game of Life.
mechanics: Events, Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move

name: TimeBomb Legacy
description:
Time Bomb Legacy is a cooperative game in which we play as SWAT and try to disarm bombs together.

The game is a campaign type game that can be played over and over again, not just once. As you complete missions, the bombs will evolve to new levels, and you will try to complete the requirements based on the added rules and cards!
mechanics: Deduction, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Team-Based Game

name: #hashtags
description:
#hashtags is a party game, based on a public domain game in which each player take turns attempting to get another player to guess famous people, objects, places, books, etc..

In the first round, clue givers can say anything they want, except for the name (or part of). On the the second round, clue givers can only say one word and the guessers can only try to guess once per card. And in the final round, clue givers can’t say anything at all: they can only use gestures and sounds (no words).

The player with the highest total score from the three rounds is the winner.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Humor, Party Game, Real-time
mechanics: Acting, Communication Limits, Memory, Team-Based Game

name: Football Final Ranking: England
description:
Football Final Ranking (FFR) is a solitaire game which allows you to recreate (or create) a football league from the beginning to any number of years in the future. FFR lets you play using top professional and amateur teams, rated – after extensive statistical research – for their abilities on the pitch.

With FFR you can play out a full season of a league on average 10 to 15 minutes, longer if you are using more teams.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Murder Mystery Party: Murder In Las Vegas
description:
Who gambles with murder?
It’s the first anniversary of the launch of the multi-million dollar Sweaty Palms hotel and casino. Only a few hand-picked guests are invited to celebrate by the hotel’s owner, Roland Ewynn. But during the big event, Roland is found dead, slumped over his office desk. Host your own party to find out who cashed in Roland’s chips!

Includes: : Invitations to be sent to your guests. Complete instructions on how to host the party. Character playbooks for all ten suspects. Costume suggestions. Menu suggestions. Clues. Solution to the murder. Note that the optional DVD content is not included in the download but it is not required to play the game.

name: Xmas Games
description:
With over 20 games to suit the occasion, this party-tin offers something for everyone!

Jam-packed with fun, there's everything from Xmas Karaoke; CD Games; Party Games; Trivia Quizzes; The New Year's Countdown & Auld Lang Syne sing-along plus a host of entertaining after-dinner games that will add to everyone's seasonal good-cheer!

name: Endless Dungeons
description:
Endless Dungeons is a solo dungeon crawling game where the player takes three heroes on a quest to enter the dungeon, slay the boss, and get out alive with as much loot as they can carry.

The game is designed to be highly modular, with expansions in development allowing more heroes, more monsters, more rooms, more everything.

You control the decks! You control the dungeons!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Modular Board, Move Through Deck, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Frankenfur!
description:
GAME SYSTEM



This entry is to allow for discussion/rating of the game system as a whole. It is not for a specific product or release. Versions will appear on the individual item pages.





Frankenfur is a TCG deck-builder in which players take on the role of mad scientists competing to see who can wreck the most destruction on The Village by creating the most powerful franken-monster out of animal body parts. Players will decide whether cards will be used as Voltage Points to power up their monster and bring it to life, or be used as Experiments or Assistants to either bolster their strategy or interfere with their opponents.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fighting, Horror, Humor
mechanics: Deck Construction, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Take That

name: Wordweave
description:
The Basic Tellin' Game

The game has been created by Jane Keeler and Kathy Gillis and is the result of many years of dreamwork.

Wordweave is a storytelling game where players agree on a time and place, imagine characters, and tell a continuous story, using card prompts.

—description from the back of the box

name: For Lovers Only
description:
A fun action game for two lovers (adults only). Practice makes perfect so if you don't reach the climax together then try again and again.

Two lovers roll the dice and move around a game board and have to draw passion cards which dare them to perform sensual actions, share secrets, etc. The game is a race to the climax space game, where the board and the passion cards create obstacles and challenges. Players move around the track, but in different directions. The board path is loosely in the shape of a heart, and the center of the heart is the climax space where both players are trying to reach. Also, the second player gets to roll last, so there is a chance that both players reach the climax together (which is a perfect game, the rules state).

—description from the rulebook

name: Firamic: The fair's challenge
description:
While you are visiting the most amusement and dynamic travelling fair, you will have to collect as much tickets as possible. To make the most out of your stay, you will have to play some "fair’s games” and pile up the tickets of every booth before your opponents. Prevent your rivals from scoring, take their tickets away, challenge them and at the same time defend yourself from thieves and other attacks. Choose a strategy and hurry up to be the first one to reach the goal, but you have to be careful, because they will do everything in their hands so that it won’t be easy to reach it. Let’s get started!

Each turn you either play a card or discard as many as you want, and then you replenish your hand to five cards again.

In the fair you could find:

4 Different booths, which have to be placed in front of you as your collection, after that you will be able to get its 1, 2 or 3 card tickets.
4 Types of tickets + the minstrel's tickets.
The minstrel itself, whom could be doing any kind of roguery.
2 Firamic crowns. First one to get each objective will receive a high ticket reward.
4 "fair’s challenges”, which you will have to win playing with the golden cards every time in order to get the tickets. Everyone will offer you one of their cards and you could choose with whom you want to play against.
A safety box, to protect your progress.
Some candy, but you must be fast enough to get them! Last one to arrive will pay!
And a thief ... and if you are lucky, maybe you could also find a security guard nearby for help.


Use your wit to create your own collection of booths, challenges and fill up your pockets with lots of tickets. It is recommended for a 2-4 player’s competition a goal of 20 tickets, and for a 5-6 player’s just 15 tickets.

Is this rivalry going to separate or gather your family and friends?

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Matching, Set Collection, Take That

name: Wordopoly
description:
Players start with a small amount of game money, then round a Monopoly-like game board where each "property" is a play on a linguistic term (Definition Drive, Antonym Avenue, Hyperbole Heights, etc). Landing on a property gives players the chance to buy it by correctly answering a related question. Players may also land on Opportunity Knocks spaces, where they draw a card to receive either a bonus ("Your story is voted most imaginative. Collect $10.) or a penalty ("You mix up antonyms and synonyms. Pay $5.). The board's Brain Drain space is its answer to Monopoly's Jail, and Think Tank is its Free Parking.

The winner is the first player who collects all seven properties from one of the four color groups. In addition to buying properties on which they land, players may also buy, sell, or trade properties with one another to reach the goal.

Game questions focus on American English grammar, vocabulary, expressions, and syntax, and increase in difficulty from kindergarten to high school level. They may be asked to all players in their original order, or may be chosen based on each player's age, so that younger and older players all have questions appropriate to their knowledge level.

Wordopoly is packaged in a durable blue plastic case with a double snap closure. It includes a folding game board, two six-sided dice, money in increments of $5, $10, and $20, 64 Opportunity Knocks cards, 28 deed cards, a rules manual, and six pawns.
mechanics: Questions and Answers, Set Collection, Trading

name: Afrika Reisende
description:
(whole title eng. Africa Travellers). New society game. Highly funny & amazing)

Roll and move board game from 1900's about 8 famous Africa explorers:
David Livingstone
Heinrich Barth
Gustav Nachtigal
Antoine d'Abbadie
Henry Morton Stanley
László Magyar
Georg Schweinfurth
Gerhard Rohlfs.
Each player choose the explorer. Each explorer has separate unique route of 8 stops. The first player, who reach the stop no 8, wins the game.

Unlike other typical roll and move games, in this game movement to the next stop occurs only if a specific number is rolled. The game also uses money, which can be gained or lost depending on the task and rolled numbers.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Emoticonundrums: Original Edition
description:
Put your Emoticon knowledge to the test with this new and amusing card game. Common and famous phrases are shown as Emoticons across 56 unique cards and you simply have to guess the correct phrases.

As we all interpret Emoticons differently this game is not as easy as it sounds and will result in fits of laughter as the ridiculous guesses ensue.

When a team or person successfully guesses the phrase they keep the card. The game ends when you have gone through all the cards.

The person or team with the most cards at the end of the game is the winner. (You can also just play to a set time limit or first to so many cards).
mechanics: Deduction, Move Through Deck, Set Collection

name: Little Astronauts Board Game
description:
Help the little astronauts race around the solar system! It's time for the little astronauts first big space race. Help them fly across all the planets while avoiding space obstacles and collecting shields to be the first one to make it back to earth and win the big race!

In Little Astronauts Board Game, kids will race across the solar system by using their rocket fuel to fly through space. But they better watch out! Each round players will encounter an obstacle, and how far they move ahead will depend on how much rocket fuel they tried to use. Strategically use your rocket fuel to move ahead and avoid the space obstacles.

The first astronaut to race all the way around the solar system and make it back to earth wins the big space race!

Colorful and detailed images make this story driven game a great way for kids to develop their basic counting and strategic thinking skills. Limited reading and easy counting make this a game for kids aged 4+ to enjoy!

name: My First Treasure Hunt Board Game
description:
Work together to race around the mysterious island and find the hidden treasure before the big storm covers the island! The treasure hunters have found a treasure map for the mysterious island and have arrived to find the hidden treasure. Players must work together to explore the different areas of the island to find all the treasure before they leave.

In My First Treasure Hunt kids race around the island, trying to collect all the hidden treasure while outrunning the big storm. Players will move across the board using their numbered cards to collect their treasure tokens while avoiding obstacles that will set them back. Work as a team to explore all the areas of the island in time to find the treasure.

Storm cards are mixed into the deck of cards players use to move around the board. When a storm card is picked up and played, a new storm cloud token is added to the top of the board. if all the storm cloud spaces are filled with cloud tokens before players find all the treasure and get back to their canoe, then the game is lost.

If the treasure hunters find all their treasure and make it back to their canoe before the storm covers the island, everyone wins!

My First Treasure Hunt uses creative and colorful scenes that make searching for treasure fun and imaginative. This cooperative game is a perfect introduction to basic counting, teamwork, and strategic thinking.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Events, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Mayas & Dragons
description:
Truck lights. Screeching brakes. Darkness... then brilliant warmth!

You just got yourself isekai-ed into a world of monsters and magic. As the fabled hero of legend, you are destined to free the land from darkness. Neat.

Harnessing the power of the Mayaverse, call upon heroes from other timelines to join your quest to save this world from corruption. Lead your party to slay the dragon and dispel the Dark Realm Magic from this land forever!

Gameplay: Players create a party from a number of hero cards, then move across the map from location to location, fighting monsters they encounter. Attacking is done by rolling dice and keeping or re-rolling them to activate your heroes' powers.

—description from the designer

name: Magistrar: Drakor
description:
The 5th mage of "MAGISTRAR" – DRAKOR – is an exclusive add-on for our KS supporters and not included in the retail version.

Drakors special spell - additionally damage for your opponent: Put the opponent's scoring pawn there where it hurts.

name: SillySaurus: The Card Game
description:
A simple card game for children. This is an 18 card deck with each card being double sided so that both sides may be played during the game. Each player must build a dinosaur using 4 cards to represent the body, head, legs and tail of the dinosaur. Whoever builds their dinosaur first wins.

—description from designer
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Prehistoric, Print & Play

name: Derby
description:
8 Horses race the track and any number of players may place bets for "Win" or "Place". Movement of the horses is determined by a spinner, which shows for each horse, depending on the space it occupies, how much spaces it may advance, if any. The race ends, when 3 horses have reached the finish line and the winnings from the bets are being payed.

The game was most likely published in the 1920s.

—user summary
mechanics: Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Drunter und drüber
description:
The players roll the dice to move their "caps" around the board. If a player lands on another cap or a stack of caps, that player captures the stack by placing his cap on top of the stack. A player then seeks to return that stack of caps to home-base to keep them secured and free his own caps from the stack. The violet spaces are safe spaces where caps can't be captured. If a player rolls a 6, he turns the turntable one space clockwise after moving his cap. The game ends when there is only one active color of caps left on the board. The last player who has active caps left on the board is the winner.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Static Capture

name: Quelle-Pferderennen
description:
The players take turns to roll and move. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. The first player to reach the finish wins the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Lustige Jahresreise
description:
The players take turns to roll and move. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. The first player to reach space 46 wins the game.

This game was a birthday giveaway for kids and seems to be from the 1950s.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Travelers of the World Famous Destinations
description:
Travelers of the World Famous Destinations - This is a strategy board game where players follow a tour guide to collect points.

A player starts a turn by rolling 4 dice, two white and two colored (blue) dice. The white dice controls the tour guide and the colored dice control your colored travelers (meeples). Each player has their own color but everyone uses the same tour guide. The object is to line up your travelers (meeples) in the same column as the tour guide to collect points. The first player to 300 points wins the game.

In the destination version, you must collect all seven destinations as well as get the 300 points. To do this you either land on a destination, get a card to collect it/steal it, or buy the destination for 100 points; but remember you must also collect the 300 points to win.

Happy Travels!!
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Land of Z
description:
Land of Z is a tactical game in a zombie universe. Players must survive while waiting for a helicopter and flee in it. The game has two modes: cooperative and semi-competitive (with the same rules). The game mechanics are based on an original system of movements and actions on an area of sixteen cards (4x).

For the turn : a player can do one action : move, use a card equipment card or attack a zombie.

There is only one way to win: reach the helicopter that arrives at the end of the game.

And two ways to lose: all players die or there are no more life markers in the general supply.

-description from designer

name: Fukuoka (fan expansion for Age of Steam)
description:
Age of Steam: Fukuoka is an expansion map for Age of Steam which introduces an area majority mechanic. The board is divided into four areas, and when a player delivers a cube, they take a track ownership disc from that route and move it to one of the special boxes tracking the majorities for any of the regions the route passes through. A neutral player color disc is given ownership of the track and any players may use the track.

There are special actions around reclaiming ownership of track, adding discs to the majority boxes, and swapping discs in the boxes.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Trains, Transportation
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Auction/Bidding, Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver, Tile Placement

name: Basketball Coach: A Hall of Fame Game
description:
In Basketball Coach you play as a coach and call in plays as you try to become a world champion on your way to developing a hall of fame career. The game is a variant of and homage to Shanghai Rummy while incorporating the theme and tension associated with coaching basketball. Each game is made up of stops and runs.

A stop is a play with at least three of the same card. Suit does not matter when playing a stop. Think three of a kind.

A run is a play with at least four cards in sequence of players from the same suit. Think straight.
