On your turn, you must: 1) draw a card from the top of the deck or the top of the free agent pool (discard pile); 2) Set your roster in hand; 3) Discard a player. The round ends when the first person gets rid of all of the cards in their hand.

You may also: Call in a play if you have the right players in hand. Plays are called after a card is drawn and before a card is discarded.

The game ends after the 7th round and the Coach given up the fewest points wins the game and is on their way to a Hall of Fame career!

name: Cardoku
description:
Cardoku is a head-to-head Sudoku game using Tech Decks, modernized decks of playing cards.

Players divide into two teams. Each turn, players/teams draw a card, then play a card. If they have no cards in their deck, they have additional options open to them. They can move a card or swap two cards. The game ends when either all players have no cards in hand or there are no more possible plays.

Players score points when they complete a row, column or 3x3 box.
mechanics: Deduction, Pattern Building, Pieces as Map, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid, Team-Based Game

name: Archroma
description:
Archroma is a thematic, lightweight Eurogame centered around bag management.

In Archroma, players are sorcerers who have just completed their first year course in Archromancy — the practice of colour magic. Now they must demonstrate their skills in their end-of-year examination. Who will come top of the class?

During the game, players need to create mana crystals in the six hues of magic (Red, Yellow, Green, Cyan, Blue, and Magenta) which will provide the fuel for their spells. Each player is equipped with their own magic component bag, which provides the primary mechanism for creating new mana crystals.

The winner is the player with the most points at the end of the game. Points are awarded for each spell a player has cast, with larger spells and spells using more colours of mana worth more points. The scoring system rewards players for casting the widest range of spells they can, and for using a variety of the colours of magic.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Set Collection

name: Emergency Force
description:
Help police, fire and ambulance response teams join together as part of your Emergency Force!

Emergency Force is a tile placement game in which players seek to deploy their emergency response teams (police, medical and fire) to where they are most needed. Players construct the city by placing tiles, each of which contains one or more incidents worth points to any response team deployed to that block. Each type of team scores points differently and the player with the most points at the end of the game wins.

name: Ark
description:
Ark is a simple card game in which players are trying to collect pairs of animals for their ark. On each turn a player adds animals from their hand of cards to one of the boats. If this boat is now full they must take all of the animals from the boat onto their ark. Pairs of animals in a player's ark score points; unpaired animals could attract a penalty.

The player with the most points at the end of the game wins.
mechanics: Hand Management, Kill Steal, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: The Strange and Twisted Game
description:
Summary: World-renowned mystery writer, Rosemary Clark, has seen more than her fair share of adventure. In addition to authoring some of the most tightly-plotted mysteries to ever hit the Best Seller list, she has also helped solve a few as well like the case of The Dark and Stormy Night and The Old and Hidden Secret. Now comes a new Rosemary Clark mystery that places her firmly in the crosshairs of someone calling themselves The Hangman. The Hangman has challenged Rosemary either to uncover his secret or face an unspoken wrath whose details he won't divulge. Accompany Rosemary on her quest to determine The Hangman's identity and why she has been dragged into the middle of this case. Yet, beware, this mystery is anything but straightforward. In the words of Rosemary herself, this is truly "A Strange and Twisted Game" indeed!

As with all Deadbolt Mystery Society games, you step into the role of the detective. Examining the evidence provided, visiting different locations and using the password protected QR mechanic to uncover the truth.

Players win once they catch the killer, find whats missing or whatever else is needed to solve the case at hand.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: John Doe
description:
Summary: Once again, your job as a Will Street Detective has landed you in the middle of a strange case. The police have called you to help investigate the homicide of a John Doe. The victim was found in the trunk of a car at Lewis’s Junkyard just before the vehicle was scheduled to be crushed. No identification was found on the victim who had been beaten past the point of recognition. As you sift through the items found scattered throughout the car, it becomes clear that this man was involved with something nefarious. Can you sort through the clues to identify this John Doe and find out who killed him?

As with all Deadbolt Mystery Society games, you step into the role of the detective. Examining the evidence provided, visiting different locations and using the password protected QR mechanic to uncover the truth.

Players win once they catch the killer, find whats missing or whatever else is needed to solve the case at hand.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Shadow Brume
description:
The house is alive but trying to kill you, you must find what you are looking for before all the light runs out and you are trapped.
In this semi-cooperative game, you take turns collecting artifacts. If you run out of light, you lose.

Each player gets a pawn and a player board with slots for equipment. Each player will get a unique character with their own items to use. The layout of the dungeon is somewhat fixed but the setup will be different in each game. The equipment will be scattered across the board and each room will receive a set amount of light plus some extra distributed by the players at the setup of the game. Players may also trade to get what they need to win.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Memory, Movement Points, Point to Point Movement, Semi-Cooperative Game, Set Collection, Trading, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Scripture Text Making
description:
'The New Sunday Pastime for old & Young'.

Primarily aimed at children at Sunday School. Players collect words from the supply on the centre of the table. The objective is to form complete scripture texts. If a text has a word added correctly that play can continue taking words until a non-required word is drawn. Turn then passes to the next player.

The player who forms his or her text(s) first wins or as the rules say "Top of the class".

name: Kipp Kubus
description:
The Kipp Kubus-class mothership has found a solar system with many inhabited planets. Your task is to collect new technologies that can be found on these planets.

Each player controls two Cubie-class starships. These can move through space in three ways: tilting, sliding, and rotating. Three actions must be performed in each round. One of them is the mothership Kipp Kubus. The other two actions are determined by cards and a die.

Decide tactically wisely which action you carry out with which Cubie. And beware of the many asteroids in this solar system. Collect as many technologies as possible to win the game.

—description from the designer

Das Mutterschiff der Klasse Kipp Kubus hat ein Sonnensystem mit vielen bewohnten Planeten gefunden. Eure Aufgabe ist es, neue Technologien zu sammeln, die auf diesen Planeten zu finden sind.

Jeder Spieler steuert zwei Raumschiffe der Klasse Cubie. Diese können sich auf drei Arten durch den Weltraum bewegen: Kippen, Schieben und Drehen. Jede Runde müssen drei Aktionen durchgeführt werden. Eine davon gibt das Mutterschiff Kipp Kubus vor. Die anderen zwei Aktionen werden durch Karten und einen Würfel bestimmt.

Entscheidet taktisch klug, welche Aktion ihr mit welchem Cubie ausführt. Und nehmt euch in Acht vor den vielen Asteroiden in diesem Sonnensystem. Sammelt so viel Technologien wie möglich, um das Spiel zu gewinnen.

—description from the designer (German)
mechanics: Command Cards, Grid Movement, Set Collection, Take That

name: What's Your Excuse?
description:
The best excuse wins - You have 30 seconds!

1. A judge reads a question card. Everyone else has a word card.
2. Using the word on their card, each player has 30 seconds to respond with an excuse.
3. After every player has answered, the judge must choose their favorite one.
4. Pass out new cards, switch judges, repeat!

Your word may have nothing to do with the question, so be creative and make up something absurd even if it makes no sense.

The perfect game to play at parties with friends and family! It's hilarious, fast-paced and takes only seconds to learn.
mechanics: Action Timer, Player Judge, Questions and Answers, Storytelling

name: Cubicus Rex
description:
As all worthy corporate legionnaires, you thirst only for total victory.

In Cubicus Rex, victory is achieved with the highest of office perks: promotions. You’ll partner with fellow legionnaires to complete milestones and projects – the steps toward the higher rank you crave – through fast-paced yet strategic rounds of play.

Choose your legion with your performance reviews, then wage war with staplers, sundials, whiteboards, and more in the quest for promotion. But take heed: your compatriots in one battle may become your foe in the next! Manage your hand wisely and stay vigilant as you build chains of cards to earn your promotions. Every card you play has another action in store – which can turn the tide of battle.

Players pair up to complete project chains. The object is to be the first player to complete enough projects to be promoted 3 times.

Finish your milestones. Complete your projects. Get promoted three times, and you will be crowned CUBICUS REX.

name: Lock ‘em Up!
description:
Lock ‘em Up! is a game of political dirty tricks where you have to put your opponents in jail before they do it to you. The winner is the last player with a character not in jail.

The game consists of a total of three decks worth of cards split into two groups: the Character Cards, the people you’re trying to keep out of jail; and the Action Cards which give you power and influence to make strategic moves in the game.

Players choose which group of characters they want to control — the White House, the Military, Law & Order, Progressives, Conservatives, or Lobbyists. Players then take turns drawing from the Action Cards deck, using those cards to indict or save characters. When the game board resembling a courtroom is full, the convictions start. Turn by turn, the Characters on the docket are sent to a jail cell, and out of the game.
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Hand Management, Player Elimination

name: Germ War
description:
In a world that is only visible with the aid of a microscope, life is teeming with activity and tension. Germs are in a constant state of growth and propagation. In the petri dish, only one faction of germs can reign supreme. It is an epic war of microscopic proportions. Each faction will vie for control of the petri dish, one section at a time. Through sheer dominance, the strongest germ faction will win out. The fate of the petri dish begins with the roll of the dice.

In Germ War, two players will attempt to grow and propagate their germ factions, in order to conquer the petri dish. The faction that dominates a majority of the sections, reign supreme and wins!

At the beginning of each round, a player will mark off the next available spot on the round tracker. Alternating turns, players can do one of two actions: "Germ Growth or "Germ Strength Increased". When a player chooses Germ Growth, they will draft a reproduction die and apply the effects. If a player has a section(s) with a die valued at six, that player will increase their Germ Strength by marking off their germ icon and rotate the die to a one. The first player to do this three times in a section, will maintain a dominate presence in that section for the remainder of the section. If a player does this four times in the game, that player wins the game.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Tug of War

name: Chrome Hammer Ascension: The Ikarus Incident
description:
The Ikarus Incident is a scripted series of 6 new scenarios for Chrome Hammer: Ascension that allow your 'Punks got gain a powerful new perk in their fight against the Corporations.

Played it once? Play it again with random scenarios, enemies and headlines!
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Flames of War: M12 155mm Artillery Battery
description:
The long 155mm guns have great range and firepower. Even heavy battle tanks are not safe from their heavy shells. These big guns have a secondary role as bunker busters when German fortifications slow down the advance.

Box comes with a platoon of five M12 guns and unit cards.

name: Money Smart
description:
A fun game, that can also teach taking risks and investing. It helps develop an investor mindset. Made with focus on fun, life realities. It has a more modern investing approach, with focus on Bitcoin, startups, Apps, stocks ...

The game is optimized for 2-4 players (even though it is possible to have more players),

Gameplay:

The game follow the classical board game mechanism, the player throws the dice and advances to the correct slot on the board.
The game is played counter-clock wise, and has 3 user types, a player needs to pay to switch to the other type. Upon every end of round the player collects money based on the type (and or investments).
Based on the slot you land on, multiple scenarios are possible. these Scenarios simulate life.
- Work : makes you lose a round. (to simulate the time we lose working for others)
- Life : You get to spin an arrow attached to the board, where you land on one of life's surprises.
- Deals : You get to withdraw the deals card, and invest (only possible for business and investor)
- Choices: You get a choices card and based on the answer fill the zen card (helps detect the player's nature).
- Stocks and bitcoin: quick risk taking action, with rewards based on dice value.
- Sabotage: You get to sabotage another player (details in the rules).
- Bills: You need to pay ...
- Other important slots: Taxes, Debt, Insurance, give an even extra realistic level to the game.
- Rules get all these elements interacting in a harmonious and homogeneous way, to make sure that not only luck is the deciding factor for winning.

Winning condition:

There are different game settings, to allow the game to be played for different periods of time.
Thus winning conditions also vary.

- In timed games: after the timer signals the end of game, the winner, is the user with most:
option 1) Cash Money (for simpler game - or younger players)
option 2) Recurring revenue

- None timed games:
+ Elimination game: you play till all players except 1 are eliminated. Elimination is triggered by not being able to pay debt or taxes. (simulating bankruptcy)

+ Goal set games:
option 1) First player to reach X amount in cash money (50k, 100k, 500k etc ...)
option 2) First player to reach X amount in recurring revenue (10k, 20k, 50k etc ...)

-description from publisher

name: Pacificum 15XX
description:
After the discovery of the Pacific Ocean by the Spanish explorer Vasco Nuñez de Balboa in 1513, it became the subject of dispute between the two great colonial empires of the time, Spain and Portugal. The Treaty of Tordesillas established a principle agreement for the division of the world, leaving this vast expanse of sea on the Spanish side, which came to be known as the "Spanish lake".

The expeditions sought quick access from South America to the Spice Islands, the Moluccas and also the mythical "Terra Australis Incognita" where they intended to find gold, spices and exotic products for the greater honour and wealth of the Spanish and Portuguese Crowns.

Thus, during the 16th and 17th centuries, the Pacific Ocean was a Spanish sea, only disturbed by some English and Dutch expeditions. During those years, Spanish navigators crossed it in various directions and discovered most of its archipelagos (Galapagos, Marquesas, Hawaii, Marianas, Philippines, Marshall Islands, Society), as well as circumnavigating New Guinea, sighting the coasts of Australia and exploring and colonising the Philippine archipelago.

One player represents the Spanish Empire based in the Viceroyalty of Peru, organizes his expedition departing from the port of El Callao. The other player in turn organizes another expedition departing from the port of Acapulco.

The player with the most victory points wins. Victory points are earned by discovering islands and mapping them, establishing colonies, Christianising natives, collecting exotic species of plants, birds and animals as well as natives and bringing them to the home port. Finding gold, pearls or spices, etc.

—description from designer

Tras el descubrimiento del Océano Pacífico por el explorador español Vasco Núñez de Balboa en 1513, este fue objeto de disputa entre los dos grandes imperios coloniales de la época, España y Portugal. Mediante el tratado de Tordesillas se establecía un principio de acuerdo para el reparto del mundo, quedando está vasta extensión de mar en la parte española y llegó a ser llamado el “lago español”.
Las expediciones buscaban un acceso rápido desde Sudamérica hacia las islas de las especias, las Molucas y también la mítica “Terra Australis Incognita” donde pretendían encontrar oro, especias y productos exóticos para mayor honor y riqueza de las Coronas Española y Portuguesa.
Así pues durante los siglos XVI y XVII el océano Pacífico fue un mar español, sólo perturbado por algunas expediciones inglesas y holandesas. Durante aquellos años, los navegantes españoles lo atravesaron en diversos sentidos y descubrieron la mayor parte de sus archipiélagos (Galápagos, Marquesas, Hawái, Marianas, Filipinas, Marshall, Sociedad), además de circunnavegar Nueva Guinea, avistar las costas de Australia y explorar y colonizar el archipiélago filipino.

Objetivo del juego : Un jugador representa al Imperio Español con base en el Virreinato del Perú, organiza su expedición partiendo del puerto de El Callao. El otro jugador representa a Portugal y parte de las islas Molucas. El otro jugador organiza a su vez otra expedición que parte del puerto de Acapulco.
Gana el jugador que consiga más puntos de victoria. Los puntos de victoria se consiguen descubriendo islas y cartografiándolas, estableciendo colonias, cristianizando nativos, recopilando especies exóticas de plantas, aves y animales, así como nativos y llevándolas al puerto base. Encontrando oro, perlas o especias, etc.

—description from designer (Spanish)
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Network and Route Building, Simulation, Tile Placement

name: Interstellar Nomad
description:
Interstellar Nomad is a set collection game where players earn points for completing the planet panoramas. In your quest for interstellar inhabitance, you’ll compete with an opponent to earn the highest Nomad Score. to win each round and the overall game.

DESCRIPTION Construct panorama’s of planets across the galaxy through twists and turns, outwit your opponent in this compact easy-to-learn, two-player card game!

HOW TO PLAY

Greetings, Interstellar Nomad. Interstellar Nomad is a set collection game where players earn points for completing the planet panoramas. In your quest for interstellar inhabitance, you’ll compete with an opponent to earn the highest Nomad Score. to win each round and the overall game.

A game of Interstellar Nomad is played over 2 or more rounds. Each round consists of 4 steps:

Setup
Shuffle all cards into a deck. Deal 2 cards to you and your opponent. Place the remaining cards in a face-down draw pile on the table. Draw 5 cards and place them face-down in a Universal Row next to the deck with each card alternating orientation. Once the Universal Row is in place, reveal all face-down cards. Randomly determine the starting player for the first round. The losing player starts subsequent rounds.

Play Cards
Players take turns placing a single card onto their own play area. Cards can be played in one of two ways:

Place a card from your hand into your play area face up and in any orientation. This card will either start or continue a set. [next Resolve Card Actions]

Select a face-up card (active card) from the Universal Row and place it in your play area to start or continue a set. The card may be placed in the correct order of the set but must maintain it's previous orientation — landscape or portrait. [next Resolve Card Actions]

Resolve Card Actions
After playing a card, the player must execute the played card’s action(s), selecting and affecting a different active card — the active card must be within their play area or the Universal Row. [see Card Actions] The player then draws a card and adds it to the end of the Universal Row following alternating orientation. Play continues until all possible cards are played.

Determine the Winner
Points are awarded as follows at the end of each round: +1 for each active card within a set -1 for each missing card in a set -1 for each inactive card -1 for possessing the Wasteland (-2 if inactive) Bonus points are awarded for each complete set: +1 for a complete set in the correct order +1 for a complete set in the correct orientation The player with the highest Nomad Score after all cards are played wins the round.

The first player to win 2 rounds is the winner of the game and continues their interstellar journey.

name: Politi-King
description:
In Politi-King, players are trying to get to 30 coins or kill all their opponents around the table. However, players can accept bribes, so whoever can make the best deals is sure to win!

Each player begins with 25 health and 3 coins. At the end of each one of their turns, a player draws a card. Cards have a value of 3-7 and be either coins or swords. Coin cards are immediately replaced with coin tokens. However, sword cards can be used on future turns to lower someone else's health by the indicated amount, which usually leads to lots of threats and deals.

All deals are binding on the turn they occur, but you don't have to follow up threats. Will you be able to get away with paying nothing? Will you become a coward, but also a survivor? Will you establish Communism? Will you give away your money to appear weak, only to watch a bloodbath ensue between everyone else? Nearly anything can happen in Politi-King.

-description from designer
categories: Card Game, Medieval, Negotiation, Party Game, Print & Play, Real-time
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Betting and Bluffing, Bribery, Negotiation, Player Elimination, Prisoner's Dilemma, Trading

name: Rick and Morty: Close Rick-Counters of the Rick Kind Deck-Building Game – Promo Glootie
description:
Promo Card Glootie from Rick and Morty: Close Rick-Counters of the Rick Kind Deck-Building Game which was originally available at Gen Con 2019.

The first time you play a Beth, Summer or Jerry during each of your turns, any one foe may choose to draw a card. If one does, draw a card and you may destroy a card in your hand. (Only the first foe to respond draws.)
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Moonstone: Goblin City
description: This troupe box allows you to add three new heroes from Goblin faction to the game: Doug the Flatulent, Vicious Midget and Beaky Bobby.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Rock-Paper-Scissors

name: Best Wrong Answer
description:
Best Wrong Answer is a card based game consisting of 250 question cards and 40 forfeit cards. Gameplay is quite simple and fun!

This edition also contains 10 additional "nuclear cards" as a pre-order bonus!

HOW TO PLAY...
Step 1. Each player takes 10 life tokens.
Step 2. Select a designated "question reader" or take it in turns in a clockwise direction around the group
Step 3. Set the egg timer the moment the card has been drawn.
Step 4. Read the question and each player has to give their answer within the allotted 30 seconds!
Step 5. If nobody slips up and gives the correct answer then the group decides who's answer was least entertaining. The nominee then takes a spin on the...

"THE WHEEL OF FATES" and instantly looses 1 token!
-Will you loose more tokens or...COULD YOU GET LUCKY!

The Wheel of Fates has...

A 50% chance of landing "forfeit" grab a forfeit card!
A 37.5% chance of landing on a "loose a token" spot. This spot instantly results in loosing 1 more token!
A 12.5% chance of scooping the kitty of sacrificed coins with the jackpot spot!


Step 6. Repeat the above steps until all but one player has lost their tokens to determine the winner of the game!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Humor, Party Game, Real-time

name: Frontera
description:
Frontera was once a peaceful kingdom that dwell
many races from centaur that roams in forest, cyclops that dominate the mountain, and dwarf that live in dune. After the king is died of illness the kingdom is torn and fought over by 2 legitimate princes.

Each player represent the prince that try to win
this war by drafting dan deploying its army. Frontera is a 2 players game with 1 solo module for solo player, in this game each player will try to captured most token and controlling most terrain while balancing with owned resources

For more replayability, a player may choose from 3 alternative setup of modular terrain tile. With each setup a new style to attacking and defending yourself is made.

The core of this game is about placing your tokens using mancala mechanic and march them to chain battle combos while capturing enemies and controlling as many terrain as possible.

In the solo mode your objective is different than the 2 player game, because this time you will try to conquer the enemy as soon as possible before running out tokens.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Chaining, Mancala, Tug of War

name: Implosion
description:
Implosion is a middle weight euro-style dice game takes place in a sci-fi fantasy world.

The game is played in six rounds. Every round we salvage from an imploding dying star - a set of face-up cards placed in a circle on the table, with dice of different colours and values on them. Players take turns choose dice from the dying star in an Azul-like manner. After that, they will use the dice to generate resources, build cards into their tableaus, and use the dice to trigger the cards' abilities.

You can build armies to fight invaders from outer space, sell resources for points, or construct wonders for a lot of rewards.

The game ends after the sixth round. Every player sum up their VP token and VPs printed on the cards in their tableau, the one with the most points wins.

—description from the designer
categories: City Building, Dice, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Worker Placement with Dice Workers

name: Plane Jane
description:
You are the owner of a travel agency. Passengers want the best trips, with one airline, and those trips mean more profit for you as well. Create attractive itineraries to become the most successful agent.

Plane Jane is a card game for two players. It requires 36 cards, 9 each from four airlines.

Each card represents a flight between two cities offered by an airline. Each row of a card shows the connections that flight may make to form a trip. Itineraries are sets of exactly three cards. Each card could be the beginning, middle, or end of a trip depending on which row is used.

- If an itinerary is with one airline, the player scores $5 in profit and draws one card.
- If an itinerary contains only two affiliated airlines, the player scores $4 in profit and draws two cards.
- If an itinerary contains non-affiliated airlines, the player scores $2 in profit and draws three cards

The second player will select one of the three cards on the table and add two cards from their hand to make a new set.

The game ends when neither player can create an itinerary. The player with the most money is the winner.

name: Cody
description:
Players use their cards to program robots. Function calls can be used to repeat some actions. Loot boxes on game field give additional unique ability. Who gets more batteries wins!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hand Management, Programmed Movement

name: Dead By Dawn
description:
Dead By Dawn is the debut title from Retro Active Games

Will you survive the night?
Will you find The Truck Key and escape??
Or will you end up...Dead By Dawn???

"Head for that Farmhouse!" you think to yourself as the moans of the recently undead trail at your heels. You pass a Truck and some gas pumps outside the house...maybe there is a key somewhere? No time now! You just hope to make it inside and find some supplies to survive until the National Guard can sweep through in the next 12 to 24 hours. You see faint other figures on the horizon, assuredly living. Will they be friend or foe?

"Dead By Dawn" is a fast paced, strategic zombie kill-a-thon with a tinge of survival horror. Play with 2-6 players in a time (and part luck) based game of desperation and intuition. Survive until the game ends (Dawn) and have the most kills to win. Or hunt down The Truck Key and escape! But it's a big house, with many locked doors, and the key could be anywhere! You'll have to look for other keys to open any doors along the way, along with gather Weapons and Items to help you survive and win the game!

Gameplay:
Each player gets their own character card with unique abilities for the duration of each game. (Random distribution recommended.) Players attempt to roll and move, while strategically avoiding, fighting, placing, and moving the growing horde of zombies that keep filling the board. Players will attempt to reach the farmhouse at the center of the board with a "KEY" CARD or Character Ability to be able to unlock one of the the many doors in the place.
Inside these rooms, there are plenty of useful cards in the form of Items and Weapons, and sometimes even Key Tokens, to help you gain points via zombie kills or help you gain the upper hand and survive long enough to escape.
But along the way, you may encounter an unlucky or helpful event via the EVENT spaces that litter the board and force players to draw an EVENT CARD- that could change the course of the game!

Games are timed. A 2 player game is an hour, 3-4 player game is 2 hours, and a 5-6 player game is 3 hours. A sand-timer is included to track turns. Players have 2 minutes to complete their turn (barring house rules).

Players have limited inventory space likened to the mechanic present in "Resident Evil" video games. This can be increased by 1 slot by finding "The Backpack" ITEM CARD.

During each standard turn, players take possession of two dice. One black D-6 die with numeric values of 1 through 3 on all faces(these add zombies to the board every turn!). And one blue D-8, 1 - 8 die that is used for player and zombie movement. (Example: player rolls an 8. They may move 8 spaces, but zombies also get to move 8 spaces after player has made their movement. The Zombie Movement can be split any way. (One zombie can move 8 spaces, or two can move 4. etc)
The player also gets use and possession of the sand timer. During a turn, the player starts the timer, rolls and FIRST places zombies, THEN moves their player Pawn, use any cards, equip items, trigger an event/etc, THEN LAST- You may move any zombies on the board (this matches your rolled movement)

To win- survive until time runs out and have the most kills. OR alternatively, hunt down the keys to the truck outside and refill the gas tank and make it to the ESCAPE space at the back of the board. (This ends the game early and regardless of kill score)

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action/Event, Area Majority / Influence, Catch the Leader, Events, Hand Management, Highest-Lowest Scoring, I Cut, You Choose, Matching, Moving Multiple Units, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Player Elimination, Relative Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Take That, Variable Player Powers, Victory Points as a Resource, Worker Placement

name: Wit & Whiskers
description:
Multi-layer team tic-tac-toe with cards! With 4 ways to score you'll need all your Wit & Whiskers to come out on top of this dog pile.

The game starts by first splitting players into two teams, this should be done using alternating seat positions going around the play area so no two teammates are sitting next to eachother. The game cards are shuffled and 4 are dealt to each player to form their hands. Play starts with the player who most recently pet an animal.

The objective of the game is to be the first team to score a total of 15 cards. Cards are scored whenever a scoring pattern, called a Whisker, is formed in the 3 by 3 play area. The player who played the final card to form the Whisker scores all cards used to create that Whisker. There are 4 types of Whiskers: same animal in line of 3, same weapon in line of 3, total 10 in square of 4, or same color in solid area of 5.

Players take turns going clockwise around the table, playing one card into the 3 by 3 play area, and then drawing a card from the deck. Players can play their card into any empty space or on top of a card with a different background (e.g. play a day-time card on top of a night-time card). Stacking cards can be strategic, but is also a risk as creatings Whiskers will score the entire pile of cards!

-description from designer

name: Word Attack
description:
This game like a cross between "Wordle" and "Whirling Witchcraft."
Combine tiles and cards with letters of the alphabet to generate more English words and longer English words.

The goal of the game is to reduce or eliminate the number of cards in your hand (server). By generating English words, you can reduce the number of cards and send them to your opponent.
This means that cards will be sent to you by your opponent at the same time, so use your English vocabulary and flexibility to keep the server from filling up with cards!

—description from the publisher

name: Krach ums Geld
description:
There are five play variants based on each other:

"Festmark-Pferderennen" is a horse race for kids.
"Lachendes Lotto" introduces the basic game rules.
"Frohe Fahrt (mit Hindernissen)" is a simple family game.
"Wer weiß wie?" adds some difficulty.
"Expertentest" is the expert game.

The players take turns to roll and move. Whenever they get on a space the players have to follow the instructions printed there. The two last game variants add quiz questions.
To win the game a player has to win a certain amount of money or have the most money after an agreed on time.

–user summary
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Escape Box: Zombie
description: Recreate the atmosphere of a escape room at home! You have 60 minutes to find the clues hidden by the Game Master that will allow you to solve all the puzzles. The game offers three scenarios, all different, to test the strongest nerves.
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Puzzle, Real-time, Zombies

name: Escape Box: La Reine des Neiges II
description:
Welcome to Arendelle...
You have 45 minutes and no more to solve the puzzles and find Olaf!
On a beautiful day, Anna, Elsa, Olaf, Kristoff and Sven are playing hide and seek. It's Olaf's turn to hide, but when his friends finish counting, they discover a strange letter left by Olaf.
To find where he is hiding, you must search for the clues left by Olaf and solve the puzzles.
It's your turn ! Be curious and clever!
categories: Deduction, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Puzzle, Real-time

name: メイドギルドへようこそ (Welcome to the Maid Guild)
description:
As wealthy patrons, players have traveled to the local maid guild in an attempt to hire new staff for their estates.

Each round a group of four maids becomes available to hire. However, each player only learns the identity of half the group. They must then bid for the order to choose new maid staff based on what they know and subtle clues from their opponents' bids.

After bidding is complete, every player learns the identity of all four maids. One by one starting with the player who made the highest bid, players choose who to hire. Of course, the player making the lowest bid will likely end up stuck with undesireable staff, including the incompetent maids in black.

Each hired maid is placed around a player's estate board to fulfill jobs such as cooking, cleaning, and accounting. Each maid has several icons denoting their strengths, which can earn extra points if they match their assigned job.

When the deck of maid cards runs out, or a player is out of money, the game ends. Players add up respect points from the maids they hired as well as bonus points from fulfilled jobs around their estate. However, the player who hired the most maids in black loses their social standing and is eliminated from the game. The remaining player with the most respect points is the winner.

name: Medi-Evil: The Card Game
description:
Build an army, conquer lands, slay dragons and steal taxes! Medi-evil is the fast changing strategy Card game for 3-5 players.

Choose to strengthen your defenses or build your army. Collect taxes and protect your land. Send your army out to war to take other players' land and taxes. Beware of dragons, famine and invaders!

Each player starts with 2 castles/land and collects taxes on each go. The more castles you have the more taxes you collect.

On each players go they go through 2 phases - the 'build' phase and the 'action' phase.

The Build Phase
During the build phase players can strengthen their defenses or choose to build an army.

The Action Phase
The action phase requires players to make a choice to send out their army to war or to to draw more cards from the middle deck.
Special Cards

Sometimes a player is forced to play or draws out one of the special cards - these are the 'Dragon' card, the 'Famine' card and the 'To War' card. Each of these cards has an immediate effect on the player or a player of their choice.

Send your army to war!
When a player chooses to send out his/her army they can choose to attack any other players castle or fight off dragons. If they win they claim that players land and all taxes.

Winning the Game
The winner of the game is the player with the most taxes after all the agreed rounds have been played.

Inside the box is all 197 cards you'll need to play the game, This includes:

18 Villagers
18 Archers
18 Knights
18 Vikings
5 Dragons
5 Famine
5 To War
10 Castles
100 Taxes

name: Ohne Leiter gehts nicht weiter
description: The players take turns to roll and move. The goal is to reach space 100 to rescue a dachshound family. To get from one floor to the next, the players have to use a ladder. On the roll of a 6 the player may take one of the four ladders to reach the window above his position.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Are you a Potty Mouth?
description:
Tired of ordinary games, Are you a Potty Mouth? is a laugh out loud game full of surprising and hilarious facts about swearing. As a creator of the game I wanted to make sure that this game is not sexual, derogatory, or prejudicial.
The game consists of 150 laugh out loud cards filled with obscure facts and pop culture about swearing. There are 10 categories: Geography, Going abroad, History, Social trends, Texting acronyms, True and false, TV/movies/music, Word definitions Wordplay and Visual cards (guess the phrase).

The game is super easy to learn and fast paced.

It can be played as individuals 3+ or in groups. It is very adaptable and has been played on Zoom as well. The object of the game is the first person to collect 10 correctly answered cards wins. The twist of the game is when a player has collected 9 cards anyone can challenge them to take a "Challenge card". Once challenged you have to play. If the player answers correctly its an automatic win. If not, the challenger earns the card.

The game is designed for 16 + due to the use of swear words.

-description from designer

name: Moonstone: Mushrooms & Mayhem
description: This troupe box allows you to add three new heroes from Dominion faction of the Goblin race to the game: Seasick Stu, Shabbaroon, Boom Boom Mc Boom.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Rock-Paper-Scissors

name: Mauseschlau & Bärenstark: Bewegungs-Quartett
description:
Mauseschlau & Bärenstark bring movement into the quartet game!
If you want to collect the most quartets in the movement quartet, you have to ask the other players for cards and also demonstrate the movement exercises shown.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Trivia

name: Kichern, lachen, Mädchensachen
description:
Each player is dealt 6 word-cards.
A story is read out and players are invited to add one of their word-cards at certain parts of the story. If a word is accepted, the player gets a Joker which scores points at the end.
When the story is finished players score-up;
Any unused word cards - -1
Any Joker - +2
Play a pre-agreed number of stories and the highest score wins.

name: Colorama
description:
Inspired by the eponymous book, which explores the tremedous variety of colour nuances, Colorama is a colour-themed trivia game in which players compete to obtain colour cards, named Colorama card, which match the objectives they are given at the start of the game.

Each player starts with randomly-assigned 6 objective cards, each representing a colour, and then players take turn answering colour-themed questions, which are on Colorama cards matching a single type of colour. If the player answers right, they win the card and place it in their collection. Each Colorama card has one featured colour which matches one of the objective cards. For example, the Black Beetle Colorama card would match the Black objective card

However, there are also Surprise cards which have various immediate effect ranging from swapping a colour card with an opponent to giving a previously acquired Colorama card to another player.

The first player obtaining one Colorama card for each of their six objective cards is the winner!

name: Scattergories Stackagories
description:
Each player controls their own set of colored stacking pieces. Lay out the Letter Cards, flip a Category Card and the one-minute timer and the game is on! Players, playing simultaneously, shout out words that fit the category and place one of their stacking pieces on the corresponding letter card. When time’s up, the player who has their colored stacking piece on the top of the stack scores for that card. The more pieces under their piece, the higher the score!

-description from publisher

name: Forest of Arden
description:
It is Midsummer's Day and a group of Shakespearean characters try to collect the four missing items from their play from the Forest of Arden. Lurking in the heart of the forest is their nemesis who they must try to avoid at all costs.

Each player needs to carefully plan their route to pick up the 4 items that are needed for their play making sure that they do not get blocked by any of the other players. Crossing the clearing containing their nemesis will take a mixture of luck and strategic movement. At the start of each turn players roll a die to determine what order they will get to move their character. Will you take the quickest route or will you play to delay your rivals?

The game ends when all of the players have made it safely out of the forest or been abducted by the fae.

The first player to exit the forest with all 4 items for their play is the winner.

If you are forced to confront your nemesis will be lucky enough to overcome them or will you be robbed of the items that you have secured so far and forced back into the forest?

Take too long and if darkness falls then the evil fae will emerge to come to claim you.

—description from designer

name: Unicorn Clinic
description:
It's a busy first day for you and your team at the new Unicorn Clinic. Like any good clinic, you not only want to give your patients (who are all unicorns, of course!) the best care, but you also need to get those positive reviews to grow your clinic's reputation. Unfortunately the supply closet is a mess and the line of waiting patients is growing by the minute. While you scramble to find the supplies you need, each waiting unicorn is wondering where their doctor is and rapidly losing their patience. Work together to quickly treat patients and get those sweet 5-star reviews!

In Unicorn Clinic, you'll work together to run your own clinic for sick and injured unicorns. On your turn, you'll decide which patient to visit and roll your dice to try to complete their treatment. If at first you don't succeed, you can try to roll again, but you'll have to be smart about which dice you reroll and where you spend your time. Do you go after a new patient who still has a rosy 5-star view of the clinic and hope to treat them fast, possibly earning more time to take on another patient? Or do you choose a patient who has been waiting a while and try to finally get them out the door? You'll also want to consider where your fellow doctors are- every doctor in the room will give you an additional specialty die to roll and increase your odds for success.

After your turn, any unicorns left unattended in other rooms will lower their potential star rating. If any unicorns reach zero stars, it's CODE U! You have one last shot to join forces as a team to treat the unicorn before they leave the clinic in disappointment, ruining your reputation (and ending the game.)

If you DO successfully treat a unicorn, of course they leave you a review to read! Score enough review stars and you'll secure your clinic's reputation as the best place for excellent unicorn care.

"They totally removed the crab from my butt. 5 stars!" - Actual Unicorn Patient.

—description from designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Re-rolling and Locking

name: Déhudékoi ?
description:
This trivia game invites players to rediscover and reflect on facts about human rights and specifically the Universal Declaration of Human Rights ratified in 1948. It's an activism tool offering a pedagogic, instructive, challenging yet easy to play experience in a casual and confortable setting.

The name of the game derives from the french acronym "DUDH" (Déclaration Universelle des Droits de l'Homme) and could be translated in english as "UDH-what??"

Proceeds contribute to finance the actions initiated by Amnesty International.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Elapsed Real Time Ending, Memory, Questions and Answers

name: Arcane Grounds
description:
In a mystical land where landforms are brimming with arcane properties, sorcerers duel one another using the ground's magic, using wisdom the site imparts to deduce their opponents' clever machinations.

Arcane Grounds is a game about collecting magic powers from various locations in order to thwart your opponent in an elemental duel. Use this power to either support your core element or attack the opposing core. By looking at which deck a card came from, you can gather information on what that card could be. Team up with a friendly sorcerer to aid you in battle!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Once-Per-Game Abilities, Pattern Recognition, Score-and-Reset Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Risk 2210 A.D.: Aerial Assault Command Deck – Reckoning
description: An additional 20 cards for the Aerial Command Deck, for Risk 2210AD.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling

name: Block Breaker
description:
Block Breaker - A tactical game set in the Krimspace Universe for 2 players.

Fight with your space ships for the victory! On the one hand you have "Blocker" ships that are slow, but can capture the opponent's ships in a team effort. Also you have "Breaker" ships, fast but unprotected ships, that can "break through" to your base on the other side of the board.
If you can capture an opponent's "Breaker" by surrounding it or catch it in your "tractor beam" upon reaching your base, you can remodel it into a "Blocker" ship and use this to catch further "Breakers".

Win by successfully blocking the opponents "Breaker" or breaking through to your base when having 5 "Blocker" ships in play.

Pure strategy, with no chance elements.

name: Das Ringier-Spiel
description:
The players take turns to roll and move. They start from Basel, Genf, Lugano or St. Gallen. On some spaces, depending on the color of the playing figure, events hinder or benefit the players. For each starting point (player color), there is a card with the applicable events.

The first to reach the central space (Verlagsanstalt Ringier & Co.) wins the game.

The game was published as a christmas supplement to the magazine "Ringiers Unterhaltungs-Blätter" Nr. 52/1937.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Ophidian Wars: Dark Rooks
description:
A new group of gladiators enters the arena!

Get them in your starting five and look for new synergies.

These 5 new female gladiators are not nice. They've been hand-picked by the Ophidian Lords as the "house" favorites, and for good reason.

Requires the "Core Deck" of Ophidian Wars to play.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Queue, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Player Elimination

name: Curling Dice!: UFO
description: Curling Dice!: UFO is a dexterity game where players flick dice onto a hanging, multi-level spaceship-shaped board. Players initially take turns using an adjustable see-saw catapult to toss dice onto the hanging platforms. There is then a round of flicking dice on the platforms. Points are scored based on the location of dice on the platforms as well as from knocking over aliens.

name: Train to East Copperdowns
description:
The train is traveling Eastward across a variable board to East Copperdowns. Along the way, players invest in towns that payout when the train visits. Players can choose to move the train rather than invest. The train cannot reuse track it has already covered and moves persistently to the east. Once the train reaches East Copperdowns, the player with the most investment cubes in her possession wins.

The game requires three players. There are bot rules included for 1 or 2 player games. Game comes tightly packed in a small "mint" tin.

name: Hidden Marks
description:
Hidden Marks is a ruthless, strategic game where players are wanted assassin in a kill-or-be-killed world.

Each turn, players have 3 actions that they can use to draw, bank, or use cards. Cards either can be saved in the hand to use for their card effects, or sacrificed to the bank to use as currency. There is no hand or bank limit, but there are cards that will kill you for having too many cards in either. Additionally, you can get information from the backs of the cards, which gives you information about the other’s strengths and weaknesses, and whether the draw pile is worth drawing from.

Each player also has a hidden mark that nobody knows at the start of the game, but can be revealed or swapped via card effect. For each mark, there is a bounty card that anyone can use to accuse another player. If right, the accused dies; if not, the accuser.

Last assassin standing wins. Good luck.

-description from publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Hidden Roles, Player Elimination

name: Car Wars: Two-Player Starter Set Blue/Green
description:
A complete redesign of the original game of autoduelling, Car Wars Sixth Edition plays faster and includes new plastic miniatures!

This Starter Set has everything two players need to go head-to-head in the arena. Use one of the game's pre-constructed vehicles – or design your own car using the included components!


Six minis: Scarab, Warhawk, Hotshot, Hammer, Butcher, and Typhoon
Miniatures come pre-assembled and unpainted
Two car bases (one blue and one green)
Two dashboards (one blue and one green)
Over 100 game cards
Four counter sheets (dashboard sliders, barrier and wreck tokens, two turning keys, and other assorted tokens)
Dice pack (20 dice: six yellow, four blue, three red, three green, two black, and two white)
Six Vehicle Record Sheets
Rulebook
categories: Fighting, Miniatures, Racing, Science Fiction, Sports, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Impulse Movement, Race, Variable Player Powers

name: Hastilude
description:
In Hastilude, players take on the roles of the King's most trusted advisors. You are tasked with using your workers to train and equip knights to enter tournaments, complete quests, and fill the orders from the king himself.

Hastilude is a worker placement game where you must figure out the best way to utilize your workforce. You start the game with five workers and one knight. Finding the balance between having a good-sized workforce and the right amount of knights to score victory points is one of the challenges of the game.

You must also decide how to use your knights. Knights are the primary way you score victory points and acquire gold to support your plans. Focusing on gaining gold could put you behind on victory points, and focusing too much on victory points and you could find yourself short of gold when you really need it. Your workers are tasked with collecting resources to turn them into equipment to aid your knights. Workers will gather resources and turn them into armor, weapons, and shields.

In Hastilude, the player who can best manage their workforce and their knights will come out victorious.

–description from designer
mechanics: Contracts, Market, Turn Order: Progressive, Worker Placement, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: Genève gagne
description:
Players answer questions about Geneva by moving their game pieces on a board that represents the canton of Geneva, its roads and its highway.

A bonus card is awarded for each correct answer. The first player to win a card of each color wins the game.

The colors correspond to themes: green = agriculture/oenology, yellow = history/culture/religion, orange = international organizations/tourism, blue = industry/transportation/commerce, red = finance/services/real estate
mechanics: Questions and Answers, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Gefragt: Gejagt – Erweiterung
description: Gefragt Gejagt: Erweiterung contains new expansions for this quiz game as well as components that allow for play with up to six players.
categories: Electronic, Expansion for Base-game, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia

name: Happy Endings
description: Grab 3-5 of your most fun and least mature friends for a memorable game of Happy Endings! Any answer will do as you fill-in-the-blanks of 150 playful and suggestive sentences. Match players’ answers correctly on your turn and write the favorite answer on everyone else’s turn to score some “amusing” Happy Ending cards and, hopefully, some extra points. The player with the most points after three rounds wins the game!

name: MonsDRAWsity: Science Refresh Pack
description: A pack of 40 new cards for Monsdrawsity featuring monsters... from real life! Axolotls, tardigrades and more!
categories: Animals, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game

name: MonsDRAWsity: Terrorsaurs Refresh Pack
description: A 40 card pack that brings new monsters to expand your options in Monsdrawsity. Terrorsaurs are part dinosaur, part monster, all terror! Can you break through the fear to describe them to your friends?
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game

name: MonsDRAWsity: Best of the Bestiary Pack
description: A 40 card promo pack of new monsters for Monsdrawsity, illustrated by legendary artists.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game

name: MonsDRAWsity: Bring Your Kid To Work Deck
description: Bring Your Kid to Work makes drawing more difficult as artists try to interview the witness while also keeping an eye on their kid who is shadowing them during bring your kid to work day. Why is your marker suddenly sticky?! With kids around, who knows? I guess you'll just have to draw while holding it with only the tips of your fingers for the next round.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game

name: MonsDRAWsity: Technically Difficult Deck
description: Technically Difficult makes being the witness more difficult as they have to memorize each creature under strange circumstances. It's already tricky to memorize a creature in 20 seconds, but what if that creatures is hanging you upside down at the same time? What if you have to talk to the D.R.A.W. agents while barely moving a muscle because you're still thawing out from the monster's freeze ray?
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game

name: MonsDRAWsity: Back For More Expansion
description: A promo pack containing the monsters designed by the people who pledged at the "Back For More" tier in the Monsdrawsity: Unusual Suspects kickstarter campaign.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game

name: Bar Fight: The Spirits Battle
description:
Bar Fight - The Spirits Battle is a two player game is simple, strategic and drinkable! There will be only 4 actions: Move, Attack, Place and Ability. Within these actions, players can choose to use their wisdom and strategies to defeat their opponent. Or, they can take as many shots as they want to stop their opponents to win the game. Anyhow, once players are into this match, it is hard to walk out sober. P.S. This game is definitely playable without alcohol!


5 minutes quick match
Everyone knows the rule, but they never play it before
Casually but strategical
Shot holder miniatures
A new drinking game

name: Vragen & Antwoorden: Classic Edition #1
description: This is a series of Dutch trivia games, with 330 questions in 6 categories printed on 55 cards per pack. As of November 2022 there are 16 packs available!

name: Crazy Quilt (fan expansion for Patchwork)
description:
This print and play was inspired by the realization that my wife and I loved Patchwork but had pretty much figured the game out.

The variations are carefully built to not make the game mean or random- it stays a friendly competition. The game also stays full information from the get go (no dice or cards or luck), so you can puzzle as hard as you want while playing the game.

All you need to do is print the PDF under the "file" tab that has the rule and pattern variations. One player picks the pattern, while the other player picks the rule change. The page even folds up nicely to fit in the Patchwork box. Enjoy!

—description from the designer
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play

name: Paws and Claws
description: Use tiny paws and claws to complete challenges in this party game. Compete one-on-one or in teams. Draw challenge cards and complete wacky challenges with your tiny paws and claws to progress on the board.

name: Little Red Riding-Hood
description:
This is a set collection game in the style of "Old Maid." All cards are dealt out to players and each sets aside complete pairs. After that, the dealer fans their remaining cards and offers them to the player on their left for a blind choice. The next player attempts to select a card to make another pair, and then the process repeats.

The game ends when all pairs have been completed, the winner having rid themselves of a full hand. The loser of the game is left with a single, unpairable "Wolf" card.

Consists of 35 cards.

This game was released by Noble and Noble Co. as part of their "Games My Children Love Best" series.

name: The Game of The Old Woman and Her Pig
description:
This is essentially a card-based game of Dominoes, using cards instead of plastic or wooden tokens. It is themed around the folk tale of the Old Woman and Her Pig, where an old woman goes to successive figures and encourages each one to do something to the previous one, creating a domino effect that will get her pig over a stile: the butcher killing the ox that drinks the water that quenches the fire that burns the stick...and so on.

Most of the 60 cards have a number of dots on one half (like dominoes) and a picture of a character on the other. Players can match numbers or pictures. Pictures are considered "doubles" and must be placed at right angles to the match.

The game ends when one player runs out of cards in their hand; that person then scores based on cards remaining in their opponents' hands. The game is repeated until someone reaches 100 and becomes the overall winner.

This game was released by Noble and Noble Co. as part of their "Games My Children Love Best" series. It is functionally 'identical' to "House that Jack Built," which was released simultaneously as part of the same series, albeit with different pictures on the cards.
mechanics: Hand Management, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition

name: The Game of the Three Bears
description:
This is a very simple children's game, based on "Snap," in which players are dealt cards with characters and situations on them based on the well-known story of Goldilocks and the Three Bears.

The full deck of 32 cards is dealt at the start of the game, and players take turns revealing the top card of their stacks. When a match is revealed, the first of the two matching players to shout "Boo!" takes control of the other's revealed cards up to that point.

The game ends when one player succeeds in taking all the cards.

This game was released by Noble and Noble Co. as part of their "Games My Children Love Best" series.

—user summary

name: Starlit Gate
description:
Starlit Gate is laughing again, is it time to tempt your fate?

Starlit Gate is a hybrid adventure/skirmish game for 1 to 6 players. Explore post apocalyptic science fantasy of a City frozen in time, in multiple coop and versus game modes. Investigate Rumors and face Perils while evading (or fighting) Voidstruck guardians of the time loop. Collect wondrous artifact from the time before the Storms and unravel the mysteries of the time loop.

In versus mode, recruit your team, bend the threads of fate to your will and fight for resources and survival against one or more of your friends in a one shot or campaign game (that can be finished in an evening).

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Movement, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Hand Management, Role Playing

name: My Koi
description:
Build your own Koi carp collection by making sets of differently colored fish cards.
First player reveals a number of cards, then he must divide the cards into sets. The player on their left chooses one of the sets of cards.
Players collect different types of fish, each type has their individual points value. The person, who gathers the most fish of one type receives points for the set. Be careful! You can collect Ghost Koi carp cards, which can bring you negative points.
The player with the most points wins.
mechanics: Hand Management, I Cut, You Choose, Set Collection

name: Cargo Master
description:
Players take roles of train company managers.
Every round of this game is divided into two phases. The fist phase is planning. Players plan their moves by playing move cards. Next in the action phase, players perform actions (load cargo, deliver cargo, upgrade rolling stock.
Players earn points for fulfiling contracts. The more cargo you transport, the higher the score.
mechanics: Action Queue, Pick-up and Deliver, Set Collection

name: Paparazzi
description:
Famous New York celebrity magazine is looking for a new paparazzo. You have to be fast to take photos of celebrities before others do it.

Players take roles of paparazzo photographers. Their task is to take photos of famous celebrities in everyday situations (in a supermarket, at the swimming pool etc.)
Players reveal the card from the celebrity deck. Each card shows a celebrity and the location where he is spotted. The task is to show the card with the time, depending on what time the celebrity was spotted. The goal of the game is to collect six different celebrity photo cards.

Paparazzi has another end game trigger, as well as some game mechanics tweaks and minor rule changes from Chameleon Time.

name: Legendary Tea Farmer
description:
Legendary Tea Farmer is a game for 2 to 5 players who each represent a different tea estate. To run a successful tea business, farmers firstly have to rehabilitate abandoned tea gardens, then grow and produce good quality tea, find a market to sell it to and also give back to the local community. As you are newbies in the tea world, then Badass Bidjo is there to mentor you. While each farmer can produce tea, only the one who manages to hire Badass Bidjo, will produce tea with enough good quality to earn a reputation on the tea market and become a legendary tea farmer. Badass Bidjo is a busy man though and tends to only one farmer per season...

Do you have what it takes to be the next Legendary Tea Farmer? With all the twists and turns that life throws at you and competition breathing on your neck, can you make tea that people would love and at the same time run an economically viable farm? Be it a cow eating your harvest, bad weather conditions affecting the harvest or an unexpected free day due to a wedding in the village, you need to find a way to adapt and come out of it as the best tea farmer in the region.

This game was created by actual tea farmers, so the game includes real-life adventures, surprises, failures and successes from the life of tea farmers.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Auction: Sealed Bid, Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Worker Placement

name: Cuba Mia
description:
After years of waiting, you are finally getting the chance to return to your beloved island. You want to see it all, but can you craft the perfect itinerary for your return to Cuba?

In this drafting game for 2 players, create the perfect itinerary by adding cards to your schedule tableau. Each game, one scoring card is used to determine how your tableau scores.

The illustrations in Cuba Mia were done by Priscilla Benitez, whose family immigrated from Cuba in the 1960's.

—description from the designer

name: Doctor Wars: The Hospital Card Game
description:
Doctor Wars: The Hospital Card Game is a card game version of Doctor Wars: The Hospital Strategy Game -- it has only cards; there are no boards, no rooms, no player pieces, and no spatial elements.

The object is to collect the most points by curing patients.

name: Bounce Back
description: A whole new ball game! Bounce the balls off the cards and into the barrel in order to avoid the deceptively difficult questions. For every questions that is answered incorrectly, the card is kept as a forfeit.

name: Pigeon Hole
description: The game consists of the playing board, fifteen coloured pigeon cards and a large Nest Box card, which has a hole at its centre. The object is to move the large Nest Box card across the board towards the coloured pigeon which matches an upturned pigeon card. Movement is made one square at a time, trying to avoid squares containing two eyes. If two eyes appear in the hole of the Nest Box, play passes to the player on your left. The player who reaches the coloured pigeon retains the upturned card and the process is repeated by revealing another card. The winner is the player who collects most cards.

name: Frozen II: Snowflake Journey
description:
Frozen II Snowflake Journey is an exciting game where Elsa journeys far beyond the gates of Arendelle in search of answers … and you. It’s up to you to spin the spinner, collect colorful snowflakes and create a trail of 7 card pairs to join her. Two special secret power spinner spaces can help you reach her even faster!

Kids learn visual and counting skills while playing a game featuring characters they know and love. It’s fast-paced fun as you make snowflake card matches and build your trail. So let the wintry journey begin.

Includes: 1 Gameboard, 1 Back Panel, 2 Connector Clips, 1 Spinner, 4 Cardboard Movers, 4 Plastic Mover Stands, 44 Snowflake cards, 1 Instruction Sheet.
categories: Children's Game, Math, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Statefall
description:
In Statefall, you are given command over a randomly assembled army group. It’s your mission as the commanding General to get the most out of the units at your disposal. To anticipate and deal with each new enemy move and to secure control over the state!

The game features a starting sequence, that generate a wide variety of scenarios to deal with, both in environmental obstacles and army group compositions.

The army group consisting of 8 units is drawn from 15 available units for each player. Divided into 11 different unit types, beloning to one of four categories. Attack, defence, support and Control.

Attack units, Mortar(2), Tank(3), Infantry, Marine, Fighter, and Sapper. Each attack unit has their own unique ability to attack enemy units on the board, thereby fliping owenership of the attacked targets and increasing your control over the board.

Defence units, Minefield and Anti-Air will together with environmental river tiles and the coastline, help you to protect high value control units from enemy attacks.

Support units, Logistics, may allow you to reactivate previously committed attack units.

Control tiles, Capital, Suburb and Rural(2), will give you an increased level of control given owenership and certain criterias. These are high value targets and should be defended if possible!

The battle sequence will see both players take turns, playing one unit card from their hand, followed be placing the corresponding unit tile on the board, next to an already placed unit. This continues until both players have committed all their 8 units to the battlefield.

The scoring sequence is comprised of two stages. Each player will start by counting each unit tile under their control. The next step is to look at any control units on the board, Capital, Suburbs and Rurals. These may give a lot of additional control-points to the owner.

The player with the highest amount of control-points is the winner of the battle!

-description from publisher

name: Hollywood Hoopla
description: Test your movie knowledge, and maybe learn some fun facts about your favorite movies! We've gathered it all - actors, plots, characters, music ... see who can remember or guess the most to win this Hollywood hoopla!

name: A Fistful of Scenarios
description:
ASL Scenario Pack issued in conjunction with the 10th Anniversary of the North Texas Shoot Out ASL Tournament in 2019. Contains the following scenarios:

NTX01: Stalingrad-1 Depot: Stalingrad, USSR
NTX02: They Came Like The Rain: Wandumi Ridge, New Guinea
NTX03: The Scugnizzi Boys, Montecalvario, Italy
NTX04: Into The Woods: Berestyan, Belarus
NTX05: Victory Over The Saar: Saarlautern, Germany
NTX06: A Veritable Delay: Qualberg, Germany

name: Palimpsest
description:
Overview:
Palimpsests occur when a piece of parchment (typically used as writing material in the past) is scraped to remove the top layer of writing. It was a form of erasure that allowed for reuse of the piece of parchment for a new piece of writing. Then, writing materials were difficult to come across and labor intensive to create, leading to the practice of scraping that resulted in the faint appearance of previous text. In recent years, the concept has been used by social scientists trying to explore and understand how the past continues to influence the present in variety of fields. It calls us to reflect on how we inherit institutions, laws, policies, neighborhoods, ideas, and histories from the past and how these influence the present.

Gameplay:
In this game you will be playing the role of a scribe trying to leave their mark on history. Each turn you will erase a letter and come up with a new word. If you cannot create a new word or there are no spaces able to be erased, you are lost to history. Players will continue doing this, passing their card around clockwise at the end of each turn, until there is only one person remaining. The last player able to make a word is the winner.

—description from the designer

name: Luminescence
description:
Luminescence is a solo tile laying and hand management game were a player is trying to connect point A to point B. The game is a metaphor about the struggle with depression and anxiety. On your turn, you draw three tiles and then either play them faceup or facedown. When playing a tile faceup, you must match all sides and lines to the tiles your are connecting to. Additionally, any tile you play must be higher numerically than the one you are connecting to. Any unused tiles are flipped facedown. You have five light tiles that help you with hand management and tile laying while trying to connect to point B.

—description from the designer

name: Le grand jeu de la littérature: c'est dans quoi déjà?
description:
A game to test one's knowledge in literature. 2 000 questions on themes like "Authors", "Works of literature", "Titles" and "Characters". 180 challenges to take part in: quotes, creation or unusual.

The game contains a board, 6 pawns, 1 die, 1 rules booklet, 1 45 seconds hourglass, 342 cards and 4 drawing boxes.

Playable by 2 to 6 players, ages 15 and up. Duration of a game: about 30 minutes. 3 difficulty levels.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Un jeu pour s'amuser et tester ses connaissances en littérature. 2 000 questions thématiques sur les auteurs, les oeuvres, les titres et les personnages. 180 défis à relever : citation, création ou insolite.

Contient un plateau de jeu, 6 pions, 1 dé, 1 règle du jeu, 1 sablier de 45 secondes, 342 cartes et 4 boîtiers distributeurs.

De 2 à 6 joueurs, à partir de 15 ans. Durée d'une partie : environ 30 minutes. 3 niveaux de difficulté.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Multi-Use Cards, Turn Order: Time Track

name: War Galleys of Thargos
description:
Take to the High seas as commander of one of three formidable fleets and cut a swathe through the storied Oceans of Thargos! You'll face an endless array of dangers, from the seas themselves, the killers that sail them and the dark horrors which lurk beneath them. Will you prevail or will a watery grave be your only prize?
​

Command a war galley in a gritty fantasy setting using solo/coop or vs game modes. You decide what risks to take to avoid being sunk. You complete epic voyages for the ultimate prize.

Players choose their fleet, which vessels to play on specific voyages and then manage the hull integrity, crew morale and supplies as you come up against pirates, enemy fleets, foul weather and sea creatures througgh the use of an event card deck.

You then roll dice to determine the success of each encounter, choosing to pursue a sea battle or make a hasty retreat to fight another day for example. Ecah vessel has unique attributes.

The game is won on a Victory Point basis with rewards for completing voyages, sinking enemy tonnage and more. The game ends after completring all 5 voyages included.

WGoT also contains bonus Mission Cards for the Heroes of Thargos CG enabling the two games to be combined.

-description from designer
categories: Ancient, Dice, Fantasy, Fighting, Nautical, Pirates, Wargame
mechanics: Action/Event, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Multiple Maps, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: YANG TAN
description:
ヤンタン (YANG TAN) is a card game from Japan, based upon ideas from Fan Tan.
The suits and ranks are on separate cards and are used in combination.

Place up to two cards on your turn. The winner is the player who runs out of cards.

name: Black God's Gambit
description:
Players assume one of two opposing roles: Jirel the tempestuous flame-haired female warrior or the phantasmal Black God with its unknowable intrigues. Each character will be forced to make difficult choices as Jirel confronts the inhuman residents of the Black God’s pocket dimension and ultimately the black god itself. Jirel must explore the nightmarish terrain via dice driven movement each round, to join combat or avoid traps and challenges to her sanity. The Black God will array its forces to stop her from reaching her goal by placing fiendish enemies, traps and psychic snares in her way. Can Jirel claim the Black God's deadly kiss and retain her sanity? Will it be worth the effort, or will she ultimately regret her choice?

"Black God’s Gambit" is described by the publisher as a fast-paced, rules lite, solo or two-player, GM’less tabletop "micro game" to be included in the "Black God's Kiss" RPG box set. The game will include punchboard tokens for the players, various enemies, traps, and a 11"x17" hexagonal game map. At the time of the Kickstarter optional add-ons for the rpg included a 48mm resin Black God and 32mm resin Jirel miniature. The microgame will feature several different scenarios or play modes, according to the successful Kickstarter that ended in late September 2022 (the game and its parent boxed rpg set are planned for release sometime in late 2023).

Based on the towering sword and sorcery stories by C.L. Moore (one of the first women to write in the genre and a contemporary of Conan's Robert E. Howard), the warrior Jirel of Joiry’s kingdom has been overtaken by the warlord Guillame. Her last ditch attempt to save her kingdom is to travel into the realm of the Black God via a secret passage in her keep's catacombs, searching for the means to destroy her enemy and take back her kingdom... potentially at the cost of her own soul.

name: Mirianth Wars
description:
Mirianth, a kingdom in constant war against terrible monsters and with nations separated by personal interests. Only those who have prepared for war will survive the coming winter.
Be among them!

In Mirianth Wars, players are creating their factions trying to earn the loyalty of warriors, build the best dwellings, find the most valuable treasures, and commit to engage in memorable battles against monsters, all through rounds of negotiation with their opponents for the cards.

However, when player strategies conflict, diplomacy will be the last resort before luck comes into play. If the players do not come to an agreement, they will face the plague deck, and the outcome will only depend on luck.

After everyone has created their faction, they will go through the tests that will define how good their strategy was.

First, players need to check that all their heroes can be accommodated in residences, from simple huts to sumptuous castles, otherwise they will scatter and leave the player.
