From the heroes who were accommodated and did not perish to the plague, the battle will begin against the monsters, which if not defeated, will destroy houses, steal treasures or kill the heroes. After the battle, you will once again need to accommodate your heroes in order for them to recover.

Finally, from the surviving heroes, saved treasures, and defeated monsters, the player's points will be counted.

Mirianth Wars presents a game of diplomacy and strategy based on the balance between ambition and luck.

-description from publisher

name: The Condemned
description:
The Condemned is a Collectible Card Game designed to be fast paced, with an easy learning curve and plenty of depth. You step into the role of a condemned inmate on a space prison. You're duking it out, gladiator-style, in a no-holds-barred arena deathmatch for the entertainment of other inmates. Condemned have weapon and armor slots to equip various cards. Some weapon types are stronger or weaker, depending on the type of armor they're hitting. In addition, there are events that change the flow of battle and preparations that give you an edge in the fight.

You win by reducing your opponent's life to 0. Simple, right? Not necessarily! There's lots of play and counterplay in The Condemned. Armor cards have weaknesses and resistances to different damage types. Events can change the course of the game when you least expect it. That Alpha Strike you were planning on using to win you the game? Nope! Your opponent just used Repossess to take your weapon away and now you can't attack!

The game is fast, fun, and has plenty of depth! Gear up and Enter The Arena!

—description from the designer

name: Intime Conviction n° 5: L'affaire des huîtres
description:
Jurors, will you make the right decision?

A Christmas dinner, a Breton family and the body of an accountant found at the bottom of a cliff.

What happened at the Duguenecs that night?

Slip into the shoes of a juror, judge a criminal case and deliver your verdict.

HOW TO PLAY ?
1. Perform the requested actions according to the indications and the order of the 12 Juror Cards
2. Reveal the 4 fact sheets throughout the game and start the debate!
3. Cast your verdict by voting anonymously with the Final Vote Cards. Guilty or Not Guilty?
4. Discover the Final Revelation

Play with friends for an evening by recreating the atmosphere of a closed session! Or make the fun last by revealing only a few items a day!

Content:
- 1 Rule of the game
- 1 Portrait of the accused & her statement
- 1 Scene of the crime
- 12 Juror Cards
- 1 Discovery Pass
- 24 Final Voting Cards
- 3 sealed fact sheets
- 1 FINAL REVELATION! To reveal at the end of the game

Intime conviction is a craft object entirely designed, made and assembled by hand and in Belgium. The format of the game is unusual as well: this game is in an envelope.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Storytelling, Voting

name: Hedron Collision
description: Hedron Collision is a dice flicking party game for 2 players. Flick your dice to get as close as possible to the center of the board to score more points, but watch out! Your opponent can knock your dice out on their turn! Fast, simple, and addictive. Will you go the safe route and try to score lots of points or play offensively to knock your opponent’s dice out at the risk of overshooting? It’s also easy to carry and waterproof, so you can take it out to the pub or a party and not have to worry about babying it when you’re drunk off your ass! It’s also printed on a playmat so you can roll up to a TCG tournament with it and jam some games between rounds.

name: Libertadores
description:
"Libertadores" is a board game divided into areas based on an impulse-based turn system. Players alternate to move several elements, not all, by chronological cards that work as impulse triggers. Libertadores is designed for two players and can be adapted to solitaire mode or several players but not rules yet.

Libertadores depicts the wars of independence in Hispanic America during the Napoleonic world context. Players can lead the forces of the Spanish monarchy or be on the side of the Latin-American republics.

Libertadores is an asymmetric conflict simulation with operational and strategy elements. It deals with major campaigns and international events, including land warfare (military and insurgent), maritime warfare, and the political-diplomatic conflict. However, the game is of low difficulty and short duration, lasting a maximum of a few hours.

The player draws three cards and discards one. With the cards he can conquer regions through a dice roll. The game ends when the winning player can obtain a number of regions.

Elements
- A map of the American continent of 891x21 cm a
- Date, Reinforcement and battle tracks
- Tokens of national flags of 12 mm
- Cards portraying warlords, sailors, and diplomats
- Dice: blue, red, and white.
- A rulebook

-description from publisher

Libertadores es un juego que simula las guerras de independencia en la América española que sucedieron durante el contexto mundial napoleónico. Una guerra de muy escasos recursos donde los jugadores pueden dirigir las fuerzas que defienden la unidad de la monarquía española o formar parte del bando que busca la independencia de los países hispanoamericanos.

Libertadores es un juego de tablero dividido en áreas con un movimiento de fichas mediante el impulso de una baraja de cartas. De esta forma los jugadores se alternan para mover un número de fichas, no todas, mediante un motor de cartas cronológicas. Libertadores está diseñado para el jugador solitario y dos jugadores.

Libertadores es una simulación de conflicto asimétrico, con elementos operacionales y de estrategia. Se ocupa de las grandes campañas y de los eventos internacionales. Abarca la guerra terrestre, las grandes batallas de los ejércitos regulares y la lucha de las guerrillas, asimismo la guerra marítima, las armadas nacionales y el Corso insurgente y los eventos del conflicto político y diplomático. Sin embargo, es un juego de baja complejidad y de una duración corta, que puede acabar en pocas horas.

Componentes:
El cuadernillo con el manual de reglamentos
Un mapa del continente americano con dos hemisféros
Una hoja con las tablas de turnos, de ejércitos expedicionarios y de flotas y navíos de guerra.
Tres barajas sumando 36 cartas de eventos políticos (12), de caudillos patriotas (12) y realistas (12).
Fichas de counters o tokens de fuerzas y de buques en cada bando y de banderas nacionales. Fichas de cubos en color azul o rojo (alternativo a las fichas)
2 dados en color azul y en rojo.

name: Labarnas: The final struggle of the Hittite Empire
description:
Labarnas is a narrative game. Strategy is involved, but if the gods are not in your favour, there won't be a happy end. So lean back and let the story unfold.

You have to guide your people through a series of 30 random events. At the start of the game, you will influence the likelihood of certain events in the Feast for the gods. But your main task through the game will be the distribution of your population between food production and border defence.

The game is set in ancient types, in about 1200 B.C. You are Šuppiluliuma II., the last Labarna (i.e. king) of the Hittite Empire. The glorious days of your ancestors are past. The extraordinary victory against the Egyptians at Kadesh has deteriorated to being merely a story. Nature itself, as well as your neighbours have conspired against you. Your realm is crumbling.

But do not despair. Your people are strong and have shaped the region for the better part of a millennium. With a wise leader like you, destiny can be altered.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Solo / Solitaire Game, Worker Placement

name: Le Clan de la Muette
description:
Le Clan de la Muette is a board game of secret actions, atmosphere and bluffing in a fantasized 19th century, populated by anthropomorphic gangsters

Members of the famous Mute Clan, you will have to collect enough money by the end of the game to pay your dues to the Silent Sisters.
Failure would mean the end of the Clan, honoring your debt will ensure you a collective victory, and whoever has known how to set aside the most money for their own account will also win an individual victory

At each turn choose a different lieutenant and play his powers day or night, the day you work for the Clan. At night you indulge in selfish and shameful acts, but be careful not to fall on someone smarter than you!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deduction, Hidden Victory Points, Multi-Use Cards, Semi-Cooperative Game, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Dracula: Jeu d'impostures
description:
Dracula has come to London to steal the love of his life, the Vampire Hunters do not intend to let him act and will seek to identify his victim in order to snatch him from the fangs of the vampire count before he leaves for Transylvania

At each game a player will embody Dracula, he is known to the other players.

Dracula, after having chosen his victim, will seek to discover the secret identity of the other players by observing them searching places. At night, he can attempt to vampirize a Hunter in order to convert him to his cause.

The other players are Vampire Hunters, they seek to identify the name of the victim in order to free him. Every day, each Hunter can search a place thanks to his secret identity. At the end of the game they will name one of them who will go and face Dracula.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Finale Ending, Semi-Cooperative Game, Traitor Game, Voting

name: Imperial Settlers: Empires of the North – Workers In Training
description:
A bonus for preordering Empires of the North : Wrath of the Lighthouse from the publisher.

4 Workers In Training tiles. Worker in training tile gives another action choice to the player.

During the setup, place the 4 workers in training tiles in the middle of the game area. On their turn, as an action, a player may assign 2 workers to one of the tiles and then place that tile in their Empire. During the cleanup phase, players return 1 worker to their supply.

name: BattleTech: Shrapnel Magazine – Issue 10
description:
Shrapnel: The Official BattleTech Magazine hits harder than ever before, launching a double-size issue filled with more BattleMechs and star-spanning conflicts from the 31st century and beyond! Venture into the Reunification War as the Taurian Concordat fights for freedom against the relentless Star League. Wander through libraries filled with forbidden knowledge lost through centuries of constant warfare. Witness the aftermath of House Arano’s bitter civil war, and face down the infamous, unbeatable, all-black Marauder—if you dare…

In this issue, you’ll hunt for a missing DropShip in the distant Periphery, and fight for survival during the most pivotal battle in the Clan Invasion. You’ll brave the chaotic nuclear fires of the Word of Blake’s Jihad and claw your way through Draconis Combine troops threatening your family, determined to survive at any cost.

Fill your double-capacity magazine with a complete novella, technical readouts, a planet and unit digest, playable scenarios, a Clan Invasion campaign, a treatise on troublesome native wildlife, some tips for downtrodden Taurian citizens, and more—all by BattleTech veterans and the next squad of new recruits
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: Resa City
description:
A fast-paced strategic board game set in a post-apocalyptic future. Resa City fuels the players' excitement by encouraging gameplay through racing mixed with strategy and combat. All methods of play affect players' chances at outwitting or outracing others on the board.

The game is broken into several turns;
1) Choosing technology that assists in the race
2) Placing obstacles on the track - the board plays against you on every turn randomizing obstacle placement and giving the obstacles technology and weapons actions against racers.
3) Racing; where all players use their advantages from garnering tech to move faster or combat other racers around a track.

The game uses dice, cards, and pieces for movement to win. Winning is determined by who finishes first, if at all.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Dice, Racing, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Action Queue, Action/Event, Alliances, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Race, Turn Order: Progressive

name: Trominii
description:
Each player pulls out 5 pieces from the bag (not to be seen by opposing players) and puts each piece onto their stand.



Each player then pulls another Trominii from the bag and totals the score on that one piece. The highest total dictates who goes first. The play continues clockwise.



The first player then places their chosen Trominii from their 5 (on the racks) in the center of the chosen playing area (70cmx70cm area approx.) No score is tallied for this first piece played.



The next player then places their Trominii to match the numbers butting them to the angled end, in any direction.



The score comes from addition of the same touching numbers. For example, 2 pieces touching with 4 on will be 8, 3 with 4 will be 12, up to a possible 8 pieces precisely touching.



After each player plays their piece, that player takes out another piece of Trominii from the bag and places it on their stand. No player should have more or less than 5 Trominii pieces during any time until the end of the play.



If no move can be made, that player misses a turn.



Blanks that are played and touch to join gain no score. Blanks can be laid as a way to force no score from the other opponents.



Wild cards can be joined to any other card at any point in the game including another wild card but will not score in the total.



The winner is the highest Total scorer. The Total score will be the addition of the individual score from each round as you play OR for beginners/younger players it could be a nonscoring easy game and play until all the Trominii pieces are gone from the bag.

name: El-Alamein 1942: "X XXX" hypothetical scenario
description:
"X XXX" - a hypothetical scenario in Taktyka i Strategia magazine no. 45 (2022), in which the main British thrust comes from the southern part of the front at El-Alamein.

It is just an additional scenario with an alternative unit set-up. No additional counters are offered.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: France by Balloon
description:
The game is played on a map of France, with each player represented by a hot air balloon token. The goal of the game is for the player to visit all 19 regions on the map.

On a player’s turn, they draw a card into their hand. If the player has 3 cards in their hand depicting 3 adjacent regions on the map, with at least one region adjacent to the current location of their balloon, then the player can play these cards, claiming each region with a trip-marker. The player then draws 2 cards, and play passes to the next player. If a player does not have 3 cards in their hand depicting 3 adjacent regions, then they discard a card from their hand, and play passes to the next player.

The first player to have a trip-marker on each region of the map wins.

name: Aventurine Expedition
description:
You are stranded on a volcanic jungle island... What a start to a grand adventure! Aventurine Expedition is a card/board game thought up by 2 game enthusiasts with a dream to design a quickly played, action-packed game where you scheme against the others in an attempt to become the greatest Aventurine Miner the world has ever known.

Aventurine Expedition is a fast paced card/board game, (it has the elements of a board game, without the board itself) that has you playing destructive cards against your opponents to stop them from acquiring more Aventurine and Gadgets, in an epic vector art format.

You begin with 2 Aventurine Mines, they are used to gain Aventurine (think of Mines as your source of income). You gain 1 Aventurine per mine you have every turn. You take 1 Recruit every turn from the Recruit Display into your hand. Aventurine is used to activate Recruits abilities which involve many different unique strategy building mechanics, some abilities include, "all opponents loose 2 mines" "lock a Gadget from an opponent" and "look at an opponents Recruit hand and take 1". Playing Recruits also allow you access to their mines. Another use for Aventurine is to purchase Materials. Materials are used to purchase Gadget cards, which help you ultimately win. When you acquire a Gadget card you flip it upside down and receive the reward denoted at the top left of the card. However you cannot buy Materials and Gadgets on the same turn. Collect 3 Gadget Cards to be the victor.

A basic turn would go something like this:

James collects 5 Aventurine for the 5 Aventurine Mines he has, he looks at the Recruit Display and take his 1 card, the Mighty Boom. He then spends the required 4 Aventurine to play a card from his hand. Mighty Boom goes into play and makes his opponents loose 2 mines each, they proceed to complain and James uses his remaining Aventurine to purchase a Water Drop costing him 1 Aventurine. He has enough materials for a Gadget, however he bought a material on this same turn so he must wait at least one turn before he can purchase.

name: King of the Turf
description:
This is a horse racing game, supposedly based on (and obviously promoting) the 1939 United Artists film of the same name.

Six horses run the race no matter how many players are involved, and three dice are thrown on each turn, with each horse of a different color assigned a number. Horses will therefore move 0-3 spaces per turn. The first horse to win the race on an exact count wins the race.

Rule variations are also included to win on doublets or triplets, as well as a more complex game of chance called "The Game of Bucking Broncos," where doublets or triplets require horses to move back.

name: Hillman: The Game
description:
Hillman: The Game is a new board game that allows you to take on the roles of characters from the hit late 80's - mid 90's TV show "A Different World" in order to be the player with the most cash at the "Season Finale". Whether you're familiar with the classic Black television show or you've never heard of a Dwayne Wayne in your life, you will have great time playing this game

—description from publisher

name: Scorched Core
description:
Are you ready to become the Ace of the New Frontier? Then jump into your personalized M.A.W. and prove yourself!

Scorched Core is a card driven, scenario based, tactical simulation of mecha combat in the far future. Play movement cards to maneuver around the battlefield and dodge enemy fire, play weapon cards to shoot and interrupt your enemies and install powerful upgrades to give you an edge over your opposition.

Chose a one off scenario or play through introductory campaign, leading you from a lowly Rookie to a Lance Commander in multiple connected coop and versus scenarios.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deck Construction, Hand Management, Hexagon Grid, Interrupts, Modular Board, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Cattle Royale
description:
A battle-royale game for 1-X players in which you control a cow trying to avoid his own "products" while moving on the pasture. The last-standing cow wins.

Developed as a promotional game for the 25th edition of the Mucca Games convention ("Mucca" = "Cow" in Italian), Cattle Royale is meant to be played by a group of people using a sheet of the game board, a pen/pencil and a simple pawn for each player.

A specific player, the "herdsman", also rolls a die for every turn and announce the result to everyone else.

The game is not meant for commercial distribution.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Life of Farming
description:
Life of Farming is a game where you build your farm from the ground over three years.

It's an exciting game where you will have to make ends meet with your farming operation, and find out whether you have earned a profit by the end of the year. You might even perhaps be crowned farmer of the year.

It won’t be a joyride, as the turnable 2-wheeled tractor might make or break your fate and have an impact on your fortune and the weather throughout the year.

Will your harvest come to a standstill due to bad weather, or will your bull win a prize for best bull at the show, all this while struggling to keep track of fields, crops, animals, machinery and helpers.

You probably shouldn’t trust your neighbors. They might not be as friendly as they look. Will they prevent you from getting any more fields, or hinder you from growing corn? They might however also lend you a tractor because your own is in the workshop, the choices may not always be so true, but they are wise.

It’s always a good idea to keep a good relation with the trading stations, as they can supply you with important crops or animals and the machines needed for your farming operation when your money is limited. It is important that you are smart and run your farm with hard work to achieve your goals.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Closed Drafting, Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Trading

name: Trivial Pursuit: Knack Editie
description: Limited edition of Trivial Pursuit celebrating 30 years of Knack magazine.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Junge Piloten
description:
Eeach player starts with his three planes at his airport. The first player draws a flight order card and rolls tree times. If the combined results are 8 or higher, he has passed the runway and is in flight. When a plane is in flight the player rolls once each turn. This is done by each player for each plane.

The players complete their flight orders and return to their home airport. The first player to completes 3 orders wins the game.
mechanics: Contracts, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Square Grid

name: Not Chess
description:
A card game to spice up your chess life. NOT CHESS is the ridiculous remix your dusty chess set has been waiting for.
A highly strategic (and highly goofy) party card game expansion to chess. Whether you’re a chess fanatic, or never played a game in your life, you’re ready to play. Just add NOT CHESS to your own chess set, or buy the Ultimate Box for all the glory.

In NOT CHESS, players work in teams to eliminate all of the opponent's pieces. These pieces are divided in to two types - each team has 1 Queen and 15 Not-Queens. While Queens can move any number of spaces, and kill opponents at any time, Not-Queens can only move 1 space, and can only kill pieces if coupled with a NOT CHESS action card. These 90 wacky cards allow pieces to move and murder in increasingly ridiculous ways, from teleporting across the board, to moving multiple pieces in a 'battering ram' to knock out the opponent.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Team-Based Game

name: Cheno
description:
Billed as "an adaptation of Chinese Checkers" for only two players, 'Cheno' is an abstract space or alignment game in the vein of a simplified Halma, using only a 5x4 grid.

Two players, red and green, each have a back row of five counters on a 5x4 grid. On each turn, one counter can move one space forward or back, left or right, or jump an opponents' counter. The player who gets all their counters, in numerical order, on to the opponents' numbered spaces wins the game.

While the game board's art includes minimally stereotyped representations of Chinese mothers and children, flowers, and butterflies, the "Chinese" characters on one side are almost meaningless and were clearly chosen for aesthetics.

name: Gator Goal
description:
Gator Goal challenges you to knock out Gatorific's teeth with your soccer ball.

Launch the ball with your soccer ball launcher.

Gatorific's eyes spin and his flag pops up.

name: Zoo au logis
description:
A party game for teams of two or more players.
Active player take a card turn and trying to get a player to find an animal.
Depend of the position on the track, the chalenge can be a mimic, a sound or others chalenge.

The cover and the box are the boardgame. You roll a die, move along the track and complete the challenge.

The game was published in 500 copies.

—user summary

name: Oẳn Tù Tì: Vàng Xám Đại Chiến
description:
In Oẳn Tù Tì: Vàng Xám Đại Chiến (Rock-Paper-Scissors: Great War of Gray Gold), you want to capture as many cards as possible.

To start, divide the deck evenly among all players. Take turns one at a time flipping your top card onto your personal discard pile. If two revealed cards have the same background color and they meet a rock beats scissors beats paper beats rock condition, then slap the drum card in the center of play. If you're first and correct, you collect all of the cards on the table; if incorrect, give each other player one card.

When a player runs out of cards, the game ends and whoever has the most cards wins.

name: Race to the Moon
description:
Race to the Moon is an All-Fair combined toy/game (as with so many of their products), involving a beautiful wooden standee decorated with one each of red, yellow, green, blue, and orange rockets. Five red cardboard rockets, each labeled with a different number of miles, are attached to the standee by taut rubber bands.

Each player gets a colored ball, which they use to roll and hit the tails of all five rockets, hopefully releasing each rubber band and sending each rocket "shooting" up. In most cases, not every rocket will work.

After their turn, the player adds up the collected miles of the rockets they were able to activate. The winner is the first one who is able to "reach" a combined 239,000 miles - the distance between the Earth and the moon!

A very similar (and probably just as rare) board game from Sweden Raket Flug shows wonderfully similar graphics and game play. The objective and scoring differ but the graphics have similar rocket launching pads and somewhat military theme.

—user summary

name: Bắn Gà Là Tạch
description:
A mad scientist has created a virus that turns anyone who catches it into a chicken. At first only a small group of people were infected, but gradually they multiplied so much that 80% of the world's human population became chickens, chickens packed with virus that will be released into the air when they're killed.

Bắn Gà Là Tạch is a shooting survival board game in which players each have only a small amount of food to fuel their efforts to both fight off other players and deal with chickens to be the last player standing. Players don't know the each other's location until they come close to one another. Everyone's location — as well as the location of loot boxes, traps and loot — is secret and known only to the game administrator.

name: Yêu Nhầm F.A
description: In Yêu Nhầm F.A, players must use their resources to overcome challenges, despite one players secretly trying to sabotage their efforts.

name: Lớp Học Mật Ngữ: Khu Rừng Kim Cương
description: In Lớp Học Mật Ngữ: Khu Rừng Kim Cương (Zodiac Classroom: Diamond Forest), the first player to plant all seven of their trees wins.

name: Runes of Zun: Reckless Magic
description:
Mix some or all of these double-edged actions, modifiers, and reactions into your Runes of Zun deck. As part of the theme, there's a reverse Boost-like card called "Reduce," which can be used to modify any card that allows Boost by lowering effects and even flipping them completely! Most of the other cards have something good and something bad, so by adding modifiers like Reverse and Boost, you can twist them into double-good and double-bad effects.

—description from the publisher

name: Manolete: Cuidado con el solete!
description:
Manolete is very relaxed on the deckchair sunbathing and drinking lemonade. But look at him, he is getting redder and redder!! Don't leave him too long in the sun without sun cream or he will turn very red and jump off the sun lounger, and... Oh what a shame! Your swimsuit will fall off! You have to avoid pressing the button on the glass of lemonade too many times and run to protect yourself with the sunscreen before Manolete turns too red, jumps off the lounger and his swimsuit falls off. The player who makes Manolete jump from the lounger loses the round. The last player left after everyone else has been eliminated wins.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Manolete está muy relajado en la tumbona tomando el sol y bebiendo limonada. Pero mírale, ¡¡está poniéndose cada vez más rojo!! ¡No le dejes demasiado tiempo bajo el sol sin crema solar o se pondrá muy rojo y saltará de la tumbona, y…. ¡Ay qué vergüenza! ¡¡Se le caerá el bañador!! Tienes que evitar presionar el botón del vaso de la limonada demasiadas veces y correr a protegerse con el protector solar antes de que Manolete se ponga demasiado rojo, salte de la tumbona y se le caiga el bañador. El jugador que hace saltar a Manolete de la tumbona pierde la ronda. El último jugador que quede después de que todos los demás hayan sido eliminados gana.

—description from the publisher

name: Party & Play
description:
Gamebox with more than 800 crazy questions & tasks.
Draw, guess, impersonate and win!

name: Just Desserts: Zucchini Muffin Promo
description: When we reprinted Just Desserts, we fixed a few errors but also replaced the Neapolitan Ice Cream with a Zucchini Muffin card. This promo card is for owners of the original version (v1.0) who would also like to have a Zucchini Muffin. The Zucchini Muffin contains the Veggies and Cake tastes and is the favorite of none of the guests.

name: Perníková chaloupka
description:
Children's game based on fairy tale "Hansel and Gretel" collected by the German Brothers Grimm.
The game is for 2 players (Hansel and Gretel). Each player player has own pawn that starts on the red arrow of the board. The goal is to move the pawn around the board to the "home" section. Movement is controlled by dice. All players move around the same board, there are various obstacles - coloured spots - strawberries, tree, gingerbread, river, ...

The winner is the first player who rolls the dice with the number of points to get to the "home" section first.

—user summary

name: Smuggle: The Game of Speak and Sneak
description:
A speaker must speak on a given topic for sixty seconds whilst trying to hide (or Smuggle) three unique words into the monologue.
Listeners keep a keen ear and can take notes. At the end, they will 'lock in' their three guesses. Points are awarded to the speaker for any successful smuggles, and to the listener(s) for any successful words detected.

—description from the designer

name: Ras al-Unuf 2011
description:
The game about clash at Ras al-Unuf at 2011, one of the very first battles of First Libyan Civil War (February-October 2011). Several scenarios covers every stage of this 6 days long clash, including initial loyalist's assault, siege, final assault and rebel counterattack. There is also a scenario that covers the entire six days of battle.

The game was published in the 46 issue of the Tactics and Strategy magazine. It contains all the counters and board, but the ownership of any boxed game of the Battles of XXI Century is required.

It is first "African" game published in this system. It uses company-platoon scale, although some units are pictured as battalions. Several special rules are applied to show special conditions of this war.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: Törj Be! Eiffel-torony
description:
Escape Game - Break In! Eiffel tower board game

In this adventure, players must travel to Paris to find and deliver the correct part for the tower's antenna to radio specialist Gustave Ferrié so that he can prove the tower's usefulness.

We are writing 1908, 19 years have passed since the construction of the tower and the Parisians were satisfied that the tower dominates the sky of the French capital, they would prefer to see it in the form of scrap metal. The task of the team is to sneak in and fix a fatal flaw.

Players must work together, solving clues and puzzles to unlock the deeper layers of the game, making hacking even more exciting. Along the way, the players will encounter many obstacles that can make it difficult to succeed in the mission, so luck will be needed a lot. The goal is to find Monsieur Ferrié and save the tower.

It's much more than a plain, simple game, it's a real social experience that includes the excitement and challenges of escape rooms. The 3D design of the playing field can enhance the amazing gaming experience even more.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Real-Time, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Lustiges Quatschquiz
description:
A clever quiz game with fun questions where the first letter of the two nouns are twisted. Identify the correct question and give the answer.

—description from the designer

name: The Forest of Fyri: Perilous Pursuit
description:
Fyri is where all those forest creatures told around campfire and scary tales told to naughty children come from. And no one needed to know they were real until 6 strangers from all around the world decided to bet their fate in the mythical forest of Fyri.

The Forest of Fyri: Perilous Pursuit is about hunting monsters and collecting bounties in the forest, then turning them in for victory points. Every player has up to two Move actions. To start your turn, exit toward a certain rune of their choice from the tile they stand on, then onto a new tile in the direction of matching rune. (1st Move) There are 2 types of tiles they will land and interact with. First type is Forest tiles, which means the player will have to flip an Encounter card to face a monster in the forest. Second type is Location tiles, which the player will skip the Encounter card and interact with the specific tile. If the player flips an Encounter card with no monsters or decides not to interact with the tile, they can move onto another tile and encounter/interact with it instead (2nd Move).

There will be repeated death & revival throughout the gameplay, but it is done without harsh consequence as the game is created for every level of players. When a player dies, their next turn is automatically moved to the last place in the turn order. And by rolling the Champion die, the player will find out where their champion will respawn and how much health they will be able to restore.

The goal of the game is to turn in certain number of bounties to the town before other champions do, racking up Victory points. The first player to reach a set amount of Victory points will win the game. How you interact between the forest and the town will be the key to victory in The Forest of Fyri.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Dice, Exploration, Fighting, Maze, Miniatures, Mythology
mechanics: Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Events, Hexagon Grid, Map Addition, Map Deformation, Modular Board, Movement Points, Pick-up and Deliver, Race, Re-rolling and Locking, Tile Placement, Turn Order: Random, Variable Player Powers

name: Ab durch die Mitte!
description: On a board consisting of 32 tiles, each player has 4 to 7 sheep in 3 barns near 3 corners and wants to bring them back to the barn which is near the 4th corner. You move 1 space orthogonally or diagonally onto a green space. When you leave a tile, flip it to the other (brown) side. You cannot stop on brown tiles but jump over it in a straight line. If you flip to the brown side and this side shows a salad or watering can, you are entitled to jump once a sheep or a green tile resp. to flip back a tile to the green side. Winner is the player who first gets all his sheep in the barn.

name: Giant Eggs
description:
Each player chooses a balloon, takes it and inflates it.
Each player has a maximum of one minute to inflate their balloon.
Once the balloon is inflated, the player must put it on the table.
If the balloon is not inflated after one minute, puncture it.
If the balloon is not on the table after one minute, puncture it.
The player whose balloon is the last to deflate completely wins the game.


—description from the designer

name: Please Don't Feed The Pandas
description:
Pandas and Trainers team up to perform tricks and score points in this silly, exciting kids' game!

Please Don't Feed the Pandas game challenges players to toss and catch in a panda-feeding frenzy. The Pandas are hungry, but they need to work for their "food"! One teammate, the Panda, wears a panda mask with an open mouth to catch the balls while another, the Trainer, "feeds" them. Draw a Trick Card to determine how to feed your Panda (off a bounce, over the shoulder, etc.), then start tossing!

Things get wild when Trainers have to spin, close their eyes or perform an all-play Trick Throwdown. The first team to score 5 points wins! Please Feed the Pandas is action-packed fun with a side of silliness that's perfect for a party or playtime with 4 to 8 kids, 7 years old and up.

name: Ratten Reich: The Board Game
description:
Ratten Reich: The Board Game is a physical tabletop companion to the upcoming RTS wargame, Ratten Reich. It is a grim and unforgiving world, where war has continued for many years. The war is fought between rats, mice, roaches and lizards alike in their never-ending struggle for power.

Your task is to lead your faction to victory. Whatever country you play as, you have to muster supplies and equip your armies, lead them into battle, face losses and recoup them.

In the Ratten Reich board game, your task is to lead your faction to victory. Whatever country you play as, you have to muster and equip your armies, lead them into battle, lose them and collect new ones. Under your command, three infantry armies are given, each of which can fit five infantry tokens. Military tokens are tied to military cards, so you can equip your armies with both elite units and simple cannon fodder. And so, the era of great conquest begins.

Naval battles are a common feature of imperialist wars and will therefore play a significant part in Ratten Reich: The Board Game. Large empires are typically surrounded by seas and ocean, allowing the transfer and logistics of military forces to travel from one continent to another. This opportunity pushes the development of military shipbuilding.

In this tabletop experience, each player is given one fleet figure to start. Choose to reinforce your fleet with heavy battleships and/or ironclads, intercept the enemy at sea, blockade ports or assist with naval bombardment. You can even execute an amphibious assault on your enemies.

Your army gains an attack bonus if it lands with naval support so ensure you utilize the whole of your forces! A fleet is also needed to transfer your armies to another continent.

Game pads are divided into two main types: the Main Player pads and the Autocrat Trade Military pad. The regular Player tablet allows you to design armies as you wish. The Autocrat tablet allows the player to create specialized armies and provides an opportunity to regulate the resource market by setting prices for mercenary armies.

Tokens are the same for all players except the Autocrat. Players can assemble armies themselves as they please. Meanwhile, the Autocrat collects and sells mercenaries whilst regulating the game market.

There is an additional battle pad that creates positive or negative conditions for the combatants. When the offensive player rolls the dice at the start of battle, the number rolled correlates to one of the six possible conditions that affect combat.

You may be lucky with fair weather conditions or you may be afflicted with corruption in your army, which will give certain disadvantages in the battle.

Tokens are an important part of the game. All resources, buildings, troops, and finances are considered tokens. Tokens in Ratten Reich: The Board Game are divided into two groups: military and economic.

Military tokens allow you to build armies on your side of the board and dually display the territories you have conquered. Economic tokens allow you to place buildings on the map, establish trade routes, conduct diplomacy, and arrange “meanness.”

Cards are ‘paper helpers’ in building your empire. Ratten Reich: The Board Game gives you the opportunity to build an economy, create your own armies, and create ‘meanness’ at your enemy’s doorstep.

Your faction’s main power source is the army. At your discretion, assemble your army by selecting from several types of infantry and vehicles - all of which will be under your control. If you are lacking in resources, gather a cheap army on a whim to capture colonies or to defend your cities. Perhaps you might prefer to invest in high-quality troops with impressive armor and equipment to best represent your faction.

To dominate the sea, build and tend to your fleet. Whether you play aggressively or systematically, develop and evolve your troops to master the board. You will only be dealt a few moves of peace and tranquility during the game; when these moves end, no one will have the right to stop you.

The economy is a vital part of the game. Without a reliable economy, you simply won’t be able to afford an army to face off against your enemies. Ratten Reich: The Board Game will offer you a standard set of building cards that includes: a bunker, factory, munitions factory, secret society, and market. Each building has a unique purpose.

Be wise with the limited resources you have! Construction will help create a defensive basis for negotiations, a stable economy, and eventual peace talks. You can play aggressively by contributing all of your resources to the army, but such tactics can end up being a lost cause. By spending some of your resources on the secret society and market, you can aim for a swift defeat of the enemy with both prosperity and gunfire.

A strong economy is the key to maintaining the army and vice versa.

Looking to harm your enemies? For this sole purpose, we have provided an opportunity for the player to build a secret society.

Players will have the opportunity to inflict greater harm upon their enemies through the construction of a secret society. A secret society grants access to cards of ‘meanness.’

Each faction has two unique villainy cards that the player can activate once per game. Each card gives a special ability to the player. For example, the player can build an underground city on the territory of the enemy and gain half of his resources or a player can burn their enemy’s lands. There are eleven unique cards in total, each with their own abilities.

To make Ratten Reich: The Board Game more interesting, the game will interfere with your plans. Be it famine, plague, or a brutal winter, these events are meant to annoy everyone at the table as you recalculate your next move and adapt in battle.

But the game does not merely take. It gives. You may come across useful event cards that offer small advantages or stability. If the Autocrat takes part in the game, then they are free to choose the event cards themselves. In the absence of an Autocrat, the cards are drawn randomly.

Six unique factions await you! Each faction will have an original design, playstyle, a variety of abilities, and different military and economic potential. Revive the old empires in the eastern part of the central continent. Build a formidable fleet. Control the colonies. Determine which of you will become the world’s new hegemony and whose country will turn to ashes.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Video Game Theme, Wargame
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Take That

name: Geas: The Vistani card game
description:
Geas is a card game intended to be played with the Tarokka deck included in the Forbidden Lore boxed set. The deck consists of 54 cards: four suits of ten cards each numbered 1-9 plus an "archetype", and 14 unsuited cards.

In each hand players are dealt five cards and take turns drawing a card from the deck or discard pile and then playing or discarding a card.

A suited card can be played as part of a player's adventuring party or to attack a member of another player's party. A party consists of one card of each suit, preferably all of the same alignment: the numbered cards are divided into good, neutral, and evil alignments while the archetypes are wild.

If a player has a single-alignment party they can play an unsuited card, which is an adventure the party completes to gain a point.

A hand ends when the deck has been gone through three times. The game ends when each player has had a chance to deal.

Optional rules allow for such things as two-dimensional alignments (adding the chaotic-lawful axis).

name: Win Word
description: Be the first player to answer 12 questions. A bilingual two-level game: french-english.

name: Drushba-Reise
description:
Each player draws a start-destination-card and travels from west to east and back by using their stock of transportation chips (train, ship, car, plane, sled). Additionally, each player draws 3 city cards, which determine which cities he has to visit on his journey.

The players take turns to roll 1 die and move their transportation chips on the corresponding spaces of the game board (blue = train, light blue = ship, green = car, orange = plane, yellow = sled). Each turn the players draw a quartet card. When the card pile is empty the players get a new traffic chip for each quartet collected. Three times per game the players may exchange cards to complete their quartets. On the spaces marked with a star, the players have to change their vehicle (transportation chip).

The first player back to his starting space wins the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Ducks in a Bucket
description:
Designed by James Ernest and gaming mathematician Joe Kisenwether, and illustrated by John Kovalic, Ducks in a Bucket is a press-your-luck game in which players attempt to build their best hands through several rolls of the dice.

In brief, players start their inning by rolling six dice: five matching dice, and one unique “Boss” die. The Boss determines which of the other dice can be promoted to the “bucket,” and which must be held back for the next roll. After any promotion, the player may choose to stop or roll again. But if they roll again without promoting a die, they could lose everything!

The player with the best bucket after everyone has rolled wins the round. (The strength of hands is similar to poker, except that a Straight beats a Full House.)

name: Forbidden Psalm: They Came from the Necropolis
description:
We're going on a hunt!

The world of Forbidden Psalm is brutal and uncaring, but for the right amount of coin there are those that will join you on your adventures.

They Came From The Necropolis, the latest mini-expansion for the Forbidden Psalm skirmish miniatures game, is chock-full of help and horror for those willing to part with enough dosh.
In this book you will find:

• new mercenaries like Pigmen (OINK!)
• a new monster, the Horse Head Knight!

Before starting a Scenario, any warband in Forbidden Psalm can replace any number of their members with mercenaries from this book. They are hired for one-off jobs, are selfish, and never drop their equipment or trade it willingly.

You need a copy of the Forbidden Psalm Core Book to play.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Minikin Saga: Jewels
description:
Minikin Saga: Jewels is a competitive micro game for 2 to 3 players. Where players as thieves stole a gem from a masquerade and must escape undetected, by revealing the opponents' identities and use them as scapegoat before they discover theirs.
At the beginning of the game, players will draw 2 Pawns from a bag, the combinations of those pawn's colors will determine is your identity.

On your turn you must do 1 Action from the 3 possible:
-Interrogate: Move a card (You can flip it too) to another empty space and ask a question. This question must refer to what the opponent's character can see. ex. Your Suspect see a Bird? Your Suspect can't see the color, Yellow? This is going to give you information about their identity.

-Investigate: At random and without looking inside the bag, take a pawn and look at it in secret. This will reveal what color is not in play and its not part of someone’s identity.

-Accuse: Point to an opponent (The other player closes their eyes in a 3 Player Game) and point to a card, if you discover the opponent's identity you win the game (In a 3 Player Game you must discover the other player's identity too) If not you lose that action and you must reveal one of your pawns to the accused player.

The game ends when a player discovers all the opponents' identities, that player is the winner!

-description from designer

name: Drama Mayhem
description: Drama Mayhem is an improvisational party game. Each round, one player is designated as the judge. The judge draws a scenario card (such as "A customer is short of money at checkout"), then selects two other players, who will have 1 minute to act that scenario out. Each of those two players draws a quirk card (such as "Overly Cheerful" or "A Famous Opera Singer") that modifies their performance. After the minute is up, the judge decides which of the two actors wins a point for the round. Then the judge token is passed to the left, and a new round begins. First to 5 points wins!
categories: Card Game, Humor, Party Game, Real-time
mechanics: Acting, Player Judge, Race, Role Playing

name: Xixx
description:
Xixx utilises six multi coloured and multi symbolled dice with which the players try to score a total of 100 points. Different combinations of the dice produce different scores. There are six shapes, circle, eye, triangle, square, pentagon and hexagon in four colours, red, blue, yellow and green. Harder combinations are worth more points.

—description from the designer

name: The Pyramid of Ayoyo Farm
description:
Cards are distributed unevenly with the following system: Players take turns revealing cards from the deck. If it matches a card already on the table, both are taken by the player who revealed them. If there is no match, the new card is left on the table.
When all cards have been distributed, players shuffle their decks. Then they take turn revealing a random card from their decks and place it in a pyramid layout. When revealing a card that already is present, these cards are stacked up. When revealing a card of the same color of an existing one, take both. When one player runs out of cards, the game ends, and players count the points on their cards. Highest score wins.

name: Throne of Hastinapur
description:
Historians estimate that the Kurukshetra (koo-rook-shay-trah) war occurred during the Iron Age of India, around 10th century BCE. The conflict arose from a succession dispute over the Throne of Hastinapur (has-tee-nah-poor). Duryodhana was the eldest from the senior branch of the family line, the Kauravas. But he was younger than Yudhishthira, the eldest Pandava. Who would become the next ruler of the vast Kuru kingdom?

The epic struggle over the Throne of Hastinapur has begun! Use your influence over the ancient heroes of India to sway them to join your side, enlist the help of other Rajas, and surprise your opponents by making your own preparations for war before they are ready to fight!

In Throne of Hastinapur, players act as local supporters who are supplying resources and political leverage to either the Pandavas or Kauravas. To show support, you must place tokens on shared Hero Cards or your personal Pati (Pah-tee) in order to win Victory Points (VP), shown as Lotus flowers. Players will “snake draft” dice from a pool in order to place tokens that match. After the Endgame is triggered, players play a final round. To win, score the most Victory Points!

-description from designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Force Commitment, King of the Hill, Negotiation, Open Drafting, Race, Random Production, Take That, Turn Order: Pass Order, Variable Set-up

name: Impact Beyond
description:
When an asteroid crashes into Earth, the very foundations of society are left in ruins. With no remaining institutions, chaos erupts as governments crumble. Some blame inaction or even conspiracy for not deflecting the asteroid. Others see the possibility of creating a new and better world. Eight mega-organizations emerge, vying for the chance to take charge of rebuilding our post-apocalyptic planet. Each has a plan that relies on emerging technology and prevailing public opinion. The plans are wildly different: from building a green utopia to merging with machines in a matrix to fleeing Earth entirely and colonizing a nearby planet. But there are only enough resources left for one of these plans to succeed. And each step of the way, other players will try to compete for the same resources or even oppose you directly.

You are the chosen leader in a mega-organization. You must convince the public that not only are your ideas the best of those presented by the mega-organizations—but also that you are the one who can save the world and lead it safely into the future. Your task is to assemble teams focused on technologies to influence humanity's future. It is up to you whether to turn Earth into an authoritarian regime, liberate people from their oppressors, change what it means to be human, return to living in harmony with nature, let the free market reign, or control human behavior with a supercomputer.

You begin the game by choosing a mega-organization card, two technology cards, and four agent cards. Each turn, you draw one card and get two points you can spend to draw cards, move agents, execute special abilities, or research new technologies. You can also trade cards for points to execute more complex turns. The table is split into three lanes: development, commercial, and monopoly, representing stages of bringing a technology to market. Each gives you prestige, public opinion, or effect bonuses you can use during or at the end of the game. You can move a card to the next stage when the assigned team's skills fulfill the card's requirements. When resolving conflicts with other teams working on the same technology, your agents' skills determine who strikes first and how much damage an agent can cause and withstand.

The game ends when all technologies in the game are developed, or if you win the tug-of-war of public opinion and successfully initiate a revolution. In this case, tally the prestige from your developed technologies and add bonus prestige from your technologies that align with the prevailing public opinion. The player with the most prestige wins the game and the chance to make an IMPACT BEYOND.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Alliances, Closed Drafting, Deck Construction, Delayed Purchase, End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, Interrupts, Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Dungeons of Kards: Vehicles Boats
description:
LET'S SAIL THIS ADVENTURE TOGETHER!
A HIGH SEA adventure game created for the whole family! Dungeons of Kards EDITION 10 is a card game, in the style of the great RPGs, where you will explore THE SEA OF DUNGEONS OF KARDS WORLD, full of magical portals, taking YOU TO A VERY DIFFERENT CHALLENGE!

The deck you've acquired will give you hours of adventure, but there's always room for more! THIS ADVENTURE IS A DUNGEONS OF KARDS EXPANSION, bringing THE FIRST VEHICLE EXPANSION TO THE DUNGEONS OF KARDS WORLD BRINGING MORE excitement to the game!

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Dice, Educational, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Critical Hits and Failures, Role Playing

name: LOOP: The Elevated Card Game – Renovated Edition
description:
The hit transit card game LOOP now has a standalone expansion! The new LOOP: Renovated Edition contains all new event cards, plus some new wild cards and a full set of station cards. It can be played on its own, or combined with the original edition of LOOP to double the fast-paced, chaotic fun!

Ride the rails of the elevated trains in Chicago’s famous Loop! Match the line colors and stations to make your way around town, but beware the everyday perils of signal delays, broken escalators, and unexplainable smells as you get where you’re going!

Like the original, LOOP: Renovated Edition is a 10-20 minute game suitable for ages 9 and up. One deck can support a game of 2-7 players, but when combined with the original edition of LOOP you can play with up to 14 people!

-description from publisher's website
mechanics: Hand Management, Network and Route Building, Take That

name: Anahata: El juego de la vida natural
description:
A nature-themed board game with mechanics similar to Game of Goose, with additional features such as nature-related trivia questions, or request to perform theatric actions.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Lose a Turn, Questions and Answers, Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Rainbow Journeys
description:
This game uses the Rainbow Deck to provide a path placement storytelling experience, with critical decisions being taken narratively and relying on the player's discretion with just a few fixed mechanics.

During gameplay, the player will create a path from a starting card to an ending card. Every new path carries with it a situation where the player must intervene in some way, by either spelling words with the cards in their hand or otherwise using the pictures in the center of the cards for a narratively acceptable conclusion; the details and outcome are decided entirely at the player's discretion.

A reimplementation of Quest for the MacGlyphin, which originally used the Glyph deck. A companion piece to Travels in the Land of Glyph, and an attempt to use similar storytelling mechanics in a more game-y fashion, goal-oriented.
mechanics: Hand Management, Solo / Solitaire Game, Storytelling

name: The Devil's Dozen
description:
In the year 1587 an act was passed for "the quieting and keeping in obedience of the disordeit and subjectis inhabitants of the Borders, Highlands, and Isles."

Along with this, a list of Clans, 13 Clans. 13 of the most notorious of the Border Reivers. In the game, you will play as one of these Clans. Collect Livestock, Crops, Followers, and Soldiers and use them to build your Clan's influence. With them, you will purchase "Holdings," land, Armies, and Strongholds, gaining you victory points. Gain the most victory points and become the most prominant Clan on the border.

As a Clan Chief, you will perform 1 of 2 actions on your turn: Gather Tokens or purchase Holdings. When purchasing Holdings you will also gain sheep for your pasture but beware, a Reiver is at first a theif. You or your neighboring Clans may conduct raids, stealing sheep from one another. Sheep are a valued resource and are worth victory points; a large flock could tilt the victory in your favor. Lastly: Each individual Clan has a unique ability drawn from the annals of history. The Devil's Dozen brings the history, hardships, fueds, and forays of the 16th Century Border life to the game table...

-description from publisher
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, End Game Bonuses

name: Hippity Hop to the Carrot Shop
description:
This is a roll-and-move race game for children in which players are bunnies trying to beat each other to the carrot shop.

As players move around the board, they may land on carrot spaces, which allow them to collect carrot cards. Other spaces force them to give the carrots back.

At the end of the game, there is an automatic point bonus for the players in first, second, and third place. To these scores are added the number of carrot cards each player has, and the player with the highest score - not the first to reach the shop - wins the game.

name: Flippo
description:
This is an action/dexterity game for kids, probably first sold in the 1930s. Players place colored marbles in a tiny cup at the end of a flexible metal strip and flip them on to the board, where they land in holes labeled 6, 12, 18, 24, 30, 36, 60, or 90 (higher numbers being harder to achieve).

Highest score wins.

name: Chick in the Coop
description:
This is advertised as a "kindergarten game." Players each take one of four coops and colored sticks of the same color. There is also a pile of chick cards.

If the spinner lands on a chick icon, the player places a chick in their own coop. If it lands on a color, whomever has the matching sticks use one to start or continue building a fence around their coop. Once a single coop is fenced in, all players count their chicks and the one with the most wins.

Released early 1940s.

name: Welcome Words
description:
Welcome Words is a coop-picture-word-association cardgame for 2-5 players.

Each round one player has to guess a term (an adjective) that was chosen randomly out of 5 terms from a laying out word card. All other players try to help them by playing a picture card that fits the chosen term best. After that they play a second picture card that fits the opposite of the chosen term best. Then the guessing player has to make their guess.

The game ends when each player was the guessing player twice. The goal for the group is to describe and guess as many terms correctly as possible.

-description from designer
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Humor, Party Game, Word Game
mechanics: Communication Limits, Cooperative Game, Deduction, Induction

name: Dragon Bleed
description: Vampire Knights fight against Human Sorcerers for supremacy. And the currency within the game? Dragon Blood! Extract just a few drops and unleash powers and purchases from the Dark Armory. Line up your warrior, weapon and dragon, then attack. This game is for 2-4 players and takes about 10 minutes to learn. The goal is to remove 500 blood points from all opponents before they do the same to you!

name: Passaggio di Marpo
description:
A two player tile/card placement game where the players aim to connect other islands to their island, and will earn more points the further away the other islands are.

On their turn, a player places a card. The game is played on a 5x5 grid with the deck placed in the center. All card plays must be played adjacent to either the deck or a previously placed card. In addition to island cards, the deck includes special cards which can affect previously placed cards.

Play continues until the board is full and the player with the most points win.

The game came in a ziplock bag which included a plastic case for the game's cards, an unassembled paper box to store the game in, and a playmat to play on. This solution was used as while the publisher's intention was to fit the components in the paper box, the playmat required too many folds to reach a size which would fit in the box and would then not lay flat enough to play; they note that the playmat is ultimately not required and the cards can be stored in the paper box.

name: Take the Path the Number Dares
description:
A roll and write castle investigation game of building your corridors then traveling through them to find treasure and get out out. Start your turn by arranging your cards to make some new paths, roll the dice in dice, add the 2 numbers in the dice together and add the numbers on top of the dice together. Use 1 number to move and use the other to write where you stop.
Group numbers so you can skip tiles. Once all the treasure and keys have been found the game is over. The player with the highest score wins.

name: Bags of Fruit
description: A push your luck fruit bag builder of picking the fruit and then trying to sell as much as you can, but you can only sell what you can remember. Pick your fruit from the bag, stop at anytime, but don't pick out rotten fruit or your turn is over. Once 5 rotten fruit have been picked, the selling phase begins. Roll the dice and try and remember what fruit are in your bag. Once a player earns $10 they win!

name: New Techno War: Drone Swarm Extension
description:
This extension of NEW TECHNO WAR proposes to discover a technology whose research and development is ongoing.

This extension adds drones that will add combat and intelligence to theatres of operation.

Cannot be played without the basic box NEW TECHNO WAR.

name: New Techno War: Delivery Drone Extension
description:
This extension of NEW TECHNO WAR proposes to discover a technology whose research and development is ongoing.

This extension makes it possible to add drones carrying equipment in theatres of operation.

Cannot be played without the basic box NEW TECHNO WAR.

name: New Techno War: Intelligent Shipping Container
description:
This extension of NEW TECHNO WAR proposes to discover a technology whose research and development is ongoing.

This extension allows you to add unmanned containers to theatres of operation.

Cannot be played without the basic box NEW TECHNO WAR.

name: New Techno War: Autonomous Vehicle
description:
This extension of NEW TECHNO WAR proposes to discover a technology whose research and development is ongoing.

Add the unmanned vehicle in the battlefield.

Cannot be played without the basic box NEW TECHNO WAR.

name: Kaiju Siege: Pop Culture Kaiju Pack
description:
Introducing a mini expansion pack which contains 6 kaiju mats for use with the base game, Kaiju Siege. 3 of the kaiju were drawn by a guest artist in a different style.

This is not a standalone game and requires the base game which is sold separately.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Rondel, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Robots Vs Dinosaurs
description:
Robots vs. Dinosaurs is a turn-based action card game where players must battle for their survival before a massive asteroid impacts the planet.

The Story: Millions of years ago...
A dinosaur shaman has discovered an incoming Asteroid that will create havoc when it impacts in 5-7 days. There is a sacred cave in the great valley that can protect them. If they can get there before the impact, they’ll survive. Meanwhile, having escaped their imploding home planet, a group of robots have landed on the planet to make a new home. The robots have built shield generators to protect themselves, but their site is right in front of the sacred cave.

In this game, robots are trying to keep their shield generators operational to win the game and dinosaurs are trying to destroy the shield generators to get to the sacred cave to win. There is a deck of 7 day cards which act as a countdown clock for the game. Each day is a round where all players get a turn. The Asteroid day is the last day of the game and is shuffled in a way where you don’t know if the game will end on day 5, 6 or 7.

Players Divide into two teams: Robots and Dinosaurs. Each team has a deck of fighters, bonus and robot equipment cards. The speed of your fighters will determine the turn order of each day where players will battle each other's fighters and try to break or fix the shield generators.

-description from publisher

name: Alfa Bēta Ducis
description:
If word games are your passion, then "Alfa Bēta Ducis" will be a new and exciting experience in the world of language games.

In the introduction to the game rules it says: "Playing this game gives players of all ages the opportunity to create shorter or longer words, and for those who are proficient in the Latvian language to prove their mastery! The game table is a bustle like a fairground: with words bought at a premium or cleverly constructed, fearless gambles, points gained and opportunities lost."

The aim of the game: To score the most points by building words from the letters on the 12 dice.

Game contents:
- 12 wooden dice with the letters of the Latvian alphabet on each side. Each letter has its own value: points (1, 2, 3, 5, 7) or stars (1 or 2).
- 16 wooden tokens, each worth 1 star.
- 1 turn leader card and 3 sequence cards.
Playing area
- Inside the game box is the playing area. The dice are rolled and the words are put together.
- Scorepad

name: Glory Trials
description:
The party game where legends are born. Glory Trials is a highly-interactive team-based card game where you will compete in group challenges and complete individual secret missions in order to be victorious! The Glory Trials are an assortment of mini-games that have each been designed to test your abilities in different and interesting ways.

Throughout the game, players will also collect Secret Cards. These cards are kept confidential until played, and will describe a secret objective or a hidden ability.

The game is incredibly easy to learn! To setup, the 3 Trials (Mind, Body, and Spirit) must be separated into individual decks and placed in front of all players. Players then sit in a circle where every second person is on the same team.

To begin play, teams alternate taking turns going around the circle. At the beginning of a players turn, they draw a card from any deck and follow its instructions. The first team to win 3 challenge cards from each of the Mind, Body, and Spirit Trials wins the game!

-description from publisher

name: 日本本土防空戦 (Nippon Hondo Bōkūsen)
description:
“The war situation is the worst. It's impossible to win anymore, but it makes sense to fight for as long as possible. It is impossible for Japan to allocate enough air forces indispensable for mainland air defense to each division. Each division commander should strive to minimize the damage to his army. From today, please become the division commander and take command.

It is now clear that there will be a lot of damage.

Execute the operation with a limited force and prepare for a long-term battle."

日本本土防空戦 (Nippon Hondo Bōkūsen) is a may-follow trick-taking game where the suits are visible on the rear of the cards. There are four suits and they are not evenly distributed (e.g. there are 7 red cards, but 18 green cards.) The less common suits are higher in strength than the more frequent ones.

Players will earn points if they do not win a trick, but the winner of the game will be the player with the fewest points.

In the second hand, the cards are dealt face down and the player with the most points can look at the backs of the cards and choose which hand they want to play.

The person with the fewest points after an agreed upon number of rounds wins.

name: Carthage: Just Liz-Tening Promo Card
description: Promo card featuring Lizzy Funkhouser of Board Game Spotlight. The power is called "Just Liz-Tening" and is +7 attack (if you have not talked this round yet), or +1 movement and +3 attack.
categories: Ancient, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: El Abuelo
description:
Grandfather is a children's game in which we have to get the highest number of points trying to complete the skeleton of our character. Created to learn the human skeleton on the one hand, its reversible board in the form of 4 puzzle pieces allows learning the parts of the body on the other. We continue singing and dancing with our Grandfather and the song.

In El Abuelo, it follows the rules for placing the tiles as in the basic game My Bag of Bones, but with some peculiarities. We tell you.

That contribute?
-For the player who plays with THE GRANDFATHER
Desert Tiles allow you to steal any tile from another player's bag but with your eyes closed. You can take 2 from the stack. They do not have to be consecutive. It's up to you. Take a good look at what the other players are discarding in their bag on the board
Grandpa introduces changes for the other players. Specifically, when they extract a tile from the grandfather and another from a foreign character. They go to their respective characters, without losing turn.

With the Color Bags variant, we will steal a tile belonging to the player's bag of that color. In setup, they are exchanged for four desert tiles.

In the Multicolor Sachets variant, we substitute three desert tiles. Grandpa must be present. We choose two players to steal a tile from each one's bag. We can combine the two variants by substituting seven desert tiles.

The multicolored puff removes a puff from the board of a player of our choice. The character ones are only used when the grandfather is in the game.

Every time we have to place a breath and we don't have it, we take our character's. Only Grandpa has one for himself.

The winner will be the one with the most points. Grandpa adds one point for every two puffs in his pool.
categories: Children's Game, Deduction, Educational, Music, Print & Play

name: Fuglafár
description:
Fuglafár is an educational game about 30 native bird species to Iceland. Players will learn the names, type, weight (í. þyngd), length (í. lengd), brood (í. urpt), population size in pairs (í. varppör), gestation period (í. álega) and age (í. aldur) of these birds as they play. The information is both available on player board and a deck of cards.
The card deck also includes additional educational text about each bird.

There are two game variants in the rule book:
- "Gettu hver fuglinn er" (similar to Guess Who?): The objective is if find out what bird your opponent has before he realizes yours, by taking turns asking yes or no questions.
- "Fuglatromp" (similar to Top Trumps): All cards are dealt equally amongst the players face down. Each player can only look at the top card from their deck. The player who starts the round chooses one of six bird attributes listed he believes is the strongest for all top cards that round. The player with the highest value wins the trick and places it at the bottom of his deck and decides the attribute for the next round. The game ends when a single player has gained all cards to his player deck.

name: Touch and Find
description:
Tactile recognition game that consists of putting your hand in the bag to find the parts you need. 21 wooden pieces including a trick piece and 20 illustrated cards. Can be used as Bingo. Instructions in 5 languages inside the box.

—description from the publisher

name: Watch Ya' Mouth:  Ultimate Edition
description:
Watch Ya' Mouth with colored mouth openers and 200 cards in 4 new categories: Ultimate Phrases, Rhyme Time, Head-to-Head, & Pop Culture. Can you get your team to guess your phrase with a mouth opener in the way?

—description from the publisher

name: Runebound: Tancerka Ostrzy
description: Tancerka Ostrzy contains three additional character sets to Runebound: Druga Edycja: Tancerka Ostrzy, Pogranicznik and Kroczący Wśród Cieni.

name: Ruthless Merchants
description:
Ruthless Merchants is a tabletop game in the pick up and deliver genre. The goal is simple, hold 5 coins at the end of a round and you win. You can choose to play peacefully and perform deliveries. Or you can play aggressively and punch/throw rocks at other players to get them to drop their coins.

There are 6 characters you can choose to play. Move them around the marketplace and interact with other players. You can play one of six actions each turn. Move, pickup a coin or item, deliver an item to your destination for coins, punch a player, throw a rock at a player, or take a nap to remove your dizziness.

You will need to balance between being peaceful and collecting your coins through deliveries and aggressively stealing other players coins.

The fun of the action happens around the turn mechanic which determines the order of play. All players choose their action card, places it in a pile and then the pile is shuffled. Cards are dealt from the pile which determines the order of play. This means you can play a punch card, but your victim might move away from you before you can strike.

-description from publisher

name: Flug durch die Welt
description:
The players take turns to roll and move. Each player has his own route in his color. The Flight starts in Germany and the first player who gets back to his airport of origin wins the game.
On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

The game was produced in the GDR.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Die Welt von Vulkanox
description: The players take turns to roll and move. On some spaces events benefit or hinder the players. The first to reach space 100 wins the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Screw'D
description: Screw'D is a trick-taking game in which the objective is to earn the highest number of points. It consists of a full number-ed deck (1-10), face cards (J, Q, K) of 4 new suits and eight Special cards (one “Flip” card in each suit, two “Wild Screw’D” cards and two “End Trick” cards).

name: Taotl
description:
Taotl is a trick-taking game using a 72-card deck that consists of the traditional 52-card deck (1-13 in four suits) along with the "magical cards": a Taotl (the highest card), four Skulls (the lowest cards), a yellow trump suit called Totems, a Red God "Quetzalcoatl" and a Black God "Tezcatlipoca" that can be either high or low situationally.
s) along with four Wizards (high) and four Jesters (low).

Players compete over multiple rounds based on the number of players, and whoever ends with the highest score wins. In each round, players are dealt a hand of cards — one card in the first round, two cards in the second, three in the third, etc.

The playing and winning of the tricks uses mostly standard trick-taking rules. If a player leads a suited card, then all other players must follow suit or play a magical card. If a player leads a Skull, then the second player determines the suit led. If a player leads a Taotl, then those who follow can play whatever they want.

After each player has played a card, determine the winner of the trick as follows: If the Taotl was played, that player wins, collects the cards, and leads to the next trick. If not, whoever played the highest Totem wins the trick, unless someone played a Red God on a red-suited trick or a Black God on a black-suited trick, in these cases the player has the option of declaring their god as higher than a Ten of Totems, but lower than a Jack of Totems. If not, whoever played the highest card of the suit led wins the trick. If all players played Skulls, whoever played the first Skull wins.

After all tricks have been played, players tally their score for the round. If a player matched their bid, winning exactly as many tricks as stated at the start of the round, they score 10 points, plus 3 points for each trick taken. If a player missed their bid, they lose 5 points for each trick that they were off, whether they took more or fewer than predicted.

The total number of tricks bid in a round cannot match the round number, thereby forcing (at least) one player to be off each round.
