The booklet attached to the papers was written by the well-known author Alfonso Del Bello, and in 64 pages he explains in the first part the meaning of the cards (which, as far as the traditional suits are concerned, is almost always modeled on the classic one of Etteilla) and a short divination game, and in the second the real game.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Predictive Bid, Trick-taking

name: Danelaw
description:
England, 876. 2-4 Players wrangle the collective conscience of entire cultures, commit horrible sins in the name of their gods, or parcel away tools of revenge in the name of propaganda through acts of clemency.
Construct a fleet, connect discovered routes build a trade empire - or - tear someone else's down.
The goal of Danelaw is to win either through connecting trade routes and taking over shires and minor interconnected kingdoms by means of military or propaganda and religious heroes.
The catch of Danelaw is players' cultures will be converted back and forth potentially multiple times in a game based on their roles and cards played.
Players roll special D'10s which always bear the potential for critical religious favor or delicious downfall.
Players have access to a unique array of hero cards of three distinct classes. Kin, Propaganda, and Fervor.
Blood feuds bubbling from within your own borders can be vented and tapped through fervor or quelled with propaganda heroes. Be sure not to let them get too high... The mob always comes for the man in the high tower.
Protect yourselves from them with only your most trusted Kin heroes. But even family can be lost to the voice of god or fate. As heroes of your culture die their legacies remain and new legacies fill their shoes.
Each game of Danelaw is different with unordered map additions added in random variations presenting opportunities that force players to think on their feet and change their approach.
Convert or subjugate, stoke the coals of war or shackle those who would with propaganda and the axe.
Keep your kin close, but keep your enemies closer.

—description from the designer

name: Squirrel Nation
description:
Squirrel Nation is a family card game for 3-4 players. In the game, players compete to build the happiest and most well-fed community of squirrels in the city park. To succeed, you will need to overcome many threats to your community such as a tree-destroying woodpecker, a trash-devouring raccoon, acorn-stealing chipmunks, and one very hungry owl!

A game of Squirrel Nation is made up of rounds where players bid using acorns to take columns of cards from a 3x3 grid (3 players) or 4x3 grid (4 players). In a "once-around" round of open bidding, the players select a column of cards, going from highest to lowest bidder. Most cards will be beneficial by adding squirrels, trees and food to your community. Many squirrels come with special actions or abilities, such as adding trees or acorns to your community. However, dangers lurk! Other critters have their own agenda that may get in the way of your plans.

The game ends after 6 rounds of play. Any squirrels not in a tree run away. All other squirrels are worth points based on how many Food cards you have of their preferred food type (Walnuts, Seeds or Peanuts). Highest score is the winner.

-description from designer

name: Fulcrum Leader: Expansion #1 – Naval Aviation
description:
Supporting the Soviet Fleets in the contest for supremacy over the worlds oceans, the ship- and shore-based aerial units of the Soviet Naval Aviation (AV-MF) takes the fight to NATO's maritime forces. This set adds 56 cards and 72 counters to your Fulcrum Leader game, including:


36 x Aircraft cards (Yak-38)
4 x Squadron Assets (Tu-22 Strike / Tu-22M Strike / Tu-95 ELINT / Mi-14 SAR)
6 x Ship-Based Ground Control Intercept station cards (Kiev and Minsk)
6 x Target cards
2 x Event cards
2 x Zampolit cards
60 x Site and Bandit counters (Sea Sparrow / Sea Wolf / RIM-66 / Sea Dart / A-6E / A-7 / Su-20)
5 x Campaign sheets


-description from designer
categories: Aviation / Flight, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Nautical, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Chit-Pull System, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Fulcrum Leader: Expansion #2 – Early Years
description:
From the earliest days of the Cold War, these iconic aircraft have served in Frontal Aviation over the years in greater numbers than any other post-war designs, incorporating lessons learnt from the Korean War, this set adds 56 cards and 88 counters to your Fulcrum Leader game, including:


45 x Aircraft cards (MiG-19 Farmer / MiG-21F Fishbed-C)
3 x Squadron Asset cards (Tu-16 Strike / Su-7 Strike / RE Spetsnaz)
6 x Ground Control Intercept station cards (Egypt)
2 x Event cards
5 x Campaign sheets
33 x Early air-to-air munitions (R-3S / R-13)
40 x Site and Bandit counters (Vatour / Ouragan / B-47 / Nike Hercules)


-description from designer
categories: Aviation / Flight, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Chit-Pull System, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Fulcrum Leader: Expansion #3 – Warsaw Pact #1
description:
In the Warsaw Pact, Soviet aircraft designs saw extensive service via unique national variants. This set features the North and Central Group of Warsaw Pact forces, comprising East German, Polish and Czechoslovakian aircraft, It adds 56 cards and 18 counters to your Fulcrum Leader game including:


48 x Aircraft cards (MiG-23 DDR / Su-22 Poland / MiG-21 Poland / MiG-23 Czechoslovakia)
6 x Ground Control Intercept station cards (Czechoslovakia and Poland)
1 x Squadron Asset card (Mi-8PP EW)
1 x Zampolit card
1 x Campaign sheet


-description from designer
categories: Aviation / Flight, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Chit-Pull System, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Fulcrum Leader: Expansion #4 – Interceptors
description:
The high-speed, high-altitude interceptor of the Soviet Air Defense Forces (V-PVO) was created as a response to the potential incursion of enemy strategic bombers and reconnaissance aircraft, resulting in a unique combat platform which became a formidable threat in its own right. This set adds 56 cards and 88 counters to your Fulcrum Leader game including:


36 x Aircraft cards (MiG-25P/PD Foxbat-E / MiG-31 Foxhound)
6 x Ground Control Intercept station cards (Soviet Air Defense Forces)
12 x Target cards
1 x Event card
1 x Zampolit card
48 x Extended Range air-to-air counters (R-40)
7 x Bomber and Reconnaissance Bandit counters (B-1 / E-3 / RF-4 / SR-71 / C-130 / EC-130)
5 x Campaign sheets


There are standalone rules for the Interceptors expansion which is included in the Fulcrum Leader core rulebook.

-description from designer
categories: Aviation / Flight, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Chit-Pull System, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Fulcrum Leader: Expansion #5 – Warsaw Pact #2
description:
In the Warsaw Pact, Soviet aircraft designs saw extensive service via unique national variants. This set features the Southern Group of Warsaw Pact forces, comprising Hungarian, Bulgarian and Romanian aircraft. It adds 56 cards and 16 counters to your Fulcrum Leader game including:


48 x Aircraft cards (MiG-21 Hungary / Su-22 Hungary / MiG-23 Bulgaria / MiG-23 Romania)
6 x Ground Control Intercept station cards (Bulgaria and Hungary)
1 x Squadron Asset card (Mi-17PP EW)
1 x Zampolit card
1 x Campaign sheet


-description from designer
categories: Aviation / Flight, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Chit-Pull System, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Fulcrum Leader: Expansion #6 – Northwestern Edge
description:
With its sizeable reserves of oil and natural gas in the Arctic sector, Soviet forces stand ready to safeguard and protect the Motherland's economic interests in these northern regions. This set adds 56 cards and 88 counters to your Fulcrum Leader game, including:


42 x Aircraft cards (Su-24M Fencer-D / Su-24MP Fencer-F / Su-27 Flanker)
3 x Squadron Assets (Tu-22 Blinder Strike / Tu-22M Backfire Strike / Tu-160 Blackjack Strike)
3 x Ground Control Intercept station cards
5 x Target cards (Difficult, hardened targets from NATO's northern flank)
3 x Zampolit cards
5 x Campaigns
Unique air-to-ground munitions (Kh-59 / BeTAB-500 penetrator)


-description from designer
categories: Aviation / Flight, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Chit-Pull System, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Eagle Leader: Expansion #1 – Luftwaffe and RAF
description:
Take to the skies over Germany with the West Germans and British in the Luftwaffe and RAF pack. Featuring aircraft such as the Panavia Tornado, the F-4F Phantom, the Jaguar A, this pack expands the fight to feature the plight of the RAF and the Luftwaffe in the 1980s. This set contains:

This set adds 54 cards and 50 counters to your Eagle Leader game, including:


54 x Aircraft cards (Tornado GR1 / Tornado ADV / Phantom FGR Mk2 / SEPECAT Jaguar RAF // Tornado IDS / F-4F Phantom / F-104G Luftwaffe)
2 x Squadron Asset cards (Alpha Jet)
18 x Skill counters
1 x Pilot Skills sheet
3 x Campaign sheets


-description from publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Chit-Pull System, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Eagle Leader: Expansion #4 – French Air Force
description:
In the Eagle Leader timeline, France maintained their unusual separation from NATO, but as the situation on the ground worsened, the French government felt compelled to intervene. While most of NATO’s Air Forces flew American aircraft, or at least used American weapons, the French had their own capable aerospace industry. This set adds 56 cards and 88 counters to your Eagle Leader game, including:


54 x Aircraft cards (Mirage F1C / Mirage IIIE / Mirage 2000C / SEPECAT Jaguar)
2 x Event cards
3 x Campaign sheets


-description from publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Chit-Pull System, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Twin Stars: Adventure Series III – Scenario 13: Topple the Giant
description:
2 new characters and a scenario that were never released. These were created in 2020(?) with big silly plans to work on Twin Stars III and a combination of life and computer crashes slowed it down. We lost a few things, but still had parts of these, so we cobbled the rest together as a prototype edition. Enjoy!

Topple the Giant is a scenario in the Twin Stars solo system by Jason Tagmire and Mike Mullins. The game consists of just 3 cards and players will provide their own dice and coins/tokens. Each scenario comes with 2 all-new characters and can be interchanged with others for a very different gaming experience.


This scenario has been released separately at ShyCon Nashville 2022.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: MetaCorps
description:
MetaCorps is an “easy to learn, hard to master” card game for two to four players aged 14+ and set in a bleak Cyberpunk background where MetaCorporations fight for Intel.
It is meant to fit a pocket and be played on small tables in about half an hour, somewhat independently of the number of players (add more time with variants).

MetaCorps is meant to have a steep learning curve and be a real challenge for the most seasoned and competitive players, with variants allowing to diminish the randomness to a bare minimum.

If the circumstances allow it, it is also meant to receive a few expansions and stand alone/expansions that will create a whole narrative arc that describes a world slowly dissolving into a nightmarish apocalypse.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Closed Drafting, Connections, Deck Construction, Hand Management, Multi-Use Cards, Score-and-Reset Game

name: Falaise 1944
description:
The game simulates a number of engagements that took place during the Battle of the Falaise pocket, which took place between 12 and 21 August, 1944. As a result of this battle, most of Army Group B deployed west of the Seine river was annihilated by the Allied Forces. This opened the way to Paris, and eventually the liberation of France from Nazi occupation.

This is the second edition of the Falaise 1944 game by Taktyka i Strategia published in 2022, and it uses the B-35 wargaming system (i.e. Bitwy II wojny światowej 1943-45).

Falaise 1944, 2nd ed., features the following four scenarios:


Totalize
Falaise
Black Division
Montormel
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: Playmaking: The Hockey Strategy Game
description:
Theme: NHL Ice Hockey
Game-Play: Dice and strategical movement
Acquire a certain number of goals before the other player (rolled randomly at the start).

Win face-offs, move tactically, pass and shoot to score goals. The roll of the die tells you how many action points you have to spend and you repeat the same number until you lose the puck while the defender rolls anew each round until they steal the puck. Saves and penalties stop the play. Penalties are played like Battleship with each player selecting, in secret, penalty spots.

name: Music City
description:
It's been a way too long since you've played with the old band. Now you're all together in Music City for one last performance.

Players work together to make an improvised song out loud. Each card is an intrument with a limited range of sounds. Once you receive a card, you may contribute to the song using only those sounds.

After a short delay to let the first instrument find their groove (rhythm, pitch and genre are up to you), the next player draws a card and joins in. Repeat this until all players have a card. Now you've got a band!

Once all players have a card, anyone can point to another player to nominate them to do their solo. After a solo is completed, the soloist will point to another player that hasn't performed a solo yet. Continue until all players have performed a solo. The last player to perform their solo should wrap up the song.
mechanics: Acting, Communication Limits, Cooperative Game, Turn Order: Pass Order

name: Ervo-Roulettespiel
description:
The game consists of a roulette spinner and rules for a number of games of chance. While older versions include rules for 4 games and a spinner with one ring of numbers, newer ones have rules for 14 games and a spinner with two rings of numbers.

—user summary

name: Hipp, hipp, hurrah: Das Fußballspiel zu Hause
description: The game board consists of a soccer field wich goals on each side. The players take turns to roll and move. The first player to get his three meeples from his corner of the game board (Anstoß) into the opposite goal wins the game. Where the tracks cross, meeples may be captured and returned to their "Anstoß" space.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Static Capture, Track Movement

name: Wer kriegt die Wurst?
description:
Each player receives a dachshund figure, the footplates of the figures are provided with different numbers to distinguish them. The players take turns to roll and move.
If a player gets to a red dot on the game board, he has to go forwards or backwards to the next brown dot in the running direction of the dachshund depicted.
The red lines running to the center of the board entitle the player to proceed towards the goal (120).
The black lines, on the other hand, force him to go outwards. But if you are unlucky enough to get to 114 or 104 or 55, you have to start again from 1.
The game is only won if the number 120 is reached exactly.

name: Tøm Køleskabet
description:
How far will you go to fight food waste? Play with food to find out!

Tøm Køleskabet (English translation: "Empty the Fridge") is a game that challenges your willingness to fight food waste, by making the players make fun and/or macabre sandwiches. Each player adds one ingredient to a sandwich each turn.

Will you add the pickled herring to the sandwich with the gummy bears? Or perhaps sprinkle watercress on top of the gorgonzola?

Once the sandwiches are made, the active player in a round has to secretly pick a "most likely to eat" and "most unlikely to eat" sandwich from the ones on display.

The other players then secretly tries to guess the active player's preferences, and can score up to two points if they get both "most likely" and "most unlikely" correct.


This game was made for the NGO Folkekirkens Nødhjælp (DanChurchAid)'s 100th anniversary. The main goal of their work is to "assist the world’s poorest to lead a life in dignity, regardless of race, creed, political or religious affiliation. This focus is centered around three core principals:


Save lives
Build resilient communities
Fight extreme inequality worldwide


Folkekirkens Nødhjælp is also a member of the global organisation ACT Alliance

—description from the designer

name: Heartstrings: A romantic card game for awkward people
description:
The goal of the game is to pull the other players’ Heartstrings. You do this by completing poems and passions, and collecting their heart tokens, until you are the only player left with tokens.

The main feature of the game is making poetry with ‘Rhyme Cards’. Simply put you have cards on hand with a phonetic symbol on it. This symbol represents the sounding of the last syllable of a phrase in a poem. When putting down a poetry card on your turn, you compose a poem with an ending like the symbol on the card. (See more in Cards - ‘Rhyme Card’).

Four cards of the table equals two rhymes of a poem, and a verse. Each ‘Rhyme Card’ has four colored hearts, corresponding with each player’s Lover Card (See more in Cards - ‘Lover Card’). The goal of the poetry is to have as many hearts corresponding with your opponents colors and as few of yours on the table when a verse is completed. When a verse is completed, you tally up the colored hearts and discard that amount of tokens.

The secondary feature of the game is talking about your Passions with ‘Passion Cards’. These are missions that you can carry out during the conversation ensuing while playing. Completing such a mission grants you a number of tokens.

The key to winning is:
- Pay attention and try to discover what Lover Card the other player’s have.
- Limit the amount of cards on the table with your Lover Card on it.
- Complete Passions to recover lost tokens.

—description from the designer

name: Who Knows Me Better?
description:
A very fun game to get to know people better.

Players guess interesting though provoking "would you rather" questions about each other without sharing their guess to others, the one who guesses right most of the times wins the game.
Players can use special cards to get extra points and manipulate others.

A great game to play as an ice breaker or during family nights, friends gathering and team building.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Humor, Party Game

name: Rough: The Card Game – Acting Rough
description:
A thin seal pack expansion to the game Rough: The Card Game. This expansion adds personalities to the deck that once played on a player forced the player to act that way for the entirety of play for that day.

The only way to remove the personality is to play another personality card on yourself or have someone else play it.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Humor, Mature / Adult, Negotiation, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Take That

name: Rough: The Card Game – Even Rougher
description:
The expansion for Rough: The Card Game that takes the game to the next level.

Adding the fifth level of difficulty for the cards, each one is brutal and specifically designed to take people out of the game, or at the very least make them question why they want to win!
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Humor, Mature / Adult, Negotiation, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Take That

name: Der Rhein von seinem Ursprung bis zu seiner Mündung
description:
Translation: "The Rhine from its origine up to its mouth".
Typical old roll and move game. The first player, who cross the route with 47 stations first, wins a game.
Figures (steamships) made of paper with a wooden stand. Game play needs money to pay or collect money by the rules. Publisher offer to use coins from other games, use other materials.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Secret Agent
description:
Designed by Yukihiro Kuroda, this is the second card game that fans have been waiting for!

Players take the role of a national leader and aim to develop their country's economy and improve science and technology.

Stabilize your own country and drive political instability by launching coups and revolutions in enemy countries! They use asylum scientists. A beauty and a spy operate in secret.

Suddenly, the horrors of the Great Depression and war strike. ...... Who will have the last laugh?

—description from the back of the box (translated)
categories: Card Game, Civilization, Modern Warfare, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: 6 Hungry Cats
description:
Thematically, the players are judges who received mysterious letters for request and head to a courthouse deep in the woods - only to find 6 cat judges who are so hungry they don't listen to the trial. A player will win when they can persuade all 6 judges to their side.

The players alternate taking turns. On a turn, a player draws 2 cards, plays up to 2 cards, and then can either bribe a judge with a fish or pay resources to bring on a collaborator. (The third collaborator brings all judges to a player's side.)

name: Fiki Hockey
description:
FIKI Hockey is the winter wonderland version of tabletop football. Now hockey fans can have their own version of tabletop fun. The game features a “hockey puck” game piece, with the recognizable black and orange design.
(from manufacturers website)

In Fiki Hockey two players are flicking the "puck" across a tabletop surface with three attempts trying to get it to hang over the opposite end of the table without falling off, resulting in an empty net shot. This is when the "puck" is stood on end & you try to then flick it into the supplied net from 11" away.
If the "puck" is sent off the table a penalty shot is awarded to the opposing player. You once again stand the "puck" on end & try to flick it into the supplied net but from 22" away.
First player to 10 goals wins.

name: Clams Aclamst Huclamity
description:
A party clam for shellfish people, with 600 fully clam-o-fied and possibly unplayable cards.

Includes 600 hastily rewritten cards in a custom box with modified instructions. You think we’re joking, but we really did this.

name: New World Order
description:
In August 1991, the Soviet Union fell. It was one of those moments in history when everything we knew about the world changed. It was a new world. Bring It On Games is proud to present The New World Order. A game of the dynamics of what happens once that wall came down.

2-4 players will vie for world supremacy. The game spans 1992 to 2032 in 2 year turns. You will manage your country’s economy, government, and population through these perilous times. Players will represent the United States, NATO, China and the Islamic Coalition. Russia starts allied to the US but may change sides as the game goes on. The game will cover national prestige, elections, regime changes, economic issues, and military deployment. You must keep your people happy, your economy prosperous, and your global interests secure. Your opponents (and sometimes enemies) will try and prevent this through sabotage, espionage, economic warfare, and sometimes, even outright warfare. You and your opponents will fight over the world. The future is yours to write.

The game comes with a 22 by 34 inch map of the entire world. A countersheet of 5/8ths inch counters in the game will represent military forces, spies, and all the markers needed to play; included cards will be used to keep things chaotic and tense; a full color rulebook will round off the basics. We promise a thoroughly playtested, developed, and complete package that is second to none in quality and presentation. There are 4 scenarios provided to start the New World Order at different times in history. A solitaire variant will also be included so you can play the game on your own.

—description from the publisher
categories: Economic, Modern Warfare, Spies/Secret Agents, Wargame
mechanics: Area Movement, Automatic Resource Growth, Command Cards, Dice Rolling, Income, Loans, Negotiation, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Turn Order: Progressive

name: 9x Klug
description:
"I have it, give it to me!"
194 questions and 582 answers from the fields of History, Science and Religion/Philosphy

The first player reads out a question and the three given answers. Whoever identifies the correct answer the fastest gets the card and places it in front of him/her. Give a wrong answer and lose a card. The first Player with 9 cards wins the game.

name: Alle Vögel sind schon da
description:
The players take turns to roll and move. Each player starts on his own track with 2 pawns (pair of adult birds) on the spaces A1 and A2 of his color. When the birds have reached the spaces N1 and N2 they lay eggs and breed. The players have to roll 6 three times to hatch 6 baby birds on the spaces J1, J2 and J3. Only then the complete bird family assembles on the spaces J1 to J5 and continues to spaces W1 to W5, while staying near together with a maximum of 3 spaces between members of the flock. On some spaces events hinder the flight of the birds, some even may be killed. The first player to get the most birds to their winter quarters wins the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Blood of the Raven Skirmish Game
description:
Blood of the Raven is a multifaceted board game that is exciting, fast paced, and built for all gamers! Based on a 16"x20" map with multiple different buildings that come in the set gameplay is fast and furious with in depth tactical movement and utilization of your characters. Blood of the Raven is primarily a skirmish game, however, it boasts a robust campaign system and party building mechanics!
The game is won when one side kills off the other or meets the victory conditions of the mission. Campaign play allows players to build their characters through the gaining of abilities, spells, and super powers and can last months or years.

—description from the publisher
categories: Dice, Fighting, Game System, Horror, Mature / Adult, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Role Playing

name: Coeur d'Alene-Opoly
description: Created by Late for the Sky under license, this version of Monopoly uses properties and cards themed for the city of Coeur d'Alene, Idaho.
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Doffinos: Onboarding
description:
Doffinos is a strategic and fun game about making decisions in the office without necessarily being the most productive.

This card game is like years of work experience but in a game. You will have to learn to leave the office early, doing your job (so far so good), attending to your boss's urgencies, and getting around the ramblings (and jokes) of your co-workers.

The game is based on hand management. You have to put work hours (task cards) on the table until you reach 8 hours.
The challenge includes avoiding Action cards (that your co-workers/other players) can play to boost their game or to stop you. Also you have to deal with the boss cards, random cards that appear and have devastating effects.

The player that reaches 8 hours of work wins one visibility point. The player that gains 2 visibility points wins the whole game.

It's a game:

Easy to learn
10 min games

—description from the publisher

name: Siege of Jerusalem AD70
description:
Siege of Jerusalem AD70 is a two-player wargame simulating the epic Roman assault on the city of Jerusalem in AD 70. The battle pits a veteran Roman army commanded by Titus Flavius against Judean rebels who are making an epic stand. The game system emphasizes command control and the use of both troop and siege units. Players randomly pick command markers to generate actions, modeling the chaos of battle. The Roman objective is to take Jerusalem, while the Judean objective is to delay the Romans long enough to claim an apocalyptic victory.

There are two players in the game: Roman and Judeans. The game consists of five months of battle (one turn each). Within each month there will be several turns, each generated by the pick of a command marker. Each hex on the map represents 200 yards. Each Roman Legionary unit represents two cohorts (800 to 1,000 men). Cavalry units are about 400 each. Auxiliary units represent groupings of 1,000 men. Judean units range from 500 to 2,500 fighters. A leader represents a great man or a lower commander along with their staff and elite guard troops.

A game turn represents about a month of operations. Each game turn will include Impulses representing anywhere from a day to a couple weeks of intense combat plus periods of reorganization.

—description from the publisher

name: Korea the Mobile War (1950-51)
description:
Korea the Mobile War (1950-51) is a solitaire wargame covering the first year of the Korean War (July 1950 to June 1951). The game covers the critical mobile stage of the war when a decisive victory was in the cards. Historically, this phase ended in a stalemate with the front stabilized at the 38th parallel. The player controls the United Nations Command (UNC) while the game system controls Communist forces. The objective for the player is to gain the decisive victory that proved elusive in 1950-51. The game rules provide asymmetrical capabilities for each side. There are also options for the employment of additional UNC forces and US nuclear weapons. While a solitaire game, two or more players can also play Korea, each taking charge of different UNC forces.

Each game turn represents one month of operations. The map is set at 30 miles to the inch. Most combat units are corps, divisions, and brigades/regiments.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Solo / Solitaire Game, Zone of Control

name: Star Wars Destiny: Crafted Lightsaber
description: This is a promo card given in tournaments (2018 Q4 Tournament Kit)

name: Un Tetto In Prato
description:
Un Tetto In Prato ("A Roof in Prato") is the game of bargaining and investment for those who feel at home in the chaotic creativity of Prato.
Retrace the narrow streets of the center, the agricultural areas of Tavola or the hills of Galceti to invest and give prestige to this "blessed" city!
In this fun game, suitable for young and old, challenge Prato and not to discover the most important monuments and the most particular curiosities of the city to see who will be the richest person in Prato!

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: Bull Tish
description:
Bull Tish is the all-new, all-play, guessing game in reverse!
We give you the answer first, then you're given six facts or clues. Five are true, one is complete Bull Tish... but which one?
As soon as you think a fact or clue is fake, yell it out... Bull Tish!

—description from the publisher

name: Pixel Star
description:
Pixel Star is an expandable and easy to learn 2-4 player space skirmish game, with unique dice drafting action and little pixel ships that pop out of stat cards. An entire fleet can fit in your pocket and be played on any table.

Build your fleet of pixel ships, pop them out of their stat cards, roll all the action dice for the round, and take turns claiming those dice to assign to your fleet. Keep an eye on all the actions available each round though, as you and all your opponents are taking from the same pool of dice!

Each ship has a unique ability or action that might need a particular die side to activate. So knowing what's available to you and your opponents each round is crucial to the strategy of dice drafting. Do you claim a die that isn't as useful to you right now but cuts off your opponent from using it? Or do you claim a die that gets your fleet into a better position straight away?

Easy to teach and playable on any table, Pixel Star gives players all the robust and strategic elements of miniature heavy space skirmish games, in a much smaller package. A full fleet, with all the tokens and dice you need is designed to fit in a standard deck box.

—description from the publisher
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, Fighting, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Action Drafting, Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Movement Template, Moving Multiple Units, Multi-Use Cards, Open Drafting, Team-Based Game

name: The Breach: Hugo
description:
A miniature called Hugo with a dice in a fancy box with magnetic lid.

This miniature was given as a promo at Spiel’22 Essen to testplayers to promote their upcoming game ‘The Breach’.

This miniature is playable whit the new game that comes out later.

name: Mensch erfreue dich
description:
The players each have their own player boards and take turns to roll and move. A special tilt die is used to generate numbers between 0 und 59. Rules for three games are included.

Marathon-Prämienspiel (Plan 1)
For this game the tilt die is used like a normal die to get results from 1 to 6. The players start at "Start" and have to get their five meeples, numbered from 1 to 5, to the space marked with "Ziel". If a meeple reaches a red space marked with five dots (tournament bonus space) it advances to the next red spot marked with a "+" (additive bonus space) from wich it advances further according to its own number. If the result of the die and the number of the moved meeple add to "5" its number is considered to be "5" when landing on an additive bonus space. The spaces marked with a double ring (pairing spaces) may be occupied by two meeples, which then move together as a stack.

Lotto-Turnierspiel (Plan 2)
Six meeples, marked 0 to 5, are placed on the board by using the tilt die to get results from 0 to 59. Then all meeples standing on white spaces are placed on the red space marked as "Start B". All meeples standing on the white/red spaces (tournament pre spaces) are placed on the associated red tournament spaces, stacked if necessary. In the next phase of the game the tilt die is uses to produce the digits 0 to 5. The goal of the game is to get all numbered meeples on the tournament spaces with digits match their number. The space "Start A" is used as an interim space to move meeples from a tournament space where they don't belong.

Lotto-Königs-Turnierspiel (Plan 2)
The placement of the meeples is like in the Lotto-Turnierspiel. But in this game the meeples move from ant to the boards of the other players till all meeples end up on the same board and the owner of this board wins the game. The movement of the meeples between the bords is controlled by strict rules wich allows the players no own decisions. So, it's a pure game of chance.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Nage x Nage Portside YOKOHAMA
description:
Players will challenge a fierce DJ battle tonight as a DJ at a dance club in Yokohama. There is only one turntable available, so you have to respond quickly and accurately to the request cards from the floor.
During the game, you have to throw your own record (with blue and red sides) into the turntable every time the request card fulfills the conditions. Records that do not enter the turntable are invalid, so not only speed but also accuracy is required.
Also, in the "floor killer" that occurs when multiple conditions are met, players will turn around and throw records. In "Chance Card", only certain players can throw records, but it doesn't always go smoothly.

It's a great action game that you can play right away, and it's fun just watching from the side.

Description by-arts1k
publishers: TANSANFABRIK, 株式会社ケンビル (KenBill)

name: The Ugly Sweater Game
description:
Roll the dice, then be the first to grab the right sweater!

Place the 36 ugly sweater cards on a table, then roll the dice to give a pattern, colour and design. The first player to grab the correct sweater using the provided grabbers wins the round! Be the first player to grab 5 correct sweaters to win the game!

name: War in the West: Expansion Module
description:
An expansion module that allowed players to play the monster war game, War in Europe using the components from War in the West as a base. This is only compatible with the original 1976, Flat Pack edition of War in the West.

According to an SPI ad from the time, the module contains the Exclusive Rules to'-War in the East, the Exclusive Rules to War in Europe, and the attendant charts and tables. It also contains 1200 Soviet and Finnish counters.

The ad further states that "Purchase of the Expansion Module will equip the Player with a complete War in Europe."
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Der goldene Turm
description: The players take turns to roll and move. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. If a player gets on an occupied space meeple already there is taken back to its starting space. When reaching space 7 the player gets a golden pearl. If he gets the pearl to his home space, he gets a card from the golden tower and has freed the character pictured on the card. If a meeple gets on a space were a meeple with a pearl is sitting, the first takes the pearl and the later is sent back to its home space. When all 12 characters are freed the player with the most cards wins the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Static Capture, Track Movement

name: Les Secrets de la Tour Eiffel
description:
Volume II of the Secret Stories Series.
Competitive mode: 3-5 players
Cooperative mode: 2-10 players


When the Eiffel Tower was inaugurated in 1889, the whole world wondered where this idea came from.

The author of this book, lost for years, was the only person who knew the real story.

This book will reveal all 4 riddles to you to this day.

-With whom did Gustave Eiffel come up with the idea?

-How did you meet?

-Where in Paris?

-What food did you share?

-A player will assume the role of author of the book, without speaking, try to guide the readers with his author cards, to discover the secret code created by the dice.

-The readers will try to discover the 4 riddles. In competitive mode, the first reader to guess the code wins the game along with the author.

name: BOOPE
description:
You and your friends decide to go on a road trip together. Unfortunately, nature calls!

Players gather a specific set of rest area tiles, determined by the destination card chosen. These tiles are shuffled and placed face-down to form a road. Players are then dealt a role card that tells them how big their stomach is and a starting value card that tells them how full they are at the beginning of the game. If they go under their stomach capacity minimum, they starve; if they go over their maximum, they poop their pants. Without showing anyone else, players grab the number of poop tokens indicated on their starting value cards and hide them with their left hand.

A rest area tile gets revealed every turn, showing how many bathrooms are available to use. Players choose a number between 1 and 5 and take that number of poop tokens with their right hand. Without telling each other how many poop tokens they have, players decide who gets to go to the bathroom. At the end of the turn, all players reveal the number of poop tokens in their right hand. If the player went to the bathroom, they discard that number of poop tokens; if they did not, they take that number of poop tokens from the supply.

If the group successfully makes it to the destination without anyone starving or pooping their pants, they win!
mechanics: Communication Limits, Cooperative Game, Hidden Roles

name: Diamond Duck Cricket
description:
A two-player dice game based on the sport of cricket.
Players roll twelve dice, and plays two dice each "delivery". The sum of each player's dice is compared, which determines the result of that delivery. After a certain number of overs (sets of six deliveries) are completed, the players swap roles, and see who can make the highest score.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Score-and-Reset Game, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Able to be Served
description:
Party game of trivia questions relating to words that end in 'able'.

Each guest or team is given a card with 32 questions on it. During the evening they are encouraged to fill in all the correct answers, or just guess the ones they don't know. When the host calls "Time", the guest or team with the most correct answers, wins.

name: Lass die Kirche ins Dorf (2nd edition)
description:
This is a strategic game of church positioning. Settlements grow & fall, farmers move around & rivers expand through the land.
As the land changes, the clerics want to build or rebuild churches in hopes of gathering the biggest flock. For that to happen, they need to stay close to the settlers.
mechanics: Action/Event, Area Majority / Influence, End Game Bonuses

name: Spontaneous
description:
Spontaneous is the game to bring out those songs that resonate in your head. Become a Director and make the whole table sing for you.

If there are times when you find yourself singing impulsively, you are a Spontaneous!


Think of a song you remember, take a single word of the lyrics and write it on a piece of paper to make your top five. That word will be one of your keywords. Think of another song and do the same until you have a top five that contains 5 keywords. Once all the participants have their list of keywords, the director starts the game and launches the first spontaneous challenge.

The first Director must flip the hourglass as he announces a word from his own Top Five. The rest of the players must compete to see who is the first to sing a fragment of at least 5 words from any song that contains the keyword.

The first player who begins to sing before the end of time must roll the dice and advance the number of squares that they indicate.

If no one managed to sing all five words of a song, the Director must flip the hourglass again and sing at least five words of a song containing their own keyword before time runs out. Once he has done so, he rolls the dice and moves on. If he fails to prove that the keyword belongs to a real song, he must roll the dice and back off.

When a player reaches the finish square, the participant who is in third place becomes the challenger and challenges the player who is about to win (leader). The leader must sing a song (at least five words) of a keyword written by the challenger at that time.

If the leader meets the challenge, he will be the winner.
publishers: Discovery Bay Games, Ruibal Hermanos S.A.

name: Wie steht Dein Stern?
description:
Before the start of the game, the enclosed stars are distributed equally to all participants as a means of payment. The indivisible remainder shall be placed in the larger center space of the board (7-12). Now 2 dice are thrown in turn. According to the result of the throw one star must be placed on the corresponding space - or if a star is already in the space, it can be taken out as won.
An exception, however, is the roll 7. In this case, a star must never be taken out, and so a larger cluster of stars forms in the center space, which can be collected by the lucky one who manages to roll a 12.
The Space 1 is also to be considered (a 1 can never be thrown with 2 dice). If the dice fall inaccurately (tipper) or if a die rolls off the table, the dice may not be rolled again as usual, but a star is lost and must be placed on space 1.
If someone now rolls the number of his birth month (for January 2 x 1 - for February also 2 x 1), he can empty space 1 if possible.
The game is played for an agreed amount of time. The player who has won the most stars, is the winner.

name: Botzy Trading Card Game
description:
Fast-paced combination strategy game. Botzy uses a 62-card deck, 50 main deck cards, 10 Botzy champion cards, and 2 instructional cards.

Botzy champions are used to aid players during their turns. Each Botzy champion has their own unique ability. Each player has 5 champions, once all champions are destroyed you lose the game.

Both players play from the same 50-card main deck, sharing the discard, and graveyard piles. (A unique twist to most competitive games.)

There are 3 ways of destroying your opponent's champion cards. Either by discarding the last card in your opponent's hand, drawing the last card in the main deck or by a card effect.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Deck Construction, Pick-up and Deliver

name: L'Auto-Code
description:
The players take turns to roll and move. They have to get their four cars from one corner of the game board to the opposite corner of their color, for example the red cars from Marseille to Paris, while minding the traffic rules. The players have to pay fines, if they violate the traffic rules or have to pay for having their car repaired after a crash, after which the car has to start anew. The results of the two dice may be split up among two cars.

The first player, who gets his four cars to his destination, wins the game and the paid fins and repair costs.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Static Capture, Track Movement

name: Rivet Wars: Reloaded – Vanguard Expansion
description:
Rivet Wars: Reloaded expansion featuring 10 additional miniatures for both the Allied and Blight factions.

Contents:
10 Allied miniatures - Allied Forces: Cher Ami, M3 Vertical Tanks, M7 Bosses, Macleod's Guard
10 Blight miniatures - Elsa Frost, Landkrieger, Sturmrads, Baron Munchen's Guard
10 stat cards

name: Caciques
description:
XVII century. The Original Peoples and the Aboriginal Nation are all sovereign in the Abya Yala del Sud. The white huinca is hardly a distant threat to the Children of the Earth.

In that Land without evil, people live respecting nature, the well-being of the people and the bravery of their caciques.
But not everything is harmony in the confines of the pachamama. In the tolderías, the smell of war is felt in the air of meadows and mountains, jungles and deserts, mountains and steppes. The caciques and their warriors will fight for the territories and their possibilities.

The end of the story is beginning...

OBJECTIVE OF THE GAME

Players dive into the fight for territories starting with 12 starting totems each. Throughout seven rounds they will fight for each territory betting totems and adding alliances with the tribes of their original region; without losing sight of the alliances of the others and the final support of the cacique to the weakest alliance. Each round is divided into five phases: two alliance phases, two betting phases, and a fight phase. A fight for supremacy where you won't have to lose sight of the impossibility of participating in all the contests, so you will have to choose very well which battle to fight.

The player with the most totems at the end of the dispute over the 7 territories wins the game and is proclaimed the new Grand Cacique of Abya Yala del Sud.
